loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a honest and hardworking farmer, with the drive and spirit that distinguishes her from other smallholder farmers in the Nandihills area of Kenya. She has been married to her husband for 30 years and has 10 children. For her to start helping her husband support the family, she ventured into mixed farming 30 years ago with her husband's three acre land as capital. Today, the farm has three cows and ten heads of poultry. The farmland is kept green and beautiful by the hundreds of trees planted on it. 

Esther is seeking a loan from Kiva lenders to buy cereal grains. Many farmers in Kenya make an extra living by selling cereals. Farmers lay out capital to aggregate cereal produce and sell it to profitable markets far away at a decent margin. Income from this investment will enable Esther to lift her family's living standards.

loans.use: to buy cereal grains for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cereals to use for planting and feeding her family.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa es una mujer de 42 años de edad, divorciada, tiene 2 hijos de 13 y 14 años, y su negocio es la zapatería.
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora, independiente, fuerte, luchadora, constante, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘villa Fátima’ caracterizado por ser el pulmón de la ciudad, La topografía es pendiente y existen aguas subterráneas. De clima frio y seco, con una temperatura ambiente que varía durante el día entre 0-12 grados centígrados. 
Rosa es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro largo lo usa trenzado, baja estatura, complexión física robusta, su forma de vestir es tradicional (sombrero, manta y pollera), su lengua materna es el Aymará que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con sus hijos que estudian en la escuela, Viven en una casa propia construida de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina y piso de madera que cuenta con energía eléctrica, no cuenta con agua potable ni alcantarillado porque se encuentra en una zona muy alejada de la ciudad. Su negocio es la zapatería; ella se ocupa de cambiar suelas, tacos, y realizar todo tipo de arreglos a zapatos, “inicié mi negocio con mi ex esposo, cuando tengo mucho trabajo mis hijos me colaboran…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con ventas diarias, la desventaja es la falta de capital para la compra de una máquina de coser y arreglar su kiosco para que no filtre agua. Su sueño es que su negocio mejore y que sus hijos abran sus propios kioscos, ella desea realizar la compra de una máquina de coser y pagar la reparación de su kiosco para evitar las filtraciones de agua. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 10 años que se dedica a esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Rosa solicita un préstamo para la compra de una máquina de coser y pagar el arreglo de su kiosco para ayudar a que sus hijos se independicen.
texts.en:
Rosa is a 42-year-old woman, divorced, and has two children of 13 and 14 years of age. She works in shoe repairs. She is a good mother who is  enterprising, independent, strong, tenacious, consistent, responsible, and very hard working. She works in "Villa Fátima," a zone known to be the lung of the city. The climate is cold and dry, with a temperature that varies between 0-12 Celsius (32-54 Fahrenheit). 
 
Rosa has a tanned complexion, with brownish-gray eyes, black braided hair, short stature, and a robust physique. Her way of dress is traditional (hat, blanket, and a skirt), and her mother tongue is Aymará, which is spoken in her family. She also speaks Spanish for the general culture and for her business. 

She shares her life with her children, who are both in school. They live in their own house built with bricks and cement, along with a zinc sheet roof and a wooden floor. The house has access to electricity, but it does not have running water or a sewage system because she lives very far away from the city. 

Rosa's business is a shoe repair shop. For work she changes the soles and heels, and does all types of shoe repairs. "I started my business with my ex-husband. When I have a lot of work my children work with me," she says. The strength of her business is that she makes daily sales. The weakness is the lack of capital to buy a sewing machine and to repair her post, so that water does not seep in. 

Her dream is that her business improves, and that her children open their own repair posts. This is the first sequence of loan she has made with this institution during the 10 years that she has been working. For the above reasons, Rosa requests for a loan to purchase a sewing machine and to pay for the reparations of her post, so that she could help her children become independent.

loans.use: to purchase a sawing machine and to repair her post, so that she can help her children become independent

loans.name: Blanca Elena

texts.es:
Elena una mujer de 45 años, que con su tenacidad y pujanza logro montar un pequeño negocio, ubico en la parte de atrás de un carro una mesa y allí vende helados (ver foto), para esta mujer no hay nada imposible y quiere seguir luchando con el fin de seguir su negocio pero en un local.

Solicita un crédito con el fin de comprar publicidad para el negocio, los ingredientes necesarios para la preparación de sus helados y mejorar las condiciones del carro donde vende este producto.

Su mayor sueño es tener una vivienda propia, pues esta le generara menos gastos y mejor estabilidad económica, sabe que de la mano de los colaboradores y prestadores del portal Kiva lo lograra.
texts.en:
Elena, 45, with her tenacity and strength has been able to set up a small business. 

She set up a table in the back of a car and this is where she sells ice cream (see photo). For this woman nothing is impossible and she wants to keep working hard so she can move her business into a space. 

She is requesting a loan to buy advertising for her business, the necessary ingredients to make ice cream and to make repairs to the car. 

Her biggest dream is to have her own home. This will allow her to have less expenses and better economic stability. 

She knows that with the help of the employees and lenders at Kiva she will succeed.

loans.use: to buy advertising for her business, the necessary ingredients to make ice cream and to make repairs to the car.

loans.name: Muhammad's Group

texts.en:
Muhammad is a 36 years old man with 4 dependents. He is a resident of Harpoke, Tehsil Kamonke, Distt Gujranwala, Pakistan. Being the team leader, he is standing in the middle and raising his hand in the photo. He has been doing work in the field since he was quite young thanks to the his father who taught him all the knowledges. He cultivates wheat, rice and vegetables in his farm and sells them in a market nearby. He utilizes all income to feed his family.

With the requested loan, Muhammad will buy 2 sacks of quality rice seeds, 5 boxes of pesticides and 16 sacks of fertilizers for growing rice crop to increase his income. This loan will help him to increase crop output. His dream is to improve the conditions of his residence.

loans.use: To purchase agriculture inputs such as fertilizer, pesticide, seeds and fuel

loans.name: Moijonbi

texts.ru: Моичонби из города Куляб 47 лет. Она честная и сильная женщина. Она замужем и у неё четыре сына. Старший сын находится на заработках в России, два сына студенты, а младший учится в средней школе. У Моичонби нет дочери и ей трудно справляться с работой по дому. Однако благодаря её таланту, она одновременно шьет занавески и женские платья. Так как её сыновья студенты, она должна их обеспечивать. Это ее долг как родителя. Моичонби тоже очень старается, чтобы её детям не было трудно учиться. Она хочет, чтобы её дети  стали образованными людьми. Основной доход семьи это работа Моичонби, но, к сожалению, её швейная машина уже устарела и она не в состоянии нормально шить. Она может шить платья, но не занавески. Хотя Моичонби получает больше денег от шитья занавесок. Ей очень нужно купить новую швейную машинку и отремонтировать дом, так как её дом уже старый и ей неудобно перед клиентками. У Моичонби недостаточно денег. Она надеется только на Вашу поддержку.
texts.en:
Moijonbi, 47, is from Kulob. She is a strong, honest woman. She is married and has four sons. Her eldest son works abroad in Russia. Her second and third sons are university students, and her youngest son is at school. Moijonbi does not have a daughter and finds it difficult to get all the household chores done. However, she has been earning a living through her talent to make curtains and female dresses. She must provide for her sons because they are still studying. It is her parental duty. 

Moijonbi is doing her best to provide for her children while they are studying. She wants them to become educated people. The family lives off Moijonbi’s tailoring business but unfortunately her sewing machine is old and does not function properly. She can still make dresses but not curtains. However, Moijonbi could earn more by making curtains. She needs to buy a new sewing machine and renovate her home because her house is old and she feels uncomfortable inviting her clients. Moijonbi does not have enough money. She hopes that you will be able to help her.

loans.use: To purchase a new sewing machine and renovate her home

loans.name: Universitario Group

texts.es:
Melina es una mujer de 39 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene 2 hijos de 4 y 8 años, y su negocio es la costura.
Ella es buena madre, optimista, generosa, amable, comprometida, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona Sur de la ciudad; que se  caracteriza por acoger a la población migrante del campo-ciudad, que genera una intensa actividad económica conformada por el comercio minorista e informal, de clima cálido sub tropical con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 21-35 grados centígrados.
Melina es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro largo, baja estatura, complexión física robusta, su lengua materna es el Guaraní que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza (al centro, viste blusa marrón con rombos y cartera). Su vida la comparte con su pareja que trabaja como constructor y con sus hijos; el mayor estudia en la escuela y el menor aún no se encuentra en edad escolar, viven en una casa propiedad de la familia construida de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina y piso de cemento que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la costura; ella se dedica a realizar arreglos a prendas como; largo de bota pie, ancho de cintura, reparación de cuellos de camisa, y otros, “tengo un pequeño taller con una máquina vieja con la comencé, el negocio funciona bien pero a veces me falla la máquina…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con clientes continuos, la desventaja es la falta de una máquina de coser que cumpla con los trabajos pendientes. Su sueño es ampliar su taller y estabilizarlo, ella desea realizar la compra de una máquina de coser industrial para trabajar de manera continua sin pérdidas de tiempo. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 5 años que desarrolla esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Melina solicita un préstamo para la compra de una máquina de coser industrial para trabajar de manera continua y estabilizar su taller de costura.
texts.en:
Melina is a 39-year-old woman who lives with her partner and has two children, four and eight years old. Her business is tailoring.

She is a good mother, optimistic, generous, friendly, committed, responsible and very hard-working. She runs her business in the southern part of the city, which characteristically welcomes the migrant population from the countryside. This generates intense economic activity defined by informal retail commerce. The climate is warm and subtropical, with temperatures varying throughout the day between 21 and 35 degrees Celsius.

Melina has dark skin, brown eyes and long black hair. She is short-statured with a heavy build and her first language is Guaraní, which is spoken in the area. She also speaks Spanish for general use and running her business. She is pictured in the centre, in the brown diamond shirt with a purse. She shares her life with her partner, who works as a builder, and with her children. The elder is in school and the younger is not yet school-aged. They live in a house owned by the family, made of brick and cement. There they have drinking water, electricity and plumbing. 

Melina’s business is tailoring; she makes adjustments to garments such as boot-bottom length, waist width, shirt collar repairs, and others. She comments, “I have a small workshop with an old machine that I started out with; the business is going well but sometimes the machine breaks down on me.”

The advantage of Melina’s business is that she has regular customers; the disadvantage is the lack of a sewing machine that can handle the work she does. Her dream is to expand her workshop and stabilize it. She wishes to purchase an industrial sewing machine for working continuously without wasting time. This is her first loan cycle with the institution in the five years that she has been developing this business. For these reasons, Melina is requesting a loan to buy an industrial sewing machine for continuous work to stabilize her tailor’s workshop.

loans.use: buy an industrial sewing machine for continuous work to stabilize her tailor’s workshop.

loans.name: Bunavshamo

texts.ru: Бунавшамо терпеливый и вежливый человек. Она живет в городе Куляб. Ей 54 лет и она мать одиночка. Бунавшвмо давно развелась с мужем и сама вырастила троих детей. Теперь её дети выросли и она уже бабушка. Бунавшамо очень любит своих детей. Ей было не легко вырастит их. У неё не было Высшего образования, но она зарабатывала путем швейной деятельностью. Её старший сын работает в пекарне, а другой в арматурном заводе. Бунавшамо не смогла дать им Высшего образования, но они понимают и знают, с каким трудом она их вырастила. Теперь они сами облегчили работу матери и стараются зарабатывать разным путем. Её дочь вместе с ней шьет национальные платья. У Бунавшамо нет денег, чтобы купить новую швейную машинку и расширить свой бизнес. Сейчас она обратилась за кредитом, чтобы купит новую швейную машинку. Она обещает, что расширит свой бизнес и будет погашать свой займ во время.
texts.en:
Bunavshamo, 54, is a polite and patient single mother who lives in Kulob. She got divorced long ago and had to raise her children on her own. Now her children are grown up and she is a grandmother. 

Bunavshamo loves her children very much. Raising them on her own was not easy. Bunavshamo did not attend a university. She has been earning a living as a tailor. Her elder son works in a bakery and her younger son works at a valve plant. Bunavshamo did not manage to send them to university but they know how hard it was for her to raise them. Now they are trying to make their mother’s live easier by earning their own living. Bunavshamo’s daughter also works as a tailor making Tajik dresses. 

Bunavshamo is requesting a loan to be able to buy a sewing machine and get more work. She promises to expand her business and pay back the loan on schedule.

loans.use: To purchase a new sewing machine and expand her business

loans.name: Manzurai

texts.ru: Манзура из города Куляб, общительная и милая женщина. Она мать одной трехлетней дочки. У неё замечательная дочка. Манзура живет в доме у отца, потому что она разведена с мужем. Она работает и учиться в мед. колледже и одновременно работает  медсестрой в больнице своего города. Манзура всегда старается, чтобы быть независимой. Она очень трудится и старается, чтобы её дочка не чувствовала нехватки отца. Одной её зарплата в больнице недостаточно им на жизнь и она в выходные дни занимается животноводством. Манзура хочет получить высшее медицинское образование. Сейчас Манзуре необходимо оплатить за учебу в колледже, но у неё не достаточно денег. Если она не  оплатит в ближайшие дни, то её отчислят, и она не сможет, продолжить учёбу. Манзура очень надеется на Вашу доброту. Если она потеряет работу, то она не сможет обеспечить будущее своего ребёнка.
texts.en:
Manzurai comes from Kulob. She is a nice, sociable person. She has a wonderful three-year-old daughter. Manzurai is divorced and lives with her father. She goes to a medical college and works as a nurse at a municipal hospital. Manzurai values her independence. She works hard so that her daughter does not feel the absence of a father. The salary she gets from the hospital is not enough and she has to breed livestock. 

Manzurai aspires to get a university degree in medicine. She needs to pay her college tuition but does not have enough money. If she does not transfer the outstanding sum in the next days, her enrollment will be terminated. She hopes that you will be able to help her. If she loses her job, she won’t be able to ensure a better future for her daughter.

loans.use: To pay tuition

loans.name: Maria Eugenia

texts.es:
Eugenia una señora con 44 años de edad, casada y con 2 hijos de 18 y 21 años de edad, hace poco inicio con su negocio, un taller de calzado, de allí es donde genera los ingresos suficientes para cubrir las necesidades básicas que su hogar amerita.

Siente que a su negocio le hace falta algo, un servicio a domicilio, es por esto que solicita un crédito para la compra de una moto la cual le sirva de trasporte para la mercancía.

Su sueño es seguir creciendo con su negocio y en un futuro dejárselo a sus hijos.

Aporta al sueño de esta mujer, preste hoy.
texts.en:
Eugenia, 44, is married with two children aged 18 and 21. 

She started her business a short while ago. It is a shoe workshop which is how she generates enough income to cover the basic needs of her household.
 
She feels her business is lacking a home service. She is requesting a loan to  buy a motorcycle so she can transport her merchandise. 

Her dream is to continue growing her business and leave it to her children in the future. 

Support this woman's dream, lend today.

loans.use: buy a motorcycle so she can transport her merchandise.

loans.name: Maria Nidia

texts.es:
Nidia una señora con 48 años, que desde hace poco comenzó a vender mercancía desde su casa, un negocio por el cual h logrado progresar con su familia conformada por un hijo menor y su esposo.

Esta señora solicita un préstamo con el cual surtirá su negocio de camisa, blusas y jeans al por mayor, con esto espera mejorar sus ventas y de tal forma aumentar sus ganancias.

Quiere seguir trabajando con el fin de mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda, ya que esta con el tiempo se ha ido deteriorando.

Aporte al sueño de esta señora, haga un préstamo.
texts.en:
Nidia, 48, started selling merchandise from her house a short while ago. This business has allowed her to provide for her family which consists of a young son and husband. 

She is requesting a loan to supply her business with shirts, blouses and jeans at wholesale. She hopes to improve her sales and in this way increase her profits. 

She wants to continue working with the goal of improving the conditions of her home as it has started deteriorating with time. 

Support this woman's dream, lend today.

loans.use: to supply her business with shirts, blouses and jeans at wholesale. She hopes to improve her sales and in this way increase her profits.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
When you look at Julius, he is the true definition of a hard worker. He is a farmer in Nkubu. Julius is involved in maize, poultry, and dairy farming. He engages in milk and egg production for commercial purposes, as opposed to many rural farmers who are in it for subsistence. Julius also grows maize for food and sales. These commercial activities place him in a better position to engage in other agriculture related businesses, which, in fact, he does. 

Julius is seeking a loan from Kiva lenders via Juhudi Kilimo to construct a cow shed. This will help significantly in managing the animals’ health and hygiene. He has been in the farming business for at least 50 years. He has no plans to quit in the future, as he finds farming to be not only fulfilling, but also lucrative. However, his biggest challenges are the poor road network and lack of market. 

With your loan, Julius will construct a cow shed, which will later come in handy when he scales up and introduces zero-grazing. The long-term impact is an increase in productivity and improved animal health. The additional income from this development will go to his children’s education.

Kindly lend to a Kenyan farmer with great dreams!

loans.use: to construct a modern cow shed.

loans.name: Hadisamo

texts.ru: Хадисамо жительница замечательного города Куляб. Ей 33 лет и она не замужем. Хадисамо живет с мамой, братьями и их семьей. Хадисамо хорошая женщина. Она всегда помогает своим невесткам с работой по дому и присматривает за их детьми. Одновременно она занимается шитьем женской одежды. Она очень красиво шьет как национальные, так и европейские платья. Раньше она почти каждый день принимала заказы на новые платья, но сейчас из-за старой швейной машинки она не в состоянии шить. Хадисамо обратилась за кредитом и хочет купить новую швейную машинку. Она не хочет быть обузой для своих братьев, и намерена вносить свой вклад в семейный бюджет.
texts.en:
Hadisamo, 33, lives in the wonderful town of Kulob. She is single and lives with her mother, brothers and their families. She is a good person. She always helps her sisters-in-law with household chores and looks after their children.
 
Hadisamo is a tailor who makes female costumes. The dresses she makes - both Tajik and European - are very beautiful. While in the past she received new customer requests almost daily, it is no longer the case because her sewing machine is old and does not function properly. 

Hadisamo is requesting a loan to be able to buy a new sewing machine. She does not want to depend on her brothers and wants to contribute her share to the family budget.

loans.use: To purchase a new sewing machine

loans.name: Oybek

texts.ru:
Ойбек целеустремленный молдой человек. Ему 20 лет. Он родился в простой рабочей семье. Его отец штукатурщик, а мама домохозяйка. Его родители сделают все возможное, чтобы жизнь их сына была лучше них. Ойбек следовал за своей мечтой и поступил в медицинский колледж. Ойбек сам выбрал эту профессию. Ойбек учится хорошо. Она уделяет по мере возможности внимание учебе, так как в будущем он будет нести ответственность за жизнь людей. Ойбек пол дня проводит на занятих, а остальные пол дня помогает отцу штукатурить. 
Ойбек успешно закончил первый курс и готовится к новому учебному году. Он учится на платной основе. У Ойбека и у семьи нет денежных средств, чтобы оплатить его обечение. Он не намрен бросать учебу и свою мечту из-за трудного финансового положения и Ойбек просит ему помочь в оплате учебного договора.
texts.en: Oybek, 20, is a goal-oriented young man who was born to an ordinary working family. His father is a plasterer and his mother is a homemaker. His parents work hard to ensure a better future for their son. Oybek followed his dream and entered a medical college. He chose the medical profession on his own. He is a good student - he works hard because he knows that one day he will be responsible for people’s lives. Oybek spends half a day in class and half a day helping his father to plaster. Oybek successfully finished his freshman year and is getting ready for his sophomore year. Now he has to pay for his studies and he does not have the money to do it. However, he won’t give up on his dreams because of financial difficulties and is requesting a loan.

loans.use: to pay medical college tuition

loans.name: La Banda Group

texts.es:
Isabel es una mujer de 31 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene 3 hij0os de 5, 7 y 9 años, y su negocio es la venta de huevo.
Ella es buena madre, alegre, optimista, feliz, de buena actitud, comprometida con su trabajo, generosa, amable, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la localidad ‘el Torno’ que se encuentra ubicado a 32 kilómetros al sudoeste de la ciudad, considerado capital de los cítricos, tiene una producción citrícola de 5 mil hectáreas. De clima de clima cálido sub tropical con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 18-24 grados centígrados. 
Isabel es de tez trigueña, ojos pardos, cabello negro largo lo usa amarrado por detrás, baja estatura, complexión física delgada, su lengua materna es el Guaraní y habla español por cultura general (al centro, viste polera celeste). Su vida la comparte con su pareja que se dedica al transporte y con sus hijos que estudian en la escuela, viven en una casa propiedad de la familia construida de madera, con techo de calamina y piso de cemento que cuenta con agua de pozo extraída mediante bomba, energía eléctrica y no cuenta con alcantarillado. Sus deseos de superación la llevaron a liderar la banca de personas con negocios como; puesto de venta de comida, venta de chompas, venta de materiales de construcción, tejido de ropa de bebe, venta de papas fritas, venta de ropa deportiva y tienda de barrio, para solicitar un préstamo y mejorar sus negocios. Su negocio es la venta de huevo; ella compra huevo por mayor de distribuidores mayoristas y también de productores locales, “las variedades de huevo son el blanco, criollo y el de codorniz, sólo cambia el tamaño y por ende el precio…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con ventas diarias, la desventaja es la falta de capital para estabilizar el negocio. Su sueño es sacar a sus hijos profesionales. Ella desea realizar una inversión en su negocio mediante la compra de huevo por mayor para contar con mercadería constante y abaratar costos generando mejores ingresos. Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 4 años que desarrolla esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Isabel solicita un préstamo para la compra de huevo por mayor para contar con mercadería constante y abaratar costos generando mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Isabel is 31 years old, and lives with her partner. She has three children, ages five, seven, and nine, and her business is selling eggs. She is a good mother, cheerful, optimistic, and happy. She has a good attitude, and she is committed to her work. She is generous, responsible, and very hardworking. 

She carries out her business in the “El Torno” locality, which is located about 32 kilometers southeast of the city. It is considered the citrus capital, having five thousand hectares (approximately 12,355 acres) devoted to citrus production. It has a warm, sub-tropical climate, with a temperature that varies during the day between 18 and 24 degrees centigrade.

Isabel has olive skin, brown eyes, and long black hair that she wears tied back. She is short of stature, with a slim build. Her maternal tongue is Guaraní, and she speaks Spanish with the general public (she is in the center of the photo, wearing a sky-blue pullover).  She shares her life with her with her partner, who works in transportation, and with her children, who are studying in school. They live in a house that belongs to the family; it is built of wood, with a corrugated iron roof and a cement floor. It has well water that is extracted with a pump and electricity; it does not have sewer service.

Her desire to succeed led her to lead a bank of persons with businesses such as a food sales stand, selling sweaters, construction-materials, knitted baby clothing, fried potatoes, sports clothing, and a neighborhood store, in order to request a loan and improve their businesses.

Her business is selling eggs. She buys eggs at wholesale from the wholesale distributors, and also from local producers. She comments, “The egg varieties are white, creole, and quail; only the size changes, and therefore the price…” The advantage of her business is that her business has daily sales; the disadvantage is the lack of capital to stabilize the business.

Her dream is to help her children to become professionals. She wants to make an investment in her business by purchasing wholesale eggs, in order to have a constant supply of merchandise and to lower costs, thus generating better earnings. This is the second loan cycle with the institution in the four years that she has been carrying out this activity.

These are the reasons that Isabel is requesting a loan: for the purchase of wholesale eggs in order to have a constant supply of merchandise, and to lower costs, thus generating better earnings.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale eggs in order to have a constant supply of merchandise, and to lower costs, thus generating better earnings.

loans.name: Iraliya

texts.ru: Иралия, 64 года, замужем, ест сын, ему 26 лет. У Иралии высшее образование, она экономист по специальности. С 1992 года она занимается торговлей одеждой. В обороте есть товар на сумму 100,000 сом (KGS). Иралия решила развить и приумножить свое дело, поэтому она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку одежды для реализации и оплату аренды магазина. Доходы от бизнеса она будет вкладывать в развитие бизнеса, копить на свадьбу сына и ремонт дома.
texts.en:
Iraliya, 64, is married and has a 26-year-old son. She has a university degree in Economics. Since 1992 she has been earning a living by selling clothes. Her turnover amounts to 100,000 som (KGS). 

Hoping to expand her business, she is requesting a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) from Bai-Tushum bank in order to buy more clothes for sale and pay shop rent. She plans to reinvest the profit in her business, save up for her son’s wedding and renovate her home.

loans.use: to buy clothes for retail sale and to pay shop rent

loans.name: Muhammad's Group

texts.en:
Muhammad is standing in the middle, holding a register. He is the resident of village Harpoke located in province Punjab. He is living with three family members. He continues devoting himself to the business of agriculture, planting  rice and wheat along with vegetables. He has been doing his business for a long time and he is doing well thanks to the hard work that he puts into it each day. He hopes to continue working in this way to keep supporting his family. 
He and his group members are asking for a loan to buy agriculture inputs such as fertilizer, pesticides, seeds and fuel for their rice crop. This loan will enable them to increase their yield. He is grateful for the loan and is committed to repay the loan on time.

loans.use: To purchase agriculture inputs such as fertilizer, pesticide, seeds and fuel

loans.name: Elizabeth De Los Angeles

texts.es:
Elizabeth una joven con 18 años de edad, trabajadora y humilde, que con su esfuerzo y dedicación a logrado salir adelante junto con su familia.

Solicita un crédito en la Corporación Interactuar con el propósito de montar  su primer negocio, un almacén con variedad de productos para todo tipo de personas.
Parte del crédito lo invertirá en la compra de blusas, jeans, lociones, cremas entre otros.

Su deseo es seguir trabajando para mejorar las condiciones de su casa, pues esta no está en buen estado.

En sus manos esta que este empresario cumpla sus deseos, anímese y haga un préstamo.
texts.en:
Elizabeth, 18, is hard working and humble. With effort and dedication she has been able to help get ahead with her family. 

She is requesting a loan from Corporación Interactuar with the goal of setting up her first business. a warehouse with a variety of products for everyone. 

She will invest part of the loan in blouses, jeans, lotions, creams etc. 

She wants to keep working to improve the conditions of her house as it is in a poor state. 

This business person's dreams are in your hands. Please contribute.

loans.use: to buy blouses, jeans, lotions, creams etc.

loans.name: Maria De Los Angeles

texts.es: María de 50 años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida y su hijo de 14 años de edad. Ella posee una panadería donde vende pan francés y pan dulce como: tortas, quesadillas, empanadas entre otros, ya tiene vario  tiempo con el negocio y ha adquirido mucha experiencia en la elaboración de pan, gracias a eso y la variada gama de su producto obtiene buenas  ganancias, la panadería está ubicada en su casa de habitación y comercializa a diferentes zonas de su comunidad. María es bien conocida por vender el pan más sabroso y gracias a eso  ha hecho  mucha clientela que prefieren sus productos  de  calidad. María es una mujer  emprendedora y con muchas ganas de salir adelante y ganarse un futuro más prospero, todos los días se esfuerza al máximo con amor y constancia sabe que solo así obtendrá el éxito que tanto desea, últimamente a aumentado la demanda de su producto y quiere aprovechar para realizar una mayor inversión por eso ella solicita un crédito a FUSAI  para comprar más materia prima como: harinas, levadura, huevos, lácteos, etc. para aumentar la producción de su panadería.
texts.en:
María, 50. lives with her life partner and her 14 year old son. 
She owns a bakery here she sells french bread and pastries such as cakes, quesadillas, savory pastries etc. She has owned her business for quite some time and has acquired a lot of experience in bread baking. 

Thanks to this the variety in her products allows for good profits. The bakery is located in her house and she sells to different areas of the community. 

Maria is well known for selling the tastiest bread and thanks to this she has a large clientele who prefers her quality products. 

Maria is a hard working woman who wants to be successful and have a better future. She tries hard every day with love and consistency she knows that this is how she will be successful. 

Lately demand has increased and she wants to take advantage and make a bigger investment which is shy she is requesting a loan from FUSAI. 

She will buy more raw materials such as flour, yeast, eggs, dairy products etc in order to increase the production in her bakery.

loans.use: buy more raw materials such as flour, yeast, eggs, dairy products etc in order to increase the production in her bakery.

loans.name: Sol Naciente Group

texts.es: Este es el grupo “Sol naciente” conformada por 09 socios entusiastas que en el transcurso del tiempo han demostrado que son personas responsables. Ella es Mechi una de las socias de 40 años de edad, conviviente con 2 hijos dependientes. Ella se dedica al servicio de mototaxi  desde hace 4 meses. Su mayor deseo es de comprarse otra moto para que su negocio crezca. Su crédito lo destinará para reparación de su mototaxi. El grupo “sol naciente” está agradecido con las personas de kiva que hicieron posible este crédito, pues le permite seguir mejorando. Mechi es la primera  del lado izquierdo ella se encuentra sentada y viste polo color fosforescente y chaleco azul.
texts.en:
This is the group Sol Naciente [Rising Sun] made up of 9 enthusiastic members that over time have shown that they are responsible people. 

Mechi is one of the members. She is 40 years old and live-in partner with 2 dependent children. She has worked in the mototaxi business for 4 months. Her biggest wish is to buy another motorcycle so that her business grows. She will use her loan for repairs to her mototaxi. 

The group Sol Naciente is thankful to the people at Kiva that made this loan possible because it allows them to keep improving. Mechi is the the first on the left. She is seated and wearing a fluorescent colored t-shirt and a blue vest.

loans.use: to repair her mototaxi.

loans.name: Penina

texts.en:
Penina is a 39-year-old farmer. She is the mother of six children and is hardworking, humble and responsible. Since she was a girl, she learned to do all of the tasks involved in farming, thanks to her parents' teaching. She is a smallholder farmer based in Nandihills, Kenya, which is a town near the famous Rift Valley escarpment. Penina and her husband are blessed with a lovely family.

Penina has been a farmer for more than twenty years. She keeps poultry for eggs, cows for milk, and grows tea and vegetables for sale. She also engages in small businesses on the side whenever an opportunity crosses her path. Despite the rapid fluctuation of prices in the market, Penina is very passionate and optimistic about the future of farming in Kenya.

Penina is seeking a loan to expand her farm. She intends to buy farm implements. This move is quite a big deal for her. With a loan, Penina seeks to continue growing a variety of crops, but on a greater scale. The demand for vegetables and other greens in Nandihills and other parts of the country is very high. Income from this venture will negate the high farming expenses she has to deal with currently.

In the long run, with increased income, she will finally be able to satisfy her family’s basic needs. She stated, “In the future, I will be able to provide food for my family and also educate my children.”

loans.use: to buy farm implements.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Farming is one of the hardest jobs there is, because of the great effort you have to make in order to progress. However, Robert is a smiling go-getter who never gives up, despite the weather or problem situations that come up. He always manages to meet the requirements of his family. He gets up very early in the morning to go to his farm where he works. He owns a small piece of land together with his lovely wife. They have been blessed with adorable children. 

On the land, they have kept dairy cattle and grown vegetables for five years. Their main income sources are milk and crops. They recently ventured into a small personal business to supplement the meager income they earn. Robert is seeking a loan of 30,000 KES from Kiva lenders to increase his horticultural business. 

Loans to smallholder farmers in Kenya are hard to get, and It is against this backdrop that Juhudi has teamed up with Kiva to afford Robert access to a loan facility that will help him to grow his horticulture farm into a highly profitable business, increase employment opportunities, and bring about increasing commercialization in the rural sector. With this loan, Robert’s family will benefit from the growth and diversification of their family business. This will not only increase their income, but also reduce their income vulnerability. Your support of this young man could give him an enormous push. Kindly consider lending to him!

loans.use: to buy seeds and for his horticulture farm.

loans.name: Burul

texts.ru: Бурул, 48 лет, замужем, мать 3 детей. У нее среднее образование, имеет очень хорошие отзывы от своих соседей. Они отзываются о ней как о оптимистичной и трудолюбивой женщине. Бурул в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, уже 25 лет занимается животноводством и полеводством. В хозяйстве есть 2 коровы, 18 овец. Дополнительно у Бурул есть земельный надел мерою 0,70 ГА, где она выращивает картофель и клевер. Благодаря упорному труду Бурул и ее семьи, ее деятельность приносит около 10,700 сом (KGS) в месяц, что служит основой для покрытия расходов на питание и бытовые нужды семьи. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Бурул планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего бизнеса.
texts.en:
Burul, 48, is married and has three children. She has a high school diploma. Her neighbors speak highly of her: they characterize her as a hardworking and optimistic woman. 

Twenty-five years ago she started breeding livestock and cultivating land. Today she owns two cows and eighteen sheep as well as a 0.70-ha plot of land where she grows potatoes and clover. Through her hard work, she makes about 10,700 som (KGS) a month, which covers her family’s basic living expenses. 

She is requesting a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) from Bai-Tushum bank in order to expand her business. The loan would help her to buy more sheep and increase her livestock headcount. She plans to reinvest the profits in her business.

loans.use: to buy some sheep in order to increase her herd

loans.name: Pamellah

texts.en:
Pamellah is a dedicated and hard-working entrepreneur. Her field of work is farming. She is a smallholder mixed farmer from Kapyego, a remote village in the North Rift area of Kenya. She has been blessed with a lovely family. She has been a farmer for five years, producing milk, eggs and maize for both home consumption and sale. Pamellah's entrepreneurial spirit extends outside agriculture: She is involved in other personal businesses for extra income. Pamellah is very ambitious. She enjoys making more and more returns, but her lack of adequate capital puts her on a short leash. It is for this reason that she is turning to Kiva lenders for a loan. 

Pamellah is seeking a loan of KES 42,400 to buy a cow. With more cows, she will be able to put the pasture on her farm to use and increase her milk production. Your loan will help Pamellah to pull herself out of poverty by constantly growing her asset base. The cow you will finance will reproduce, and with time Pamellah will produce many liters of milk and other dairy products. This improvement in her business will enable her to realize profits that are currently small due to the high cost of inputs. It will impact the rest of her family in a very meaningful way. Her dream is are to be a leader in milk production in her county.

loans.use: to buy a high-quality dairy cow.

loans.name: Almakan

texts.ru: Алмакан, 50 лет, замужем, 6 детей. У нее средне-специальное образование, работает в школьной библиотеке, по совместительству преподает этику. Алмакан в качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи, уже много лет занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес 20 лет назад. Благодаря упорному труду Алмакан в хозяйстве имеется: 8 коров, 30 овец, лошадь. Ее деятельность приносит около 19,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коров для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Алмакан планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего хозяйства.
texts.en:
Almakan, 50, is married and has six children. She finished a vocational secondary school. She works in a school library and teaches Ethics. In addition, she makes her living from livestock breeding and land cultivation. She has been doing it for 20 years. Through her hard work, she owns 8 cows, 30 sheep and a horse. This brings her about 19,000 som (KGS) a month. 

Almakan is requesting a loan of 150,000 som (KGS) from Bai-Tushum bank in order to expand her business. The loan will help her to buy additional cows in order to increase her livestock headcount. She plans to reinvest the profits from this loan in her farm.

loans.use: to buy additional cows in order to increase her livestock headcount

loans.name: Shyrmanai

texts.ru: Шырманай, 43 года, замужем, мать 3 детей. У нее среднее образование, 5 лет занимается животноводством и полеводством. По хозяйству активно помогает вся семья. В хозяйстве Шырманай есть корова. На 0,37 Га земли она выращивает картофель для реализации. В целях увеличения поголовья скота, она обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом, в сумме 10,000 сом(KGS) на покупку овцы для откорма и реализации. Доходы от кредита Шырманай направит на дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса.
texts.en:
Shyrmanai, 43, is married and has three children. She has a high school diploma and in the past five years has been earning her living from livestock breeding and land cultivation. Her family helps her to run the household. Shyrmanai has a cow. In addition, she grows potatoes on a 0.37-ha plot of land. 

Shyrmanai is requesting a loan of 10,000 som (KGS) from Bai-Tushum bank in order to increase her livestock headcount. The loan will help her to buy a ewe for fattening up and resale. She plans to reinvest the profit in her farm.

loans.use: to purchase one sheep for fattening and resale

loans.name: Jolman Nolberto

texts.es: Jolman, tiene  31 años de edad,  esta casado, tiene una hija y reside en una aldea del municipio del Negrito, Yoro. El trabajo unos años en una maquila como asalariado y hace tres años decidió poner su propio negocio junto con su esposa. Vende productos de la canasta básica familiar como ser arroz, frijoles, azúcar, manteca, pan, café, huevos, churros, refrescos, harina, productos de aseo, condimentos etc. De este negocio cubren los gastos del hogar. El prestamo que solicita es por 15,000 lempiras para comprar más productos como azúcar, harina, arroz, manteca, refrescos lácteos y embutidos para mantener inventario y vender. Su plan es seguir creciendo con el negocio para obtener mejores ganancias y que su hija estudie sin problemas económicos.
texts.en:
Jolman, 31, is married and has a daughter. He lives in a small village in the municipality of Negrito, Yoro. He worked for  several years in a clothing factory as an employee, and three years ago he decided to start his own business with his wife. He sells basic homusehold goods such as rice, beans, sugar, butter, bread, coffee, eggs, churros, drinks, flour, cleaning products, condiments etc. With this business they cover the household bills.

The loan he is asking for is for 15,000 lempiras, in order to buy more products such as sugar, flour, rice, butter, drinks, dairy products and cold meats in order to maintain inventory and sell. His plan is to continue growing with the business in order to increase his income and so that his daughter can study without economic problems.

loans.use: to buy more products to sell in his grocery store.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.en: Isabel apply for this $1,000 loan to pay for her tuition to graduate from university. She is single and she is happy with this loan because it will to help her to finish her education.

loans.use: To pay for her tuition to graduate from university

loans.name: Pedro

texts.en: Pedro is married and he is taking the loan from TRM to buy school clothes and school equipment. He did not have enough money to go to school. So now he is taking a $1000 loan to improve his education for the future.

loans.use: to buy school clothes and school equipment

loans.name: Ismael Efrain

texts.es:
Ismael continúa estudiando veterinaria para animales de granja en la universidad. El crédito que obtuvo lo invirtió en la compra de una computadora portátil. El pago de sus cuotas fue puntual porque no tuvo inconvenientes. Actualmente él se encuentra finalizando sus estudios, sólo le falta preparar su tesis, para la cual necesita realizar la compra de textos, libros, pagar por fotocopias, hojas, etc., y otros gastos referentes, “ya estoy en la última etapa de mi carrera, solo me queda preparar la tesis, defenderla y graduarme…” comenta. La ventaja de sus estudios es que existe demanda de profesionales en esa área en el lugar, la desventaja es la falta de capital para la preparación de la tesis final. Su sueño es graduarse como profesional y recorrer el altiplano ayudando a las personas, el desea pagar los gastos de preparación de tesis para graduarse y trabajar en su rubro. Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 3 años que desarrolla esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Ismael solicita un préstamo para pagar los gastos de preparación de tesis para graduarse y trabajar en su rubro.
texts.en: Ismael continues studying to be a farm animal veterinarian at the university. He used his previous loan to purchase a laptop computer. His loan payments were punctual and he didn't have any barriers to repayment. Today he is finishing his studies, he only needs to prepare his thesis, for which he needs to buy texts, books, pay for photocopies, paper, etc. and other related expenses. "I am now in the last stage of my career, I only have to prepare my thesis, defend it, and graduate...", he comments. The advantage to his studies is that there is a demand for professionals with this expertise; the challenge is the lack of capital to prepare his final thesis. His dream is to graduate and become a professional in the highlands, helping people. He wishes to pay the expenses to prepare his thesis in order to graduate and work in his profession.  This is the second sequence of loans with this institution in the 3 years that he has been in school. It is for these reasons that Ismael to pay the expenses to prepare his thesis in order to graduate and work in his profession.

loans.use: to pay the expenses to prepare his thesis in order to graduate and work in his profession.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen de 65 años de edad es una mujer trabajadora que habita en vivienda propia y se dedica a la venta variada de carnes de res y cerdo, además de lácteos y siempre se esfuerza por salir adelante apoyada en su trabajo por lo que se siente feliz de contar con esa fuente de ingresos. Carmen desea solicitar un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: la compra de más carnes, quesos, crema, etc., para aumentar las ventas que le generen mejores ingresos y al mismo tiempo de esta manera ofrecer mayor variedad de producto a sus clientes y así mismo mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Carmen is 65 years old and is a hardworking woman who lives in her own house. She works selling an assortment of beef and pork products as well as dairy products. She always tries very hard to get ahead with the support from her business, so she feels happy to count on that source of income. 

Carmen wants to request a loan from FUSAI to invest in buying more meats, cheeses, cream, etc. to increase the sales that generate better income. At the same time, this way she can offer a larger variety of products to her customers and also improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to invest in meats, cheeses, cream etc. to increase her sales.

loans.name: Annah

texts.en:
Annah is an industrious and progressive smallholder farmer from Bingwa village in the Siongiroi area of Kenya. She is involved in many agricultural activities but dairy farming is her strong suit. The fact that her work brings home an important source of income moves her to keep being better at it every single day.

Annah is requesting a loan to buy a good quality dairy cow that will guarantee reproduction and high milk production.

The impact of the loan will be increased milk production in the short run and an increased number of stock in the long run. This change in the trajectory of the business will eventually lead to an improved livelihood for Annah and her family.

loans.use: to buy a high quality dairy cow

loans.name: Sibilina

texts.en:
The only thing on Sibilina’s mind at the moment is success. She has to work hard and always stay strong through all of the adversities that may arise. Sibilina, a youthful 43-year-old mother, is a wise farmer who is respected by her neighbors and fellow farmers as a mentor. She farms a small plot of land in the green, lush hills of Kapsowar, which is in the Rift valley region of Kenya. 

Sibilina is happily married and is blessed with a lovely family. For the past 10 years, she has been involved in mixed farming. She grows maize and vegetables. Sibilina also operates a flour mill (posho mill), and she has dairy cows. Sibilina has been able to provide nutritious food for her family. She earns profits selling a variety of food crops, but she is faced with the challenge of delivering the produce to the market in a timely manner. This challenge has not made her give up and she states: “I have to do something for my family“. 

Sibilina joined Juhudi Kilimo, which is a microfinance institution that assists aspiring women like her. She applied for a loan from Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva lenders, to buy a motorbike. Sibilina is from a remote village that has poor roads, and transporting her produce to the market has been a challenge. She has suffered many losses of perishable products (milk, vegetables, and tomatoes), which require timely delivery to the market. 

This loan will help Sibilina to achieve her dream and reach her goals. Accessing a financial solution for women in Kenya is an uphill battle, but Sibilina feels relieved to know that there are institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo and Kiva that help women to gain respect and equality among their male counterparts. The benefits of this loan will be astronomical, because Sibilina will never suffer losses due to delay in delivering her produce to the market. She will increase her sales volume, because she will be able to transport more goods to the market. Her income will increase. Sibilina is a woman who is making a change for herself and for others in the community because she intends to employ someone to ride the motorbike and help with the farm work. Sibilina will use the loan to improve her living conditions and assure her children and grandchildren of a secure future. Kindly lend to Sibilina to keep her big smile!

loans.use: to buy a motorbike to help her deliver her perishable products to the market in a timely manner.

loans.name: Felix

texts.en:
Felix is a youthful 25-year-old farmer from Kapsowar, a remote town in the Rift valley area of Kenya. He is elegant and admirable in spirit and effort. He is a role model, a mentor and an inspiration to many young farmers in his village because of his resilience. Despite personal challenges, his passion is to support his siblings and family. 

The living conditions in the Kapsowar area are very tough, and you need to have a tough skin in order to survive. Felix has always shown the resilience necessary to beat all the odds. Because of the hardcore poverty in his village, Felix started practicing mixed farming 10 years ago. His sources of income are vegetables, milk, and egg sales. However, these products are highly perishable and require timely delivery to the market. The Kapsowar area has a poor road network and poor feeder roads, which really hampers timely delivery of products to the market.  That is why Felix is kindly seeking a loan to buy a motorbike. With the motorbike, he will deliver products to the market on time and reap more profits, because the products will still be fresh. 

Felix is very determined to succeed. Because he is very disciplined with his finances, he believes he will be able to provide a secure future for himself and for his grandchildren through his accumulated profits. Felix's dream is to provide a secure future for his siblings by paying tuition fees for them. You will help him realize his dream through your loan.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike to deliver his perishable products to the market in a timely manner.

loans.name: Meerikan

texts.ru: Меерикан, 47 лет, замужем. У нее среднее образование, 6 лет она занимается торговлей женской одеждой, на данный момент есть 3 торговые точки. Ежемесячный доход Меерикан от ведения бизнеса около 27,300 сом (KGS). Она добивается всего своими силами, знает, как правильно использовать и планировать денежные средства. Она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку одежды для расширения ассортимента. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение бизнеса и хочет накопить на свадьбу сына.
texts.en:
Meerikan, 47, is married. She has a high school diploma. In the past six years she has been selling female clothes. She has three outlets and her monthly income amounts to about 27,300 som (KGS). She is good at managing money and tries to achieve everything on her own. 

Meerikan is requesting a loan of 150,000 som (KGS) from Bai-Tushum bank in order to buy more clothes for sale. She plans to reinvest the profit in her business and save up for her son’s wedding.

loans.use: to buy clothes for retail sale and attract new clients

loans.name: Anar

texts.ru: Анар, 57 лет, замужем, мать 4 детей. У нее среднее образование, уже 6 лет она занимается торговлей продуктами питания, в частности шоколадом на рынке города. В обороте есть товар на сумму 210,000 сом (KGS). Анар обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку товаров для реализации. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса и постройку дома.
texts.en:
Anar, 57, is married and has four children. She has a high school diploma and in the past six years has been selling chocolate at the local market. Her turnover amounts to 210,000 som (KGS). 

Anar is requesting a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) from Bai-Tushum bank in order to buy more goods for sale. She plans to reinvest the profit in her business and build a house.

loans.use: to buy food for retail sale

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is a woman who is very dedicated to her work. Her tenacity and perseverance have allowed her to pull through, overcoming different obstacles that have arisen in her life. She is a mother of five from Chuka, a remote town in the central province of Kenya.

She has spent the past 30 years of her life farming. She sells eggs, milk, and vegetables produced on her farm. She also engages in a personal business to make ends meet. Catherine is a go-getter and has a great desire to succeed in life. Of all the activities she involves herself in, poultry farming is closest to her heart.

Catherine wants to diversify and start a cereal-selling business. She is requesting a loan to buy cereals for resale. The Chuka area has a ready market for cereals, but the problem is that there are no cereal suppliers. With your loan, Catherine will be able to sell cereals to the local market and to her neighbors.

This will generate enough income to repay the loan, and she will also be able to save extra money. Catherine is very concerned about her children’s education, so profits from cereal selling will go to pay their school fees. She dreams of a secure future for her children.

Catherine awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy cereals for resale.

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
When speaking with Salome, it becomes obvious that she is a very dynamic, hardworking and helpful woman, and that everything she does is for her family's benefit and wellbeing. She lives in a humble home in the town of Nkubu, along with her handsome husband and their seven angelic-looking children. She has always strived to give them a decent life and a good education. 

Salome has been in agriculture for seven years. She makes money selling produce from her farm, including milk, eggs, and crops. She enjoys plowing her farm and watering her plants. Crop diseases pose a big challenge for her, as does low productivity. Salome is seeking a loan to buy farm inputs. With the loan, she plans to buy good quality seeds and fertilizer, which will help increase soil fertility and productivity on her farm. Increased productivity will allow her to improve her quality of life and living standards. 

Through her training from Juhudi Kilimo, Salome has learned about the culture of saving, and she plans to use the increased income to improve her farming. This loan will go a long way toward changing the life of Salome and her family. Salome has the firm intention to advance her farming business. She wants to become a successful businesswoman and ensure a better quality of life and welfare for her family. She knows that, with help from Kiva lenders and Juhudi Kilimo, she can achieve all that and more. Lend to this enterprising Kenyan woman farmer!

loans.use: to buy good quality seeds and fertilizers for her farm.

loans.name: Gulsaira

texts.ru: Гулсайра, 44 года, замужем, мать 3 детей. С 2003 года она занимается животноводством и полеводством. На сегодня в хозяйстве имеет: 2 коровы. На участке мерою 0,20 Га она выращивает клубнику для реализации. Доход Гулсайры - 17,800 сом (KGS) в месяц. Она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 80,000 сом (KGS) на покупку одной коровы. В будущем Гулсайра хочет увеличивать поголовье скота и накопить на обучение ее детей.
texts.en:
Gulsaira, 44, is married and has three children. Since 2003 she has been earning a living from livestock breeding and field crop cultivation. Today she owns two cows and grows strawberries for sale on a 0.20-ha plot of land. This brings her about 17,800 som (KGS) a month. 

Gulsaira is requesting a loan of 80,000 som (KGS) from Bai-Tushum bank in order to buy a cow. She would like to increase her livestock headcount and save up for her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy one cow in order to increase her herd

loans.name: Damira

texts.ru: Дамира, 35 лет, не замужем, воспитывает 2 детей. У Дамиры высшее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, она занимается животноводством, стартовав 15 лет назад с 10,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Дамиры, на данный момент в ее хозяйстве имеется 2 коровы, 25 овец. Ее ежемесячная прибыль - около 7,800 сом (KGS), этих средств не хватает на достойную жизнь и воспитание ее детей. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Дамира обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец и телят для откорма и перепродажи. Доходы от кредита она планирует вкладывать в дальнейшее расширение бизнеса, что позволит улучшить материальное благосостояние ее семьи.
texts.en:
Damira, 35, is single and has two children. Her primary source of income is livestock breeding. She started out fifteen years ago with a sum of 10,000 som (KGS). Through her hard work, she owns 2 cows and 25 sheep. Her monthly income is about 7,800 som (KGS) but this is not enough for living a decent life and raising children. 

Damira is requesting a loan of 50,000 Kyrgyz som (KGS) from Bai-Tushum bank in order to buy sheep and calves for fattening up and resale. She plans to reinvest the profit in her farm, which would allow to improve her family’s material well-being.

loans.use: to buy some sheep and calves in order to increase her income

loans.name: Zhuzhuna

texts.en:
Zhuzhuna is 65 years old. She lives in Ozurgeti district with her husband, son, and daughter-in-law. Zhuzuna is unemployed and  has a great desire to do her bit for her family's welfare, and to somehow increase their income. Zhuzhuna requested a loan from Credo to start a business. Her loan request was approved in the framework of a joint initiative by Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisions provision for business start-ups and restart-up credits with soft conditions for the country's rural poor, who are regarded as "high risk borrowers" because of their low income and lack of access to credit products. 

With the received credit, Zhuzhuna will start to purchase tables and chairs and other needed inventory to open a restaurant. Her husband will also help her. They will work hard in their newly opened restaurant to satisfy their clients and generate stable income. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly increase the family's income. Their income will double, and the family members will be able to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase inventory for opening a restaurant

loans.name: Sandra Patricia

texts.es: Sandra vive en una Provincia netamente ganadera y de producción agrícola, Sandra  tiene 34 años de edad, Sandra es madre soltera y vive junto a sus  3 hijos de 14, 16 y 20 años, 2 están estudiando y el mayor ya no pudo seguir los estudios debido a la falta de recursos económicos de su madre, es asi que se dedica a trabajar al jornal, Sandra se dedica a la crianza de animales menores desde hace 7 años, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de chanchos ya que este negocio es el que le deja ganancias para tener para cubrir las necesidades de sus hijos y seguir incrementando su negocio, Sandra tiene la  aspiración de seguir luchando en la vida por sus hijos para darles hasta donde más pueda la educación.
texts.en:
Sandra lives in a province with high cattle and agricultural production. Sandra is a 34 year old single mother. She lives with her three children aged 14, 16 and 20 years old. Two are studying and the oldest couldn't continue with his studies due to the lack of economic resources of his mother so he is working as day labor.

Sandra has been working raising small animals for seven years, She will invest the loan buying pigs as it is this business that leaves her profit to pay for the needs of her children and continue to expand her business. Sandra has ambitions to continue fighting in this life to provide her children with all the education she can.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Trabajando Juntas Group

texts.es: Ada de 39 años de edad es conviviente con dos hijos menores de edad. Este es el Grupo “Trabajando juntas” esta conformada por 04 mujeres carismáticas y 01 caballero con proyecciones a crecer cada día en sus negocios. Ada se dedica a la venta de especerias como aji molido, ajos y condimentos. Hace mas de 05 años que se dedica a dicho negocio por lo que tiene planeado implementar su tienda para vender mas productos variados. Es por ello que solicitó el crédito para la compra de mercaderías de abarrotes al por mayor . El grupo “Trabajando Juntas” agradecen a los inversionistas Kiva por el apoyo brindado. Ada es la primera del lado derecho y viste chompa blanca con pantalón marrón.
texts.en:
Ada, 39 years old, has a live-in partner and two minor children. This is the group "Trabajando Juntas” [Working Together] which is comprised of 4 charismatic women and 1 gentleman, with plans of growing each day in their businesses.  

Ada makes a living selling spices like ground chili, garlic and condiments. She has worked in this business for more than 5 years, and now has plans to implement her store to sell more varied products. For that reason she seeks a loan for the purchase of wholesale grocery merchandise.  

The group "Trabajando Juntas" thanks the Kiva investors for the support given. Ada is first from the left, dressed in a white sweater and brown pants.

loans.use: to buy wholesale grocery merchandise and implement her store.

loans.name: Chepkemoi

texts.en:
Chepkemoi is a young dairy farmer from the Sirikwa location in South Rift Kenya. She enjoys dairy farming because she loves cows and the milk they produce not only feeds her family but also brings them income.

Chepkemoi applied for a loan because she wants to buy a dairy cow and grow her dairy farm. Having one more cow will increase the quantity of dairy products and byproducts while cutting the cost of feed and animal husbandry.

The impact of this loan to Chepkemoi will be increased income which will elevate the quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Hello! Meet Margaret, 35 years of age, a very hard-working, honest and dedicated farmer who lives in Mugwe, a remote village in Chuka. She is happily married and is blessed with three adorable children. 

She has been practicing mixed farming for the last 20 years and has gained so much experience. To afford a decent and comfortable life for her children, she has been selling milk, eggs, and a variety of food crops from her farmland. To make ends meet and make extra cash, she has been engaging in another small personal business. 

The Chuka area is very populated and demand for poultry products and eggs is very high. Like many farmers from her region, she finds poultry farming very enjoyable, and she stated that the most enjoyable part about poultry farming is “the increased profits I enjoy.” 

Her biggest challenge, however, is meeting the demand that is really high. She lacks funds to increase her poultry farming, and she is seeking a loan of 20,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) to buy poultry. Being a woman accessing funds is very challenging, but through institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva, she feels relieved knowing that her dream will be achieved, and she will be able to buy more poultry. 

Through the loan, she will sell eggs and poultry products to her neighbors and to the local market, and this will translate to increased profit margins and an improved income level. Being a visionary woman, she intends to accumulate more profits and increase her poultry market to other markets and this will increase her income and improve her living conditions. 

The extra income she will get will be used in fully repaying back the loan and permanently changing her living conditions and securing the future of her school-going children. She needs your help to make these aspirations come to fruition!

loans.use: To buy poultry

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is a diligent Kenyan farmer from Kapsowar. She is married and blessed with a lovely family. Ten years ago, Caroline decided to start farming. Her husband was supportive, and he even allowed her to use their land as capital.

Today, she has achieved great milestones in terms of diversifying from vegetable farming by introducing farm animals such as dairy cows and hens. She also does a side hustle business (posho mill) to supplement the meager income she earns from farming. However, a large portion of the land is still dedicated to maize farming.

Caroline is seeking a loan from Kiva lenders to purchase farm implements. After years of use, her farm tools have become old and worn out. This makes Caroline’s work on the farm very slow and tedious. With your loan, she will be able to acquire new farm implements that are in good condition, better designed, durable, and more efficient. The overall effect will be a better quality of farm work and better yields at the end of the season.

Her biggest dream is to become a large-scale farmer, which she believes she can achieve slowly with the help of Kiva and Juhudi, which is a field partner.

loans.use: to buy farm implements.

loans.name: Viola

texts.en:
Hello, Lenders, meet Viola. This lovely lady is from Kapsowar, in the North Rift region of Kenya. One thing you will notice when visiting Kapsowar is that the place is all green! Expansive maize farm and hills stretch 360 degrees to the horizon. Maize farming and dairy farming are the most dominant in the area. 

For five years, Viola has been banking on dairy farming to provide for her family: Her primary income source is milk. This is what she had to say about dairy farming: 'It is what educates my children!' 

Viola is seeking a loan to purchase poultry. She is seeking a loan through Juhudi Kilimo because the microfinance institution has an exclusive focus on farmers. With the money, she will diversify into poultry farming. She will introduce eggs and meat into her product portfolio. This move not only increases her income but also helps her to manage various risks that may befall dairy farming in future. 

Viola is the type of mother that places more premiums on education than an average parent. She believes that if she does her part and lays a proper foundation for her children through education, she has afforded them a shot at being anything they want to be in the future.

loans.use: to purchase poultry

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to start sheep farming.

loans.name: Faith

texts.en:
Hello! Meet Faith, who, with her partner, has become a very good smallholder farmer. They didn't just get together romantically; they joined their hands in improving their farm to create financial strength for the home that they share. She is happily married and has been practising mixed farming for the last 10 years and has gained so much experience. To afford a decent and comfortable life for her family, she has been selling eggs and varieties of food crops from her farmland. To make ends meet and make extra cash, she has also been engaging in another small personal business.

The Kerugoya area is very populated, and the demand for poultry products and eggs is very high. Like many farmers from her region, she finds poultry farming very enjoyable. She stated that what she likes best is “the increased profits I enjoy.” Her biggest challenge, however, is meeting the demand, which is really high. She lacks funds to increase her poultry farming, and she is seeking a loan of 40,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) to buy poultry.

Being a woman, she finds that accessing funds is very challenging, but through institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva, she feels relieved knowing that her dream will be achieved, and she will be able to buy more poultry. As a result of the loan, she will sell eggs and poultry products to her neighbours and to the local market, and this will translate to an increased profit margin and an improved income level. Being a visionary woman, she intends to accumulate more profits and expand her poultry sales to other markets. This will increase her income and improve her living conditions. The extra income she will get will be used to fully repay the loan, permanently change her living conditions and secure the future of her school-going children. Help this hardworking woman realize her dream!

loans.use: To buy poultry

loans.name: Jedidah

texts.en:
Jedidah is a woman with a lot of honesty, wisdom and a go getter. She is very industrious and resides in the Siongiroi area of Kenya. Jedidah has been farming for the past 10 years. Through these years, she has gained much experience and is considered among the best farmers in her village. She has been practicing mixed farming. Her primary sources of income have been milk, eggs, crops, and some small business ventures that help her make ends meet. Jedidah is very passionate about farming and loves cultivating her farm. That is why, every day, she wakes up very early to go to her farm to plow.

Although she makes profits from farming, she is not comfortable and has always wanted to increase her income by selling cereals. That is why she is seeking this loan to buy cereals. Kenya's Siongiroi area, one of the county's populated regions, has a high demand for cereals. This means that Jedidah could increase her profits and satisfy the demand that is there.

Accessing funds has been a challenge for Jedidah, but she now feels relieved because Juhudi Kilimo is partnering with Kiva lenders to help aspiring women farmers like her turn their farming dreams into reality through training and loan financing. Jedidah believes that this loan will be of much help, and that she will be able to satisfy the demand for cereals. She also believes that the extra income she earns will enable a permanent change in her life and increase her business. Increased profits will allow Jedidah to repay this loan and secure the future of her school-going children.

loans.use: to buy cereals.

loans.name: Aibarkut

texts.ru: Айбаркут, 29 лет, замужем, мать 3 детей школьного и дошкольного возраста. У Айбаркут среднее образование, в качестве дохода для своей семьи на протяжении 5 лет занимается полеводством и животноводством. Благодаря упорному труду и целеустремленности Айбаркут, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется земельный участок мерою 1,20 ГА собственной земли, где она выращивает ячмень для реализации оптовым покупателям. Также в хозяйстве есть корова и 15 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 15,800 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коровы. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса и покупку автомобиля для семьи.
texts.en:
Aibarkut, 29, is married and has three preschool- and school-age children. She has a high school diploma and in the past five years has been earning her living from livestock breeding and land cultivation. Through her hard work and purposefulness, she owns a 1.20-ha plot of land where she grows barley for wholesale. She also has a cow and 15 sheep. Her monthly income amounts to about 15,800 som (KGS). 

Hoping to develop her farm, Aibarkut is requesting a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) from Bai-Tushum bank to be able to buy a cow. She plans to reinvest the profit in her business and buy a car for her family.

loans.use: to buy one cow in order to increase her livestock headcount

loans.name: Nazgul

texts.ru: Назгул, 28 лет, замужем, имеет 3 детей. Муж активно помогает по хозяйству. Назгул в качестве дохода для своей семьи, занимается животноводством и растениеводством. Благодаря упорному труду, в ее хозяйстве на сегодня есть 4 коровы и 8 овец, на 2,0 Га земли пшеницу и клевер для реализации. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 2 телят и 10 овец для откорма и реализации.  Доходы от кредита Назгул планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего бизнеса.
texts.en:
Nazgul, 28, is married and has three children. Her husband helps her to run the household. She earns a living from livestock breeding and crop cultivation. Through her hard work, she now owns four cows and eight sheep. She also grows wheat and clover for sale on a 2.0-ha plot of land. 

Nazgul is requesting a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) from Bai-Tushum bank in order to develop her farm. The loan would help her to buy two calves and ten sheep for fattening up and resale. She plans to reinvest the profits in her business.

loans.use: to purchase two calves and ten sheep for fattening and resale

loans.name: Hugo Javier

texts.es:
Hugo tiene 44 años y vive en su pequeña finca con su esposa y sus tres hijos, en una comunidad rural de Nicaragua. Desde hace más de 15 años la producción de café es la principal fuente de ingresos para esta familia.

Este ciclo, este pequeño productor está solicitando un financiamiento para comprar los insumos agrícolas que requiere su cafetal para garantizar el plan de nutrición que le permitirá incrementar la productividad y rentabilidad de su finca. 

El sueño de este productor es continuar invirtiendo en su finca para dar a sus hijos mejores condiciones y oportunidades que las que él tuvo.
texts.en:
Hugo is 44 years old and lives on a small farm with his wife and three children. They live in a rural community in Nicaragua. For more than 15 years he has produced coffee as the main source of income for his family.

This loan cycle, this small producer is seeking financing to buy farming supplies that his plantation requires in order to guarantee a nutritional plan that will increase productivity and thus profitability on his farm. He dreams of continuing to invest in his farm in order to give his children the best conditions and opportunities in life.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies that he will apply to his coffee plantation to ensure a good harvest

loans.name: Ugilhan

texts.ru: Угилхан, 44 года, замужем, мать 5 дочерей и 1 сына. Образование- среднее, с 2010 года занимается полеводством и животноводством. Благодаря упорному труду Угилхан, на сегодняшний день она имеет хорошее развитое хозяйство, 6 коров. Ежедневно она продает экологически чистое, домашнее и очень вкусное молоко. На 1,70 Га она выращивает рис. Среднемесячный доход Угилхан около 32,700 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, она обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку удобрений, семян для обработки почвы и выращивания экологически чистого риса. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее расширение ее бизнеса, что позволит ей вырастить детей и дать им достойное образование.
texts.en:
Ugilhan, 44, is married and has five daughters and a son. She has a high school diploma and from 2010 has been cultivating land and breeding livestock. Through her hard work, she owns a nice farm with six cows. Every day she sells delicious organic milk. In addition, she grows rice on a 1.70-ha plot of land.
