Her total monthly income is about 32,700 som (KGS). 

Ugilhan is requesting a loan of 150,000 som (KGS) from Bai-Tushum bank in order to develop her farm. The loan would help her to buy fertilizer and seeds and to grow organic rice. She plans to reinvest the profit in her farm, which would allow her to raise and educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seeds for land cultivation and growing organic rice

loans.name: Toilukan

texts.ru: Тойлукан, 35 лет, есть 2 детей, замужем. Образование у нее среднее, в качестве дохода для своей семьи, занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 3 года назад с 20,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Тойлукан, на данный момент в ее хозяйстве имеется 4 коровы, 18 овец, лошадь. На ежедневной основе продает молоко.  На 0,84 Га земли выращивает кукурузу и картофель. Ежемесячный доход составляет примерно 30,700 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Тойлукан обратилась в Банк «Бай–Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота для увеличения поголовья. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее расширение бизнеса и обучение детей.
texts.en:
Toilukan, 35, is married and has two children. She has a high school diploma and has been earning a living from livestock breeding and agriculture. She started out three years ago with a sum of 20,000 som (KGS). Through her hard work, she owns 4 cows, 18 sheep and a horse. She sells milk on a daily basis. She grows corn and potatoes on a 0.84-ha plot of land. She has a monthly income of approximately 30,700 som (KGS). 

Toilukan is requesting a loan of 150,000 som (KGS) from Bai-Tushum bank to be able to increase her livestock count. The loan would help her to buy additional livestock. She plans to invest the profit in expanding her business and educating her children.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock in order to increase her herd

loans.name: Emperatriz Estela

texts.es: emperatriz de 33 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y su hija, ella posee una pequeña tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia desde hace un año tiene muchos clientes por sus buenos precios con las ventas que realiza logra salir adelante con su familia, ella esta solicitante un crédito para la compra de sopas, huevos, granos básicos, refrescos, golosinas, pan dulce, etc. y así poder tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Emperatriz, who is 33 years old, lives in her own house with her husband and daughter. For the last year she has had a small store located in her residence.  She has many customers due to her good prices.  

With the sales she makes she's managed to move forward with her family. She's seeking a loan for the purchase of soups, eggs, basic grains, soft drinks, candies, sweet breads, etc., to be able to obtain greater income for a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase soups, eggs, basic grains, soft drinks, candies, sweet breads, etc.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es:
Beatriz continúa con su negocio de venta de ropa de segunda mano. El crédito que obtuvo lo invirtió en la compra de ropa por fardos. El pago de sus cuotas fue puntual. En esta oportunidad ella inicia un nuevo negocio, se trata de la venta de zapatos de segunda mano, actividad que se encuentra en sus inicios y que ha tenido buena aceptación, “abrí otro puesto de venta, esta vez de zapatos, al comienzo pensé que iba a ser difícil pero los clientes iniciaron sus compras…” comenta. La ventaja de sus actividades es que se realizan ventas diarias, la desventaja es la falta de capital para la compra de zapatos por mayor. Su sueño es abrir una tienda, ella desea realizar la compra de zapatos por mayor para estabilizar su segundo puesto de venta. Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 25 años que viene desarrollando esta actividad. 
Es por esos motivos que Beatriz solicita un préstamo para la compra de zapatos de segunda mano por mayor para estabilizar su segundo puesto de venta y continuar en el negocio.
texts.en:
Beatriz continues with her second-hand clothing sales business. She invested the loan that she obtained in the purchase of clothing by the bale, and she has made her payments punctually. 

On this occasion she is starting a new business selling second-hand shoes. She is just beginning this occupation, and it has been very well received.  She comments, “I opened the other sales stand, this time with shoes. At the beginning I thought it was going to be difficult, but the customers started making their purchases…”

The advantage of her occupation is that she makes sales every day, and the disadvantage is the lack of capital for the purchase of shoes at wholesale. Her dream is to open a store. 

She wants to make the purchase of shoes at wholesale in order to stabilize her second sales stand. This is the second loan cycle with the institution in the 25 years that she has been engaged in this occupation.

These are the reasons that Beatriz is requesting a loan: to purchase second-hand shoes at wholesale in order to stabilize her second sales stand, and to continue in the business.

loans.use: to purchase second-hand shoes at wholesale in order to stabilize her second sales stand, and continue in the business.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is a woman who is very hardworking, ambitious, and persevering in her dreams. She has the character to run her farming business, which is a small farm, where she has a principle and that is to be very proper with her customers. She has been blessed with a lovely family. She has been a farmer for eleven years, producing milk and maize for both consumption and sale.

Lilian's entrepreneurial spirit extends outside agriculture. She is involved in other personal businesses for extra income. Lilian is very ambitious. She enjoys making more and more returns but lack of adequate capital puts her on a leash. It is for this reason that she is turning to Kiva lenders for a loan.

Lilian is seeking KES 40,000 to purchase a cow. With more cows, she will be able to utilize the pasture on her farm and increase milk production. Your loan will help Lilian to pull herself out of poverty through constantly growing her asset base. The cow you will finance will reproduce, and with time Lilian will produce many litres of milk and other dairy products. This improvement in her business will enable her to realize profits that are currently cut due to the high cost of inputs. It will impact the rest of her family in a very meaningful way.

loans.use: to buy another dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.en:
Jacinta is a mother with energy and perseverance to get ahead her family and her farming business. She is a very industrious, honest and hard-working woman from the Nkubu area of Kenya, near the famous Mount Kenya. 

Jacinta, 37, has been farming for the past eight years. Over the years, she has gathered much experience and is considered among the best farmers in her village. She has been practising mixed farming. Her primary sources of income have been different varieties of crops, milk, and some small business ventures that help her make ends meet. Jacinta is very passionate about farming and loves cultivating her farm. That is why, every day, she wakes up very early to go to her farm to plough. 

Although she makes profits from farming, she is not comfortable and has always wanted to increase her income by selling cereals. That is why she is seeking this loan to buy cereals. Kenya's Nkubu area, one of the country's populated regions, has a high demand for cereals. This means that Jacinta could increase her profits and satisfy the demand that is there. 

Accessing funds has been a challenge for Jacinta, but she now feels relieved, because Juhudi Kilimo is partnering with Kiva lenders to help aspiring women farmers like her turn their farming dreams into reality through training and loan financing. Jacinta believes that this loan will be of much help, and that she will be able to satisfy the demand for cereals. 

She also believes that the extra income she earns will enable permanent change in her life and increase her business. Increased profits will allow Jacinta to repay this loan and secure the future of her school-going children.

loans.use: to buy cereals for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Many people have chicken farms in Kenya, but few start a business out of it. Mary is a small landholder and mixed farmer based in Kiminda village. She is the mother of nine and has practiced mixed farming for thirty-five years. To earn a decent living, she sells milk and poultry and engages in numerous small personal businesses.

Recently, she started seeing how she could make money out of poultry farming. Raising hens to Mary is something close to a hobby. She wants to sell eggs but figures it won't make economic sense unless she buys more poultry. However, her biggest challenge today is limited funds to expand. Mary is seeking a loan from Kiva lenders via Juhudi Kilimo to buy hens. Future proceeds from the commercialization of her farm are already committed to pay for her children's education. In the long run, she is confident her efforts will translate into her family having a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy poultry

loans.name: Lenity

texts.en:
Hello world: meet Lenity. She is a smallholder farmer based in Kianjungu village, which is found in the Central region of Kenya. The 24-year-old farmer started in 2012 with a dairy cow and poultry for milk and eggs. As of today, she has also ventured into crop farming both for sale and consumption. 

She sells her produce at Nkubu which is one of the fastest growing towns in Africa. Lenity is seeking a loan to increase her banana farming. Growing bananas does not require much effort, but to achieve high yields requires skills, dedication, and proper planting methods. 

Lenity, who has three children, feels she is cut out for it. She has adequate space at the one acre farm she owns for this project. She also has one employee who is a farmer, and he will come in handy to get the banana farm off the ground. 

Returns from this investment will enable Lenity to pay for food, which is her highest monthly expense when she is not servicing a loan. She managed to attain a primary school education herself. With your investment, she will make enough income to educate her children and even further her own education if the stars align.

loans.use: to increase her banana farming

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
It is common to have a chicken farm in Kenya, but starting your own business is something else entirely. Christine is a smallholder mixed farmer based in Kapsowar, a remote village in Kenya. She is a loving mother and has been practicing mixed farming for the last ten years. To earn a decent living, she sells milk and greens and engages in numerous small personal businesses.

Only recently, she started seeing how she could make more money through poultry farming. In the past, she saw raising hens as just a hobby. She wants to sell eggs, but assumes that the quantity she produces will not make economic sense. She needs to purchase more poultry. However, her biggest challenge today is limited funds to expand her business.

Christine is seeking a loan of KES 20,000 from Kiva lenders, via Juhudi Kilimo, to purchase poultry. Future proceeds from the commercialization of her poultry farm are already committed to pay for her children's education. In the long run, she is confident that her efforts will translate into a better quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional poultry.

loans.name: Aileen

texts.en:
Thirty five years ago, Aileen started farming on a small inherited piece of land in Chuka, a remote rural town in Kenya. Today, this humble mother of three children sells milk, eggs, and a variety of food crops. 

She is a passionate farmer and, because of the immense knowledge she has about farming, she commands a lot of respect from other farmers in her village. Dairy farming is close to her heart, and every day she wakes up to milk her cow and that makes her very proud. 

Although she makes a profit through milk selling, she lacks a proper dairy unit so she is seeking a loan to build a modern dairy unit. Through the loan she will have an easier time milking her cow and also feeding. A good dairy unit provides a good place where cows can relax and also prevent them from diseases that may arise because of being exposed to harsh weather conditions such as rain. 

Aileen believes that through this loan her living conditions will change because she is going to have an increase in milk production. She will save money that she used to spend on treating her cows because she lacked a good dairy unit. Aileen waits for your kindness.

Help this Kenyan smallholder farmer with a loan today!

loans.use: to build a modern dairy unit

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella is always a smiling young fighter, vibrant and active. Neither the economic necessity nor the lack of employment opportunities stop her from continuing to fight and progress.

She is a smallholder farmer in Central Kenya who is very passionate about dairy farming. She started doing mixed farming back in 2005. She has two children to look after with the income she makes from farming. Her primary income sources are milk and poultry. Stella stated that her business is profitable, despite facing numerous challenges in terms of needed resources.

She is looking to improve the state of her farm in order to make the work more efficient. Stella is seeking a business loan to construct a shed for her dairy cattle. The shed will protect her animals against harsh weather, thus minimizing health issues. The shed will also improve feed management, as she is slowly transitioning to zero-grazing. Her highest monthly expenses are farm inputs.

When asked, "How will this loan benefit your family?”, Nancy replied, “Their lives will change because the food will be enough.”

loans.use: to construct a cowshed.

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah, 29, is a woman with a vision; she's an entrepreneur and very active. For lack of work experience and education, it has been very difficult to find work opportunities and so she decided to venture into farming. 

She is a 29-year-old smallholder farmer based in Kapsowar, which is a small rural town in the North Rift region of Kenya. Leah and her husband have been blessed with an adorable family. 

For 10 years Leah has been a mixed-farmer. She keeps dairy cattle and poultry on her farm. She also grows maize, among other crops. Despite prevailing animal diseases, she finds dairy farming to be the most enjoyable commercial farming activity. Besides dairy farming, she has a deep connection with gardening. 

In African communities, gardening is the most popular, yet the least exclusive, hobby for women. You really don't have to be born with a green thumb to give life to a glorious garden; any woman with a homestead and a few square feet of earth is doing her best to make her little corner of the world more gracious and beautiful. 

Leah, however, is taking this a little step further. Leah is seeking a loan to start horticultural farming. This is a big deal for her. She is very excited to start growing different varieties of crops for commercial purposes. The demand for vegetables and other greens is always high. 

Income from this venture will cover the high farming expenses she has to deal with currently. In the long run, with increased income, she will finally be able to satisfy her family’s basic needs.

loans.use: To start horticultural farming

loans.name: Luisa Fernanda

texts.es:
Con 26 años de edad la señora Luisa, logro consolidar su primer negocio propio, una tienda de abarrotes, un medio por el cual ha logrado salir adelante con sus dos hijos menores.

Su deseo es seguir creciendo como familia y empresaria, solicita un crédito en la Corporación Interactuar con el fin de surtir su negocio con productos de la canasta familiar y hacer unos cuantos arreglos en su tienda.

Su mayor sueño es pagarles la educación a sus hijos, pues son el único motivo por el cual ella sigue luchando.

Aporta al sueño de esta madre, haga un préstamo.
texts.en:
At 26, Luisa was able to realize her first business, a grocery store.  Through this business she has been able to get ahead with her two young children.

Her wish is to continue growing with her family and as a business woman.  She requests a loan to Corporacion Interactuar with the goal to stock her business with basic need products and also to make a few improvements to the store.

Her dream is to pay for her children’s education, they are her only reason to continue fighting.  

Help this woman achieve her dream, lend today.

loans.use: to stock her business with basic need products and also to make a few improvements to the store.

loans.name: Santa Rosa De Proboste Group

texts.es:
Andreyna es una mujer de 18 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene un hijo de 1 año, y su negocio es la venta de artesanía.
Ella es emprendedora, decidida, constante, activa, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la comunidad ‘Proboste’ caracterizada por convertirse en una Ciudad intermedia, teniendo como centro turístico la Iglesia, Además de sus artesanías y su arte culinario, hacen una ciudad confortable, posee todos los servicios básicos, Luz, Agua, Alcantarillado sanitario, Telefonía fija y móvil, Tv. Cable, hotelería, instituciones financieras, Supermercados, Hospitales públicos y clínicas privadas, Universidades, colegios fiscales y privados. De clima cálido sub tropical con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 21-35 grados centígrados.
Andreyna es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro largo lo usa amarrado, baja estatura, complexión física robusta, su lengua materna es el guaraní que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza (la segunda de la izquierda, viste chompa marrón y pantalón negro). Su vida la disfruta en compañía de su pareja que trabaja elaborando sombreros de saó y con su hijo que aún no se encuentra en edad escolar y está aprendiendo a caminar, viven en un cuarto propiedad de la familia construido de madera con techo de calamina y piso de ladrillo que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. La necesidad de pagar los gastos posnatales de su hijo la llevaron a formar una banca de personas con negocios como; venta de fruta, artesanía en cuero, elaboración de sombreros de sao, ganadería, pollería, servicio de moto taxi, venta de ropa de segunda mano y venta de medicina natural,  para solicitar un préstamo y mejorar sus actividades. Su negocio es la venta de artesanía como; collares, manillas, aretes, anillos, etc., “nuestra ciudad al ser de paso es de comercio también y a los visitantes les gusta llevarse recuerdos de todo tipo para recordar su grata estancia en el lugar…” comenta. Paralelamente a su actividad de artesanía, ella vende refrescos hervidos típicos, de somó y chicha, ambas son bebidas refrescantes a base de maíz, se sirven fríos y son muy populares. La ventaja de sus actividades es que puede ocuparse de ambas al mismo tiempo, la desventaja es la falta de capital de trabajo para la elaboración de artesanías y refrescos hervidos. Su sueño es mejorar su negocio de artesanía con nuevos diseños propios, ella desea realizar la compra de material de trabajo para artesanía como cuero, madera, arcilla, y otros, y también para su negocio de refrescos para comprar, maíz, azúcar, hielo, etc. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 7 años que desarrolla esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Andreyna solicita un préstamo para la compra de material de trabajo para artesanía como también para su negocio de refrescos.
texts.en:
Andreyna is an 18 year old woman who lives with her partner and 1 year old son. Her business is selling handicrafts.

She is enterprising, determined, constant, active, responsible and hardworking. Her business is located in the 'Provost' community, a mid-size city known for its church. In addition to its crafts and cuisine, it has all basic services such as electricity, water, sewerage, and health, making it a comfortable city. In addition there is fixed and Mobile Telephony, TV, cable, hotels, financial institutions, supermarkets, public hospitals and private clinics, universities, prosecutors and private schools. This area has a warm subtropical climate with a temperature that varies during the day between 21-35 degrees Celsius.

Andreyna is of dark complexion, brown eyes, long black hair, short, robust physique, and her first language is Guaraní which she speaks with her family, and Spanish for business and everyday tasks. In the photo she the second from the left, wearing a brown sweater and black trousers. She enjoys her life with her partner who works making hats and with her child that is not yet of school age and is learning to walk. They live in a room, on family property, built of wood with tin roof and floor. The house has water, electricity and sewerage. The need to pay postnatal health care for her son was what inspired her to form a community bank. The members have a variety of businesses: selling fruit, leather craft, making hats, cattle, poultry, motorcycle taxi service, sale of second hand clothes and sale of natural medicine. They are applying for a loan to improve their businesses.

Her business is selling crafts such as necklaces, bracelets, earrings, rings, etc., "our city is frequented for trade and tourism, and people like to buy souvenirs of all kinds to remember their pleasant stay in this place ..." she says. Alongside her craft activity, she sells typical fermented beverages, such as somo and chicha, both are a refreshing beverage made from corn, served cold, and are very popular. The advantage of her businesses is that she can do both at the same time; the challenge is the lack of working capital for the development of handicrafts and her beverages. Her dream is to improve her craft business with her own new designs. She wants to make the purchase of working material for handicrafts like leather, wood, clay, and others, and also for her business to buy soda, corn, sugar, ice, etc. This is the first sequence of loans with this institution in the 7 years she has had this business.

It is for these reasons that Andreyna is applying for a loan for the purchase of material for handicraft work as well for her beverage business.

loans.use: to buy materials to make traditional crafts as well as for her beverage business.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a 33-year-old mum who has given all her life for the benefit of her family, trying to raise them and together overcome all the adversities that have been presented to them in life. Thanks to farming she has been able to practice mixed farming for the past ten years. Beatrice hails from the Nandi Hills area of Kenya, a rural town near the famous Rift valley. Together with her handsome husband Edwin, they support each other as a team. They have been doing mixed farming for the past 10 years. Through all those years, she has been able to take care of her family and pay school fees for her children.

Although this humble mom has been making profits, not everything has been “a bed of roses," as she has been facing financial challenges. Because the Nandi Hills area has a ready market for cereals, she is requesting a loan to buy cereals to improve her income level. Beatrice’s upbringing was challenging and she has been facing many economic problems, but this ever-smiling mom has been making great improvements. She believes that through your loan, she will be able to realize her goal of improving her living conditions and transforming her life.

Through Juhudi Kilimo, Beatrice has gone through training and is very honest and disciplined with finances. She hopes that through her business profits she will be able to repay the loan. Beatrice is visionary and hopes that through accumulated profits she will be able to open a large cereal selling shop that will boost her income and completely turn her life around.

Help Beatrice establish her cereal selling business!

loans.use: to buy cereals to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Winnie

texts.en:
Winnie is a woman who is devoted to her family and her farming. Her tenacity and perseverance have enabled her to get ahead, overcoming various obstacles that have come her way. 

She is a 33-year-old smallholder farmer from Kapsowar in the Rift Valley region of Kenya. Winnie owns a small parcel of land. On the farm, she practices mixed farming. This loving mother keeps dairy animals and grows maize and vegetables. She has 10 years of experience in farming. 

Winnie is seeking a loan to buy seeds and expand her horticulture farm. She is very hardworking and determined to increase her farm's output. 

Loans for smallholder farmers with little irregular income and no solid collateral are hard to come by in Kenya. Few organizations such as Juhudi Kilimo support farmers like Winnie. Through a group of 15 members called Kapyegon, Winnie has access to income-generating asset loans from Juhudi, which use the group-based savings as collateral. 

According to Juhudi Kilimo, horticulture represents an opportunity for reducing poverty through income generation among smallholders, whether unskilled or semi-skilled. In the past, African women used to stay at home and look after the household. Juhudi Kilimo facilitates loans that empower smallholder farmers like Winnie because the institution believes that women too are actively involved in various segments of the horticultural industry.

loans.use: To buy seeds and start horticulture farming

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: la joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 29 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica a la venta de productos de uso personal por medio de catálogos de manera ambulante, tiene muchos clientes por los buenos precios, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, la joven vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de perfumes, lociones, cremas, shampoo, desodorantes etc. todo por mayor y así poder seguir con su trabajo para tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
The young woman whose face is blurred in the photo (because she is 29 years old and lives in a high-risk area) lives in her own home with her life partner. She works selling products for personal use through catalogues as a traveling salesperson. She has many clients because of her good prices and she is able to cover some of her household expenses with the money she makes from her sales.

She is asking for a loan to buy perfumes, lotions, creams, shampoo, deodorant, etc. in bulk so that she can continue her work in order to increase her income.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, lotions, creams, shampoo, deodorants, etc. in bulk.

loans.name: Mairamgul

texts.ru: Майрамгул, 40 лет, вдова, мать 4 детей. Образование у нее среднее, работает оператором в отделе охраны. В 1994 году, начала бизнес по разведению скота. На сегодняшний день у нее в хозяйстве есть 2 коровы, 12 овец. Также на земельном участке мерою 0,36 Га она выращивает клевер для реализации. Совокупный среднемесячный доход составляет около 10,600 сом (KGS), этих средств не хватает на достойную жизнь и воспитание детей. Поэтому Майрамгул обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец для откорма и реализации. Доходы от кредита позволят ей и дальше развивать бизнес, взять в аренду поливную землю и улучшить благосостояние семьи
texts.en:
Mairamgul, 40, is a widow and has four children. She has a high school diploma and works as an operator in a security department. In 1994 she started breeding livestock and today she owns 2 cows and 12 sheep. She also grows clover for sale on her 0.36-ha plot of land. Her monthly income amounts to about 10,600 som (KGS) but this amount of money is not enough for a decent life. 

Mairamgul is requesting a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) from Bai-Tushum bank in order to buy sheep for fattening up and resale. She plans to reinvest the profit in her farm, rent irrigated land and improve her family’s well-being.

loans.use: to purchase some sheep for fattening and resale in order to increase her income

loans.name: Saadatkan

texts.ru: Саадаткан, 54 года, замужем, 4 сновей. У нее среднее образование. На протяжении многих лет в качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи занимается разведением скота и полеводством. У Саадаткан в хозяйстве есть 3 коровы и 30 овец. На 1,23 Га земли она выращивает кукурузу для реализации. Саадаткан известна, как оптимистичный, честный и трудолюбивый человек. Для дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, она обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 3 коров для откорма и реализации. Доходы от кредита она планирует использовать для развития своего хозяйства и обучение одного из сыновей в университете.
texts.en:
Saadatkan, 54, is married and has four sons. She has a high school diploma. For many years she has been earning a living from livestock breeding and land cultivation. Today she owns 3 cows and 30 sheep. In addition, she grows corn for sale on a 1.23-ha plot of land. Saadatkan is known as an optimistic, honest and hardworking person. 

Saadatkan is requesting a loan of 150,000 som (KGS) from Bai-Tushum bank to be able to buy 3 cows for fattening up and resale. She plans to reinvest the profit in her farm and save up for educating one of her sons.

loans.use: to purchase three cows for fattening and resale

loans.name: Beishenali

texts.ru: Бейшенали, 57 лет, женат, есть сын. Бейшенали имеет среднее образование. По характеру он спокойный,  целеустремленный, ответственный. Занимается животноводством и полеводством. В хозяйстве есть 2 коровы, 10 овец. Ежемесячная прибыль - около 9,000 сом (KGS). Бейшенали обратился в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS), чтобы купить овец для увеличения поголовья скота. Это позволит развивать бизнес и накопить на постройку дома.
texts.en:
Beishenali, 57, is married and has a son. Beishenali has a high school diploma and is known as a quiet, responsible and goal-oriented man. He has been earning a living from livestock breeding and field crop cultivation and today owns two cows and ten sheep. His monthly profit amounts to about 9,000 som (KGS). 

Beishenali is requesting a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) from Bai-Tushum bank in order to buy sheep and to increase his livestock headcount. This would allow him to develop his farm and save up for building a house.

loans.use: to buy additional sheep in order to increase livestock headcount

loans.name: Carla Stephany

texts.es:
Carla es una joven mujer de 32 años de edad, soltera, tiene una hija de 5 años, y estudia la carrera de administración de empresas. 
Ella es inteligente, comprometida, constante, sincera y muy responsable. Sus estudios lo realiza en una universidad privada situada en la zona ‘Miraflores’, ubicada al sureste de la ciudad, tiene como sus principales atractivos; el Jardín Botánico, la avenida Busch, la plaza Villarroel al norte, el Estadio Hernando Siles junto a la Plaza Arqueológica entre otros, es un barrio residencial y está completamente urbanizado. De clima frio y seco, con una temperatura ambiente que varía durante el día entre 0-12 grados centígrados.
Carla es de tez morena, cabello negro largo peinado a la moda, su lengua materna es el Aymará el cual ya no habla porque estudia y vive en la ciudad. Su vida la realiza junto a su hija que está empezando a estudiar en la escuela, viven en un cuarto alquilado construido de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina y piso de madera que cuenta con los servicios agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Ella cursa la carrera de administración de empresas y se encuentra en 3 año de 5 años que dura la carrera; disfruta realizando las cuentas de ingresos y egresos, le gusta prever los gastos semanales y mensuales, su carácter es de servicio y su vocación es el orden y el cumplimiento de horarios, “trabajo como cajera de banco y en los ratos libres estudio...” comenta. La ventaja de sus estudios es que los horarios son nocturno y no se cruzan con su trabajo, la desventaja es la falta de capital para realizar el pago de las mensualidades de su carrera universitaria. Su sueño es salir profesional para ser promovida en su trabajo, ella desea pagar las cuotas de su carrera para continuar estudiando. Esta es la primera secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 3 años que se dedica a ambas actividades. 
Es por esos motivos que Carla solicita un préstamo para pagar las cuotas de su universidad y continuar estudiando para terminar y ser promovida.
texts.en:
Carla is a 32 year old young woman.  She is single and has a five year old daughter.  She is studying for a degree in business administration.
She is intelligent, dedicated, steady, sincere, and very responsible. 

She attends a private university in the ‘Miraflores’ area, which is located southeast of the city.  Its main attractions are the Botanical Garden, Busch Avenue, the Villarroel Plaze to the north, the Hernando Siles Stadium, and the Archeological Plaza, among others.  It is in a residential neighborhood, and it is completely urbanized.  It has cold and dry climate with an ambient temperature that varies during the day between 0 12 degrees centigrade.

Carla has a dark complexion and stylish, long, black hair.  Her mother tongue is Aymará, which she does not speak now because she goes to school and lives in the city.  She lives with her daughter, who is starting school.  They live in a rented room made of brick and cement blocks with a corrugated tin roof and a wood floor.  They have running water, electricity, and indoor plumbing.

She is studying business administration, and she is in year three of the five year program.  She enjoys doing the income and expense accounts.  She likes projecting the weekly and monthly expenses.  Her nature is to be of service, and her calling is order and schedule compliance.  “I work as a bank teller, and in my free time I study,” she says.

The advantage of her studies is that it is a night schedule, and the classes do not interfere with her work.  The disadvantage is the lack of capital to make the monthly payments for her university degree.

Her dream is to move on as a professional in order to be promoted at her work.  She wishes to make her degree payments in order to continue studying.  This is the first loan cycle with the institution in the three years that she has been engaged in both activities.  It is for these reasons that Carla is requesting a loan to make her university payments and to continue studying in order to finish and to be promoted.

loans.use: to make her university payments and to continue studying in order to finish and to be promoted.

loans.name: Shahid's Group

texts.en:
Shahid is a hard working farmer raising his hand in the photo. He is the group leader and he lives in village Qila Bhattian, District Gujranwala, Pakistan. 
He and his group members cultivate wheat and rice to earn a living. Due to the lack of formal capital, the members rely on middle men to purchase seeds, fertilizers, fuel and pesticides.

They are requesting a loan to purchase agriculture inputs from open market at discounted rates. This loan shall release them from the manipulation of middle men and increase their crop output. The members dream of getting out of poverty and hope to improve their quality of life and to improve their children's well being.
They are committed to be responsible group members.

loans.use: To purchase agriculture inputs such as fertilizer, pesticide, seeds and fuel

loans.name: Zaheer's Group

texts.en:
Zaheer is a 25 years old young farmer who lives with his old parents in village Qila Bhattian located in Punjab. He works hard in his field along with his old father to feed his other family members. He works hard in his agriculture fields farming rice and wheat crop.

He and his group members are requesting a loan to buy agricultural inputs and fertilizers so they can achieve a good harvest and prepare the land to plant rice crop. This loan will enable them to improve their per acre yield. The group members hope to renovate their house in the future.

loans.use: To purchase agriculture inputs such as fertilizer, pesticide, seeds and fuel

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Hello, Kiva lenders! Meet Agnes, a young farmer from Githuu, a remote village in Nkubu, Kenya who has defied the common thinking about most Kenyans that agriculture is for the older generation. 

Agnes is happily married and together with her husband they are blessed with three children. Her primary source of income is milk and also she plants different varieties of food crops. She also engages in personal business and has been able to earn a handsome profit from the venture. Agnes practices agriculture with a difference, employing youthful energy, enthusiasm, and knowledge from the many agricultural training classes she has been attending to broaden her skills. 

Although she earns handsome profits from farming, she faces one big challenge and that is the high price of fertilizers, seedlings, and inputs, and this is a result of the monopoly that is enjoyed by the only agrovet shop in her area. She is requesting a loan to start an agrovet shop. 

Githuu area has only one agro dealer, which is catering to thousands of smallholder farmers who solely depend on that dealer for agricultural inputs. The agro dealer has been making a killing from farmers by charging them higher prices since this is the only agro dealer, making it a monopoly. Agnes wants to change this and seize the business opportunity, and through your loan she will start an agrovet shop and tap into the potential agricultural market. 

Agnes will also help the smallholder farmers in her area, who have long been having a serious problem accessing affordable farm inputs. Through your loan, Agnes will change from the peasant farmer she is right now to a certified agro dealer. 

Through increased income from the loan, she will improve her living conditions, and her future plans are to purchase a truck which will be used to engage farmers in output marketing activities. Agnes believes that there is no doubt that youths like her can find rewarding employment in farming. She patiently waits for your kindness.

loans.use: To start an agrovet shop

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 26 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica a la jardinería y fontanería,  tiene 4 años de dedicarse a ese trabajo del cual ha podido salir adelante junto con su familia, el joven vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus dos hijos, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de una máquina para cortar césped  ya que esa es una de las herramientas que utiliza para su trabajo y así poder atender mejor a sus clientes y tener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
The young man, whose face has been blurred because of being 26 years old and living in a high risk zone, lives in his own house with his wife and two children. He makes a living doing gardening and plumbing. He has been doing this work for 4 years, and because of it has been able to get ahead along with his family.

He is asking for a loan to buy a lawnmower, as that is one of the tools he uses in his work. With it he will be able to take better care of his clients and earn better profits.

loans.use: to buy a lawnmower.

loans.name: Genesis Group

texts.es: Benedicta de 55 años de edad es separada y tiene 05 hijos. Ella Pertenece a la Alcancía Comunal “génesis”  la cual lo conforman 06 socias con deseos de  trabajar honradamente y progresar. Ella hace más de 20 años que se dedica al negocio de venta de golosinas Gracias a su constante dedicación mejoro su calidad de vida y la de su familia.  Su mayor deseo es poder ampliar su negocio. Solicitó el crédito para la compra de galletas chupetines y gaseosas. La Alcancía “génesis” agradece a los Inversionistas de Kiva por el apoyo brindado. Benedicta es la tercera del lado derecho viste polo blanco y chaleco color rosado.
texts.en:
Benedicta is 55 years old, separated, and has 5 children. She is part of the communal bank Génesis, which is made up of 6 members who wish to work honestly and progress.

She has made a living for 20 years selling candy as a business. Thanks to her constant dedication, she improved her and her family's quality of life. Her greatest wish is to be able to expand her business.  She requested a loan to buy cookies, lollipops and sodas. 

The bank Génesis is grateful to Kiva's investors for the help given. Benedicta is the third from the right. She is wearing a white shirt and pink vest.

loans.use: to buy cookies, lollipops and sodas.

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en:
Meet the young energetic Dorcas, born in Chuka, central area of Kenya in 1983,married for seven years and blessed with two kids, a small holder farmer who thought of expanding her farming and decided to sought for help from Juhudi kilimo, the company that has helped a lot of farmers in her area changing their lives by financing them.  She then decided to join a group near her home (Kanini kega) and took a start-up loan of twenty thousand that enabled her buy a young cow.  

After clearing the first loan she went for another loan of twenty five thousand and decided to add another cow since she saw the scarcity of milk in her area and saw an opportunity of supplying milk that made her get good money. This was her eye opener and she decided to venture in a different kind of farming.

She is now applying for a loan of forty thousand that she would love to start selling cereals. As a young energetic mother, Dorcas wants to grow her farming activities by setting up a shop for her cereal selling and this will not be able without the help of Juhudi kilimo and the wonderful Kiva lenders.
Kindly help her out!

loans.use: To buy cereals for resale

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To enable her to bulk-purchase wood and charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Zia's Group

texts.en:
Zia is standing in the middle and holding a booklet in the photo. He is a hard working farmer living with 9 family members in Chak Sadhoo, Pakistan. He leads a group of three farmers in his village. He grows wheat, rice and vegetables and sells the crop production to earn a living. 

Having suffered low yields on their crops for a long time, he and his group members joined JWS farmers’ development program to learn more about how they can improve their productivity. They have attended several training sessions and have gained practical knowledge and skills to do better farming. 
They are therefore requesting for the loan to buy fertilizers, herbicides and better quality seeds in order to boost their productivity. 

He wish to use this loan to increase his farm productivity. With an increased income, he will rent more land to expand his harvest.

loans.use: To purchase agriculture inputs such as fertilizer, pesticide, seeds and fuel

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To make improvements to their stalls and buy more goods for resale.

loans.name: Nuri Maricela

texts.es: Nuri de 30 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su madre de 64 años de edad y su sobrino de 20 años de edad. Ella es una mujer que gracias a su esfuerzo y  trabajo va saliendo adelante, siempre apoyando a su madre y cuidando a su sobrino, ella se gana la vida prestando sus servicios de oficios varios de manera domiciliar en su comunidad. Nuri anteriormente obtuvo un crédito  que fue destinado para terminar de construir el cuarto de la cocina y un dormitorio, y con el deseo de continuar las mejoras de su vivienda ella solicita un nuevo crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo y hierro para instalar un techado en la parte del corredor y el área del lavadero que se encuentra al aire libre, además desea iniciar la construcción de un nuevo cuarto dormitorio para poder brindar a su familia una mejor condición de vida.
texts.en:
Nuri is 30 years old and lives in a home of her own with her 64 year old mother and 20 year old nephew. Thanks to her hard work and determination, she's a woman who's getting ahead, always helping her mother and taking care of her nephew. She makes a living offering several types of services from house to house in her community. 

Nuri previously obtained a loan that was earmarked for finishing the construction of the kitchen and a bedroom, and with the aim of continuing her home improvement she's applying for a new loan from FUSAI to invest in: cement, sand, gravel, brick, and iron to install a roof in the hallway and washing area which is currently open air. Additionally she wants to start construction of a new bedroom so that she can provide her family with a higher standard of living.

loans.use: To invest in: cement, sand, gravel, brick, and iron to improve her home.

loans.name: Las Palmeras Group

texts.es:
Carmen es una mujer de 54 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene un hijo de 19 años, y su negocio es la venta de comida tradicional cruceña.
Ella es buena madre, organizada, comprensiva, paciente, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la localidad ‘el Torno’ situado a 32 kilómetros al suroeste de la ciudad, Sus calles lucen completamente pavimentadas con modernas construcciones habitacionales que se levantan en ambos lados de la moderna carretera doble vía, por donde cruzan los viajeros hacia el interior del país. De clima cálido sub tropical con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 21-35 grados centígrados.
Carmen es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro corto, baja estatura, complexión física robusta, su lengua materna es el Guaraní que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza (sentada a la izquierda, viste chompa rosada). Su vida la comparte con su pareja que se dedica al comercio y con su hijo que es independiente, viven en una casa propiedad de la familia construida de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina que cuenta con agua de pozo extraída mediante bomba, energía eléctrica y no cuenta con alcantarillado. La necesidad de expandir su negocio la impulsó a liderar una banca de personas con negocios como; venta de fruta, taller de soldadura, reparación de celulares,  venta de salteñas, venta de vajillas, venta de ropa de segunda mano y venta de edredones, para solicitar un préstamo y mejorar sus actividades. Su negocio es la venta de comida tradicional lugareña, como;  Cogote relleno (cuello de gallina criolla, relleno puede ser de papa),  majao (charque molido, plátanos hervidos y arroz), sopa de maní (sopa a base de maní), y otros, “mis clientes son puntuales, llegan todos los días a la misma hora…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con clientes diarios, la desventaja es la falta de muebles e utensilios de cocina para vender comida a mayor número de clientes. Su sueño es abrir un restaurante, ella desea ampliar su negocio mediante la compra de utensilios de cocina como; cubiertos, vajilla, ollas, etc., También algunas mesas y sillas. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 5 años que se dedica a esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Carmen solicita un préstamo para la compra de utensilios y muebles de cocina para vender comida a muchos clientes y mejorar su vida.
texts.en:
Carmen is a 54 year old woman.  She lives with her husband and has a 19 year old son and sells traditional Cruceña food.

She is a good, organized, understanding, patient and hardworking mother who runs her business in el Torno, located 32 kilometers southeast of the city. Its streets are completely paved with homes built on both sides of the two-way street on which travelers to the center of the country travel. The climate is warm and sub-tropical with a temperature that varies between 21 and 35 degrees Celsius.

Carmen has olive skin, brown eyes, and short black hair.  She is short with a robust complexion and Guaraní is her native language, which is spoken locally, but she speaks Spanish culturally and in her business (seated to the left wearing a pink sweater).  She is married and works with her adult son.  They live together in their brick and cement home with the tin roof.  They use well water that they pump out, electricity, but no sewage.

The need to expand her business motivated her to head up a group of people with different businesses, such as fruit selling, welding, cell phone repair, salteña sales, dishware sales, second hand clothing sales, and bedspreads, in order to request a loan to improve her business.

She sells traditional local food such as Cogote relleno (Creole chicken necks stuffed with potato), majao (ground salted meat, boiled bananas, and rice), peanut soup (peanut based soup), and other things.  “My customers are reliable, they come at the same time every day…” she says. The advantage in her business is that she has regular customers. The disadvantage is that she needs furnishings and kitchen utensils so she can sell food to a greater number of customers.

Her dream is to open a restaurant and wants to expand her business by buying kitchen utensils such as flatware, dishes, pots etc.  Also some tables and chairs. This is her first loan sequence with the institution and she has been doing this for five years.



This is why Carmen is asking for a loan to buy furnishing and kitchen utensils so she can serve more customers and improve her life.

loans.use: to buy furnishings and utensils.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.en:
Miriam a single mother of one from Nandi hills  was born in 1985 and she has managed to get through her college education. She knows very well why farming can change her living standards. Miriam has been practicing small farming at her home in Nandihills and she wants to grow her farm into a bigger one that will help generate more income, her prayers were answered when she heard of a group in her area (Kaptumo digital) from Juhudi kilimo and there she did not hesitate joining the group. Miriam has two cows, keeps poultry and practices crop farming. 

She respectfully seeks a loan to buy farm inputs (fertilizers and seeds). With the loan she will be able to increase her farming business and generate more income through selling different varieties of food crops. Her dream is to be able to buy a bigger land that can help her expand her farming.
Kindly help her out!

loans.use: To buy farm inputs (fertilizers and seeds)

loans.name: Justin

texts.en:
Hello world, meet Justin, a smallholder farmer from the Chuka area of Kenya. Justin is married and has one child. He owns a 0.75 acre farm, which contains a dairy cow, a dozen chickens, and over 1,000 trees.

Justin is seeking a loan to buy dairy goats. He feels optimistic about the uptake of goat milk in the local market.

Income that he expects to generate from this venture will be used to clear his loan and grow the business further. In the long run, Justin plans to uplift the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to buy dairy goats

loans.name: Abariki Group

texts.fr: Charlotte est commerçante, membre du groupe de crédits «Abariki», cliente de l’IMF Hekima, mariée, âgée de 40 ans, mère 8 enfants qui tous étudient. Elle est vendeuse des poissons dans un marché secondaire de la ville depuis 27 ans. Elle débuta avec de fonds reçus de ses parents. Elle va s’approvisionner en poissons fumés, frais et salés. Elle souhaite construire une belle maison, augmenter son capital, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au final, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en:
Charlotte, a vendor, is a member of the Abariki borrowers' group and a client of the IMF Hekima. She is married, 40 years old, and the mother of eight children, all of whom are in school. She has been selling fish at one of the smaller market in her town for 27 years. She has launched her business with the funds received from her parents. 

She will stock up on smoked, fresh and salted fish. She would like to build a nice house, bolster her capital, and provide for her children's schooling and food. Finally, Charlotte thanks Hekima for its support of entrepreneurs lacking access to traditional banking.

loans.use: to stock up on smoked, fresh and salted fish for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To make a large candle making machine to produce a wider range of candles for sale.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana lives in Ndurio village, situated in the Nandi Hills area of Kenya. The land in Ndurio is extremely fertile for agriculture. Most families in Ndurio practice agriculture.

Susana and her husband own a small piece of land in this region. They live together. They have been doing dairy farming for the last 25 years to earn a living. Her primary income source is milk.

As her children grow older, the upkeep and educational expenses keep rising. In order to meet these needs, Susana needs to diversify and start a milk business so as to earn more income. Susana is seeking a loan to buy more milk so that she can start a milk vending business in her village. 

With your loan, she will be able to sell milk to the large milk processing firms in her area, which will result in increased income levels. She will use the additional income from milk sales to pay the loan installments and, later on, school fees. All that Susana waits patiently for is your kindness.

loans.use: to start a milk vending business

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Ann, a dynamic, entrepreneurial, industrious and honest 28-year-old woman, resides in the Chuka area of Kenya where she has been practicing mixed farming for the past 12 years. During that time she has gained much experience and is considered among the best farmers in her village, Her primary sources of income are milk, eggs, crops and some small business ventures that help her make ends meet. 

Ann is very passionate about farming and loves cultivating her farm. That is why, every day, she wakes up very early to go to her farm to plow. Although she makes profits from farming, she is not comfortable and has always wanted to increase her income by selling cereals. She is therefore seeking this loan to buy cereal. 

Kenya's Chuka area, one of the county's populated regions, has a high demand for cereal. This means that Ann could increase her profits and satisfy the demand that is there. Accessing funds has been a challenge for Ann, but she now feels relieved because Juhudi Kilimo is partnering with Kiva lenders to help aspiring women farmers like her turn their farming dreams into reality through training and loan financing. 

Ann believes that this loan will be of much help. The extra income earned will enable a permanent change in her life and increase her business. Increased profits will allow Ann to repay this loan and secure the future of her school-going child.

Ann's main dream is to offer a great variety of cereal products to expand her client base and sales, thereby improving her well-being.

loans.use: to buy cereal

loans.name: Abdul's Group

texts.en:
Abdul is 43 years old, married with 4 children. His wife looks after the household tasks. He is standing in the photo and raising his hand. He is the leader of a group of four farmers. He is a resident of village “Harpoke”, Tehsile Noshera Virkan, Pakistan.

He has 23 years experience in farming; he grows rice and wheat in his land to earn a income for his family. He wants to better feed his children and dreams to send them to good schools.

He is asking for the loan to buy supplies for the rice season. With this harvest, he can be sure to have money to satisfy the needs of his household. He has to buy 20 bags of fertilizer and 6 boxes of pesticides for his rice crop. His yield will increase after using these inputs. He hopes to have a very good harvest to support his children to have better life.

loans.use: To purchase agriculture inputs such as fertilizer, pesticide, seeds and fuel

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase: sheet metal and wooden beams to fix the roof of his home.

loans.name: Santina

texts.en: This loan of $1000 will allow Santina to send her youngest daughter to post-secondary school. She will use the loan to pay tuition and school supplies. Santina loves her daughter very much and hopes that further education will help her to have a brighter future. Santina and her husband are farmers. She is happy with this loan, because it is improving her youngest daughter's ability to finish education in the future.

loans.use: to pay tuition and buy school supplies.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
Listening to James talking about the different breeds of dairy cows on his compound, it is obvious that he is an accomplished dairy farmer. James, who is from the remote town of Nkubu, in Kenya, is an active and progressive farmer. He and his wife live on a small piece of land. 

James has been practicing farming for the past six years. Having done farming for such a long time, he has gained so much experience that he is always ranked the best farmer in his village. 

Kenyans drink a lot of milk. This tradition is probably derived from tribal culture - particularly the Meru tribe (James' tribe), where cows represent wealth. Demand for dairy milk has been high and James wants to take advantage of the market. 

Therefore, he is seeking a loan to buy a quality dairy cow. Dairy farming is another profitable agricultural venture in Kenya and James has already identified the breed of dairy cow that he wants. 

James believes that to become a successful dairy farmer, one needs passion, information, and keenness to learn from the successful farmers. He has planted so many trees on his farm that food for the cattle will never be a problem. 

Marketing of the dairy milk and dairy products will not be a challenge either because he will sell the milk directly to the market and also to big dairy-processing firms. 

Through the loan, James will not only benefit from milk but also from the manure that will be used to improve the fertility of his farm, thus enabling him to save money that would have been spent buying fertilizers. 

James has been facing challenges in accessing credit but feels relieved knowing that institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva are there to make his dream come true. James chose Juhudi Kilimo because the interest rate on their loan is low. James underwent training through Juhudi Kilimo, and during the training season he learned that saving is a continuous process in many micro-finance institutions. 

Through accumulated profits, James plans to permanently improve his living conditions and to secure the future of his school-aged children by paying tuition fees for them. Through increased income, he will be able to buy more dairy cows and build a bio-gas processor, thereby saving the costs incurred in buying fuel.

With this loan, you will support a father full of life and energy for his family!

loans.use: To buy another good quality dairy cow.

loans.name: Luis

texts.en: This loan of $1000 will allow Luis to send his son to post-primary school. He will use the loan to pay for tuition and school supplies. Luis loves his son very much and hopes that further education will help him to have a brighter future.

loans.use: to pay tuition and buy school supplies.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a responsible, respectable, hard-working, honorable and honest woman who dedicates her life to raising her children, who mean everything to her. It is thanks to her children that she has a smile every day when she wakes up to go to her farm.

Rose is a very hard-working woman who enjoys farming, which she has been doing on her small piece of land for the past 10 years. Through all those years, she has gained much experience and is one of the most respected farmers in her village. Because of the immense knowledge that she has of farming, Rose offers extension services to other farmers who are new in the business. 

Being a caring and loving mum, Rose has been able to take care of her family and support them through the profits she has earned from farming. She also has a side hustle business (motorbike) to supplement the meagre income she earns through farming. Although Rose reaps much profit from farming, one challenge that she is facing that is dragging her down and preventing her from reaching the top of the skies is lack of enough land to farm. 

For this reason, Rose is seeking a loan of KES 50,000 to buy a piece of land and expand her farming activities. Having so much experience in farming, Rose is sure that she will make good use of the land and double her profit levels. 

Through the profits, she would be able to repay the loan and improve her living conditions. Rose is sure that if you invest in her, she will be able to realize her dream of having a good quality life and securing her children's future. Rose has gone through the repayment schedule and amount and is comfortable with the plan. 

Support the project of an enterprising Kenyan woman! She aspires to have a very productive third quarter for the year.

loans.use: To buy a piece of land.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Nearly three quarters of Kenya’s young people struggle to make their way in this world because they lack employment and money. This was true for Elizabeth, 23, who is based in the Kitale area of Kenya. She has now been practicing mixed farming for the past three years and has managed to earn a decent income. Her primary source of income has been milk, eggs, crops and some personal business she engages in to make ends meet. 

She passionately loves dairy farming, and when asked what is most enjoyable about dairy farming, she stated, “feeding my cows.” Her hobby is milking her cow. She sells milk to her neighbors and to the local market, but the demand has been overwhelming, and she cannot meet it. 

For this reason, she is seeking a loan to buy an extra dairy cow, which will assist in increasing milk productivity. The dairy cow that she plans to buy is not just an ordinary cow, but it’s a quality breed of dairy cow that will be producing between 10 and 20 liters of milk a day. This extra production will immediately translate to more profit margin and an increased income level. 

Profits from selling milk will be used to repay the loan in full, and the extra income will be used to increase her business enterprise. Elizabeth is very visionary, and she intends, that in the near future, she will start adding value to her milk business by packaging the milk before selling it. She also plans to start selling dairy products such as cream. 

An improved income level will assure her family of a secure future. By joining Juhudi Kilimo, which assists smallholder farmers, she will also benefit from free extension services and links to markets.

loans.use: To buy a quality breed of dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, sand and bricks and also pay for labor to build a septic pit.

loans.name: Rey

texts.en:
Rey is 45 years old, married and has two children to provide for. He is engaged in a transport business to earn a living. He wants to give his family a good life, so he wants to increase his income to achieve this. He decided to borrow a loan to buy motor parts for motor repair so that he can continue to cater to more passengers and generate more income.

Rey plans in the future to buy a new motorcycle to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy motor parts to repair his motorcycle

loans.name: Eden

texts.en:
Thank you for your lives lenders! It is a wonderful experience for Eden to finally be able to gain enough amount for the maintenance of her sari-sari (variety) store business. From the inventory, she is able to survive their daily needs. 

She wants again to take a loan amounting to PHP 40,000. She will use this on the other hand to buy greater stock of supplies of grocery items for the variety store. She hopes indeed that you will still show her your unwavering support. She will make sure that she will water the seed of success you planted in their lives. 

Someday, Eden wants to witness her children graduate from schooling and how they will go well in their lives. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy greater stock of supplies and grocery items for the variety store.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is a woman who has had to overcome many hardships throughout her life. Nevertheless, she has always had the strength to succeed and to continue moving forward with her family. Edna is a hardworking mum and aggressive with the principle of truth on her lips; she is honest and faithful to what she does and what she says.

The Kapsowar area has hardcore poverty, but nevertheless, Edna has always kept hope and has been toiling on her farm for the past five years. Her primary sources of income have been milk, poultry and some "side hustles" she does to supplement the meager income she earns from farming. 

She is requesting a loan to buy an electric "posho" mill that will grind corn or maize into flour.

Maize meal is very common in Kenya and is a staple food for many communities. Many Kenyan families consume the maize product "ugali" (hard porridge) regularly. The market usually provides sifted flour, but the cost is higher because of the sifting and packaging. Cheaper flour can be obtained by milling the maize directly, using a posho mill.

The Kapsowar area has a few diesel posho mills that serve a sea of people, but the mills keeps breaking down, so farmers are not able to grind their maize. Edna intends to change this.

Through this loan, Edna will be able to grind maize faster because she will use an electric posho mill. Cases of breakdown will be long-ago history because electric posho mills are more reliable.

This loan will assist Edna in permanently changing her life and achieving her life mission of driving economic development. Profits from the posho mill will be used to comfortably repay the loan, which Edna promises to fully repay on time.

In the next two years, Edna sees herself as a very established businesswoman who will be running more than one posho mill in her remote village. Edna patiently waits for your kindness.

loans.use: to buy an electric "posho" mill for grinding corn or maize into flour.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Speaking with Lucy, it becomes obvious that she is a very hardworking and helpful woman and that everything she does is for her family's benefit and well-being. 

She lives in a humble home in the town of Nkubu, along with a handsome husband and their three angelic-looking children. She has always strived to give them a decent life and a good education. 

She has been doing agriculture for 15 years now. She makes money selling produce from her farm, including milk, eggs, and crops. She enjoys plowing her farm and watering her plants. Crop diseases pose a big challenge for her, and also poor productivity. 

Lucy is seeking a loan to buy farm inputs. With the loan, she plans to buy good quality seeds and fertilizer, which will help increase soil fertility and productivity on her farm. 

Increased productivity will allow her to improve her quality of life and living standards. Through training from Juhudi Kilimo, she has learned about the culture of saving and she plans to use the increased income to improve her farming. This loan will go a long way in changing the life of Lucy and her family.

loans.use: to buy good quality seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Edwin

texts.en:
Edwin, at heart, is a resourceful, loving man. His fatherly love has been enough to show him that he needs to work hard to help his children get ahead with excellent values and an education. 

Edwin, 48, is a smallholder farmer in the Kitale area of Kenya. In the past five years, he has bred more than one dairy cow, poultry birds and has developed his farm. He has also planted and sold a variety of crops. He says the secret to his success is thinking of farming as a way to make money, not just as a traditional way of life – adopting new technologies and methods, crop diversification, record-keeping and good planning also help. 

Edwin was unable to study to get a professional career because of the economic situation that his family faced. However, he never gave up and he has been practicing farming. Because of how much he likes farming, he has even nicknamed one of his cows, which make him a very proud farmer, especially when he is milking his cows. Through his dairy cow, he is able to get between 5-10 liters a day, and this helps him support his family. 

Edwin also practices crop farming, but he has not been making good profits because of poor farming inputs, and that is why he is kindly seeking a loan to buy farm inputs. Through the loan, he will be able to buy high-quality seeds, good fertilizer and pesticides that he will use to greatly improve his crop production. 

Modern farming requires the use of modern techniques; using high-quality seeds will assure him of a bumper harvest and hence, increased profit levels. Edwin is visionary, and his goal for the season is to boost his crop production and be able to get more crop output than the previous year. All this can be achieved through lenders’ help and goodwill. Edwin believes that through the loan, he will turn around his family life and be able to give his children a solid educational background. 

This loan will be Edwin’s way out of poverty.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs

loans.name: Crystal Group

texts.en:
Anna is member of Crystal group and she is a married mother of 3 school going children, She lives in Harare with her husband and children, the husband is unemployed and she is the one who is taking care of the children. 

Anna has a salon business selling weaves and braids and other beauty products and also offering beauty services. She joined Thrive in December 2014 and received business advice and a loan amounting to 250 USD  which she used to restock weaves and braids for her salon business. Anna and her other group members are very appreciative for the business advice and loans they received from Thrive and wishes to maintain a good relationship with Thrive and its partners. Anna said her business has improved and she can now restock weaves from South Africa selling them at her salon.

Anna and her group members have applied for a combined loan of 900 USD and she wants to use her potion of the loan amount to restock more beauty products at her salon. Anna is also making savings in her savings account and she is planning to open a new salon.

loans.use: To buy more hair weaves and other products for resale.

loans.name: Sami

texts.en:
Sami is a 21-year-old single man from Khanyounis. His father works as an employee, earning a low income. Sami started his own business four years ago to support his family and to pay part of the family's expenses. He sells fresh fish in a stall in the city. It is a good business and the demand is high. 

Sami has borrowed a loan from FATEN to help him to buy more products for his stall and some tools to clean fish. This will enable him to improve his business and increase sales.

loans.use: to buy more products for his stall and some tools to clean fish.

loans.name: Iya Ate Amb Group

texts.en:
IYA ATE AMB is a group that consists of five women and led by Yohana, a 40-year-old woman, who is wearing the red blouse in the picture. She and her husband Johan, a 44-year-old man who works as a honor employee at government department, are blessed with with four children; Exel, 16, a 2nd grade senior high school student; Ivan, 11, 5th grade in an elementary school; Indah, 5, kindergarten; and Erma, 3, who is not attending school yet.  

Yohana runs a kiosk business of selling daily needs such as coffee, sugar, and instant noodles, at the front of her house. She has been involved in the business for last four years. Yohana wants to increase her kiosk income by adding some stock but she does not have much money to do so. 

When an Account Officer introduced a group loan product at her village, Yohana and four women were interested and agreed to form a group named IYA ATE AMB and requested a loan totaling of 12,500,000 IDR. Yohana intends to use her loan for more stock such as sugar, coffee, and cooking oil, and kerosene for her kiosk. All the members wish that, through the loan offered by Kiva and TLM, there will be improvements in their income.

loans.use: to buy more stock, such as sugar, coffee, cooking oil, and kerosene

loans.name: Ma. Elisa

texts.en:
Ma. Elisa is 42 years old and married. She has three children; two of her children are in school.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Ma. Elisa is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF, in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She has been raising pigs for 13 years, and she earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a 40-year-old woman with a great future ahead of her. She is a loving and caring mother who has been running a small-scale mixed farm in Kenya for 10 years. Her primary income sources are maize, vegetables, and profits from a small-time personal business. 

Grace is seeking a loan to purchase modern farming implements. She realized that she is working increasingly longer and harder on her farm. The work women in the area are currently doing on the farm was previously done by men. They have been forced to take over as their husbands migrate to find wage labour in urban areas. Therefore, the tools women use are of great importance for improving productivity and yields and reducing time and physical effort. There are health implications as well in using poor traditional tools. 

The increased income from the use of better tools will help her meet business-related expenses. When asked, "How will this loan benefit your family?" Grace replied, "I will be able to educate my children."

loans.use: To buy farm implements

loans.name: German Gearedy

texts.es: German, de 19 años de edad, esta soltero, el reside junto con sus padres y vive en el municipio de San Marcos de Ocotepeque. German es muy emprendedor el lleva 3 años y medio de dedicarse al cultivo de maíz, vende el maíz, también vende tortillas de maíz, montucas y tamalitos de elote. Además realiza algunos trabajos de mecánica. Anteriormente trabajó como asistente de albañilería.  Ha decidido solicitar un prestamo de 10,000 lempiras para la siembra de maíz, comprara abonos, insumos y pago de preparación de la tierra. Su meta es seguir creciendo en la agricultura y también dedicarse al cultivo de café.
texts.en: German, who is 19 years old, is single. He lives with his parents in the municipality of San Marcos de Ocotepeque. German is very enterprising and has been cultivating corn for three and a half years. He sells the corn, as well as corn tortillas, "montucas" [traditional Honduran corn tamales], and mini corn tamales. In addition, he does some mechanical work. Previously, he worked as a construction assistant. He has decided to request a loan of 10,000 lempiras [HNL] in order to plant corn, buy soil amendments and supplies, and pay for soil preparation. His goal is to continue growing in agriculture and also to become a coffee grower.

loans.use: to buy soil amendments, supplies, and to pay for preparation of the land for growing corn.

loans.name: Imaculada

texts.en: Imaculada has planned to repair her house, but the money is not enough to buy more materials. So she requests a loan of $ 1,500.00 from Tuba Rai Metin to complete her materials. She is taking this loan because she wants to buy more material such as sand, cement, stone, iron, zinc, and other materials to use. She is very happy with the loan that she was offered from Tuba Rai Metin, because with this loan she can repair her house.

loans.use: to buy sand, cement, stone, iron, zinc, and other materials to use.

loans.name: Hinngon Group

texts.en: Nouane’s village sources much of their drinking water from local wells, streams, and collected rainwater.  These sources of water are not safe to drink without treatment by boiling.  Nouane and his group are excited that the filter was available on a payment plan that made it much more affordable.  Treating drinking water requires cash and time, which now he can shift to other pursuits.  Nouane and his village also understand the impact that unsafe drinking water has on their family’s budgets. The filter is guaranteed for two years; within this two years filter users, like Nouane’s family, identify a substantial decrease in illness and associated medical costs.  The extra person in the picture purchased a water filter for cash therefore they are not eleigible for Kiva financing, this person signed the Kiva photo waiver.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a smallholder dairy and poultry farmer dying to get her hands on the horticultural market. She is a loving mother and has been doing crop farming too but for subsistence purposes. She also grows vegetables, a bit of maize and grass for her cow. 

She is seeking a loan to grow vegetables on a bigger scale for commercial gains. The demand for horticultural products such as fruits and vegetables has grown steadily in Kenya in recent years. As much as they have become one of the top traded agricultural products, there is still plenty of room to expand. Mary is very excited to start commercialization of her crops. With your $25 loan, this can be easily achieved. She will rely on other sources of income to make initial installments of the loan but in no time, the horticultural farm will start pumping in income. The profits will be ploughed back into the business to fuel growth. Her increased income will uplift the living standards of her family.
Kindly lend to this enterprising smallholder farmer!

loans.use: To expand her horticulture farm for greater profits

loans.name: Nabong Group

texts.en: Soukinphon is excited the filter was available on an affordable payment plan.  Soukinphon and his group, along with other villagers, participated in a village meeting where they discussed the costs of treating local water supplies.  Charcoal, firewood, and even bottled water were discussed and priced out over two years.  The water filter which Soukinphon and this group purchased is guaranteed for two years but is known to function for up to five years.  Soukinphon and his group also discussed the cost of medical care for waterborne disease.
