And after totaling up the costs, Soukinphon and his group recognized the substantial financial savings the water filter will have for them and their families.  The 11th peson in the picture purchased a water filter but their face can not be seen therefore they are not eleigible for Kiva financing, this person will receive microfinancing through TerraClear without assistance from Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters in order to  have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Clara

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal LOS EXITOSOS.
La socia Clara alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose al negocio de venta de ropa ,la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma continuar apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de chompas entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
The partner belongs to LOS EXITOSOS communal bank.

Clara, the partner, alternates her daily activities by selling clothes. She has had this business for a some time, and it is going well thanks to the support that she gives it each day.  She hopes to be able to keep working so that she can continue to support her family this way. 

The partner is seeking a loan to buy sweaters among other things. 

The partner feels grateful for the loan she is granted and promises to keep up with her payments.

loans.use: to buy sweaters among other things.

loans.name: Mercedez

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Mercedez works hard to support her family.

She has a tricycle passenger business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fattening pigs. Mercedez is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF in order to buy wheels and other spare parts for her tricycle passenger.

Mercedez has been sustaining her business activities through her past 15 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy wheels and other spare parts for her tricycle passenger.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Hello lenders! Meet Rebecca. Rebecca is an industrious lady from the Kapsowar area of Kenya. She does farming on her family's small piece of land. This is her way of helping her husband provide for their family, including their children.

Rebecca's farming activities range from dairy to poultry to trees to maize farming. As of now, however, Rebecca is only interested in expanding her dairy business by becoming a milk vendor. She is seeking a loan from Kiva lenders to start a milk vending business.

With your loan investment in her business, she will be able to sell milk to large milk processing firms and hence increase her income. She intends to be buying milk from small dairy farmers and selling it to the large processing firms. The increase in income from this milk vending business will help Rebecca with loan repayments and her children's educational fees.

Kindly help out this mum who has great desire to succeed in life!

loans.use: to start a milk vending business

loans.name: Ermelinda

texts.en:
Ermelinda is living in a town with her family. 

Ermelinda opened her garden in 2009 with her own working. Ermelinda is generating a good income from selling.

An $800 loan is offered to Ermelinda to improve her business.

She will use the loan to buy spades, machetes and powder. 
She has been thinking of running a big business after years of involving herself in doing business.

loans.use: To buy spades, machetes and powder

loans.name: Bakur

texts.en:
Bakur is 36 years old and hails from Tsalenjikha district. He has been involved in the agricultural business since early childhood, as his parents were farmers and this is a traditional activity for the family. Sadly, for lack of economic resources and because he had to start working at a very young age, Bakur was unable to study toward a professional career.

Bakur has two cows and produces dairy products. He also owns a plot of agricultural land, where he grows nut trees. He always has high quality products which are sold to local retailers for a good price.

As the family has only seasonal income, Bakur decided to start an additional business, but his attempt was unsuccessful because of poor living conditions. The startup program that is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo enables him to get a loan for renovating a flat and renting it out. He will receive monthly rent and will be able to get a stable income.

The new business initiative will give Bakur the chance to have financial stability and a monthly income.

loans.use: to renovate a flat and rent it out to get a stable income

loans.name: Señor Manuel Exaltacion Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SEÑOR MANUEL EXALTACION”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Mollepata, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Gladys ella es soltera y tiene 32 años y tiene 3 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de tienda de abarrotes y restaurant, la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, leche y galletas, la socia por medio de este negocio quiere salir adelante, la socia es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar arroz, azúcar, leche y galletas.
La socia que esta pegada a la foto grupal se le tomo la foto despues de la reunion porque pidio permiso por motivos de trabajo.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de cereales, negocio de venta de animales, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de restaurant.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These borrowers belong to the communal bank "Señor Manuel Exaltacion." This bank is located in the Mollepata district, which belongs to the Anta province in the department of Cusco.

The featured borrower is 32-year-old Gladys. She is single and has 3 children. She works in her grocery store and restaurant. She sells basic necessities like rice, sugar, milk, and cookies. She wants to succeed through this business. She is an enterprising and hard-working woman. Her dream is to expand the grocery store business. She is requesting the loan to purchase rice, sugar, milk, and cookies.

The borrower pasted onto the group photo had her picture taken after the meeting because she had permission to miss due to work obligations.

The other members of this group make their living in cereal sales, animal sales, a grocery store, and a restaurant.

Gladys thanks everyone who forms part of her dream through these loans, and she commits to make all of her payments according to the established schedule.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, milk, and cookies

loans.name: Rudith Felipa

texts.es:
Rudith es una mujer de 53 años de edad, soltera, tiene 2 hijos de 12 y 18 años, y su negocio es la venta de comida tradicional. 
Ella es buena madre, optimista, generosa, paciente, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona sur de la ciudad, caracterizada por su intensa actividad económica y el asentamiento de los mercados más grandes de innumerables galerías y locales comerciales. De clima cálido sub tropical con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 21-35 grados centígrados.
Rudith es de tez morena, ojos pardos usa lentes de aumento, cabello negro corto, baja estatura, complexión física delgada, su lengua materna es el Guaraní que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con sus que estudian en la escuela, viven en una casa propiedad de la familia construida de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina y piso de cerámica que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la venta de comida tradicional como; majao (charque molido, plátanos hervidos y arroz), sopa de maní (sopa a base de maní), locotos rellenos (locotos, carne picada, cebollas), arroz con queso (arroz, leche y queso), y otros. Actividad que realiza en su domicilio todos los días de la semana par la hora de almuerzo y cena, “inicié mi negocio vendiendo almuerzo, ahora busco ampliar y vender cena también…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con clientes y ventas diarias, la desventaja es la falta de capital para la compra de utensilios de cocina y mobiliario. Su sueño es tener su restaurante propio, ella desea realizar la compra de utensilios y mobiliario de cocina para vender comida por las noches y ampliar su negocio. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 2 años que realiza esta actividad. 
Es por esos motivos que Rudith solicita un préstamo para la compra de utensilios y mobiliario de cocina para vender comida por las noches y consolidar su negocio.
texts.en:
Rudith is a 53-year-old woman. She is single, and she has two children, ages twelve and eighteen. Her business is selling traditional food. She is a good mother, optimistic, generous, patient, and very hardworking. 

She carries out her business in the southern zone of the city. It is characterized by its intense economic activity and the establishment of the biggest markets, with innumerable arcades and commercial outlets. It has a warm, sub-tropical climate, with a temperature that varies between 21 and 35 degrees centigrade during the day.

Rudith has tan skin and brown eyes, and she wears eyeglasses. She has short black hair and she is short of stature, with a slim build. Her maternal tongue is Guaraní, which she speaks at home; she speaks Spanish with the general public and for her business. She shares her life with her children, who are studying in school. They live in their own home, which is built of brick and cement, with a corrugated iron roof and a tile floor. It has potable water, electricity, and sewer service.

Her business is selling traditional foods, such as majao (ground jerky, boiled bananas, and rice), peanut soup (soup with a peanut base), stuffed locotos (hot chili peppers, minced meat, and onions), rice with cheese (rice, milk and cheese), and others. She carries out her activity in her home every day of the week, for the lunch and dinner hours. She says, “I started my business selling lunches; now I’m looking to expand and sell dinner also…” The advantage of her business is that she has daily customers and sales; the disadvantage is the lack of capital for the purchase of kitchen utensils and furniture. 

Her dream is to have her own restaurant. She wants to purchase kitchen utensils and furniture in order to sell food at night, and expand her business. This is her second loan cycle with the institution in the two years that she has been carrying out this activity.

That is why Rudith is requesting a loan to purchase kitchen utensils and furniture in order to sell food at night, and consolidate her business.

loans.use: to purchase kitchen utensils and furniture in order to sell food at night and consolidate her business.

loans.name: Consuelo

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal LOS EXITOSOS.
La socia Consuelo continua con su negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia continua vendiendo arroz, azúcar, leche  entre otros para sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de azúcar, leche entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
This is a member of the communal bank Los Exitosos.

The member, Consuelo, continues with her business selling groceries. She has been doing this for some time, and it is going well for her thanks to the effort that she puts into her business each day. She continues to sell rice, sugar, and milk among other things that her customers request. 

She hopes to be able to continue to keep working in this way to continue to support her family.

She is seeking a loan to buy rice and milk among other things.

She feels grateful for the loan that has been granted to her and promises to make the payments that are agreed upon.

loans.use: to buy sugar and milk among other things.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
To be the pace setter in the market and be able to offer a good education to her children are the goals that motivate Lucy to get up every day at 5 o’clock in the morning and work very hard.

Lucy passionately loves farming. She has been farming for the past five years and has always managed to provide for her family. Feeding the large family she has requires a lot of hard work and determination. Her other sources of income are milk, crops and some personal business that she does in order to provide food for her large family. In farming, she enjoys the returns she gets, but she is challenged to maintain a good standard of living.

Lucy has identified free space on her farm and wants to fully utilize this space by setting up a biogas plant. A big chunk of Lucy’s money is spent on buying firewood and charcoal for cooking, but with the introduction of the biogas, she will be able to save money that she used to spend in buying fuel. She will also have clean energy because biogas does not pollute the environment.

Through this loan, her children will have something to smile about, and that is a good education, which Lucy will now be able to afford because less money will be spent on fuel.

Kindly lenders, please assist Lucy in realizing her dreams.

loans.use: to start a bio gas plant

loans.name: Everlyne

texts.en:
Everlyne is a hardworking dairy farmer from Mariashoni village. Her work brings home an important source of income. Everlyne is married and she does this work to secure the financial future of her children. The children help her with the work.

Everlyne applied for a loan because she wants to grow her dairy farm. She will buy an additional cow with the borrowed money. The cow financed by Kiva lenders will increase the quantity of milk she takes to the market and will thus boost her monthly income.

Everlyne needs more income to take care of her increasing family expenses, and that is why this loan is important to her.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Dorika

texts.en:
Dorika is a hardworking young smallholder farmer from Magumoni village in Kenya. She does dairy farming for a living.   Her work brings home an important source of income. Dorika is married and has three children. The children help her with the work. 

Dorika applied for a loan because she wants to grow her dairy farm. She will buy an additional cow with the borrowed money. The cow financed by Kiva lenders will increase the quantity of milk she takes to the market and boost her monthly income.  

Dorika needs more income to take care of her increasing family expenses and that is why this loan is important to her.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Phanice

texts.en:
Phanice is a resilient smallholder farmer from Trans-zoia district in Kenya. She does dairy farming and sells raw milk at a local market. Her work brings home an important source of income. Phanice is married and her children help her with the work. 

Phanice applied for a loan because she wants to grow her dairy farm. She will buy an additional cow with the borrowed money. The cow financed by Kiva lenders will increase the quantity of milk she takes to the market and boost her monthly income.  

Phanice needs more income to take care of her increasing family expenses and that is why this loan is important to her.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is a progressive smallholder farmer based in the Kitale area of Kenya. She is married and has children. She practises both livestock and crop farming for a living. If you were to visit her farm today, you would find dairy cows, hens, and a maize garden. 

Lilian is seeking a loan from Kiva lenders through Juhudi Kilimo to buy a reasonably-priced motorcycle that will be used for transporting goods to and from the market. With this asset, Lilian will be able to have access to formal markets in new geographical and economical regions where prices are much better than the local markets.  

Increase in income from this intervention will help Lilian to scale up her business and improve the quality of life being led by her family.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Benice

texts.en:
Benice is a diligent smallholder dairy farmer from Central Kenya. Her work brings home an important source of income. Benice is married and has four children who rely on her.

Benice applied for a loan because she wants to grow her dairy farm. She will buy an additional cow with the borrowed money. The cow financed by Kiva lenders will increase the quantity of milk she takes to the market and thus will boost her monthly income.

Benice needs more income to take care of her increasing family expenses, and that is why this loan is important to her.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Idah

texts.en:
Idah is a farmer and salesperson who is connected to many players in the agricultural food chain. She earns income from mixed-farming and through engaging in the cereal trade as a broker. She owns a 5-acre farm where she raises dairy and poultry animals. To generate extra income, she helps to arrange logistics of getting cereals  from local farmers to their buyers in urban markets. 
Given that Idah is well connected and can arrange a sale more easily than regular farmers can, she prefers to deal with larger volumes of produce. She is seeking a loan to aggregate more produce from local farmers at fair prices and use her better understanding of the market conditions and prices to sell at a profit. Her role helps local farmers to focus on production, rather than sales.
Your loan will help Idah to make bigger returns from her business and take better care of her family's basic needs and wants.

loans.use: to buy cereals

loans.name: Viola

texts.en:
Viola is a 37-year-old, small-holder farmer based in Kitale, which is an agricultural center in Kenya. She owns a small parcel of land and has been blessed with a lovely family. On the land, she has kept dairy cattle and grown vegetables for 10 years. Her main income sources are milk and crops. She recently ventured into a side business. From Kiva lenders, Viola is seeking a loan worth KES 65,000 to grow her horticulture business. Horticultural produce and processed products from the developing world are becoming increasingly popular in international markets, evident by the steadily rising exports. While experience shows that horticulture offers good opportunities for poverty reduction, because it increases employment and generates income, the government takes little care to ensure that small and poor farmers are not excluded from the opportunities in this market sector. It is against this backdrop that Juhudi has teamed up with Kiva to provide Viola access to a loan that will aid help grow her horticulture farm into a highly profitable business, increase employment opportunities, and bring about increasing commercialization of the rural sector. With your loan, Viola’s family will benefit from the growth and diversification of their family business. This will not only increase her income, but also reduce her income vulnerability.
Help out this humble farmer from the lands of Kenya with a loan!

loans.use: to expand her horticulture farm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a quality breed of dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to pay small photovoltaic solar electricity systems for their houses.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
A large percentage of the people living in Kenya, particularly the Kapsowar area of Kenya, are poor, with the women bearing the brunt of it. Measures to be taken so as to reduce this trend require a concerted effort. It’s against this back drop that Juhudi Kilimo decided to commit its energy in eradicating poverty by making loans available to women smallholder farmers. 

Lenders! The above picture presents to you Christine, 43 years of age. She is very ambitious and enterprising, and a go-getting woman who hails from the Kapsowar area of Kenya. She is a proud mum, and has been doing mixed farming for the past ten years. Her primary source of income is crop selling, and some personal business that she does to make ends meet. 

Christine loves farming and has even nicknamed her cow, and she really takes good care of her dairy cows. The Kapsowar area has favorable conditions that favor horticulture farming; good soils, good climate, a good transport system and a ready market for horticulture products. Christine wants to take advantage and start horticultural farming. 

She is seeking a loan to start horticulture farming, and through improved income she will be able to improve her living conditions and secure the future of her family. The financial benefits that Christine will reap are almost immediate, and hence she will be assured of a secure future. She plans to start exporting her horticulture to international markets once she has accumulated more profits.

Support this loan to a farmer from the Kenyan remote area who has great dreams for her family!

loans.use: To start horticulture farming

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a progressive smallholder farmer based in the Kitale area of Kenya. She practises both livestock and crop farming for a living. If you were to visit her farm today, you would find dairy cows, poultry, and a grazing field. 

Grace is seeking a loan from Kiva lenders, through Juhudi Kilimo, to buy a reasonably-priced motorcycle that will be used for transporting milk to and from the market. With this asset, Grace will be able to have access to formal markets in new geographical and economical regions where prices are much better than the local markets.  

Increase in income from this intervention will help Grace to scale up her business and improve the quality of life being led by her family.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is a humble mother who wakes up every morning at 5 o’clock to work on her farm. She is fully dedicated to her farm work and thinks only of progressing. Hellen resides in the Siongiroi area of Kenya which is a remote town with harsh living conditions because of the bad terrain in the region. She is happily married and, together with her husband, has a lovely family. Hellen’s primary sources of income are milk and some personal business she engages in to make ends meet. Hellen has managed to take care of her family with her income from milk selling. The Siongiroi area has conditions that favor dairy farming. Hellen has always wanted to take care of another dairy cow but the lack of capital has prevented her. She is seeking a loan to buy an additional dairy cow. The dairy cow she intends to buy is not just an ordinary cow. It’s a breed that produces between 10-15 liters of milk a day. With this cow, she will produce more milk which will translate to more income. Demand for milk in the Siongiroi area is high but the supply is low. So, through this loan, Hellen is going to have more milk and comfortably meet the demand. Her increased income will allow Hellen to provide a secure future for her school-going children by paying their tuition fees. She believes that education is the gateway to success. Her vision is to keep even more dairy cows so that she will be able to build a biogas digester, which would help her to save more energy.
Help her out!

loans.use: To buy a quality dairy cow

loans.name: Serbaho

texts.en:
Serbaho is a diligent woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1965. She is living in a village with her two children. She is divorced. She is working at “Lola” club as a manager. She likes her activity and works hard to ensure her family is provided for.

Serbaho got sick and needs to be treated in order to work and earn a living. She appealed to IMON and Kiva, asking for financial support to pay for her treatment at a hospital. She hopes to be supported and awaits Kiva lenders' kindness.

loans.use: to pay for her treatment at a hospital

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is a forty two year old married woman with three children living in Masindi-Uganda. She deals in poultry as her major business. She is also a primary school teacher who earns a salary to supplement her incomes. She has a dream of educating her children to university although she is challenged by inadequate capital and low salary payment.

She is requesting for a loan to buy more chickens for her business.

loans.use: to buy more chickens for her business

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Agriculture is fundamental to Kenya's economy. But it is much more than an economic activity. Farmers like Sarah, 34, are stewards of Kenya’s countryside and provide the citizens with the option of buying locally-produced food.

Sarah started farming in 2007 after the country suffered post-election violence. With the support of her husband, she has grown the business dramatically. She has acquired numerous income-generating assets, including farm machines to help her run the farm. She keeps dairy cattle and grows subsistence and commercial crops, such as maize. She takes pride in being independent and being involved in a sector that feeds the population. 

Sarah is seeking a loan to purchase more land. Her operations are growing consistently, eating up the available space. With your funding, Sarah will have more space to expand her business output. 

The money from the investment will be plowed back into the business, to finance even more growth. The additional income will also enable her to repay the loan, buy food for her family, and pay fees for her school going children. 

She feels blessed to have the support of her husband, through all her undertakings. Make a $25 loan, and push Sarah's dream closer to reality.

loans.use: to purchase more land for farming

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to pay small photovoltaic solar electricity systems for their houses.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but no piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past one year, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour to sell in her shop.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour to sell in her shop.

loans.name: Justina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal LOS EXITOSOS.
La socia Justina alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose al  negocio de costurera, la socia lleva buen tiempo en su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia confecciona sacos, blusas entre otros, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de tela entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
This partner belongs to Los Exitosos communal bank.

Justina, the partner, works daily as a seamstress. She has been in this business for some time, and it is going well for her thanks to the daily effort that she puts into it. 

She makes jackets and blouses among other things.  She wishes to be able to keep working in order to keep supporting her family in this way. The partner is seeking a loan to buy cloth among other things.

She is grateful for the loan that has been given her and she promises to keep up with the payments agreed upon.

loans.use: to buy cloth, among other things.

loans.name: Mayra Katty

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal LOS EXITOSOS.
La socia Mayra alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose a trabajar en una empresa privada en el área de contabilidad, la socia lleva buen tiempo en su trabajo  el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su trabajo, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de una laptop.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Mayra belongs to the "Los Exitosos" communal bank. Mayra alternates her daily activities by making a living working in a private accounting company. She has been at her job for some time and it is going well because of her commitment each day towards her work. She hopes to be able to continue working so she can keep supporting her family.

Mayra is requesting a loan to buy a laptop. She is grateful for the loan and she promises to comply with the established payments.

loans.use: to buy a laptop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, sand, and brick to construct a perimeter wall at her house.

loans.name: Zully Elena

texts.es: Zully es una apasionada por la modistería, ella aprendió este arte en el que cuenta con 15 años de experiencia confeccionando prendas de vestir. Reside en compañía de sus tres hijas en un barrio de Barranquilla, en su casa propia y el fruto de su trabajo ha sido el sustento para ellas puesto que se encuentra separada y es responsable de su hogar.  Ella confecciona todo tipo de prenda de vestir, camisas, pantalones, vestidos, uniformes de colegios, entre otros y realiza todas las operaciones de la confección, diseño, corte, preparación, ensamble y acabado de piezas; sus clientes se han mantenido fieles con el pasar del tiempo, pues brinda un excelente servicio y elabora sus prendas sobre medida y a la vanguardia. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para comprar una maquina plana la cual permitirá ofrecer mejores acabados y mayor agilidad.
texts.en:
Zully is passionate about tailoring. She learned this art, and has 15 years  experience making garments to wear. She lives in her own home with her three daughters in a neighborhood in Barranquilla. The fruit of her labor has been her support of her daughters, since she is separated and is responsible for her home. 

She makes all kinds of garments: shirts, pants, dresses and school uniforms among other things. She works in all aspects of making clothes: design, cutting, preparation, and the assembly and finishing of pieces.

Her customers have been loyal over time, because she offers excellent service and her clothes are well made and fashionable. 

She is currently applying for a Kiva loan. This is the first loan she has made with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, in order to buy a sewing machine that will enable her to offer better finishes and give her more flexibility.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Patricia Del Carmen

texts.es: Patricia de 49 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y su hijo, ella se dedica a la venta de pupusas desde hace 21 años su negocio está ubicado cerca de su lugar de residencia, con las ventas que realiza logra salir adelante, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de harina de maíz, quesillo, frijoles, chicharrón, etc. y si poder tener mejores ingresos económicos.
texts.en: Patricia, 49, live sin her own house with her husband and son. She's been selling pupusas (corn tortillas stuffed with meat and cheese) for 21 years. Her business is located near her place of residence. With the sales she makes, she is able to move forward in life. She is requesting a loan to buy corn flour, cheese, beans, pork rinds, etc., in order to improve her income.

loans.use: buy corn flour, cheese, beans, pork rinds, etc.

loans.name: Magnolias De Acero Group

texts.es:
Referirse a una mujer como una “magnolia de acero” es hacer referencia a la fuerza que tiene para afrontar la vida. El nombre también hace alusión a la película en donde seis mujeres logran superar distintos retos que se les presentan en su día a día. De esta forma el grupo tomó dicho nombre pues para sus miembros es muy importante combinar la fuerza con la delicadeza, y más que un grupo de amigas ellas se consideran una gran familia.
Ellas son: Dominga quien vende ropa; Janet, lencería; Hortencia, comida; Lilia, dulces; Guillermina, refresco; Graciela y Amalia, cosméticos mientras que Rocío y Francelia manejan un club nutricional.
   Doña Dominga es una mujer que ejemplifica el carácter del grupo pues a pesar de haber enviudado hace años ella ha logrado sobreponerse y salir avante con su actividad. Todos la conocen como Doña Minga y desde hace 15 años vende ropa para dama dentro de su comunidad. La clave de poder mantener por tanto tiempo su negocio es que conoce el gusto de todos sus clientes y atiende puntualmente si le solicitan algún modelo específico. Del mismo modo añadió a su venta la de ropa interior desde hace diez años ya que las ganancias son mejores, “he vendido de todo un poco y las mejores ganancias provienen de la ropa interior”  comenta. Con el éxito obtenido hoy en día incorporó la venta de artículos para recamara por catálogo tales como sabanas, sobrecamas, edredones, toallas y cortinas. De tal forma que Doña Minga siempre está activa para trasmitir seguridad a sus cinco hijos: “para mí lo más difícil ha sido superar la pérdida de mi esposo, pero mis hijos siempre me han apoyado”.
   El préstamo lo emplearía por un parte para comprar sabanas, cortinas y toallas y por otra para adquirir más calzado de temporada. Los préstamos siempre le han sido de utilidad pues incrementa considerablemente la producción de sus negocios. 
*La fotografía fue tomada en el patio de Janet, doña Minga es quien viste blusa color azul con distintivos en rosa y blanco.
texts.en:
To refer to a woman as a Steel Magnolia (Magnolias De Acero) is making reference to the strength that she has to face life. The name also alludes to the movie where six women managed to overcome the various challenges that occurred to them day by day. In this way the group chose their name as for the members it is very important to mix force with gentleness. Plus the women consider themselves as a big family.

They are: Dominga who sells clothing; Janet sells lingerie; Hortencia sells meals Lilia sells sweets; Guillermina sells soft drinks; Graciela and Amalia sell cosmetics while Rocío and Francelia manage a nutrition club..

Dominga is a woman who exemplifies the character of the group as despite being widowed many years ago she has managed to keep herself together and get ahead with her business. Everyone knows her as Minga and for 15 years she has been selling clothing in her community. The key to her being able to maintain her business for so long is that she knows her clients tastes and she takes care of her customer punctually if they order a specific model. At the same time she added the sale of underwear ten years ago and her income increased. "I have sold a little of everything and the best profits come from underwear" she says.

With the success she has had she is now incorporating the sales of bedroom products by catalog such as sheets, bed covers, quilts, towels and curtains. In this way Minga is always active in obtaining security for her five children. "For me the most difficult thing was to get over the loss of my husband, but my children have always supported me".

She will use a part of the loan to buy sheets, curtains and towels and the other part to buy seasonal footwear. The loans have always been useful as they increase considerably the production of her business.

The photograph was taken on Janet's patio. Minga is wearing the blue blouse with pink and white stripes.

loans.use: to buy sheets, curtains and towels.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy 60 kg of meat for resale.

loans.name: Dora Alicia

texts.es: Dora tiene 47 años de edad, habita en casa humilde pero de su propiedad junto a su esposo y su hijo de 16 años de edad. Dora es una mujer que día a día se dedica al comercio en la venta de pescado el cual ella misma pesca en una laguna cercana a su vivienda y además para mejorar sus ingresos económicos  elabora y vende tamales de elote en los alrededores de las comunidades cercanas a su vivienda, es así como ella a diario lucha para llevar hasta su hogar el pan de cada día y brindar a su familia lo necesario en el hogar. Dora como interés principal tiene como objetivo realizar lo más pronto posible una mejora en su vivienda para lo cual solicita un crédito a FUSAI para la compra de: madera, lámina y clavos para cambiar el techo de su vivienda el cual se encuentra en malas condiciones y en épocas de lluvia le presenta filtraciones de agua que dañan sus pertenencias materiales.
texts.en:
Dora, 47, lives in her own modest home with her husband and 16-year-old son. Dora is a woman who makes a living each day selling fish that she catches in a lake near her home. To increase her income, she also makes and sells corn tamales in the surrounding communities near her home. This is how she struggles each day to bring home the daily bread and to give her family the household necessities. 

Dora's main interest is to improve her home as soon as possible. This is why she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to buy wood, sheet metal and nails to change the roof on her home, as it is in bad condition and when it rains it causes leaks that damage her material belongings.

loans.use: to buy wood, sheet metal and nails to change the roof on her home.

loans.name: Caridad Group

texts.es:
Decir que la comunidad de donde es originario el grupo Caridad es sumamente apacible es poco. Allí la naturaleza transmite tranquilidad y sirve incluso de inspiración para muchos de los visitantes pues los sentidos pueden dejarse llevar por el canto de las aves o el fresco aroma de los campos.
   Los miembros del grupo se consideran una familia y por ello cada que se reúnen platican  los acontecimientos y avances de sus actividades, siempre mostrando una actitud positiva y alegre para con los demás. El nombre fue elegido pues para las integrantes la caridad es una cualidad que todo ser humano debe realizar, ellas son: 

Alejandra – Cosméticos Y Zapatos 
Cristina – Cría De Cochinos Y Borregos 
Amalia - Comida
Karla –Cría De Cerdos Y Venta De Cosméticos
Luz – Cría De Cerdos Y Venta De Calzado
María –Comida Y Cosméticos
Susana - Cosméticos
Edith – Ropa Y Refrescos 
Mariana – Cría De Puercos
Amairani – Zapatos 
María 	E- Zapatos Y Ropa

  Doña Luz María, o Luchi como le llaman sus amistades, es una mujer decidida a cumplir todos sus objetivos. El hecho de no haber podido continuar sus estudios no le ha impedido realizarse laboralmente pues desde hace 5 años se ha dedicado a la venta de calzado por catálogo; “lo recuerdo como si hubiese sido ayer cuando tuve mi primer préstamo e inmediatamente corrí a comprar un paquete de catálogos y desde entonces  mi actividad prospera” comenta. 
   Aunado a eso con parte de las ganancias obtenidas desarrollo la cría de cerdos; en promedio debe cuidar 10 a 12 lechones por camada por diferentes etapas hasta llegar a un peso promedio que oscila entre 60-70 kilos. De igual forma con los beneficios remunerados llevo a cabo la construcción de dos chiqueros, un criadero de gallinas, una barda y remodelaciones en su casa. Esta vez ha solicitado el préstamo para comprar alimento de crecimiento y suero, en tanto que para su negocio de calzado invertirá en comprar más producto.
Las integrantes del grupo Caridad agradecen a todas las personas que han hecho posible los préstamos con los que han visto un cambio favorable en sus actividades.
*La fotografía fue tomada en el patio de la casa de Karla, Doña Luchi es quien viste blusa blanca y short beige.
texts.en: The community where the Caridad (Charity) Group comes from is extremely quiet. There, nature transmits peace and even serves as inspiration for many of the visitors, because senses can be felt by the song of the birds or the fresh aroma of the fields. The group members consider themselves a family, and because of this they meet up to talk about the events and progress of their activities, always showing a positive and happy attitude to everyone else. The name was chosen, because for the members, charity is a quality that all human beings should have. They are: Alejandra – cosmetics and shoes; Cristina – raising pigs and lambs; Amalia - food; Karla – Raising pigs and sale of cosmetics; Luz – raising pigs and sale of footwear; Maria – Food and cosmetics; Susana - cosmetics; Edith – Clothing and Soft drinks; Mariana – Raising pigs; Amairani – shoes; Maria E. - shoes and clothing. Luz Maria or Luchi as she is called by her friends, is a woman, committed to fulfill her objectives. The fact of not having been able to continue with her education has not stopped her from achieving something in her work life, because for 5 years she has worked selling footwear by catalog. "I remember as if it were yesterday when I had my first loan and I immediately ran to buy a packet of catalogs. From then on my job prospered", she comments. Besides that, with part of the obtained earnings she developed a business of raising pigs. In average she must take care of 10 to 12 piglets per litter in different stages until she gets them to an average weight ranging from 60-70 kilos. In the same way, with the paid benefits, she was able to build two hog farms, a chicken coop, a fence and to remodel her house. This time, she has requested a loan to buy feed for fattening and whey; and she will also invest in her footwear business to buy more products. The members of the Caridad group are grateful to those people who have made the loans possible. With these, they have seen a favorable change in their activities. *The photograph was taken at the patio of Karla's house. Luchi is wearing a a white blouse and beige shorts.

loans.use: to buy feed for growth, for fattening, whey, sandals, tennis shoes and huaraches (Mexican sandals)

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a married mother of six children. She conducts dairy, poultry, sheep and horticulture farming on her 1.6 acre piece of land. To earn a better income, Elizabeth engages in cereal brokering, which involves arranging the logistics of getting farm produce from local farmers to their buyers. Over the 36 years that she has been a farmer, she has made strong relationships which her success as a broker depends on.

Given that Elizabeth can arrange a sale more easily than regular farmers, she prefers to deal with larger volumes of produce. She is seeking a loan to aggregate more produce from local farmers at fair prices and use her better understanding of the market conditions and prices to sell at a profit. 

Your loan will help Elizabeth’s clients to focus on production, rather than sales. Elizabeth’s family also stands to benefit greatly from the improved incomes and elevated livelihood.

loans.use: to buy cereals

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is a married mother of three children. She conducts dairy and horticulture farming on her 2.8 acre piece of land. To earn a better income, Eunice engages in cereal brokering, which involves arranging the logistics of getting farm produce from local farmers to their buyers. Over the eight years that she has been in the business, she has made an effort to build strong relationships because in this business, success depends on reputation.

Given that Eunice can arrange a sale more easily than regular farmers, she prefers to deal with larger volumes of produce. She is seeking a loan to aggregate more produce from local farmers at fair prices and use her better understanding of the market conditions and prices to sell at a profit. 

Your loan will help Eunice’s clients to focus on production, rather than sales. Eunice’s family also stands to benefit greatly from the improved incomes and elevated livelihood.

loans.use: to buy cereals

loans.name: Renny

texts.en:
Renny is a persistent and hardworking woman who takes advantage of her farming skills to generate an income. She lives in the Nandihills area of Kenya, renowned for its rolling hills carpeted in manicured tea plantations. Renny is the mother of three lovely children and she has been in the agriculture business for 15 years. Her primary income sources are milk, eggs, and maize. 

Renny has been relying on agriculture to make all her income. However, the rising costs of farming inputs (such as for fertilizers) and fluctuations in market prices are some of the serious challenges that are cutting farmers' profits significantly. Despite these tough conditions, Renny remains positive and passionate about her economic activity. Renny is seeking a loan to purchase poultry. This will enable her to expand the section of business least affected by harsh external conditions. Poultry farming is cheaper to run and the demand for chicken products is always high. 

With this loan, Renny will be able to increase the sales from her poultry business and make more profits. An increase in income for her will be timely since it will enable her to tackle high farm-related costs next season. This will greatly improve the quality of her work since the cost of every input will be adequately met. As a result, she will realize better-quality produce and more yields. This loan will support Renny’s economic activity, and will change her family’s living standards indirectly.

loans.use: to buy poultry

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is a married mother of one child. She has dairy cattle, tea and cereal crops on her 1-acre piece of land. To earn a better income, Caroline engages in cereal brokering, which involves arranging the logistics of getting farm produce from local farmers to their buyers. Over the two-year period that she has been in the business, she has made an effort to build strong relationships because success depends on reputation in this business.

Since Caroline can arrange a sale easily, she prefers to deal with larger volumes of produce. She is seeking a loan to aggregate more produce from local farmers at competitive prices and use her better understanding of the market conditions and prices to sell at a profit. 

By supporting Caroline's business, you will also be helping local farmers selling to her to focus on production, rather than sales. Caroline's family also stands to benefit greatly from the improved incomes and elevated livelihood.

loans.use: to buy cereals

loans.name: Blanca Isabel

texts.es:
En la comunidad veracruzana conocida como la novia del sol se encuentra una vieja locomotora de vapor cual fue nombrada por los pobladores como “la prieta linda”. Es un símbolo para la región ya  que fue la primera máquina en recorrer sus vías transportando el azúcar; producto principal del municipio. Ahora es una pieza que expresa identidad y fuerza de trabajo.
   En una de las colonias de dicha comunidad se encuentra ubicada una estética desde hace tres años la cual es atendida por su propietaria Blanca Isabel.  Todos sus conocidos la llaman Chabe y cuenta con siete años de experiencia como estilista profesional; cuando iniciaba en esta actividad sólo realizaba trabajos a domicilio pues no contaba con un local fijo además de que continuaba con su educación preparatoria. Una vez terminados sus estudios y gracias a los ahorros obtenidos junto con la ayuda de su familia logró abrir su salón de belleza. La constante actualización, el trato que brinda a sus clientes, la calidad de su servicio y los precios accesibles han permitido que su negocio se posicione dentro de la zona. 
   De igual forma comenta  “los prestamos me han sido de utilidad como no tienen idea, gracias a ellos las ganancias son mayores y con ellas puedo acondicionar mi estética”. Ahora solicita un nuevo préstamo para instalar aire acondicionado e invertir en la compra de tintes, peróxido, capuchas, capas, maquillaje, cremas,  peines, pasadores, spray, tijeras, acrílico, uñas y esmaltes ya que en esta temporada tiene mucho trabajo debido a las graduaciones escolares.
   El camino que Chabe quiere emprender es el de expandir su local y actualizarse profesionalmente, y sabe que lo logrará trabajando como hasta ahora y con los apoyos otorgados por VisionFund México.
*Chabe siempre se muestra alegre aquí aparece realizando su actividad, también se  aprecia parte del equipo que utiliza.
texts.en:
In the Veracruz community known as the girlfriend of the sun, you will find an old vapor locomotive that the inhabitants named "the brown beauty". It's a symbol for the region as it was the first locomotive to run on the tracks transporting sugar, a principal product of the municipality. Now it's a symbol expressing identity and strength.

In one of the neighborhoods of this community you will find a beauty salon that has been there for three years, run by its proprietor, Blanca Isabel. Everyone who knows her calls Chabe and she has seven year sor experience working as a professional stylist. When she started her business, she made only house calls as she didn't have a fixed locale; she was also continuing her schooling. Once she finished her studies and thanks to her savings and help from her family, she managed to open her beauty salon. The constant actualization, the way she treats her customers, the quality of the service and accesible pricing have allowed her business to flourish in the area.

Also, she comments, "the loans have come in handy like nobody knows. Thanks to them, my earnings are greater and I can renovate my salon." As it is school graduation time, she gets lots of work, and so she is requesting a new loan to install air conditioning and invest in dyes, peroxide, hoods, capes, makeup, creams, combs, pins, hairspray, scissors, acrylics, artificial nails and nail polish.

Chabe would like to undertake the path toward expanding her locale and actualizing herself professionally, and she knows she'll accomplish it by working as she has up to now and with the support provided by VisionFund México.

*In the photo: Chabe is happy as she runs her business; you can also see some of the equipment she uses.

loans.use: buy dyes, peroxide, hoods, capes, makeup, creams, combs, pins, hairspray, scissors, acrylic, artificial nails and nail polish.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a single mother of two children. She does dairy, poultry and crop farming on her 0.6 acre piece of land. To earn a better income, Mary engages in cereal brokering, which involves arranging the logistics of getting farm produce from local farmers to their buyers. Over the 10 years that she has been in the business, she has made strong relationships with other actors to boost her reputation.

Given that Mary can arrange a sale more easily than regular farmers can, she prefers to deal with larger volumes of produce. She is seeking a loan to aggregate more produce from local farmers at fair prices and use her better understanding of the market conditions and prices to sell at a profit. 

Your loan will help Mary’s clients to focus on production, rather than sales. Mary’s family also stands to benefit greatly from the improved incomes and elevated livelihood.

loans.use: to buy cereal produce.

loans.name: Emmy

texts.en:
Emmy is a 26-year-old farmer who wants to start commercial poultry farming in Ndurio,  a village in Nandihills, Kenya. The mother of two has been in the farming business for over four years, keeping poultry and cattle and growing different varieties of food crops. Emmy enjoys farming. The few poultry she currently keeps are enough to supply her family with eggs all year. The few times they ended up with more than they wanted, they sold door to door or at the farm's gate. 

Emmy is seeking a loan to venture into commercial poultry farming. She is planning to use the chicken for eggs and meat, and she will raise her own chicks. The male chicks will be raised for meat, while the female will be kept for egg production, to be sold at the market. The income Emmy makes from this investment will not only go toward loan repayment but also business and personal expenses. In this life, she strives to provide the best for her family in order to improve their quality of life.

loans.use: To purchase poultry

loans.name: Viola

texts.en:
Viola is a smallholder farmer from Chepkunyuk village in Kenya. She is married and has three youngsters. To help her husband provide for the family, Viola practices dairy, poultry and horticulture farming. Her work brings home an important source of income. 

In a bid to produce more milk for sale, Viola applied for a loan to buy a dairy cow. The cow she plans to buy with the borrowed money will be her third. From this investment, Viola hopes to increase milk production by 30% or more. This will improve her income, which she will use to meet her family's basic needs and pay for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Imagine investing in farming and reaping nothing at the end of the day just because you don’t have enough land to cultivate. This is the sad story of Christine (she has an eye condition).She is a youthful 61-year-old shosho (old mum), a wise farmer whose neighbours and fellow farmers respect as a mentor. 

Christine started doing farming over two decades ago. With the unwavering support of her husband, who dedicated his farm, she has grown the business dramatically. She has acquired numerous income-generating assets. She keeps dairy cattle and grows subsistence and commercial crops, such as maize. She takes pride in being a farmer and being involved in a sector that feeds the population. 

Christine is seeking a loan to purchase more land. Her operations are growing consistently, eating up the available space. With your funding, Christine will have more space to expand her business output. The money from the investment will be ploughed back into the business, to finance even more growth. The additional income will also enable her to repay the loan and buy food for her family. She feels blessed to have the support of her husband through all her undertakings. Make a $25 loan, and push Christine's dream closer to reality.

loans.use: To buy more land for farming

loans.name: Oscar Juventino

texts.es: Oscar tiene 29 años de edad, vive en casa de su propiedad al lado de su grupo familiar conformado por una hermana el esposo de ella   y un sobrino. Oscar es una persona responsable que a diario se desempeña como árbitro de futbol en una asociación de arbitraje ubicada en las cercanías de su comunidad y es de esta manera como la ayuda a su hermana para suplir las necesidades básicas del hogar. Oscar con el deseo de mejorar el lugar de residencia ha tomado la decisión de solicitar un crédito a FUSAI el cual piensa utilizar para la compra de: ladrillo, arena, una puerta y cemento para la construcción de unas paredes en sustitución de una malla de alambre que posee.
texts.en: Oscar, 29, lives in his own house with his family, which comprises his sister, her husband and their son. Oscar is a responsible person who works daily as a soccer referee in a referee association located near his community, and that way he can help his sister with the basic household expenses. With the desire to improve his place of residence, Oscar has decided to request a loan from FUSAI, which he will use to buy bricks, sand, a door and cement to build some walls to replace the wire mesh.

loans.use: buy bricks, sand, a door and cement to build some walls.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Carlos, mantiene con actividad el servicio de taxista, los créditos son una herramienta que él utiliza para optimizar el vehículo y así dar un buen servicio, está satisfecho por los resultados positivos que ha tenido en sus ingresos, ya que puede cubrir las necesidades básicas de su familia y cancelar su deuda. 
Hace la solicitud de un nuevo crédito para comprar suspensiones y otros repuestos para darle mantenimiento adecuado al taxi, su aspiración realizar viajes con seguridad y mantener su fuente de ingresos.
texts.en:
Carlos actively offers his service as a taxi driver. The loans are a tool he uses to improve his vehicle and this is how he offers good service. He is happy with the positive results he has had with his income, since he can afford the basic needs of his family and pay off his debt. 

He is requesting a new loan to buy automotive suspension and other parts to provide aqequate maintenance to his taxi. He aspires to make trips safely and maintain his source of income.

loans.use: to buy automotive suspension and other parts to provide adequate maintenance to his taxi.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is a single mother of three who is very passionate about agriculture. She owns a 1-acre piece of land land in Nkage village where she lives and works. On the farm, she has 4 dairy cows, 32 trees, and bananas. 

The biggest growth constraint for Agnes is lack of access to capital. To buy agricultural inputs necessary to increase her farm’s productivity, she is seeking a loan of KES 95,000. With the money, she plans to buy improved seeds, fertilizers and other important inputs such as herbicides and pesticides. Agnes' loan officer described her as a lady who is very committed to paying her debts. 

Your loan will uplift Agnes' livelihood and her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet is a married mother of three children. She does dairy, poultry, pig and tree farming on her 0.5-acre piece of land. To earn a better income, Harriet engages in cereal brokering, which involves arranging the logistics of getting farm produce from local farmers to their buyers. Over the 10 years that she has been in the business, she has made an effort to build strong relationships because in this business, success depends on reputation.

Given that Harriet is well connected and can arrange a sale more easily than regular farmers, she prefers to deal with larger volumes of produce. She is seeking a loan to aggregate more produce from local farmers at competitive prices and use her better understanding of the market conditions and prices to sell at a profit. 

Your loan will have two great impacts. Local farmers selling to Harriet will be freed to focus on production, rather than sales. Harriet’s family also stands to benefit greatly from the improved incomes and elevated livelihood.

loans.use: to buy cereal produce

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica, in her quest to find the necessary resources for the support and education of her six children, chose to start doing mixed farming 20 years ago. She makes a living farming and selling her produce, which includes milk, eggs and crops, at the local market. Veronica spends most of her time pasturing her cows. Currently though, she is facing a big challenge of transporting feed from the store to the animal shed. 

Today, Veronica is seeking a loan to purchase cereals. Farm supplies are increasingly becoming expensive by the day. Farmers who seek cheaper sources end up buying ‘fake’ seeds that either do not germinate or that do not produce quality seeds. With your loan, Veronica is going to afford seeds for planting from recommended sources to ensure tht her crops grow healthy and productive. Profits made from this harvest will be reinvested into the business for growth. When asked “How will this loan benefit your family?” Veronica replied, “I will start a cereals business which will increase my family’s cash flow.”

loans.use: to purchase cereal seeds.

loans.name: Olvin Javier

texts.es: Olvin, tiene 35 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su pareja, con quien tiene dos hijos y vive en una aldea del municipio de Trinidad, Santa Barbara. El ha trabajado siempre con la agricultura, cuenta con su propio cultivo de café y banano. Esta actividad la tiene desde hace 10 años de donde obtiene sus ingresos. Ha mantenido su finca mediante la inversión de varios préstamos, y actualmente solicita el cuarto ciclo de prestamo a ODEF y es por 8,000 lempiras con el cual va comprar fertilizantes para aplicarle al cultivo de café y mejorar la producción y calidad. Su plan es comprar tierra para seguir cultivando y obtener ingresos para darles el estudio a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Olvin is 35 years old, and lives in a common law marriage with his partner, with whom he has two children.  He lives in a village in the town of Trinidad, Santa Barbara.  He has always worked in agriculture and has his own crop of coffee and bananas.  He has earned his living in this occupation for 10 years.  

He has sustained his farm with the investment of various loans.  He currently seeks a fourth loan cycle from ODEF for 8,000 lempiras, with which he will buy fertilizers to apply to his coffee cultivation to better the production and quality.  His plan is to buy land in order to continue farming and earn income to provide schooling for his children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers to apply to coffee cultivation.

loans.name: Marianita

texts.en:
As a married parent of nine children, Marianita works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell spices business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from general store. Marianita is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to buy sacks of spices to sell like onions, garlic, etc. for her buy and sell spices business.

Marianita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy sacks of spices to sell like onions, garlic, etc.

loans.name: Janefer

texts.en:
A big chunk of farmers in Africa struggle to make their way in this world because of unemployment and lack of financing from established financial institutions. This is true for Janefer, 42, who is based in the Chuka area of Kenya and is a loving mother. She has been practicing mixed farming for the past 20 years, and she has managed to earn a decent income. Her primary sources of income have been milk, eggs, crops, and some personal businesses she engages in to make ends meet. 

She passionately loves dairy farming, and when asked what is most enjoyable about dairy farming, she stated “feeding my cows.” Her hobby is milking her cow. She sells milk to her neighbors and to the local market, but the demand has been overwhelming, and she cannot meet the demand. For this reason, she is seeking a loan to buy an extra dairy cow, which will assist in increasing milk productivity. The dairy cow that she plans to buy is not just an ordinary cow; it’s a quality breed of dairy cow that will produce between 8-12 litres of milk a day. This will immediately translate to more profit and increased income levels. Profits from selling milk will be used in repaying back the loan in full, and the extra income will be used to increase her business enterprise. 

Janefer is very ambitious. In the near future, she intends to start adding value to her milk business by packaging the milk before selling, and she also plans to start selling dairy products. An improved income level will assure her family of a secure future. By joining Juhudi Kilimo, which assists smallholder farmers, she will also benefit from free extension services and links to markets.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna, 35, is a small-holder farmer who resides in the Kapsowar area of Kenya. The loving mother has been a farmer for more than five years. Her primary income sources are eggs, milk and a side business. Edna finds farming to be very enjoyable. However, as she is aging, she is finding dairy farming to be challenging. She is seeking a loan to purchase poultry. 

Poultry farming is a less-strenuous activity that is profitable. Many poultry farmers find a sense of fulfillment having hens all over their homestead. The hens lay eggs that can be consumed or sold. If taken seriously, poultry farming has the potential of being a big business since the demand for poultry products is always high. With your loan, Edna is going to make more income that will enable her to take care of her family's expenses. As the times keep getting harder, Edna is doing all she can do to ensure that her family's basic needs are met.

loans.use: To buy poultry

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
In her tireless search for a better life and better economic stability for her siblings and parents, Florence started farming 10 years ago. Florence is a hardworking farmer based in Abogeta village, in the Nkubu area of Kenya. She makes a living raising dairy cows and poultry. She also fetches water from the river for both domestic and agricultural use. 

Florence is seeking a loan to purchase cereals for resale. With a 20,000 KES loan, she will buy more cereals to sell to her neighbors and to the local market. Her dream is to scale up her cereal-vending business and have it as one of her main sources of income. In order to achieve this, she has partnered with other local farmers to form a group so that they can access co-guaranteed loans. Income generated from the cereal-vending business will enable her to repay the loan on time and she will use the additional amount to meet her family's basic needs and education costs.

Kindly lend to this charming lady!

loans.use: To buy cereals for resale

loans.name: Petronila

texts.en:
Petronila (pictured with one of her sons on her back) is well established and living in the Kapsowar area of Kenya, which is an area with very high productivity. She has been farming for the past 10 years. Her main source of income comes from the sale of milk and eggs. When farming, she enjoys working on her land and taking care of her animals, but her biggest challenge is marketing problems. 

She is kindly requesting a loan to buy seeds and start horticulture farming. Kapsowar area has good weather conditions that support horticulture farming. Petronila chose Juhudi Kilimo because they help farmers to raise their living standards. During the training, she learned that MFIs (micro finance institutions) help the poor access loans. Through the use of this loan, Petronila's income base will increase, and she will better educate her children. Lend to this charming lady and make her live her dream!

loans.use: To buy seeds and start horticulture farming

loans.name: Neliza

texts.en:
Neliza is 35 years old and married with three children. With three children in school, Neliza works very hard to provide for them.

Neliza runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like eggs, canned goods, junk foods, home product care and other groceries.

Neliza has been in this business for 4 years and sells a variety of items such as soft drinks, vinegar, soy sauce, biscuits, dried fish, bread and other groceries. 

In the future, Neliza would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like eggs, canned goods, junk foods, home product care and other groceries

loans.name: Joanina

texts.en:
In her tireless search of a better life and better economic stability for her four children, Joanina started practicing farming. She is a jovial 31-year-old farmer from Githu village in the Central region of Kenya. Joanina loves animals, in particular, her dairy cows and goats! In the picture, she can be seen playing with her goats. 

Dairy farming is a good business in Githu village. Joanina would like to produce more milk out of her cows in the future. In order to realize her goal, she needs to ensure that the environment in which her cows are subjected to is comfortable and conducive for maximum productivity of the cows. It is for this reason that Joanina is seeking a loan to introduce cow barns at her farm. Having a cowshed in place paves the way for the introduction of confined feeding, which enables the cows to save energy and feed more. Returns from this investment will enable Joanina to increase the number of cows at her farm and grow her family income above the status quo.

With a loan, you can help support Joanina in continuing with her life dairy farming!

loans.use: to construct a cowshed.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Honesty and hardworking that’s what describes Elizabeth, a dedicated and determined farmer. She is based in Kitale, Kenya. The rich soil of this area makes it one of the nation’s biggest maize growing regions, lending it the nickname of “bread basket of Kenya.” 

For the past 5 years, she has been involved in mixed farming and her primary source of income has been selling milk, eggs, and a variety of food crops. These ventures have allowed her to earn a decent income. Elizabeth passionately loves poultry farming, but the biggest challenge she faces is lack of funds. However, this challenge has not made her give up: “I have to do something for my family,” she has said. 

She mobilized other enterprising women like her in her village and they have joined Juhudi Kilimo, which is a microfinance organization that assists small-scale farmers through giving out loans and training. She is requesting a loan from Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva lenders to buy additional poultry. Having gone through training on loan management, she is educated on how to utilize the loan and save more money. Through this loan, Elizabeth will generate enough income to take care of the farming costs and expand her poultry business.

loans.use: to pay for poultry

loans.name: Doreen

texts.en:
In 2000, Doreen ventured into farming as a way of life so that she could be able to produce food for her family. Fifteen years down the line, Doreen is deep into commercial dairy, poultry and horticultural farming. Her primary income sources are milk, eggs, and vegetables. The money she makes from her various investments have helped elevate the quality of life led by her child, who is in school. 

Doreen is seeking a loan to expand her horticultural farm. The crops she grows on her farm are insufficient to fulfill the demand. However, to grow more crops, she needs more income. Caught up in this situation, Doreen will find your loan very handy. With KES 35,000 she is also going to pay for the resources necessary to expand her horticulture production. She has made a commitment to herself that the money she will make from this investment will go to loan repayment and her child's education. The money will also offset some of the farm expenses. She is certain that your lending will have a very big impact on her life.

loans.use: To expand her horticulture farming

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a hardworking smallholder farmer from the Kitale area of Kenya. The married mother of 4 children has been doing dairy, poultry, sheep and crop farming for 12 years. The reason she got into farming was to help her then newly married husband to settle the increasing needs and expenses of their family.

Rose is requesting for a loan to buy more poultry to increase the income she makes from selling poultry products. Currently, she owns 30 heads of poultry. With your loan, she can triple that number.
Rose hopes to grow her farm business in the future in order to increase her income and improve her family's living condition

loans.use: to buy more poultry to increase her income

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is a humble farmer who goes to work every morning on her mixed farm. She's fully dedicated to her work and she only thinks about getting ahead. She farms a small plot of land in the green, lush hills of Nkubu, in the Central region of Kenya. Regina is happily married and together with her husband, blessed with five lovely children. 

For the past 28 years, she has been involved in mixed farming. Her primary source of income has been growing different varieties of crops and keeping dairy cows. Regina has been able to provide nutritious food for her family. Although she has been making profits selling a variety of food crops, she is faced with a challenge of timely delivery of the produce to the market. This challenge has not made her give up. “I have to do something for my family, “she said. 

Regina mobilized other woman in her village and joined Juhudi Kilimo, which is a microfinance institution that assists aspiring women like her. She is requesting a loan from Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva lenders to buy a motorbike. Regina is from a remote village that has poor feeder roads, and transporting her produce to the market has been a challenge, hence she suffers so many losses. Perishable products such as milk, vegetable and tomatoes require timely delivery to the market if you are to fetch a high price. 

Through this loan, Regina is going to achieve her dream and goals. Accessing a financial solution for women in Kenya is an uphill battle, but Regina feels relieved to know that there are institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva that help out women so that they can gain respect and equality among their male counterparts. The benefits of this loan are astronomical because Regina will never suffer losses due to delay in delivery of produce to the market. She will increase her sales volume because she will be able to transport more goods to the market and increase her income level. 

Regina is a woman who is making a change for herself and for others in the community because she intends to employ someone who will be riding the motorbike and helping in farm work. With your loan, Regina will improve her living conditions and assure her children and grandchildren to come of a secure future. Lenders, if there is someone you should consider lending to, then that person is Regina.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike to transport produce to market

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is a smallholder farmer from a very remote village in the Kitale area of Kenya. She owns a small piece of land where she lives with her husband. Christine has dairy cows, poultry and over 50 trees on her farmland. With all these activities, she still has room left to plant crops. 

The main problem that she is facing is lack of enough capital to venture into horticultural farming. She is requesting for a loan to buy seeds and start horticulture farming. Christine is counting on Kiva lenders to invest in her agri-business expansion in the form of a loan. She will spend the money to pay for seeds and labour in her horticulture farm. The harvest at the end of the season will provide money for reinvesting into the business.
Help improve the life of Christine and her family with a loan!

loans.use: to venture into horticultural farming, buying seeds and paying for labour

loans.name: Samphouse's Group

texts.en:
A young woman living in Siem Reap province, Samphouse is 24 years old and married. For her living condition, she works as construction worker as her main source of income. Moreover, she can get more income via chickens-raising. She has worked for 2 years and it earns her about 20,000KHR per day. 

For Samphouse, this is her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She leads a group of two to get a new loan. As the group leader, she will manage her entire loan portion to buy a decent motorbike to ride to work. She hopes that she can save her time more than before after she got a motorbike, so she can earn more income from her work to update her family to get better condition.

loans.use: to buy a decent motorbike to ride to work.

location.town: Siem Reap district, Siem Reap province

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to pay small photovoltaic solar electricity systems for their houses.

loans.name: Zainabu

texts.en:
Zainabu is a married with two school going children. They live at their own house that  neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

She has operated a Khanga ( women wrap cloth) selling business, selling from home and door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of competition from other operators in her business.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase bales of khanga’s for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of Khanga’s for resale

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 30-year-old single man from Khan Younis City, in the Gaza Strip, which is a difficult place to live due to the Israeli economic blockade, in place since 2007. He lives with his family in a small house. Ahmad wants to improve himself and be an independent entrepreneur, so he thought of starting his business idea to transport goods in rickshaws. He took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new rickshaw. By taking this loan, Ahmad will be able to improve his family's conditions. Ahmad appears in the photo.


Additional information :
Rickshaws (also called “tuk-tuks”) are a common mode of transportation for goods and people in the Gaza Strip, due to efficient use of fuel, which can be scarce and expensive due to the economic blockade. Further, they became even more appealing following the Summer 2014 assault and the resulting destruction of buildings, homes, and infrastructure, as they are able to navigate narrow roads and difficult-to-reach places.

loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw

loans.name: Ihsan

texts.en:
Ihsan is a 31-year-old married man from Khan Younis City, in the Gaza Strip, which is a difficult place to live due to the Israeli economic blockade, in place since 2007. He lives with his wife and one child in a small house. Ihsan works in the public sector where he earns a low income. He wants to improve himself and be an independent entrepreneur, so three years ago he thought of starting his business idea to transport goods in rickshaws. Now Ihsan is thinking of replacing the old rickshaw with a new one. He took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new rickshaw. He hopes that by taking this loan, he will be able to improve his family's conditions. Ihsan appears in the photo.


Additional information:
Rickshaws (also called “tuk-tuks”) are a common mode of transportation for goods and people in the Gaza Strip, due to efficient use of fuel, which can be scarce and expensive due to the economic blockade. Further, they became even more appealing following the Summer 2014 assault and the resulting destruction of buildings, homes, and infrastructure, as they are able to navigate narrow roads and difficult to reach places.

loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw.

loans.name: Selina

texts.en:
Selina and her family live and work on a 2 acre farm in Kitale, an area situated in the fertile Rift Valley province of Kenya. On the farm, Selina has; dairy cows, poultry, sheep, maize/corn and trees. She sells her farm produce at a local market near her home.
