Selina's biggest growth constraint is lack of capital to buy agricultural inputs necessary to increase her farm’s productivity. She is seeking a loan to buy improved seeds, fertilizers and other important inputs that control weeds and pests for her maize farm. 

With your lending, Selina will be able access capital to buy important farm inputs that will increase her farm’s productivity and family income.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizer to increase productivity

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome is a smallholder farmer practising dairy and horticultural farming to provide for her family. She enjoys farming for it is her means of securing the basic necessities for life.

In the Kitale area of Kenya where she comes from, most people depend on agriculture for a living. The people there live and work on small farms: Their biggest challenge is the huge deficit in access to agricultural inputs, meaning that farmers' yields and incomes are far below what they could be.

Juhudi Kilimo partnered with KIVA to provide financial services to smallholders around Kenya. Through these financial services, farmers in Kitale now can buy productive assets and important agricultural inputs for use in their farms. 
Salome is seeking a loan to buy farm inputs such as seeds, fertilizer, herbicides and pesticides. Your loan will enable her to improve her production through use of quality farm inputs. This intervention will help her fill the increasing demand for food in the market and, in the process, generate more income to repay the loan debt and elevate the quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizers to increase her output

loans.name: Mashhura

texts.en:
Mashhura is a generous woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1983. She is single and lives with her parents. When she graduated from high school she started doing business. She is busy with the processing of dry fruits. 

Her mother died when she was 14 years old. She was responsible for looking after her father and family members. She does business by herself and sells dry fruits to rural markets. For many years she has done business and looks after her family alone. Unfortunately, she got ill and needs to be treated, but she has no money. She requested a loan from Kiva and IMON to pay for the treatment costs at a medical clinic. She awaits your compassion.

loans.use: to be treated at the medical clinic

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a widowed woman with five children, all of whom do not attend school. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past three years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. In addition she also operates a business selling vegetables. She faces a major challenge of transportation in her place of operation.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for horticultural farm inputs with fertilizers

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca is a hardworking 44-year-old woman. She is married with four dependent children. She and her family live in Ghana, Accra-Chorkor. In order to support the family, Rebecca works hard. Her husband also helps her when he can. Rebecca joined ID-Ghana in 2010. She used her previous loans to buy beans (bambara) and sold them, and she successfully repaid her loan. She receives a good income from the sale of beans (bambara). Now she would like to increase her business to earn a bigger profit. She is requesting 3,000 GHS.

loans.use: To buy beans (bambara) to sell to customers.

loans.name: Madinahon

texts.en: Madinahon is a hardworking woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1976. She is living in a small town with her family. She is married to a constructor and they have two children. She is a confident, goal oriented, nice and honest person. She tries to work hard to help her husband feed their family together. She has a serious illness of the head and she needs to go to the hospital for the treatment. She asked for a loan so that she can be treated at the hospital. She hopes to be supported and awaits Kiva lenders kindness.

loans.use: to go to the hospital for treatment

loans.name: Souad

texts.en:
Souad is a 54-year-old married mother of one child. Almost a year ago she opened a cereals shop where she sells beans, pickles, olives, spices, etc. to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their family.

Souad is a hard worker and ambitious lady who is trying desperately to develop her business. Thus, today she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to increase her business merchandise with more cereals to satisfy her customers' needs.

Souad also sells cosmetics as a second source of income, and she hopes to develop it in the future through opening her own cosmetics shop. This will increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to increase her merchandise with more cereals to satisfy her customers' needs

loans.name: Aurora

texts.en:
Aurora has been managing her own sari-sari store for 10 years. With this long span of time, she has already encountered different kinds of people or customers and also experienced lots of rough roads in handling her business. However, Aurora explored different schemes of attracting people's interest that enabled her to make it this far.

Wanting to further develop her current trade, she's making sure that she's really keeping her finger on the pulse. In fact, her recent loan from Kiva has indeed propped up her inventory. Thus, it also aided her family's daily expenses. 

Today, she's applying for another 20,000 PHP loan that she will use for purchasing more merchandise to sell. She will be buying a greater variety of products like grocery items and other commodities. She is undoubtedly hoping that you'll help her have this amount. 

It is her prospect someday to operate additional businesses to increase her income, and to totally settle her finances so she can save enough. She is also praying for good health and strength for her entire family. 

She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase more merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Katrina

texts.en:
Katrina sells frozen products. 

Since preserved foods nowadays are highly appreciated because they can be cooked instantly, Katrina saw this as a good opportunity to grow income. Now, it has been four years since she started her trade. 

She is married to Dennis and they have two kids. To pursue her children to finish their studies, Katrina is indeed applying to save money for both the present expenses and for future investments of the family. 

However, of all the high priced commodities today in the market which her family needs every day, it is inevitably difficult to earn enough from this kind of inventory, though Katrina gets a better income from this.

That is why, she really wants to develop her inventory so she could also improve her profit. Now she asks your help. With just PHP 15,000, she can already purchase additional stocks of frozen products to sell. She hopes that you could really help her with this. 

She regularly meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of frozen products to sell.

loans.name: Maria Estefania

texts.es:
A sus 23 años, Maria tiene mucha energía y empuje para trabajar en su negocio de tapicería.

Vive en una humilde casa con su familia. Actualmente enfrenta problemas en su negocio como el largo desplazamiento hasta su sitio de trabajo y el clima.

Esto intenta contrarrestarlo comprando insumos y es precisamente ese el motivo por el cual solita un préstamo, pues desea comprar gran cantidad de espuma, cuero, pega, hilo, entre otros y de esta forma consolidara su negocio para el futuro con mejor capital de trabajo.
texts.en:
At 23 years old, Maria has a lot of energy and drive for her work in her upholstery business.

She lives in a modest home with her family. She currently faces problems in her business such as the long trip to her work site and the climate.

She is trying to offset it by buying supplies and this is precisely why she is asking for a loan. She wants to buy a large quantity of foam, leather, glue, thread, among others and in this way she can strengthen business for the future with improved working capital.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of foam, leather, glue, thread, among others

loans.name: Salomey

texts.en:
Salomey is single and has one child. She is requesting a loan of GHS 2,000 to buy additional supplies to keep in her business, including soft drinks and toiletry. She has been doing business for 17 years and started this business all by herself. 

She's taking a loan from ID-Ghana to increase her income and she wants to do this business for a very long time. She is happy with the loan that was offered by ID-Ghana for her to have more working capital to buy more soft drinks and toiletries to sell to customers. 

She promises to repay without trouble. This is her 9th loan cycle.

loans.use: To buy more soft drinks and toiletries to sell to customers.

loans.name: Carlos Manuel

texts.es: Carlos, tiene 22 años de edad, esta soltero, tiene 3 hijos y vive con sus padres en el municipio de Macuelizo, Santa Barbara.  Carlos anteriormente se dedicaba a la reparación de celulares pero sus ingresos no eran suficientes y decidió mejor poner una pulpería con el apoyo de sus padres, vende arroz, azúcar, refrescos, embutidos, lácteos, harina, churros, dulces, pan, manteca, carnes, condimentos, pastas y productos de limpieza.  Esta solicitando un préstamo por 21,000 lempiras para comprar más productos como carnes, embutidos, pan, leche, refrescos, churros, azúcar, arroz y otros productos de aseo para surtir y vender. Su meta es mejorar el negocio sacar adelante a sus hijos y mejorar su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Carlos is 22 years old, single, has 3 children and lives with his parents in the town of Macuelizo, Santa Barbara.  Carlos previously made a living repairing cell phones but his income was insufficient, so he decided it better to start a small store with the support of his parents.  He sells rice, sugar, soft drinks, sausages, dairy products, flour, snacks, candies, bread, lard, meats, condiments, pastas and cleaning supplies.  

He seeks a loan of  21,000 lempiras to buy more products such as meats, sausages, bread, milk, soft drinks, snacks, sugar, rice and other cleaning supplies to stock and sell. His goal is to improve the business, help his children succeed and improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more products such as meats, sausages, bread, milk, soft drinks, snacks, sugar, rice and other cleaning supplies to stock and sell.

loans.name: Cañada Group

texts.en: The members of the Cañada group are low-income peasants who install third-generation solar-home systems to have a basic electricity service that they will not receive through the power lines of the national grid. Mr. Ildefonso, standing third from the left in the back row, is the veteran of this group. He lives with his wife in a small house where they have electric lighting for the first time due to the installed system. The loan is asked to fund solar systems for this group and will be paid back with the monthly fee for first-year-of-operation maintenance services they pay.

loans.use: to pay for small photovoltaic systems for their houses.

loans.name: Ma. Lourdes

texts.en:
This is Lourdes, 29 years old. Currently, she is residing at Pasay City, a small area in Metro Manila. She is married to Robin and they were gifted with six children. This young, Lourdes is really obligated to help her husband in working, or else their little children will starve for food. 

Today, Lourdes sells liquid dishwashing soaps in their community in exchange for a little amount per bottle. But most of the time, customers don't pay the whole amount at once. And at times, such situations really challenge her. But, she's still pressing on toward her goal because she wants her family to get out of the breadline. 

As a matter of fact, she's dreaming of establishing more businesses to manage, which she thinks will help her save for her children's education. She wants to ensure that her children will finish their studies. That's why she's working very hard. 

Every week, Lourdes is attending a regular fellowship with her co-lenders. Here, they inspire each other, share their stories and study the word of God, which encourages them to continue their businesses. 

Lourdes would like you to know that she's requesting a loan of PHP 15,000. She will use this to develop her business and have additional capital for purchasing more soap to sell. 

She is expecting that your generosity will extend to her now that she really needs to help her family. She would like to assure you that she will be accountable in paying back the loan.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to have additional capital for purchasing more soap to sell

loans.name: Zita

texts.en:
Meet Zita. She's undeniably a selfless and passion-driven mother. When we talk about working hard for just raising her children, she's unstoppable. This is maybe the reason why her husband, Jessie, loves her so much. 

Today Zita is already 60. Despite the age, she remains persevering, knowing that someday her family can also rise from an awful poverty. 

Zita owns a small sari-sari store today (commonly known as variety store). Here she sells different commodities such as toiletries, beverages, condiments and other grocery items. Customers are attracted to buy because of the low-cost price of the items. 

To further improve sales, she asks your help. She wants to sustain her family needs and she envisions her business expanding someday. if that happens, she wants to have their own house. The realizations of these starts today as you let her borrow a loan worth PHP 12,000. She would use this to buy more grocery items to sell in her sari-sari store. 

She hopes that you would not ignore this. It means a lot to her if you respond to her prayer. 

She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase [clothing] merchandise.

loans.name: Carlos Reni

texts.es:
Carlos, vive con su compañera de vida y una hijastra de 16 años; tiene un taller mecánico, estudio Bachillerato Mecánico Automotriz, al culminar sus estudios inicio a trabajar en una empresa distribuidora de boquitas, luego decidió fundar su negocio, trabaja de siete de la mañana a seis de la tarde. 
Invertirá en la compra de cables, aceite, focos, pastillas para frenos, etc., para reparar el vehículo que utiliza para trasladar su equipo de trabajo del taller automotriz, de esta manera brindara un mejor servicio y aumentara sus ganancias con las que pagara sus deudas y los gastos de su hogar. 
Su sueño es tener nuevos empleados para brindar un mejor servicio y conseguir que su negocio sea autosuficiente.
texts.en:
Carlos lives with his partner and sixteen-year-old step-daughter. He has a mechanic shop, and he studied to be an auto mechanic in high school. After finishing school he started to work in a snack distributing company, then he decided to start his business, working from 7:00 am to 6:00 pm. 

He will buy cables, oil, lights, brake pads, etc., to repair the vehicle he uses to move his work equipment from his auto shop. This is how he will offer better service and increase his earnings with which he will pay his debts and the household expenses. 

His dream is to have new employees to offer better service and to have his business be self-sufficient.

loans.use: to buy cables, oil, lights, brake pads, etc., to repair the vehicle that he uses to move his work equipment from the auto mechanic shop.

loans.name: Roxanne

texts.en:
This is Roxanne. Every week, she joins a group of people that study the word of God. Here, she is inspired and encouraged to go for living with hope and joy. Despite the fact that they're family is not as so fortunate like other families, with her husband, Ryan, they are persevering and working hard for their children's lives. 

Today, she is operating a small store of variety products along the road in their community at Batasan, Quezon City. Through this small stand, they are able to suffice the family with the basic needs, hopefully (can't hide the fact that their income at times is still not enough). She wants to improve this so she could also develop her sales and she asks help from you. 

She humbly wants to avail a financial support amounting to PHP 10,000 to be used in buying more products to sell. She's really hoping that you'll grant her this. 

This is now your chance to help in just a little way. 

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: for buying more products to sell.

loans.name: Solidaria Mujer Esforzadas B.a. Group

texts.es:
Este grupo inicio con 6 integrantes, actualmente solo 3 continúan. Todas desean este crédito para invertir en compra de mercadería que le solicita su clientela. Las integrantes viven en Buenos Aires, es el cantón número 3 de la provincia de Puntarenas, Costa Rica y la número 4 en extensión territorial del país, que incluye 9 distritos. No existe suficientes fuentes de empleo, especialmente para las mujeres, por eso ellas deciden iniciar con su actividad productiva.
Una de las integrantes doña Elizabeth tiene 46 años de edad, esta casada, tiene tres hijos, los cuales ya son mayores de edad y logro salir adelante gracias a su trabajo propio. Ella siempre se ha destacado como muy luchadora, es comerciante, vende todo tipo de sandalias, ropa, zapatos y artículos de uso personal que le solicitan en su comunidad. Ella vive en una comunidad de difícil acceso, donde no se encuentra algún tipo de comercio para adquirir lo necesario, es por eso que siempre le compran y esperan que llegue con nueva mercadería, ya que es una de las pocas maneras de adquirir los productos. Necesita este crédito para comprar sandalias, blusas, pantalones y ropa interior que le han solicitado. Esta actividad le permite salir adelante junto con sus tres nietos, los cuales obtuvo la custodia, ya que su mamá los dejo en abandono, por lo que ella como abuela desea sacarlos adelante, brindándoles una correcta educación, alimentación, recreación y salud. Es por eso que desea continuar como comerciante para generar los ingresos que le permitan cubrir las necesidades del hogar. Eligió Fundación Mujer por la baja tasa de interés y trato personalizado que brinda. 3
texts.en:
This group started out with six members but only three are still active.  They are requesting a loan to buy merchandise for their customers.  The members live in Buenos Aires which is the third largest canton of the province of Puntarenas, Costa Rica.  It is the fourth largest in extension in the country and includes nine districts.  There are not enough sources of employment, especially for women, so they decided to start their own business.

One of the members is Elizabeth who is 46, married and has three adult children who she raised thanks to her work.  She always has stood out as a hard worker.  She is a merchant and sells sandals, clothing, shoes and personal use items which people in the community request.  The community where she lives has a difficult access so there is nowhere to buy needed goods.  So she always runs out of inventory and customers are anxious for her to bring new merchandise as it is the only way they can acquire them.

Elizabeth is in need of a loan to buy the sandals, blouses, pants and lingerie to fill orders.  Her business allows her to provide for ther three grandchildren who are in her care since their mother abandoned them.  As a grandmother, she wants to give her grandchildren a good education, nutrition, recreation and health.  Therefore she wishes to continue generating an income to cover household needs.  She chose Fundacion Mujer because of its low interest rate and personalized attention.

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Jhon Alexander

texts.es:
Jhon es un joven de 28 años, es muy trabajador, salió de su casa ubicada en la provincia de Carchi desde los 18 años para tener un mejor nivel de vida, desde entonces vive arrendando en la ciudad de Ibarra, es soltero y no tiene hijos. 
Se dedica al comercio de ropa desde hace 3 años aproximadamente, inicio con el negocio como iniciativa propia, él trabaja en una empresa textil en donde adquiere sus productos a un costo más bajo que normalmente costaría, como Jhon es un empleado de esta empresa tiene muchas ofertas de ropa en liquidación y aprovecha estas ofertas para incrementar su mercadería y ofrecer más productos en las ferias a donde asiste.  Sus productos los vende en las ferias de Otavalo, Tulcán, San Gabriel e  Ibarra, los vende de forma ambulante.
El crédito lo va invertir en la compra de Pijamas de niño y ropa interior que le van entregar con un buen descuento, Jhon desea invertir para incrementar su mercadería y estar listo para la temporada que se viene desde el mes de octubre que empieza nuevamente la temporada alta. Agradece a KIVA por la ayuda brindada.
texts.en:
Jhon is a 28-year-old man, he is very hardworking, he left his house in the Carchi province at 18 years old to have a better quality of life, since then he has been renting a house in the city of Ibarra, he is single and doesn’t have any children.  

He has made a living selling clothes for approximately three years, he started this business as his own endeavour. He works in a textile factory where he can access goods at a lower price than they would normally cost, as an employee of the factory Jhon sees many clearance sales on clothes, he takes advantage of these sales to increase his inventory and have a wider range of products at the fairs he attends.  He sells his products at the Otavalo, Tulcán, San Gabriel and Ibarra fairs, where he sells them on the street.

With the loan he will invest in buying children’s pyjamas and undergarments that he will get at a good discount, Jhon would like to invest by increasing his inventory and being ready for the season beginning in October, when peak season begins again.  He thanks KIVA for the help they offered him.

loans.use: to invest in more merchandise such as pyjamas and undergarments, this way he can be ready for the student season.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to pay small photovoltaic solar electricity systems for their houses.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a rural smallholder crop farmer from the Kapsowar area of Kenya. Besides crop farming, David also does dairy farming for extra food and income.  The key lesson he has taken away from the years of being in crop farming is how to predict weather patterns and plan farm activities accordingly.

David is seeking a loan to buy agricultural inputs. With the borrowed money, he plans to buy improved seeds and fertilizer to enhance his farm’s productivity.
With your loan, having quality agricultural inputs will increase David’s chances for a successful harvest.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs like improved seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more food staffs like beans, ground nuts and Irish potatoes to sell

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is a single woman who has no kids. She lives at a  rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food .

Catherine operates a grocery vegetables selling stall, she sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of seasonality in her place of operation. 

With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes and onions for resale

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
To be the leader in the horticulture market and be able to offer a good education for her children are the goals that motivate Catherine to get up every day at 5 o’clock in the morning and work hard. She is a warm-hearted farmer who hails from the Kitale area of Kenya, an area that has one of the best weather patterns on earth that favors farming. 

Catherine is the proud mother whom she adores and always protects. Catherine's upbringing was very challenging, and because of this, she promised herself that she would work hard to get out of poverty. That is why she started farming six years ago. Through farming, she has been able to earn a decent income. 

Catherine is the breadwinner of her family, and this really pushes her to work hard so that her children will have a bright future and her parents will have a comfortable life. Catherine is seeking a loan to start horticultural farming so that she can use the excess space on her land. She dreams of buying more land and increasing her horticultural farming through buying of quality seeds. Accessing funds is very difficult for a woman in Africa, but through institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo and Kiva.

Catherine is optimistic that her dream will be realized and her life will completely change. Through the income from horticultural farming, Catherine will assure her children of a bright future and will be able to pay tuition fees for her siblings who depend on her. Through your loan, the promise of supporting small-scale farmers will be achieved.

loans.use: To start horticultural farming to improve her income

loans.name: Daniel Ulises

texts.es:
Daniel, solicita un nuevo crédito por los buenos resultados que estos le dan al invertirlos en su negocio, en esta oportunidad lo utilizara para comprar hierro de diferentes medidas, solventes, pinturas, electrodos, etc., así tendrá un inventario bien surtido para elaborar puertas, ventanas, portones y otros en el taller de estructuras metálicas.
Agradece a la institución por el apoyo recibido a través del crédito anterior, comenta que su negocio ha crecido, tiene nuevos clientes, su situación económica es más favorable y el estilo de vida familiar es más confortable.
texts.en:
Daniel seeks a new loan because of the good results he has had with his business. Now he will use it to buy different lengths of iron, solvents, paints, electrodes, etc. so he will have a well-stocked inventory in order to make doors, windows, gates, and other items in his metalsmithing workshop.

He is thankful to the institution for the support he received through his prior loan. He comments that his business has grown, he has new customers, his economic situation is more favorable, and this quality of life is more comfortable.

loans.use: to buy different lengths of iron, solvents, paints, electrodes, etc. so he will have a well-stocked inventory in order to make doors, windows, gates, and other items.

loans.name: Zoila Rosa

texts.es: Zoila de 40 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida y sus dos hijos, ella posee un comedor y venta de pupusas desde hace 3 años su negocio esta ubicado en una zona muy transitada cerca de su lugar de residencia por esa razón posee muchos clientes, ella esta solicitando nuevamente un crédito para la compra de granos básicos, pollo, carnes, mariscos, vegetales, frutas, refrescos, gaseosas, etc. todo por mayor y así poder tener mejores ingresos económicos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Zoila, 40, lives in a home with her life partner and their children. She has a dining room and has sold stuffed tortillas for three years. Her business is located in an area with heavy traffic near her home. Thus, she has many clients.

She asks for this loan in order to buy basic grains, chicken, meats, shellfish, vegetables, fruits, drinks, soda water, etc wholesale, so she can have a better income and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, chicken, meats, shellfish, vegetables, fruits, drinks, soda water, etc wholesale.

loans.name: Manos Unidas De Amadeo Repeto Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal  “Manos Unidas de Amadeo Repeto” en la ciudad del Cusco, la socia Lucila continua con su negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia continua vendiendo diferentes tipos de productos como arroz, azúcar, leche, gaseosas entre otros, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio  el cual le trae satisfacciones personales entre otros, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el  crédito para la compra de arroz, leche, azúcar entre otros.
Los demás socios se dedican a la confección de ropas, venta de abarrotes, venta de comida los demás son profesionales en las aéreas de salud.
Los socios en general agradecen la oportunidad brindada y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos.
Los socios que salen en la foto adjunta pidieron permiso para llegar tarde a la reunión por motivos de salud y trabajo,los socios se comprometen para el proximo desembolso tomarse todos juntos.
La persona que sale  con la cara tapada no pertenece al banco comunal.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the “Manos Unidas de Amadeo Repeto” communal bank in Cusco city. Lucila continues with her business selling groceries. She is a responsible, hard-working woman who continues selling different kinds of products such as rice, sugar, milk, soda pop, among others. This is the manner in which she supports her family.

She seeks a loan to buy rice, milk, sugar, and other items. The other members have businesses such as making clothing, selling groceries, selling food, and the others are professionals in the field of healthcare. The members are thankful for the opportunity provided by the loan and promise to make their respective loan payments on the established schedule. The members missing in the photo asked for permission to arrive late to the meeting because of health and work. The members promise for the next disbursement to take a photo together. The person with the covered face does not belong to the communal bank.

loans.use: to buy rice, milk, sugar, and other items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cereals for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy yarn and dye for weaving.

loans.name: Ledys María

texts.es: Su deseo de iniciar un negocio alterno a su profesión como abogada, llevaron a Ledys de 53 años a ofrecerle a la comunidad del barrio donde residen en la ciudad de Barranquilla,  servicio de alquiler de lavadoras.  Esta idea de negocio surgió al observar la necesidad entre los habitantes del sector los cuales no tienen este electrodoméstico en casa y optan por tomarlo rentado.  Su negocio ha sido un éxito, diariamente atiende en el horario comprendido entre las 7 a.m. a 3 p.m. a un gran número de vecinos que gracias a este servicio se benefician en un ahorro significativo de detergentes y agua, además mientras lavan su ropa pueden realizar cualquier tipo de actividad.  En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para adquirir cuatro lavadoras  y poder responder a la demanda.  Ledys es madre de cuatro hijos mayores de edad y su meta es continuar ofreciéndoles su ayuda, así mismo desea cada día ser mejor persona.
texts.en:
Her wish to open her own business alternative to her profession as a lawyer, lead 53-year-old Ledys to offer the community where she resides, in the city of Barranquilla, the service of washing machine rentals. This business idea emerged after observing the necessity among the inhabitants of the community who don't have this electric appliance at home and choose to rent it. 

Her business has been a success. Her daily business hours are between 7 a.m. and 3 p.m. and she serves several neighbors who, thanks to this service, can significantly save in detergents and water consumption. Furthermore, while their clothes are being washed they can occupy themselves with other activities. 

She is currently applying for a Kiva loan, the first financial aid she has requested from the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, to acquire four washing machines and thus keep up with the demand. 

Ledys is the mother of four adults and her goal is to continue to keep offering them her help; furthermore, she also wishes to be a better person every day.

loans.use: to acquire four washing machines

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
Annet is a thirty one year old single parent with two children living in Masindi-Uganda. Her businesses include selling second hand clothes, farming and earning a monthly salary as sources of income. 

She hopes to educate her children from the profits that she will realize from this business. She complains of unpredictable weather changes and high taxes on secondhand clothes. Annet is requesting a loan to buy clothes for selling.

loans.use: to buy clothes for selling

loans.name: Tereso De Jesus

texts.es:
Tereso, agradece a Padecomsm y a los inversionistas kiva por el apoyo que la han brindado con el crédito anterior, actualmente en su taller está atendiendo a nuevos clientes, genera más ingresos y los utiliza para cubrir las necesidades básicas de su familia y brindarles acceso a mejor salud.
Considerando que debe mantener el buen servicio a sus clientes nuevamente solicita un crédito, para comprar hierro en diferentes medidas, pintura, solventes y otros materiales para equipar el taller de estructuras metálicas esperando que las demandas se mantengan.
texts.en:
Tereso is grateful to Padecomsm and the Kiva investors for the help that he has been given with his previous loan.  Currently, in his workshop, he is taking care of new customers, generating more income and using it to cover the basic necessities for his family and to give them access to better health.

Considering that he should maintain the good service he is giving to his customers, he is again requesting a loan to buy metal in different sizes, paint, solvent and other materials to equip his metal structures workshop, hoping that the demands will be maintained.

loans.use: to buy metal in different sizes, paint, solvents and other materials to equip his metal structures workshop

loans.name: Tahira

texts.en:
Tahira  is 37 years old and a married woman.  She deals in the business of selling animals. She buys animals (baby goats & calves) at low prices, brings them up and then sells them out in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute in the family income. She also sells milk to generate an extra amount of income. 

She needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and has availed Murabaha loan of PKR 30000  to purchase more animals to increase her sales. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase more animals to increase her sales

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is a tender, charismatic and hard-working woman and a resident of Kipkaner a remote and humble village in the Kapsowar area of Kenya.She has spent the past 10 years of her life farming. She sells milk and vegetables produced on her farm. She also engages in personal business, to make ends meet. Christine is a go-getter and has a great desire to succeed in life. 

Of all the activities she involves herself in, dairy farming is closest to her heart. She enjoys waking up every morning to go and milk her cows and feed them with fodder that has high nutrient value. Dairy farming being a very profitable business venture, Christine wants to take full advantage. She would like to expand her dairy business, but the biggest challenge she faces is a lack of capital for growth. 

She is requesting a loan, which she will use to buy a quality breed of dairy cow. Christine has planted  grass, and feeding the cows will never be a challenge. She also owns an expansive piece of land, and the excess space will be productively used once she acquires the additional dairy cow. The cow she will buy will produce between 10 and 15 litres of milk per day, and this will translate to more income and profits. The profits from milk selling will allow Christine to grow her business further, by starting to package milk and by processing it into other dairy products, such as cream and yoghurt. In addition, she will benefit from the organic manure from the cow. 

She projects that in the future she will be able to start a biogas plant at her farm, which will save her money in fuel costs. With your loan, all that Christine dreams of is a secure future for her children. Christine patiently awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy a high quality dairy cow

loans.name: Abbah Group

texts.en:
Charity is a member of Abbah group, the group is based in Harare, she is a widowed mother of three school going children and is doing business to take care of her children. Charity joined Thrive microfinance in May 2014 and received business advice which she described as a key that unlocks her potential of doing business and also boosting  confidence to live taking care of her children as a widowed mother. Charity is a cross border trader going to South Africa, Botswana and Zambia restocking clothes and kitchen ware products which she sells at her flea market in Harare. 

Charity said the loan of US$400 which she received helped her to expand her business and now her business is stable, her life has improved she can now afford to buy basic necessities for her children like food and clothing.

Charity and her other group member Claria is very appreciative for the loans and business advice she received and wishes to maintain a good relationship with Thrive and its partners so that she can continue to benefit from their program. Charity together with her other group member has applied for a combined loan of US$900 and she said she wants to use her potion of the loan amount to restock more winter clothes, as there is high demand for winter clothing in the city. Charity also said she is making savings in her bank account which she wants to use to open a shop in the CBD and sell her clothes than to continue selling at a flea market.

loans.use: To buy more clothes and other goods for sale from her stall.

loans.name: Unidos Venceremos Group

texts.es:
REVISADO
Cuando se visita la comunidad de Veracruz llamada la novia del sol se deben tomar en cuenta monumentos y símbolos importantes para los pobladores. Las caritas sonrientes, por ejemplo, son artesanías que tienen un significado desde la época de los Totonacas y Olmecas; la locomotora “la prieta linda” es una de las más famosas por ser de las primeras en recorrer territorio nacional y el monumento a la bandera es un lugar obligado para los turistas.
   En dicha ciudad se integró un grupo llamado Unidos Venceremos ya que para los integrantes del grupo “la unión hace la fuerza”. Cada uno de ellos se dedica a una actividad económica que permite satisfacer las necesidades de sus familias, los 12 integrantes actuales del grupo son: Severiana quien vende ropa, zapatos, perfumes, coronas, guías, juguetes y accesorios; Guadalupe, carne; Rosa, artículos de plata; Miguel y Norma, ropa; Luis, refresco; Ernestina, bisutería; María y Concepción, antojitos típicos; Nati, pescado; Leticia, abarrotes y Anahí quien maneja un centro nutricional.
   Doña Severiana es mejor conocida como doña Seve por sus amistades y es madre de una niña de 8 años quien estudia la educación primaria. Su pequeña siempre la llena de orgullo ya que cada ciclo escolar sobresale en el cuadro de honor debido a sus excelentes calificaciones. De igual forma tiene un hijo de 18  años quien además de estudiar se dedica a la venta de ropa para caballero, por lo que su familia siempre ha sido el motor principal para afrontar los retos con fortaleza.
   Gracias al préstamo otorgado por VisionFund México pudo iniciar su negocio además de invertir en la compra de floratel, papel celofán, celo seda, alambre, hojas de color, cinta adhesiva  y cera para poder elaborar coronas y arreglos con motivo de los fieles difuntos y la celebración de la  Virgen de Juquila y la Virgen de Guadalupe. Con las ganancias obtenidas estableció un negocio de ropa y gracias a la constancia y dedicación en sus actividades, hoy en día vende perfumes, juguetes y accesorios. Con las ganancias obtenidas ha remodelado su casa y reinvertido en mercancía. En esta ocasión el préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de playeras, blusas, camisas, pantalones, faldas y vestidos pues sus clientes le han solicitado ropa para las graduaciones.
*La fotografía fue tomada en el patio de Doña Seve quien viste una blusa floreada y un pantalón café.
texts.en:
Revised 

When one visits the Veracruz community, often called the Sun's girlfriend, one must take into account the monuments and symbols that are important to the inhabitants. The smiling faces, for example, are important crafts that have been around since the Totonacas and Olmecas; the locomotive, "the beautiful brown", is one of the most famous for being among the first ones to cross the national territory; and the monument to the flag is an obligation for tourists. 

In this city emerged a group called "United We Shall Overcome" (Unidos Vencermos) because for the group members "union makes the force". Each one of the members makes a living from an economic activity that allows him/her to satisfy the family's necessities. The 12 group members are: Severiana who sells clothes, shoes, perfumes, wreaths, guides, toys, and accessories; Guadalupe, meat; Rosa, silver products; Miguel and Norma, clothes; Luis, sodas; Ernestina, imitation jewelry; Maria and Concepcion, typical snacks; Nati, fish; Leticia, groceries; and Anahí who manages a nutrition center. 

Mrs. Severina is better known as Doña Seve by her friends, and she's the mother of an 8-year-old girl who is currently in elementary school. Her little one always fills her up with joy because each school year she has made it to the honor roll due to her excellent grades. She also has an 18-year-old son who aside from studying, also makes a living selling gentleman's clothes. Her family has always been her principal engine to affront challenges with strength.

Thanks to the loan from VisionFund Mexico, she has been able to open her own business and also invest in the purchase of flowers, cellophane paper, silk zeal, wire, colored leaves, masking tape and wax to elaborate wreaths and arrangements for the deceased and the celebration of the Virgin of Juquila and the Virgin of Guadalupe. With the earnings she was able to establish a clothes store, and thanks to the perseverance and dedication to her activities, today she sells perfumes, toys and accessories. With the earnings she has been able to remodel her house and reinvest in her merchandise. 

This time, she will invest the loan in purchasing t-shirts, blouses, shirts, pants, skirts, and dresses because her clients have requested clothes for graduation. 

*The photograph was taken in the courtyard of Doña Seve, she's the one who wears a flowery blouse and brown pants.

loans.use: to purchase: t-shirts, blouses, shirts, pants, skirts, and dresses

loans.name: Benson

texts.en:
Benson is a rural smallholder crop farmer from the Kitale area of Kenya. He is married and has 4 children. Besides crop farming, Benson also does dairy and poultry farming for extra food and income. The key lesson he has taken away from 3 years of being in crop farming is predicting weather patterns.

Benson is seeking a loan to buy agricultural inputs. With the borrowed money, he plans to buy improved seeds and fertilizer to enhance his farm’s productivity.
With your loan, having quality agricultural inputs will increase Benson’s chances for a successful harvest.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as improved seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is a smallholder dairy and poultry farmer dying to get her hands on the agricultural products market. She is the mother of two and has been doing crop farming too, but for subsistence purposes. She also grows vegetables, a bit of maize and grass for her cow. She is seeking a loan to buy more land and grow her farming on a bigger scale for commercial gains. The demand for different varieties of food crop (vegetables, fruits and maize) has grown steadily in Kenya in recent years. As much as they have become one of the top traded agricultural products, there is still plenty of room to expand. 

Nancy is very excited to start the commercialization of her crops. With your loan, this can be easily achieved. She will rely on other sources of income to make initial installments of the loan but in no time, the farm will start pumping in income. The profits will be ploughed back into the business to fuel growth. Her increased income will uplift the living standards of her family.

With her drive and ambition, Nancy sees herself in the medium term in a position to generate employment, always with the helping hand of KIVA lenders and Juhudi Kilimo
Kindly help her out!.

loans.use: To buy more land and expand her farming

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to pay small photovoltaic solar electricity systems for their houses.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
With the support of Kashf Foundation and Kiva, Nasreen  has successfully built her business manufacturing footballs. By the time she attained a good number of customers and makes good amount of income to contribute in the family income. 

Previously with the help of Kiva she was able to expand her business. Now she has applied a loan of 45000 PKR to purchase more rubber bladders, leather covers, threads and needles to increase her sales.

loans.use: to purchase more rubber bladders for footballs, leather covers, threads and needles to increase her sales

loans.name: Mercado Digno Group

texts.es:
REVISADO
Mercado Digno es el nombre de un grupo integrado por diez personas cuyo objetivo es proveer a sus familias de cualquier necesidad. El nombre lo eligieron debido a que, al ser todos comerciantes, la dignidad de cada uno de sus negocios es un ejemplo en su comunidad. Todos son originarios de Veracruz y sus actividades son: Demetrio quien vende pan y agua embotellada; Juana, comida y piñatas; María, comida, pan y refresco; Bertha, comida y carne de cerdo; Oralia y Alicia, ropa y calzado; Elideth, medicina naturista; Maricela, ropa y cosméticos; Mireya, comida y Ana, repostería. 
   Elideth es una mujer muy trabajadora que se preocupa por el bienestar de sus dos hijos cuyas edades son de 13 años y 6 años; ambos estudian en escuelas de la colonia. Desde hace 15 años se ha dedicado a la venta de medicina naturista, tuvo que incrementar su labor debido a que enviudó y ahora es el único soporte para su familia; “la necesidad de un ingreso económico para poder ofrecer lo mejor a mis hijos es lo que más me motiva” comenta satisfecha. Al principio sólo vendía de calle en calle a pie sin embargo gracias a las ganancias obtenidas pudo comprar una motocicleta con la que trasporta de manera más rápida y segura el producto hasta sus clientes.
   Este préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de capsulas, ampolletas, polvos, clorofila y té pues son los productos que más consumen sus clientes. La estabilidad de su actividad es consecuencia del buen servicio que brinda, ella siempre está bien informada de cada necesidad de su clientela “para poder vender la medicina tomé cursos sobre cada planta que compone al medicamento” refiere.  
   Los planes a futuro de Elideth son vender en comunidades de difícil acceso de tal manera que su mercado crezca favorablemente, de igual forma pretende comprar un automóvil para facilitar su tarea. Sin embargo lo que desea principalmente es que sus hijos continúen estudiando.
*Ellos son los integrantes de Mercado Digno, los integrantes muestran la medicina que comercializa Elideth quien viste blusa blanca con mangas en color verde.
texts.en:
Mercado Digno is the name of a group made up of ten members who's object is to provide all they need for their families. The name they chose is due to them all being merchants and the dignity of each of their businesses is an example for the community. They are all natives of Veracruz and their businesses are: Demetrio who sells bread and bottled water, Juana sells meals and piñatas; María sells meals, bread and soft drinks Bertha sells meals and pig meat; Oralia y Alicia sell clothing and footwear; Elideth sells natural medicine; Maricela sells clothing and cosmetics, Mireya sells meals and Ana sells pastries.

Elideth is a hard-working person who cares for the well-being of her two children who are 13 and 6 years old. Both study in the school in their neighborhood. For 15 years she has been selling natural medicine. She had to increase her work when she became widowed and now is the only support of the family. "The need for an economic income to be able to offer the best for my children is my greatest motivation", she commented with satisfaction. In the beginning she sold only in the streets on foot but thanks to the profits she got she was able to buy a motorcycle which transports her product much quicker and safer to her clients.

She will invest the loan in buying capsules, vials, powders, chlorophyll and tea as they are the products that her clients use the most. The stability of her business is due to the good service she provides. She is always well informed about the needs of her clientele. "To be able to sell medicine I took courses on each plant that is used in the medicine", she stated.

Elideth's future plans are to sell in community that are difficult to access in such a way that her market will grow considerably and she also wants to buy an automobile that would facilitate her work. However what she wants mostly is for her children to continue studying.

In the photo are the members of the Mercado Digno group who are demonstrating the medicine that Elideth sells. She is wearing a white blouse with green sleeves.

loans.use: to buy capsules, vials, powders, chlorophyll and tea.

loans.name: Everlyne

texts.en:
Everlyne and her family live and work on a seven-acre farm in Kwanza, situated in the fertile Rift Valley province of Kenya. On her farm she keeps dairy cows, sheep and poultry, and grows maize. She sells her farm produce at a local market near her home.

The biggest growth constraint for Everlyne is a lack of access to capital to buy agricultural inputs necessary to increase her farm’s productivity. She lives in a part of Kenya where there are no banks, so she is seeking a 55,000 KES loan through Kiva's field partner Juhudi Kilimo. With it she will buy improved seeds, fertilizers and other important inputs such as those that control weeds and pests.

With your assistance Everlyne will be able to grow more maize and generate more income for her family.

loans.use: buy seeds, fertilizers and other important farm inputs

loans.name: Jose Alfonso

texts.es: Jose de 29 años de edad vive con su compañera de vida  y sus hijos de 11 y 4 años de edad. El habita  en casa propia pero no posee luz eléctrica, él trabaja  a diario como distruibuidor de pan frances y pan dulce  en diferentes casas que están cerca de su vivienda y con el pago que obtiene de su trabajo logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar. Santos está solicitando un crédito a FUSAI para la compra de una lámpara solar ya que con lo que ganan con su trabajo no le alcanza para poder realizarlo, la lámpara es una estación de carga con energía de paneles solares en forma de lámpara que sirve para los hogares que no cuentan con el suministro de energia electrica. Jose con el monto otorgado comprara dicha lampara y asi su familia se podrán beneficiar ya que por las noches podrán tener luz propia en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Jose is 29 years old. He lives with his wife and his children ages 11 and 4. He lives in his own home but doesn't have any electricity. He works daily as a baked french bread and pastry distributor, delivering to different houses near his home. With the payment he receives from his work he is able to support his home.

Jose is seeking a loan from FUSAI to buy a solar lamp because with what he earns from his work he doesn't have enough money to make the purchase. The lamp is a charging station with solar energy panels in the form of a lamp that serves houses that don't have electric energy. With the awarded amount Jose will buy that lamp and his family will be able to benefit because at night they will have light in their own home.

loans.use: to buy a solar light for his home.

loans.name: Benigno

texts.es: Benigno se dedica a la actividad de transporte de estudiantes. Necesita un préstamo de $2,100 para realizar mejoras a su vehículo, como cambiar llantas, mejorar la pintura y el tapizado de los asientos ya que su familia depende de los ingresos obtenidos por esta actividad.
texts.en: Benigno works in the business of transporting students. He needs a loan of $2100 to make improvements on his vehicle, such as changing tires and improving the paint and the upholstery of the seats, since his family depends on the income obtained from this work.

loans.use: to buy parts to repair his school transportation vehicle

loans.name: Evangelina

texts.es: Evangelina por tradición familiar es comerciante, actividad que le ha permitido su crecimiento personal y laboral.  Reside en una urbanización ubicada en Barranquilla donde ofrece a los vecinos del sector un variado surtido de prendas de vestir que compra en el vecino país de Venezuela y en algunos establecimientos de la ciudad. Cuenta con 29 años de experiencia y una clientela muy consolidada a quienes ofrece los productos a crédito o contado según su flujo de efectivo,  en la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, que invertirá en nuevo surtido; camisa, pantalones y blusas, para damas y caballeros.  Su meta de negocio a futuro es organizarse en un punto fijo de venta para poder exhibir a plenitud todo su surtido.  Personalmente desea realizarle adecuaciones al apartamento donde reside para mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Evangelina, by family tradition, is a businesswoman. This work has allowed her to grow personally and in her work. She lives in a development located in Barranquilla, where she offers her neighbors in the area a varied stock of articles of clothing, which she buys in the neighboring country of Venezuela and in some establishments in the city. She has 29 years of experience and a very established clientele, to whom she offers products on credit or for cash, according to her cash flow. At this time she is applying for a Kiva loan, the first financing that she has had from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, which she will invest in new stock: shirts, pants, and blouses for women and men. Her business goal for the future is to set up at a fixed sales point in order to be able to fully exhibit all her stock. [As a] personal [goal], she wants to make modifications in the apartment where she lives in order to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to invest in a new stock of shirts, pants, and blouses for women and men

loans.name: Olivia

texts.en:
Olivia is a smallholder farmer practicing dairy and horticultural farming to provide for her family. She enjoys farming, for it is her means of securing the basic necessities for life.

In the Kitale area of Kenya where she comes from, most people depend on agriculture for a living. The people there live and work on small farms: Their biggest challenge is the huge deficit in access to agricultural inputs, meaning that farmers' yields and incomes are far below what they could be.

Juhudi Kilimo partnered with Kiva to provide financial services to smallholders around Kenya. Through these financial services, farmers in Kitale now can buy productive assets and important agricultural inputs for use in their farms. 

Olivia is seeking a loan to buy farm inputs such as seeds, fertilizer, herbicides and pesticides. Your loan will enable her to improve her production through use of quality farm inputs. This intervention will help her fill the increasing demand for food in the market and, in the process, generate more income to repay the loan debt and elevate the quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Chameli

texts.en:
Chameli is a 41-year-old lady who lives with her husband and two sons in Kandi of the Murshidabad district. One of her son works in a small company and the other is unemployed. 

Chameli and her husband are engaged with a "Dashakarma" business. They run a small general store locally known as a "Dashakarma Bhandar" in their neighborhood. "Dashakarma Bhandar" is a store where especially Hindu festival things and worship items are sold like God and Goddess photos, idols, incense sticks, candles, artificial garland, utensils, etc. In festival seasons, there is a great demand for their products. But the income of the family is not sufficient to bear all the household expenses. Thus, Chameli wants to expand her business.

Thus, she applied for a loan from Kiva’s partner BJS to purchase the stock of necessary articles for her shop. She hopes this loan will give a lift to their business. 

Chameli is grateful for the financial support.

loans.use: to purchase necessary items to expand her existing "Dashakarma" store.

loans.name: Kalpana

texts.en:
Kalpana lives in a small village of Falakata. She is 56 years old and a hard-working mother of two sons. Two of her sons are involved with the vegetable business. She is a homemaker. Her husband's occupation is farming, and he works hard to meet the family needs. 

Kalpana's husband cultivates beans, gourds, cabbages, peas, and other seasonal vegetables to sustain his family. Kalpana also helps her husband with the cultivation during busy seasons. The crops he grows are sold in the market, which is their main source of income. But the income is spent in buying household requirements. He plays an important role in meeting his family's needs.

Now he wants to grow teasel gourd, which is fully a summer crop. They want to get a huge profit from the cultivation of this crop in the forthcoming summer season, and so he wants to buy the necessary farm supplies for teasel gourd. Kalpana applied for a loan from Kiva’s partner BJS. The loan money will be used to purchase necessary farm supplies like good quality seeds, fertilizers, pesticides, etc., for teasel gourd cultivation. 

She and her husband are thankful to her lenders.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural inputs for teasel gourd cultivation.

loans.name: Ana Cecilia

texts.es: Ana de 34 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus padres, ella posee una tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia desde hace 5 años tiene muchos clientes por la variedad de productos que comercializa y con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de sodas, granos básicos, lácteos, huevos, etc. todo por mayor para continuar con sus ventas ya que esa es su única fuente de ingresos.
texts.en:
Ana, 34, lives in her own home with her parents. She's had a shop located in her house for 5 years. She has many clients for the variety of products she sells, and with her profits she strives to solve some of her household needs.

She requests this loan to buy soda, basic grains, dairy, eggs, etc, all wholesale, in order to continue her sales since it's her only source of income.

loans.use: to buy soda, basic grains, dairy, eggs, etc wholesale.

loans.name: Lida Luz

texts.es: Lida Luz de 55 años, es una microempresaria madre de cuatro hijos mayores de edad, que vive en un barrio del municipio de Barranquilla y se encuentra dedicada al comercio de distintos productos de consumo masivo y artículos de cuidado personal.  Ella inicio esta actividad al pasar por una difícil situación familiar cuando su cónyuge falleció,  pese a su dolor era consiente que necesitaba generar recursos para su sostenimiento, así que decidió ofrecer yogurt, suero y pasteles a sus conocidos y amigos,  así mismo también propone artículos de tocador como lociones corporales, perfumes y demás.  Su entrega y dedicación han permitido tener éxito en su negocio y actualmente está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para invertir en yogurt, suero, pasteles y perfumes. Con esta inversión pretende incrementar sus ingresos. Su meta a futuro es comprar una casa y ampliar el surtido de productos.
texts.en: Lida Luz, who is 55 years old, is a micro-entrepreneur, the mother of four adult children, who lives in a neighborhood of the city of Barranquilla. She works in commercializing different mass consumer products and articles for personal care. She began this business while going through a difficult family situation when her husband died. In spite of her grief, she was aware that she needed to generate resources for her support. Thus she decided to offer yogurt, suero [similar to sour cream], and cakes to her acquaintances and friends. At the same time, she also offered toiletries such as body lotions, perfumes, and other items. Her commitment and dedication have allowed her to have success in her business, and now she is applying for a Kiva loan, the first financing that she has had from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, to invest in yogurt, suero, cakes, and perfumes. With this investment, she expects to increase her income. Her goal for the future is to buy a house and expand her stock of products.

loans.use: to invest in yogurt, sour cream, cakes, and perfumes to sell.

loans.name: Dipti

texts.en:
Thirty-four-year old Dipti is a married woman and a mother of three daughters. Two of them read in school, and the smaller one is a preschooler. She lives with her family in a remote village of Falakata.  

Dipti's husband is a farmer who has agricultural land where he grows different types of crops and vegetables. He has grown good quality crops for many years. He has good customers due to his moral character and behavior, and he sells good quality crops at a cheaper price compared to other sellers — that's why his customers like him. Dipti, though a housewife, helps her husband in his agricultural activities. 

Now they want to cultivate paddy (rice) because the climate and soil are perfectly suitable for paddy cultivation. 

Dipti applied for a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase seeds and fertilizers for good quality paddy cultivation so that they can satisfy their valued customers. This will enable them to generate more income and better profits for improving the living standard of their family.

Her full thanks go to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs for paddy cultivation.

loans.name: Suchanda

texts.en:
Twenty-four-year-old Suchanda lives in the village named Dalimpur of Falakata with her husband, Bikram, and one toddler daughter. She studied up to grade 11. 

Suchanda and her husband run a fast food stall in their locality. They mainly sell chow mein, eggrolls, fish fry, etc., in their shop. These snacks are very popular among the people of their locality. Though a housewife, Suchanda looks after the family, and after managing all the household work, she assists her husband in making these fast foods. Her husband sells these items from his stall to their neighbors and the local area people. 

Suchanda knows that this business will produce sufficient revenue, but for continued operation she needs some capital. So she requested a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase necessary ingredients like raw noodles, gram flour, eggs, oil, vegetables, spices, sauce, and different necessary resources so that she can fulfill her customers' needs. 

She dreams of enhancing the business so that the increased profit generated by the business will help them to open a restaurant in the near future.

Suchanda is grateful to her lenders.

loans.use: to purchase necessary ingredients for the fast food selling business.

loans.name: Firoza

texts.en:
Firoza is a very energetic young woman of 28 years from Falakata. She completed secondary grade education. Due to a lack of economic resources of her parent, she was not able to pursue further education. She is now married with Janab. They have two sons. One is studying in grade 4 and another is below school-going age.  

Firoza's husband, Janab, has a grocery shop. After finishing the household work, Firoza helps her husband in his business. The couple sells food products and grocery items in her shop such as rice, sugar, oil, eggs, bread, biscuits, detergent, soap, shampoo, etc. 

As Firoza is a hard-working, responsible woman with a great desire for her family's success, she aims to extend her business to obtain better income. Thus, she applied for a loan from Kiva’s partner BJS. The purpose for her loan amount is to purchase more variety of grocery items for giving financial sustenance to her family.

Firoza is thankful to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase more necessary grocery items for her existing grocery store.

loans.name: Camilo Andres

texts.es:
Camilo es un hombre con 35 años de edad, trabajador y humilde, dedicado a la preparación y venta de comida, un negocio que monto en la sala de la casa donde reside, con esto ha tenido un gran progreso, de allí se generan los ingresos suficientes para cubrir las necesidades de su hogar.

Solicita un crédito el cual lo invertirá en la compra de un carro de comidas, carpa, estantería, enfriador y demás implementos que sean de su utilidad. Con el fin de que sus aumentar sus clientes e incrementar sus ganancias.

Desea seguir trabajando para cumplir el sueño de comprar una vivienda propia, con la esperanza de que sus necesidades sean mínimas.

Con su apoyo este hombre podrá continuar su sueño, anímese y haga un préstamo.
texts.en:
Camilo is a 35 year old man, hardworking and humble. He works preparing and selling food from the living room of the house he resides in. He has been successful at this and generates enough income to cover his household needs.

He is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of a food cart, a tarp, racks, a cooler and other useful items, with the purpose of growing his clientele and increase his earnings.

He wants to continue working to reach his dream of buying his own house, with the hopes that his needs will be at minimum.

With your support, this man will be able to continue his dream. Take heart and make a loan.

loans.use: purchase a food cart, a tarp, racks, a cooler and other useful items.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
From the Ntaigo Self-Help Group, Mercy is a loving mum to two angelic-looking children and has been farming for the past thirteen years. On her farm she has pigs, chickens and a field of maize. (She also has some small businesses that help her make ends meet.) Mercy is very passionate about farming and loves cultivating her farm. That is why every day she wakes up very early to go to her farm to plow.

There is a high demand for cereals in Kenya's Nkubu region. Although she profits from her farm, Mercy has always wanted to increase her income by selling cereals. For a smallholder farmer like Mercy, though, getting a loan to start her venture has been a challenge.

Fortunately, Juhudi Kilimo is partnering with Kiva lenders to help aspiring women farmers like her turn their dreams into reality through training and loan financing. Through these two entities Mercy is seeking a 100,000 KES loan to buy cereals to start her business. She believes that the extra income she will earn will mean a permanent change in her life for the better. Mercy’s increase in profits will allow her to repay this loan and secure the future of her school-going children.

Understandably, Mercy praises Juhudi Kilimo’s efforts to transform the lives of farmers like her. Now all that Mercy awaits is your kindness.

loans.use: to buy cereals for resale

loans.name: Sabita

texts.en:
Sabita, a 28-year-old woman, stays in a small village called Harinathpur at Falakata, in the Alipuduar district of West Bengal. She lives with her husband and three children (two sons and one daughter). They are studying in grade 8, 4 and 3, respectively. Sabita takes care of her livestock and her husband is engaged in carpentry work. 

Sabita has a cow in her herd and sells milk to the villagers. Her husband’s income is quite inadequate for the family, so Sabita devotes her full time to her small milk selling business to support her family financially. Because of the growing expenses of her family, it has become necessary for her to increase the family income, and so she wants to expand her business by buying a new dairy cow. For this reason, Sabita seeks a loan from Kiva's partner BJS.

She will use the loan money to buy a dairy cow so that she can sell more milk and cow dung, as well, which is very in demand in rural areas as fuel. This investment will support her to earn more for strengthening her family economy and to save money for the better education of her children.

She thanks her lenders.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow for her milk selling business.

loans.name: Nasanairi

texts.en:
Nasanairi is a 51-year-old married man with eight children, seven of whom attend school in Kasese, Uganda. 

He is a teacher by profession, and a catechist, who has been in service for fifteen years. Nasanairi also gets additional income from a textile shop and from farming. 

He began teaching to generate income to educate his children, and Nasanairi is requesting the loan to pay school fees for them. He has a dream of educating his children, however he faces a challenge of low and delayed salary payments.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is married and has six children. She is a smallholder farmer practicing dairy, poultry, horticulture and tree farming to provide for her family. She enjoys what she does, and it is her means of securing the basic necessities of life.

In the Kitale area of Kenya where she comes from, most people depend on agriculture for a living. The people there live and work on small farms. Their biggest challenge, however, is the huge lack of access to agricultural inputs, meaning that farmers' yields and incomes are far below what they could be. Juhudi Kilimo, though, has partnered with Kiva to provide financial services to smallholders around Kenya so that farmers in Kitale can now buy vital inputs for use on their farms.

Rose is seeking a 30,000 KES loan to buy quality seed, fertilizer, herbicides and pesticides to improve her farm’s productivity. This will help her fill the increasing demand for food in the market and, in the process, give her income to repay her loan and elevate her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy quality seed, fertilizer, herbicides and pesticides to improve her farm’s productivity.

loans.name: Mendoza Group

texts.es:
Para acceder a la comunidad de donde es originario el grupo Mendoza se debe recorrer un camino de terracería por aproximadamente dos horas. Por tal motivo los habitantes, si no cuentan con algún medio de transporte, tienen que solicitar un taxi o pedir que algún vecino los lleve. La mayor parte de la población se dedica a trabajar el campo debido a la riqueza del suelo.
   Loe integrantes son: Guadalupe quien vende caña, maíz, frijol y chile; José Luis, carne; José y José Ambrosio, caña de azúcar y Claudio quien se dedica a la ganadería y siembra de caña.
   Don Claudio es un hombre de tradiciones muy arraigadas siempre se le puede ver vestido de botas, camisa a cuadros y sombrero ya que según comenta es característico de su familia. Está casado con doña Eudocia, y es padre de 2 hijos a quienes logró ofrecer estudios profesionales gracias a las ganancias obtenidas en la producción de caña de azúcar y la venta de ganado. “Dedicarse a la producción de caña de azúcar es una actividad que ha prevalecido en mi familia durante  muchas generaciones; cada uno aprende de su padre el trabajo y amor por la tierra que nos da de comer” comenta satisfecho.
   Gracias a préstamos anteriores ha podido comprar fertilizante y abono que necesita para el crecimiento adecuado de la caña de azúcar. En esta ocasión el préstamo lo invertirá de nuevo en abono y  un fertilizante especial que no maltrata el pasto con el que se alimenta el ganado. Para Claudio es de suma importancia que sus hijos muestren interés por el campo y continúen con la herencia familiar cuando él ya no esté presente. Añade orgulloso que, “he vivido del campo y en la actualidad me sigue sosteniendo por eso estoy firme y en pie de lucha para hacer valer el trabajo en el campo”.
   El grupo Mendoza agradece la confianza de las personas que ha hecho posible el otorgamiento de créditos.  
*Ellos son los integrantes del grupo, don Claudio es quien viste camisa a cuadros color beige.
texts.en:
The community from which the Mendoza group originates can only be accessed by traveling along a dirt road for about two hours. For this reason, if the inhabitants do not have a method of transportation, they must request a taxi or ask a neighbor to take them. The majority of the population works in the fields due to the richness of the soil.

The group members are: Guadalupe, who sells sugar, corn, beans, and chili peppers; José Luis, who sells meat; José and José Ambrosio, who sell sugar cane; and Claudio, who raises livestock and grows sugar cane.

Claudio is a man of very rooted traditions. He can always be seen wearing boots, a checkered shirt, and hat, which he mentions is characteristic of his family. He is married to Eudocia and is the father of two children. He was able to offer professional education to his children thanks to the income he earned through sugar cane production and livestock sales.

“Sugar cane production is a profession that has been in my family for many generations. Each one of us learns from his father this work and love of the earth that provides us with food,” he says with satisfaction.

Thanks to previous loans, Claudio was able to buy the fertilizer and manure that he needs to sufficiently grow the sugar cane. With this current loan, he will invest again in manure and fertilizer which do not harm the pastures that the livestock eat. For Claudio, it is of great importance that his children show interest in farming and continue the family legacy once he is no longer around. He proudly adds, “I have grown out of the countryside, and it continues to support me. For this reason, I am determined and will bring worth to the work of the fields.”

The Mendoza group is thankful for the trust of the people who make it possible for these loans to be granted.

loans.use: to buy special manure and fertilizer which do not damage the pastures that the livestock consume.

loans.name: Babli

texts.en:
Thirty-seven-year-old Babli lives in a small village of Falakata. She is married and the mother of three children (two sons and one daughter). All of her children are attaining education in the local village school. Both Babli and her husband, Gosai, studied up to 5th grade, and after that, could not continue due to financial issues in their families.  

Babli is a homemaker, and her husband has a business of making and selling Ayurvedic medicines (medicine made from herbs). He gets the materials for making herbal medicine from the wholesale medicine market. He prepares the medicine with the assistance of Babli. Mainly he sells medicines that cure dental problems. Her husband sells these medicines to the people in their locality. There is a great demand for his Ayurveda medicine among the local people. With the growing increase in essential goods, they want to expand their business. But they do not have sufficient capital to invest in their business.

Babli has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner BJS to purchase necessary materials and herbs. She hopes it will help her husband to make more medicine to serve more customers. She hopes to provide better education to her children, who are her major priority. 

Babli sincerely thanks BJS and Kiva for their kind support.

loans.use: to purchase more Ayurveda medicine for the business.

loans.name: Mukarrama

texts.en:
Mukarrama is a married woman with a heart of peace. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan, in a family of workers, and  lives in a small town with her family. 

She is a business woman, and retails clothes for women and children. Mukarrama rents space at the center of a domestic market. She is a responsible, talkative, cheerful, and honest person. 

Mukarrama is sick, and needs to get treatment at a medical clinic. She is asking for a loan from KIVA and IMON to pay for her treatment. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to get treatment at a medical clinic

loans.name: Ujjbala

texts.en:
Ujjbala is a married woman of 46 years of age. She is illiterate but only can sign her name. She lives with her husband, Shrinanda, in a small village of Falakata with two daughters who have gotten married. 

Ujjbala’s husband has been engaged in agriculture for many years. He cultivates different crops and sells the gathered harvest in the local markets. Now they are thinking of cultivating a crop which is profitable and in demand all season. So they have decided to grow paddy (rice) on their farmland.
