Because of having inadequate capital, they have decided to take some financial help for cultivation. Thus, Ujjbala has applied for a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner). 

Ujjbala will use the loan amount to purchase good quality fertilizer and seeds for paddy cultivation. The loan will greatly help this family to organize a good harvest, which will be lucrative as the crop has a tremendous demand in the market. She dreams to expand their agribusiness by purchasing a small piece of land in the future.

She thanks her lenders.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and other necessary farm supplies for paddy cultivation.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is a 55-year-old married man with 11 children, three of whom attend school.  He lives in Kasese Uganda. 

Julius has been operating a retail shop, selling general merchandise, for 20 years. He gets supplementary income from crop farming. 

He has a dream of expanding his business into wholesale, however Julius is limited by capital. He is a hard-working, honest person, requesting a loan to buy sugar, salt, millet flour, rice, and cooking oil to sell.

loans.use: to buy sugar, salt, millet flour, rice, and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Beauty

texts.en:
Beauty is a married woman of 22 years old. She is a graduate woman. She lives with her husband, Jagadish, in their own small mud house in a small village of Falakata. 

Beauty’s husband has been engaged in agriculture for many years. He cultivates different crops and sells the gathered harvest in the local markets. Now they are thinking of cultivating a crop that is profitable and that is a round-the-year crop. So they have decided to grow paddy on their farmland, but they do not have adequate capital to invest in their business, so they have decided to take some financial help for cultivation.

Beauty has applied for a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) and the requested loan is very important for Beauty to be able to purchase fertilizers, seeds and other required farm supplies for paddy cultivation. The loan will greatly help this family to organize cultivation work, and they hope for a good harvest. They hope it will be a lucrative business as the crop has a tremendous demand in the market. She dreams to expand their agribusiness.

She is thankful to her lenders for their help.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers for paddy cultivation.

loans.name: Grecia Group

texts.es:
Para cierta comunidad veracruzana ubicada en los límites de la carretera federal la agricultura y ganadería son la fuente principal de empleo para los lugareños.  Ellos consideran a la tierra con amor pues es un símbolo de gratitud por ser muy productiva. Ahí 8 personas se reunieron para integrar el grupo que lleva por nombre Grecia debido al cariño que sienten por la hija de una integrante quien se llama así.  Todos los miembros son: Noelia, María y Marcela quienes venden antojitos; Maribel, abarrotes; Agustina, artículos de papelería; Genny, ropa; Esmeralda, zapatos y Marcos, pollos.
   Doña Agustina es madre de 3 jóvenes y, junto con su esposo Rafael, está comprometida a generar los ingresos necesarios para mejorar su calidad de vida. En su comunidad conocen a la pareja como Tina y Fallo,  desde hace 13 años inició con la venta de dulces en el exterior de su hogar; “siempre me ha gustado vender, recuerdo que desde pequeña vendía  fruta y verduras de temporada, toda mi familia ha sido  comerciante, creo que lo traemos en la sangre” comenta sonriendo. Sin embargo cuando a alguno de sus hijos les hacía falta un lápiz, goma, cuaderno, lapicero, goma o sacapuntas, etc. tenía que trasladarse hasta el centro de la comunidad para comprarlo por lo que decidió implementar artículos de  papelería para complementar sus ganancias. Trascurrido el tiempo la papelería creció, y hoy en día ofrece un amplia variedad de productos a sus clientes  además de ofrecer el útil servicio de fotocopiado. 
   El préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de tóner, hojas blancas tamaño carta, oficio y doble carta, lapiceros, lápices, colores, cartulinas, cuadernos y libretas. Tina comenta que “la gratitud es el mejor de los regalos y por eso que agradecemos por la oportunidad que nos otorgan con el préstamo”. Este es el primer ciclo para el grupo Grecia y se compromenten a cumplir muchos más en beneficio de sus negocios.
*La fotografía fue tomada en el patio de Doña Noelia, doña Tina es quien viste playera verde.
texts.en:
For a certain Veracruz community located on the edge of the federal highway, agriculture and animal husbandry are the main source of employment for the locals. They regard the land with love because it is a symbol of gratitude for it to be so highly productive. There 8 people gathered in order to join the group that bears the name Grecia, due to the affection they feel for a member's daughter, who is so called. All the members are Noelia, María and Marcela who sell snacks, grocer Maribel, stationary-seller Augustina, clothing-seller Genny, shoe-seller Esmeralda, and chicken-seller Marcos.

Doña Agustina is the mother of 3 youths, and together with her husband Rafael is committed to generating the income necessary in order to improve her quality of life. In her community the couple is known as Tina and Fallo.

Thirteen years ago she began the sale of sweets outside her home. "I have always liked to sell, I remember that since childhood I would sell fruits and vegetables in season, all my family had been merchants, I think that we have it in our blood," she says smiling. 

However, when some of her children needed a pencil, eraser, notebook, pen, or sharpener, etc... she had to travel to downtown in order to buy it. So she decided to open an office supply store to supplement their earnings. Time passed, the office supply store grew, and today it offers a wide variety of products to her customers in addition to offering a helpful photocopying service.

The loan will be invested in the purchase of toner, white letter-sized paper, office and ledger paper, pens, pencils, crayons, construction paper, notebooks and notepads. Tina says that "gratitude is the best gift and this is why we give thanks for the opportunity that they have given us with the loan." This is the Grecia group's first financing round and they commit to fulfill many more to benefit their businesses.

The photograph was taken in Doña Noelia's backyard. Doña Tina is the one wearing a green shirt.

loans.use: to purchase toner, white letter-sized paper, office and ledger paper, pens, pencils, crayons, construction paper, notebooks and notepads.

loans.name: Tina

texts.en:
Twenty-eight-year-old Tina is an energetic woman who not only manages her household responsibilities successfully but also creates a strong platform for the well-being of her family. Tina lives in the small village of Falakata with her husband and two children (a son and a daughter). They are studying in grades 10 and 4, respectively.

Tina’s husband Tapan is engaged in a vegetable business. His income is insufficient to manage their household needs. Therefore, Tina decided to help her husband financially and started her business selling varieties of clothing. She runs her business from her house. She buys different varieties of clothing like saris, salwar, frocks, etc. from the wholesale market and sells in her area. Her neighbors, relatives and friends are her main customers. Now she wants to expand her business. Thus, she applied for a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner).

She will use the loan to buy more clothing to increase her stock collection for her business. She hopes it will enable her to earn more profit for her family’s well-being. With the profit, she dreams to build a concrete house for them in future.

She is grateful to her lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more stock for her clothing business.

loans.name: Sarubala

texts.en:
Sarubala is a married woman of 38 years. She is illiterate and can only sign her name. She lives with her husband Sharat, and two school-going daughters in their own small house in a small village of Falakata, West Bengal, India. Her daughters read in the local village school.

Sarubala's husband is a farmer; he is a hard worker and very enterprising man. He works on their small piece of land from dawn to dusk to grow a variety of crops according to the seasonal demand. He sells them in the local market and earns money for their livelihood. Sarubala also helps her husband after managing her household work. Now they decided to grow paddy in their land, as it is a very beneficial crop and also in great demand. Being a staple food of West Bengal, paddy cultivation will be very profitable for them.

Thus, Sarubala requests a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase good quality seeds, fertilizers, manure and other necessary farm supplies etc., so that they can grow good quality paddy in their land. Sarubala's dream is to expand their business to give good financial support to her family and a better life to their children.

She is thankful to BJS and Kiva for the loan.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizers and other necessary farm supplies for growing paddies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy seeds and start banana farming

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita is a 50-year-old woman who lost her husband a few years back. She is a mother of three children (two sons and one daughter). Her daughter is married. Now she lives with her two sons in a small village in Falakata. Since her husband’s death, her sons have been engaged in cultivation, which is the only source of income for their family.

They have agricultural land where they cultivate different kinds of crops and vegetables. They work on their small piece of land from dawn to dusk to grow a variety of crops according to the seasonal demand and sell them in the local market to earn their livelihood. Rita also helps her sons in their work after managing her domestic activities.

Now they decided to grow paddy on their land, as it is a very beneficial crop, is in great demand in the various markets and is full of various nutrition. Thus, Rita requests a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner).

She will use the loan money to purchase good quality paddy seeds, fertilizers, manure etc., so that they can grow good quality paddy on their land. Rita's hopes and dreams are to expand their business to give good financial support to her family, give a better life to their son and build a concrete house in the future from the profit generated from the business.

She is thankful to BJS and Kiva for the loan.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies for growing paddies.

loans.name: Rina

texts.en:
Rina is a young woman of 21 years. She is a housewife and a mother of a kid son. She is very energetic, hardworking and optimistic. Her husband does cultivation on their own land. They live in Falakata in West Bengal.

Rina's husband is the only earning member for the family and he always strives for the betterment of his family. Rina, though a housewife, helps her husband in his agricultural activities. They mainly cultivate seasonal vegetables and crops and sell them in the local market. But the income is hardly enough for them to run the family in a decent way. They thought to expand their business. So they want to cultivate jute, which is a profitable crop, but they cannot fulfill their dream due to the lack of capital.

Thus, Rina has applied for a loan from BJS to purchase jute seeds and other necessary farm supplies for jute cultivation. She hopes it will be a lucrative business and will provide them more profit to give her family a financial stability.

She is grateful to Kiva and BJS for this financial support.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, manure, fertilizers and necessary farm supplies for jute cultivation.

loans.name: Jhumur

texts.en:
Jhumur is a 27-year-old enterprising lady from Parengerpar village in Falakata in West Bengal. Her husband works as a laborer on a daily wages basis. His income is inconsistent and low. Jhumur is a mother of two children (one son and daughter). Her children read in grade four and one, respectively.

Jhumur rears cows to supplement her husband’s income and to provide a smooth education to her children. She sells milk in her neighborhood. There is a good demand for cow milk in her area; this is why she has chosen this business. For additional income, she also sells cattle byproducts like cow dung to her customers.

Now Jhumur needs to expand her business, as the household cost as well as the education of her children is gradually increasing. To cope with the situation, she plans to buy one more cow for her business.

Thus, she is asking for a loan from BJS, a Kiva partner. She feels that this will add some extra profit to her present income as well as satisfy her customers' demand.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow for the expansion of her dairy business.

loans.name: Radha

texts.en:
Twenty-nine-year-old Radha is a married woman and the mother of a daughter. Her daughter is a student in grade eight. She lives with her husband and daughter in a remote village in Falakata.

Radha's husband is a farmer who has agricultural land where he grows different types of crops and vegetables. He grows good quality crops as he has many years of experience in this line. He sells good quality crops at a cheaper price compared to other sellers and that's why his customers greatly demand his crops. Radha, though a housewife, helps her husband in his agricultural activities. Now they want to cultivate paddy because the climate and soil are perfectly suitable for paddy cultivation.

Radha applied for a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies to grow good quality paddy so that their products will be the best quality, and therefore they can satisfy their valued customers. This will enable them to generate more income and better profits so that they can improve the quality of life of their family.

Her full thanks go to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs for paddy cultivation.

loans.name: Dinah

texts.en:
Dinah is a single woman with four kids, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Dinah operates a vegetable-selling stall. She sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of the high cost of transportation to her place of operation.

With the Kes 20,000, she wants to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale.

loans.name: Abraham

texts.en:
Abraham is a rural smallholder crop farmer from the Kapsowar area of Kenya. Besides maize/corn farming, Abraham also does dairy farming for extra food and income. The key lessons he has taken away from years of being in crop farming are predicting weather patterns and applying quality farm inputs for maximum yields.

Abraham is seeking a loan to buy agricultural inputs. With the borrowed money, he plans to buy improved seeds and fertilizer to enhance his farm’s productivity.

With your loan, having quality agricultural inputs will increase Abraham’s chances for a successful harvest.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita is a married woman of 28 years. She lives with her husband and two daughters in a small village in Falakata. She received an education up to grade nine. Her one daughter is reading in grade five and the other is too small to go to school.

Rita’s husband has been engaged in agriculture for many years. He cultivates different crops and sells the gathered harvest in the local markets. After managing all household work, Rita assists her husband in his agricultural works. Now they are thinking of cultivating a crop that is profitable and in demand in all seasons. So they have decided to grow paddy on their farmland. Because they have inadequate capital, they need some financial help. So Rita has applied for a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner).

The requested loan amount will help Rita to purchase fertilizer, seeds and other farm resources for paddy cultivation. They hope it will be a lucrative business as the crop has a tremendous demand in the market. It will greatly help this family to generate more income for the rest of the year. She dreams of purchasing more farmland in the future to expand their agribusiness.

She thanks her lenders.

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizers and other farm resources for paddy cultivation.

loans.name: Anima

texts.en:
Anima is a 28-year-old lady living with her husband and two sons in Falakata in the Alipurduar district, West Bengal. One of her sons reads in grade one and the other one is a toddler. Her husband is a driver by profession.

To supplement her husband’s inconsistent income, Anima runs a grocery shop where she sells essential commodities of everyday needs like rice, oil, salt, sugar, flour, biscuits, eggs, etc. Anima runs this shop after managing her household works.

Besides aspiring to provide a good education to her children, Anima also hopes to save enough for better living conditions. To that end, they work very hard and save a little from their earnings. To generate more income and to cover all the costs of a four-member family smoothly, Anima wants to expand her business by adding more items in her inventory to sell. To stock and store this inventory, she needs financial help. So she requested a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner).

With the expansion of her stock of grocery items, her income will also increase substantially. She wants to use the additional income to admit their children into renowned schools to make them well-educated. She will also have the option of reinvesting these savings in her business for further growth.

She thanks her lenders.

loans.use: to increase her stock of grocery items for her grocery store.

loans.name: Rosa Virginia

texts.es: Rosa tiene 50 años de edad, es madre soltera y habita en casa propia al lado de sus dos nietos. Rosa es una mujer emprendedora que siempre ha luchado para seguir adelante y brindar a su familia lo necesario dentro del hogar, ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de tamales de gallina  y de pan dulce como la quesadilla en su casa de habitación las cuales distribuye con los vecinos y personas que viven a los alrededores de su comunidad. Rosa hace un tiempo comenzó con la construcción de unas paredes en su casa pero debido a la situación económica no logro terminar la construcción es por ello que ha decidido adquirir un crédito en FUSAI para  comprar:   ladrillo, arena y cemento para terminar la construcción de las paredes de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Rose is 50 years old, a single mother and lives in her own house next door to her two grandchildren. Rosa is an entrepreneurial woman that always has fought in order to get ahead and to give her family what it needs at home.

She makes a living preparing and selling sweet-dough and chicken tamales in her house which she distributes to the neighbors and people who live in the surrounding community.

Rosa began the construction of some walls in her home but due to the economic situation, she has not manage to finish the construction, which is why she has decided to obtain a loan from FUSAI in order to buy bricks, sand and cement to finish the construction of her house's walls.

loans.use: to buy bricks, sand and cement to finish the construction of her house's walls.

loans.name: Adriana Maria

texts.es:
Adriana es una mujer con 33 años de edad, que con su tenacidad y pujanza logro consolidar su propio negocio, una heladería, un medio por el cual ha logrado salir adelante con su hijo de 10 años.

Debido a que no cuenta con mucho surtido, Adriana solicita un préstamo para la compra de helado al por mayor y desechables como vasos y cucharas.
Con esto espera un gran cambio en su negocio, que la gente la busque por calidad, economía y buen servicio.

Su sueño es ver la casa donde reside en buen estado, ya que su amerita de muchos arreglos.

Ayude a esta mujer con trabajadora y con ganas de salir adelante, preste hoy.
texts.en:
Adriana is a 33 year old woman, that with her tenacity and strength managed to build her own business, an ice cream parlor, a means by which she has managed to get ahead with her 10 year old son.

Since it does not have much variety, Adriana requests a loan in order to buy ice cream wholesale and disposables such as cups and spoons. With this she hopes to greatly change her business, as the people look for quality, affordability and good service.

Her dream is to see her house in good condition, since it warrants many repairs.

Help this hardworking woman, eager to get ahead. Lend today.

loans.use: to buy ice cream wholesale and disposables such as cups and spoons.

loans.name: John Jairo

texts.es:
Jairo es un joven campesino, actualmente se dedica a la cría y posteriormente a la venta de terneros, un medio por el cual ha logrado salir adelante con su familia conformada por sus padres y un hermano.
Su dedicación es de todos los días durante 6 horas.

Solicita un crédito el cual lo invertirá en la compra de seis terneros de levante, y cuido de engorde, con esto espera aumentar sus ventas y dejar a  sus clientes satisfechos.

Su sueño es tener su casa bonita, brindarle una mejor estabilidad económica a su familia y una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Jairo is a young farmer. Currently, he makes a living raising and then selling calves, a means by which he has managed to get ahead with his family, which consists of his parents and a brother. His work is 6 hours every day.

He requests a loan which he will invest in purchasing six calves for raising and fattening. With this he expects to increase his sales and leave his customers satisfied.

His dream is to have a beautiful house and to provide his family with better financial stability and a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase six calves for raising and fattening.

loans.name: Plamedi Group

texts.fr: Buhendwa est commerçante, vice-présidente de la banque communautaire «Plamedi», cliente de l’IMF Hekima, mariée, âgée de 46 ans, mère des 9 enfants tous scolarisés. Elle est vendeuse des denrées alimentaires dans un marché secondaire de la ville depuis 13 ans. Elle va s’approvisionner en un sac farine de manioc et un de maïs. Son conjoint est un aide maçon  qui l’avait aidé pour commencer son activité. Elle souhaite scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au final, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en: Buhendwa is a shopkeeper, the vice-president of the Plamedi community bank and a client of IMF Hekima. She is a 46-year-old married mother to nine children, all of whom are receiving an education. She has been selling foodstuffs at a town market for 13 years. She wants to purchase a sack of cassava flour and a sack of corn flour. Her husband works as a bricklayer's assistant. He was the one who helped her start her business. Buhendwa hopes to be able to offer her children an education and keep them well fed. Finally, she would like to thank Hekima for the support they give to entrepreneurs excluded from the traditional banking system.

loans.use: to purchase a sack of cassava flour and a sack of corn flour

loans.name: Blanca De Jesus

texts.es: Blanca de 44 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida y su hija, ella posee una tienda desde hace 5 años su negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia y tiene muchos clientes especialmente sus vecinos, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de granos básicos, productos lácteos, huevos, sodas, pan dulce etc. y así poder tener mejores ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Blanca, 44 years old, lives in her own house with her life partner and her daughter. She has owned a store for five years. Her business is located in her residence and has many customers especially her neighbors. With that which she obtains from her sales, she manages to overcome some household expenses. 

She is requesting a loan in order to purchase basic grains, dairy products, eggs, sodas, desert bread, etc... and so as to be able to improve her economic returns.

loans.use: to purchase basic grains, dairy products, eggs, sodas, desert bread, etc...

loans.name: William De Jesus

texts.es:
William es un señor de 41 años de edad, que desde hace tiempo monto su propio negocio, un Café Bar, con esto ha tenido un gran progreso, pues sus clientes siempre lo buscan por calidad, economía y buen servicio.
Trabaja 5 días a la semana durante 12 horas.

Actualmente William no cuenta con mucho espacio, desea ampliar su negocio, es por esto que solicita un crédito, con el fin de remodelar el segundo piso de su local y la compra de enseres.

Su meta  es seguir trabajando para mejorar las condiciones de su casa y pagarle la educación a su pequeño de 8 años.
texts.en:
William is a 41-year-old man, who has been running his own business, a cafe/bar, for some time. With this he has made good progress. His customers always come to him for the quality, reasonable prices, and good service.

He works 5 days a week for 12 hours per day.

At the moment William does not have much space. He wants to extend his business. This is why he is requesting a loan, with which he will redesign the second floor of his bar and buy furnishing.

His goal is to keep working to improve the condition of his house and to pay for the education of his his little one, who is 8 years old.

loans.use: to redesign the second floor of his bar and to buy furnishing.

loans.name: Fredy Alberto

texts.es:
Fredy tiene una carnicería con la cual intenta obtener los recursos necesarios para el sustento de su familia compuesta por su esposa y tres hijos.

Lleva en el negocio aproximadamente 2 años y se siente muy contento con él.

Solicita un préstamo para la compra de ganado y un molino industrial de carne, esto le permitirá tener un mejor inventario y podrá trabajar de una manera más eficiente, ofreciendo siempre la mejor calidad y servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Fredy owns a butcher's shop to earn the income needed to support his family, consisting of his wife and his three children.

He has been running the business for about 2 years and is very happy with it.

He is requesting a loan to buy livestock and an industrial meat grinder. This will allow him to have a better stock and to work in a more efficient way. He always offers his customers the best quality and service.

loans.use: to buy livestock and an industrial meat grinder for his butcher's shop.

loans.name: Faida Group

texts.fr: Kalivanda est commerçante, présidente du groupe de crédits «Faida», cliente de l’IMF Hekima, veuve, âgée de 38 ans, mère des trois enfants qui vont tous à l’école. Elle est vendeuse des tapis, nappes et des tricots bébés dans un marché du centre commercial depuis 13 ans. Elle va acheter les fils et autres matériels de tricotage. Elle souhaite trouver un bon emplacement pour faire son travail, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au final, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en: Kalivanda is a shopkeeper, the president of the Faida credit group and a client of IMF Hekima. She is a 38-year-old widowed mother to three children, all of whom are receiving an education. She has been selling rugs, tablecloths and baby knitwear at market for 13 years. She wants to purchase yarn and other knitting materials. Kalivanda hopes to find a good location from which to run her business and to be able to offer her children an education and keep them well fed. Finally, she would like to thank Hekima for the support they give to entrepreneurs excluded from the traditional banking system.

loans.use: to purchase yarn and other knitting materials

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: Juan  tiene la edad de 51 años, está casado y vive con 4 hijos y la esposa actualmente. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de almacigo y abono y dar asistencia a una plantación de café. El desea darle el adecuado mantenimiento al cultivo para que este le permita tener una mayor producción y así tener mayores ingresos económicos. El espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productor. Es el segundo préstamo que recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado los  préstamos con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Juan is 51 years old. He is married and lives with 4 children and his current wife. He wants the loan in order to purchase seedbeds and fertilizer, and to provide financial assistance for a coffee plantation. He wants to provide the crop with proper maintenance, thus letting him have increased production and higher economic returns. He hopes in the future to provide his family with a better quality of life and improved financial stability, and to be able to continue to grow as a person and as a producer.

This is the second loan that he has received from FUDECOSUR. He has not had other state-bank loans before, but FUDECOSUR has provided him loans with better facilities and much lower interest rates.

loans.use: to purchase seedbeds and supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase palm oil

loans.name: Marianela

texts.es: Marianela tiene la edad de 26 años, está casada y vive con el esposo y dos hijos actualmente. Ella el crédito lo quiere para la compra de materiales para hacer un gallinero y además comprar los pollos de engorde  y el alimento para los mismos. Ella desea venderlos a los vecinos y en algunos negocios y así tener mayores ingresos económicos. Ella espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productora. Es el primer préstamo que recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Marianela is 26 years old, is married and lives with her husband and two children.  She wants a loan to buy materials to make a chicken coop and buy broiler chickens and chicken feed for them.  She wants to sell them to her neighbours and some businesses and in this way increase her income.  

She hopes to provide a better quality of life and greater economic stability for her family in the future, and to continue growing as a person and producer.  

This is the first loan she has received from FUDECOSUR.  She has not had other loans before with any banks, but FUDECOSUR has provided her with a loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy chickens and feed

location.town: Bello Oriente, Agua Buena, Coto Brus

loans.name: Macario Antonio

texts.es: Macario de 67 años de edad vive en casa propia con esposa, el posee una tiendita y una cafetería ubicada en su lugar de residencia desde hace 35 años tiene muchos clientes y con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra salir adelante, el esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de granos básicos, productos, lácteos, huevos, gaseosas, jugos, café, pan dulce, etc. para continuar con sus ventas y así poder tener mejores ingresos económicos.
texts.en: Macario is 67 years old. He lives in his own house with his wife. He owns a small convenience store and a coffee shop located in his house for the past 35 years. He has many clients, and he has been able to get ahead with earnings from these sales. He is asking for a loan to buy basic grains, products, milk products, eggs. soda drinks, juices, coffee, sweet bread, etc. to continue selling and obtain greater earnings.

loans.use: To buy basic grains, products, milk products, eggs, soda drinks, juices, coffee, sweet bread, etc.

loans.name: Asly Llisary

texts.es: Asly LLisary  tiene la edad de 25 años, está casada   y vive con el esposo   actualmente. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de unos cerdos pequeños y el concentrado para su alimentación .Ella espera poder engordarlos y venderlos con el peso ideal y  así tener mayores ingresos económicos. Ella espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo. Es el primer préstamo que recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Asly LLisary is 25 years old. She is married and lives with her husband. She is asking for a loan to buy small pigs and food concentrate to feed them. She hopes to be able to fatten them and sell them with the ideal weight, thus to be able to get greater earnings. She hopes to provide a better quality of life to her family,  and a greater economic stability and to continue growing.This is the first loan she is receiving from FUDECOSUR. She had never received loans from local banks, but FUDECOSUR has given her a loan with easier payment terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: To purchase pigs.

location.town: El Ceibo, San Vito, Coto Brus

loans.name: Glenda Elizabeth

texts.es: Glenda de 35 años de edad, vive  junto a sus padres y sus 3 hijos de 2, 8 y 16 años de edad. Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora que con mucho esfuerzo ha sacado adelante a sus hijos y brindando el apoyo con las necesidades básicas del hogar. Glenda cuenta un pequeño negocio de venta de bebidas como lo son jugos de fruta de una gran variedad de sabores al cual llegan muchas personas a comprar debido a que es una mujer muy amable con sus clientes y , además de que es el único negocio en la comunidad. Ella desea mantener su negocio por mucho tiempo es por eso que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de una mayor cantidad de cajas de jugos de fruta para su negocio con el propósito de aumentar sus ventas y sus ganancias..
texts.en: Glenda is 35 years old. She lives with her parents and her 3 children ages 2, 8, and 16 years old. She is a hard working woman who, with a lot of effort, has helped her children get ahead and has supported the basic needs of her household. Glenda works selling beverages such as fruit juices of assorted flavors. Many people stop by her shop,  because she is very kind with her clients and because it is the only business in the community. She wants to keep her business for a long time,  thus she has asked for a loan from FUSAI to buy a greater quantity of fruit juice boxes for her business, and be able to increase her sales and her earnings.

loans.use: To buy fruit juice boxes for her business.

loans.name: Celinda

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal LOS EXITOSOS.
La socia Celinda alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose al negocio de venta de ropa ,la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma continuar apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de chompas entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en: This member belongs to the community bank Los Exitosos. Celinda works alternating her daily chores with selling clothes. She has been working in this business for a long time, and it is going well thanks to the effort she puts in her business every day. She wants to continue working to continue supporting her family. She is asking for a loan to buy sweaters among other items. She is grateful for the loan and is committed to meet her installment payments.

loans.use: To buy sweaters among other items.

loans.name: Nadia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal LOS EXITOSOS.
La socia Nadia  alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose a trabajar en una empresa privada en el área de promotora de ventas en el sector salud, la socia lleva buen tiempo en su trabajo  el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su trabajo, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de una laptop.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en: This member belongs to the community bank LOS EXITOSOS. Nadia works alternating her daily activities with health sales promotions for a private company. She has been doing this job for a long time, and it is going well thanks to the effort she puts in her work. She would like to continue working in this area, to be able to continue helping her family. She is asking for a loan to buy a laptop. She is grateful for the loan and is committed to meet the installment payments.

loans.use: To buy a laptop.

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia is a smallholder farmer based in Kitale. She grows maize/corn for food and income. She also owns a grain mill (posho mill) that she uses to process customers' cereal grains into flour and generate additional income. Recently, however, the grain mill broke down. It is old and requires regular maintenance. Julia is seeking a loan to repair her machine and run it back to life. 

Your loan will help Julia to continue carrying out business and generating income for her family.

loans.use: to repair her posho mill.

loans.name: Gentrix

texts.en:
Smallholder farmers in Kenya, like Gentrix (pictured), continue to languish in poverty due to the unwilling nature of formal financial institutions to set up shops in remote areas. They say the rural population is unevenly dispersed, and the farmers make low incomes, irregularly. Supported by Kiva, Juhudi Kilimo penetrates remote regions to finance agricultural assets and farm inputs to improve productivity and profitability of rural enterprises. 

Gentrix is a 46-year-old smallholder farmer from Kitale in the Rift Valley region of Kenya. Gentrix owns a small parcel of land. On the farm, she practices mixed farming. This charming mother keeps dairy animals and grows maize and vegetables. She also has a side business sewing clothes. She has seven years of experience in farming. Gentrix is seeking a loan to buy seeds and expand her horticulture farm. She is very hard working and is determined to increase her farm's output. 

Loans for smallholder farmers with little irregular income and no solid collateral are hard to come by in Kenya. Few organizations such as Juhudi Kilimo support farmers like Gentrix. Through a group of 15 members called Bethzatha, Gentrix has access to income-generating asset loans from Juhudi Kilimo, which use the group-based savings as collateral. According to Juhudi Kilimo, horticulture represents an opportunity for reducing poverty through income generation among smallholders, whether unskilled or semi-skilled. In the past, African women used to only stay at home and look after the household. Juhudi Kilimo facilitates loans that empower smallholder farmers like Gentrix because the institution believes that women too are actively involved in various segments of the horticultural industry.

loans.use: to buy seeds and expand her horticulture farm.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is a smallholder farmer from the Rift Valley province of Kenya. Her family owns a spacious plot of land that could be very productive for crop farming if it were not for the seasonal rains and dry spells. So instead of crop farming, Monica practices dairy farming which does not  rely strongly on weather changes. She is able to earn a regular income selling milk.

Monica seeks a loan to buy poultry. By keeping both dairy cows and poultry, Monica stands to increase her income while spreading her business risks. This loan investment will help her family to get more food and income while meeting other basic needs.

loans.use: to buy poultry.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy poultry and farm implements.

loans.name: Ana Cecilia

texts.es: Ana Cecilia  tiene la edad de 43 años, está soltera   y vive sola  actualmente. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de unas vacas para doble propósito .Ella  espera poder obtener más leche y queso para vender a los negocios y vecinos y engordar las crías  y venderlos con el peso ideal y  así tener mayores ingresos económicos. Ella espera en un futuro tener  una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo. Es el primer préstamo que recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Ana Cecilia is 43 years old. She is single and lives by herself. She wants the loan to buy cows for two reasons: she hopes to get more milk and cheese to sell to larger businesses and neighbors, and to fatten their steers and sell them with the right weight and get better earnings. She hopes to have a better quality of life and more economic stability, and to continue growing. This is the first loan she has received from FUDECOSUR. She has not received previou loans from local banks, but FUDECOSUR has given her easier payment terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: To buy young steers.

location.town: El Ceibo, San Vito, Coto Brus

loans.name: Milkah

texts.en:
Milkah is a smallholder farmer from Central Kenya. She is married and has 3 children. She started farming 10 years ago to help her husband in covering the increasing needs and expenses of their family. Currently, she is practicing dairy farming but has determination to diversify her farm. 

Milkah is seeking a loan of KES 20,000 to buy poultry. This amount is enough to buy up to 40 heads of poultry. With this number of hens, Milkah will be able to sell enough poultry products to send her children to school. 

Your loan will not only help Milkah to diversify her business and offer more products to her clients, but also to enrich her family with better income and diets.

loans.use: to buy poultry.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es: María de 49 años de edad, habita en vivienda propia al lado de su hijo y su esposa los cuales tienen un hijo que es su mayor alegría.  Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora que se esfuerza por salir adelante luego de la perdida irreparable de su compañero de vida, dedicandose  a la venta de calzado para damas  en forma ambulante, negocio que le brinda los ingresos economicos para suplir algunas necesidades básicas de su hogar. Maria con el proposito de aunmentar las ventas y las ganancias de su negocio a decidido solicitar un credito a FUSAI para comprar una mayor cantidad de calzado para su negocio.
texts.en: María is 49 years old. She lives in her own house, with her son and his wife and their child, who is her greater joy. She is a hard working woman, who works to get ahead after the irreparable loss of  her life partner. She works selling ladies shoes on the street, which gives her economic income to cover some basic needs in their household. With the goal of increasing her sales and earnings in her business, Maria has asked for a loan from FUSAI to buy a greater quantity of shoes to supply her business.

loans.use: To buy footwear for her business.

loans.name: Cynthia Angelica

texts.es: Cynthia de 32 años de edad, es madre soltera quien habita en vivienda propia en compañía de sus dos hijos de 1, 9 años y una sobrina de 10 años de edad. Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora que se esfuerza mucho para sacar adelante a su familia brindándoles su apoyo para suplir las necesidades básicas del hogar gracias a que cuenta con una pequeña tienda en su casa de habitación con la que ha logrado un numeroso grupo de clientes que la visitan y la recomiendan por ser una mujer muy amable. Cynthia desea aumentar el inventario de su negocio y mejorar la variedad de productos que tiene es por eso que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: golosinas, bebidas, arroz, maíz, frijol, pan dulce, sopas instantáneas, papel higiénico, jabones, etc., para su negocio, con el motivo de generar mayores ganancias que le permitan brindar a su familia una mejor condición de vida.
texts.en: Cynthia is 32 years old. She is a single mother who lives in her own home with her two children, aged 1 and 9, and a 10 year old niece. She is a very hardworking woman who strives to get her family ahead, offering them her support to meet the basic needs of the home. She has a small store in her house and has gained a numerous group of customers who visit her store and recommend her because she is a friendly woman. Cynthia wants to increase her business' inventory and improve the variety of products that she has. That is why she is asking for a loan from FUSAI to invest in buying snacks, beverages, rice, corn, beans, sweet bread, instant soup, toilet paper, soap, etc., for her business. This is to generate more profits which will allow her to offer her family a higher standard of living.

loans.use: to buy snacks, drinks, rice, corn, beans, sweet bread, instant soup, toilet paper, soap, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy has had to overcome a lot of adversity in her life. She has always had the strength to overcome it and move forward with her children. 

Nancy is one of the hardest-working women on planet earth, she is a 30-year-old go-getter from Naitiri, a remote village in the Kitale area of Kenya. This area has harsh weather conditions and to survive, you must have tough skin. Nancy has defied all the odds and has farmed for  five years. Her primary sources of income are growing crops and raising animals. She earns additional income through a motorcycle business. 

Nancy is content with the farming way of life and is a very enterprising woman.  She hasn't had formal employment but always worked hard on her farm to provide her children and family with decent meals. The Kitale area has favorable conditions for horticulture farming which is why she seeks a loan to buy seeds and start horticulture farming. Because of good roads, good climate, and a good transportation network, she is sure that she will reap maximum profits and increase her business. 

Being a woman and accessing funds in Africa is very challenging, but Nancy feels relieved knowing there are institutions such as Kiva that help enterprising women. Nancy is well disciplined with finances and she plans  to improve her living conditions and secure the future of her children. 

Please help Nancy so that her horticulture farm can flourish!

loans.use: to start horticulture farming.

loans.name: Priscilla

texts.en: Priscilla is a very industrious, honest and hardworking woman who hails from Nkubu area of Kenya, an area that is near the famous Mount Kenya region. She is 41 years of age and has been farming for the past 10 years. Through those years, she has gathered so much experience and is considered among the best farmers in her village. She has been practicing mixed farming and her primary source of income has been milk, eggs, crops and some small businesses that she does so that she can make ends meet. Priscilla is very passionate about farming and she loves cultivating her farm. That is why every day she wakes up very early to go to her farm to plough. Although Priscilla makes profits through farming, she is not comfortable and has always wanted to increase her income through the selling of cereals. That is why she is seeking a loan to buy cereals. The Nkubu area is one of the regions that is populated and has a high demand for cereals. That means that Priscilla will make more profits and be able to satisfy the demand that is there. Accessing funds has been a challenge for Priscilla, but she feels relieved, because Juhudi Kilimo is partnering with Kiva lenders to help aspiring women farmers like her turn their farming dreams into reality through training and loan financing. Priscilla believes that this loan will be of much help and she will be able to satisfy the demand that is there for cereals. She believes that the extra income will allow permanent change to her life and increase her business. Increased profits will allow Priscilla to repay the loan, and secure the future of her school-going children. Lenders, if there is someone you should invest in, then it is Priscilla. Support this business owner, who wants to show that the role of a mother and a farmer isn't too much for her; she just needs your vote of confidence.

loans.use: to purchase cereals to sell.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is 28 years old and he lives with his mother in Kobuleti. His mother is unemployed and is a housekeeper. Robert owns a plot of land, where he grows mandarins and sells them seasonally. As they have only seasonal income the family lives in poverty. 

The Start Up program created by Kiva and Credo enabled him to get a loan of 3,000 GEL. Robert will purchase a second-hand car and will start providing a taxi service. He will transfer people through the town and also in other regions. He will become the only breadwinner in the family and tackle their poverty. The family's living conditions will significantly improve, and the family will have enough income to cover everyday costs.

loans.use: to purchase a car and start a taxi business.

loans.name: Selly

texts.en:
Selly is a smallholder farmer from South Rift area of Kenya. She lives with her family and works on a small farm to raise dairy cows and grow vegetables. The farm helps Selly to produce food and generate income for her family. 

This year, Selly plans to diversify the farm business and requests 20,000 KES to buy poultry. She can buy up to 40 heads of poultry. This loan investment will  kick-start her new venture. A small quantity of the poultry products produced will be consumed by her family and the rest will be sold for income. Money generated from the poultry business will help Selly clear her loan obligation and improve her family's  standard of living.

loans.use: to buy poultry.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothes and shoes to sell.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is an industrious smallholder farmer from Kitale area of Kenya. Until recently, Sarah was financially excluded. This confined her to subsistence farming where she only produced enough food for family consumption and a little bit extra for other basic necessities.

Sarah seeks 10,000 KES to get started with commercial poultry farming. With this amount, Sarah can acquire 20 hens which will produce eggs and reproduce with time. 

This loan investment will help Sarah build up her asset base and generate income.  Sarah's family livelihood will be elevated as a result of your loan.

loans.use: to buy poultry.

loans.name: Robinson

texts.en:
Robinson is a rural smallholder crop farmer from the Kapsowar area of Kenya. In addition to growing crops, Robinson dairy farms for extra food and income.  

The key lesson he has taken away from being in crop farming is predicting weather patterns.


Robinson seeks a loan to buy agricultural inputs and plans to buy improved seeds and fertilizer to enhance his farm’s productivity.  Quality agricultural inputs will increase Robinson’s chances for a successful harvest.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a married woman with three children, two attend school. She lives in a rental house that has running water and electricity. School fees and food costs are her greatest monthly expenses.

She has operated a beauty salon business for  three years. She faces a major challenge of climate conditions in her business.

She will use the loan to purchase chemicals and air conditioners for her beauty salon. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase chemicals and air conditioners for her beauty salon business.

loans.name: Unity Goup Group

texts.en:
The members of thie 3-member group are from the same neighborhood and have good social and professional relationships. The group has been in existence since May 11, 2010. They sell wigs, conditioner, cream, shampoo, cloth, and fry plantain chips. 

Regina, the group's representative, is a 46-year-old single mother. She works as a hair dresser. She will use the loan to buy some wigs, conditioner, cream, and shampoo to perm and weave her customers hair in a kiosk at the market. She has plenty of experience  and provides for her family with food.  

This is the sixth loan with ID-Ghana and they will hold each other responsible to repay the loan. They request 3,900 GHS to improve their businesses.

loans.use: to buy wigs, conditioner, cream, and shampoo.

loans.name: Violet

texts.en:
Violet is single and the mother of three children who attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water.

She sells fruits and green vegetables. She always struggles to improve her grocery stall, trying to sell more and save money in order to have a more formal establishment. Violet is requesting a loan to purchase sacks of fruits and green vegetables for resale. She decided to join Yehu so that she could access loans and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fruits and green vegetables for resale

loans.name: Enkhbaatar

texts.en: Mr. Enkhbaatar, 54 years old, lives with his wife and daughter in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. He has been rendering a taxi service to local people for 22 years. His wife makes and sells traditional clothes at the outdoor market. Using his previous loan, he has renovated his house, but last year due to bad weather, his house was damaged greatly. So now he is requesting a loan of 1,500,000 MNT to buy building materials such as bricks, cement and putties in order to repair the broken walls and collapsed door. After repair, his family will live in a safe place where less coal is burned for heating, releasing less pollutants into the air.

loans.use: to repair broken walls and a collapsed door

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Pauline is a married woman with two kids, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Pauline operates a grocery and vegetable selling stall, selling at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces the challenge of a high cost of seasonality to her place of operation. 

With the KES 30,000 she wants to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale

loans.name: Vepkhvia

texts.en:
Vepkhvia is a 49-year-old  married man with 2 children from the small village Tezeri. The family has a cow and a plot of agricultural land to grow maize and haricot. Vepkhvia's wife raises the cow to produce and sell dairy products. They also sell seasonal harvested products. 

Vepkhvia wants to start a trading business and requests a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables him to get a loan to purchase fruits and vegetables. He will use his car to trade fruits and vegetables from village to village for a higher price and profit. 

Vepkhvia is very motivated to increase his family's income and awaits your support.

loans.use: to trade fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Tamari

texts.en:
Tamari is 43 years old and lives with her husband, Zaza, and school-aged child in the Gurjaani district. They have a vineyard and a plot of agricultural land to grow vegetables. 

Tamari and Zaza are very hardworking and want to purchase a truck to trade fruits and vegetables. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan to purchase a truck. Zaza will drive and transport vegetables to other villages. The family will gain more income and they will provide better living conditions for their child. 

Tamari awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase a truck.

loans.name: Suzan

texts.en:
Suzan is a 24-year-old married mother of one child. She started five years ago working as an accountant from her house to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their family.  Suzan is a hard worker and ambitious lady who is working hard to improve her family's living conditions. 

Thus today she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to renovate her house to make it a better and healthier place for her new baby. She hopes to stay capable of providing her child with better life.

loans.use: to renovate her house to make it a better and healthier place for her new baby

loans.name: Atef

texts.en:
Atef is a 36-years-old married man from Rafah city, which is located in the Gaza Strip, which has an economic blockade imposed by the Israeli authorities since 2007. He is father of four children and lives with them in a small old house.  Atef works in the public sector where he earn low income. This income barely covers all the family's needs.

Because he is not able to save enough money, Ahmad took a USD loan from FATEN. With this loan, he will buy a solar electricity system and filter for cleaning and heating water for the family house. Palestinians use water boilers that use either gas or gasoline to heat the water before a shower, which can be dangerous, expensive and inefficient. This will help him to provide hot and clean water without using electricity, which is much more expensive.

Atef appears in the photo, he holds the filter.

loans.use: buy a solar system and also a filter for cleaning and heating water for the family house

loans.name: Yousef

texts.en:
Yousef is a 36-years-old married man from Rafah city, which is located in the Gaza Strip, which has an economic blockade imposed by the Israeli authorities since 2007.   He is the father of four children and lives with them in a small old house.  Yousef works in the public sector where he earn low income. This income barely covers all the family's needs.

Because he is not able to save enough money, Ahmad took a USD loan from FATEN. With this loan, he will buy a solar system and filter for cleaning and heating water for the family house. 

Palestinians use water boilers that use either gas or gasoline to heat the water before a shower, which can be dangerous, expensive and inefficient. This will help him to provide hot and clean water without using electricity, which is much more expensive.

Yousef appears in the photo and holds the filter.

loans.use: to buy a solar system and also filter for cleaning and heating water for the family house

loans.name: Hunimo

texts.en:
Hunimo is a generous woman. She was born in northern part of Tajikistan in 1975 and is living in village far from city with her big family. She is married to farmer, with four children. Hunimo is also busy in agriculture and she has land where she plants vegetables, cereal and fruits. She has been doing this activity almost 17 years. She is a confident, patient, active and bright person. 

She got sick. She wants to be treated but she has not money to go to the hospital. She requested a loan from IMON and KIVA to pay her treatment at hospital. She awaits you kindness and is willing to be supported.

loans.use: to go to the hospital for treatment

loans.name: Josephat

texts.en:
Josephat is a thriving and hardworking man who works for a better future. He is based in Kiptere, a remote village in the rich highland areas of Kericho in Kenya. This area is known for producing the best tea and milk. Their staple food is “mursik,” a mouthwatering delicacy prepared from milk. Josephat has been practising mixed farming for the past 5 years and he has made great strides in terms of profit margins. This small scale farmer generates income through selling milk, maize and some personal business that he does, or “side hustle” as he likes to call it. He passionately loves poultry farming and the best part is when he wakes up every morning to collect eggs. The main challenge facing Josephat is the constant perennial shortages of eggs and poultry products in his village and local market. He seeks to change this through a loan to buy more poultry. Josephat is seeking a loan from Kiva lenders via Juhudi Kilimo to purchase additional poultry. With the loan, Josephat will increase his income through selling eggs, poultry meat and also poultry feathers. The demand for poultry products in Kericho area is very high and through the loan he will be able to satisfy the demand. Other than profits from poultry farming, he will also benefit from poultry manure, hence saving money that would have been used in purchasing fertilizers. The additional income from this expansion will permanently change his life and improve his living conditions.
Support this enterprising Kenyan with a loan today!

loans.use: To buy poultry birds

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a smallholder farmer based in the North-rift area of Kenya. He is married and has 2 children. To provide for his family, Peter has relied on dairy farming for the last 5 years. His main source of income is milk. 

In a bid to grow his business, Peter is seeking external financing to implement modern techniques that will improve the productivity levels of his cows. This year, there are two key projects that he plans to undertake; introducing zero-grazing technique and buying a machine for processing fodder. Peter is seeking a loan to buy a chaff cutter and materials for constructing a cowshed. 

Through your loan investment into his business, the chaff cutter will be used to chop hay into chaff, which the cows prefer due to the even, small sizes and fresh aroma. The chaff-cutting machine will also make it easier for him to handle fodder in bulk when he introduces zero-grazing, after constructing a cowshed. 

This loan investment will help Peter to generate more income to repay his debt and improve his family's livelihood.

loans.use: to buy a chaff cutter and construction materials for a cowshed

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina is a widowed woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Rosalina is 39 years old and has two children who are in school.

Rosalina has a junk food making business in the Philippines. Rosalina requested a PHP 50000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Rosalina has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Rosalina would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She lives in her own house that has electricity and piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past year, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. In addition, she also operates a poultry selling business that earns her another source of income. 

With the loan that she is requesting, she wants to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Nopalera Group

texts.en:
Mr. Flocelo, in the middle of the picture, is a peasant who has decided together with his neighbors to get access to electricity to improve the living conditions of their families. Flocelo, his wife and their children live in a remote house where, as well as their neighbors, they have to use candles for lighting by night. 

As a member of the Nopalera group he will get a third generation solar electricity home system to obtain a basic electricity service. The loan is asked to fund the systems of this group and will be paid back with the monthly fee for first-year-of-operation maintenance services they pay.

loans.use: to pay small photovoltaic solar electricity systems for their houses.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is 24-year-old, he is one of four siblings and lives in Irbid. He goes to the university to get his bachelor degree in designs and applied arts and wants to help his family in the household expenses and his siblings with their education. 

Mohammad`s father is facing a financial crises, therefore he is applying for a loan to help him to cover the rest of the semester fees and buy what he needs from books.

loans.use: To pay for his university fees in applied arts and design

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a smallholder farmer from the Nandi Hills area of Kenya. She is married and has 5 children. On the 2.3 acre farmland where she lives and works, she has 3 dairy cows, tea crops and almost 1,000 trees. 

Jane is seeking a loan of KES 60,000 to buy cereal produce from other farmers. With the loan capital, she plans to build inventory and sell in markets offering better prices or sell rapidly once the market conditions are favorable. With your contribution, she will have greater returns. 

She plans to use income from this investment to repay the loan and cover her family's growing expenses including her children's education.

loans.use: to buy cereals for sale

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is a smallholder farmer who resides in the North Rift area of Kenya. She is married and has 4 children between 6 and 15 years of age. To provide for her family, Irene relies on the dairy and poultry products from her cows and hens. She also has 250 trees on her 4 acre farmland that are of significant value. 

Irene has been farming for 14 years. One special challenge that she has been facing is lack of means of transport for her produce. Relying on public transportation services is not only costly but also unreliable and inconvenient. Today, she is seeking a loan to buy her own motorcycle. She will equip a carrier on the motorcycle for carrying milk cans. 

With your loan, she will be able to transport her produce to the market in a timely and convenient fashion. The motorcycle will also enable her to participate in the formal market process by giving her a means to reach further markets. 
The impact of this loan will be improved income and interaction with other actors of the value chain.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for farm transportation

loans.name: Irine

texts.en:
Irine is a humble and hard-working woman who has devoted a great part of her life to caring for her children. She lives in the Chuka area of Kenya, renowned for its rolling hills. Irine is the mother of two children, and she has been in the agriculture business for ten years. Her primary income sources are milk, eggs, and maize. Irene has been relying on agriculture to make all of her income. However, rising costs of farming inputs, such as fertilizers, and fluctuations in market prices are some of the serious challenges that are cutting farmers' profits significantly. Despite these tough conditions, Irene remains positive and passionate about her economic activity. 

Irine is seeking a loan to purchase poultry. This loan will enable her to expand the section of her business least affected by harsh external conditions. Poultry farming is cheaper to run and the demand for chicken products is always high. With this loan, Irine will be able to increase the sales from her poultry business and make more profits. 

An increase in income for her is timely, since it will enable her to tackle high farm-related costs next season. This will greatly improve the quality of work since the cost of every input will be adequately met. As a result, she will realize better quality produce and more yields. This loan will support Irine’s economic activity, and will change her family’s living standards indirectly.
Kindly support the dream of a Kenyan woman with a loan today!

loans.use: To purchase poultry to increase her farming business

loans.name: Dolin

texts.en:
Dolin is a 30-year-old, married and living with her four children in Bundibugyo-Uganda. She deals in selling fresh foods as a vendor in the markets and gets additional income from growing and selling cocoa. 

She is very hardworking but is challenged by inadequate capital; she hopes of building a permanent house and also educate children up to University.  Dolin has requested for a loan to buy foodstuffs like tomatoes, cabbages and ground nuts to sell.

loans.use: to buy fresh foods like tomatoes for selling.

loans.name: Erastus

texts.en:
Erastus and his family live in a rural home in Central Kenya. He, his wife and two children enjoy dairy farming for it provides their family with a livelihood and source of income. Erastus started farming 10 years ago and continues to produce food which he sells at a local market near his home. 

Erastus is seeking a loan to construct a cowshed for his cattle. The borrowed money will be used to buy construction tools and materials needed for the construction. He hopes that once the cowshed is built, his animals will enjoy the new environment and become healthier and more productive.

loans.use: to construct a dairy unit

loans.name: Geofrey

texts.en: Geofrey is 31 years old, married with one child, and living in Kasese, Uganda. He has a boutique of new and secondhand clothes which he has been operating for the past eight years and earns a side income from his monthly salary. He works 10 hours a day and 6 days a week. He intends to use the loan to buy men's and ladies' shoes and clothes to sell. He is hardworking and honest but faces a challenge of limited capital. He has hopes of expanding his business and improving his family's welfare.

loans.use: to buy men's and ladies' shoes and clothes to sell.

loans.name: Musrat

texts.en:
Musrat is a happily married woman. Some years ago, she decided to support her family by starting business of tailoring at her home as her husband's (also shown in the photo) income was barely enough to meet their day-to-day expenses. Musrat is popularly known in her area for her skill in sewing.

 However, due to a shortage of raw materials, she is facing a difficulty in meeting daily expenses related to her business. Therefore, she has availed Murabaha loan of PKR 35000. With the requested loan, she wants to purchase sewing materials, such as threads of different colors, laces, zippers, and cloth make more dresses on time.  She hopes to get increase in her income.

loans.use: to purchase sewing materials, such as threads of different colors, laces, zippers, and cloth to make more dresses on time

loans.name: Nazi

texts.en: Nazi is 21 years old. She is married and lives with her husband and child in Telavi district, in Kakheti region. Nazi works at a local hospital as a nurse and gets a small monthly income. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan to purchase a stock of linens to resell among her neighbors and co-workers. This will increase her income and Nazi will be able to improve living conditions for her family. Nazi hopes that the business will be profitable and awaits your support.

loans.use: to begin trading linens

loans.name: Rapha Group

texts.en:
Tarisai’s’s story dates back to ‘90s when she lost her husband in a car accident. After that painful event, she joined hands with other women and established a baking business. They would bake samoosas and scones and walk around the neighbourhood selling their baked products. Tarisai would also sell vegetables and do part time jobs that would earn her sufficient income to buy bread for her children. She raised her three children, paid their primary and secondary education fees using income from selling samoosas and doing household chores for people. 

As the years went by and life became harder as the economy took a dip, her colleagues abandoned their projects and decided to start other businesses. Tarisai remained strong even as her business struggled. She still bakes samoosas and people love them for their meaty and chilli taste.

She now has two women who assist her in baking and selling the samoosas. At the end of the day, she pays them their daily wages. Her business is growing and coupled with her experience, she is managing her business well. 

She and a couple of friends then formed a group called Rapha, and they hope that a loan backed by Kiva will help Tarisai to take her business to the next level, so that she manages to open a small bakery in the near future.

loans.use: To expand her bakery, which employs other women and needs to be expanded

loans.name: Tawfeeq

texts.en:
Tawfeeq is a 31-year-old married man from Khan Younis City, in the Gaza Strip, which is a difficult place to live due to the Israeli economic blockade, in place since 2007.  He lives with his wife and two child in a small house. Tawfeeq works in the public sector where he earn low income, so he wants to improve himself and be independent.  An entrepreneur, he thought of starting a business to transport goods in rickshaws three years ago. 

Now Tawfeeq is thinking of replacing the old rickshaw for another new. He took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new rickshaw. He hopes that, by taking this loan, Tawfeeq will be able to improve his family's conditions. Tawfeeq appears in the photo.

additional information:
 Rickshaws (also called “tuk-tuks”) are a common mode of transportation for goods and people in the Gaza Strip, due to efficient use of fuel, which can be scarce and expensive due to the economic blockade. Further, they became even more appealing following the Summer 2014 assault and the resulting destruction of buildings, homes, and infrastructure, as they are able to navigate narrow roads and difficult to reach places.

loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena, a 45-year-old micro-entrepreneur from Batasan, Quezon City, has been operating their transportation business for five years now, and she makes a good income from this. She is married to Rehum, a truck driver. They have four kids to feed that's why she is determined to work harder to help provide her husband for their family needs. 

She has been into several business for a long time and for sure, she already knows the tricks of the trade. In fact, today, aside form the transportation business, she also manages a e-load business and direct-selling as well. 

She has a of tricycle that carries up to four passengers to their destination within the community. The tricycle driver then remits a boundary (daily quota) each day to her. In her business the regular customers are the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 600 every day.

Rowena wants to apply a PHP 40,000 loan assistance to continue operations of their business. She will be utilizing the loan to buy spare parts, accessories and also for the maintenance of their motorcycle.

Rowena's dream is just always for her children- to ensure that someday they will complete their studies and  generate better lives eventually.  

She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy spare parts, accessories and also for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a quality dairy cow for better milk production

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a quality breed of dairy cow

loans.name: Chepkurui

texts.en:
Chepkurui is a married mother of 3 children. She conducts dairy and tea farming on her 2 acre piece of land situated in the Nandi Hills area of Kenya. To improve her income level, Chepkurui engages in cereal brokering, which involves arranging the logistics of getting farm produce from local farmers to their buyers. 

In order to make significant returns from the trade, Chepkurui needs to secure more inventory. The biggest problem she is facing is lack of capital. 
Chepkurui applied for a loan to buy cereals. With your loan, Chepkurui plans to aggregate produce from local farmers at fair prices. Later, when the market conditions and prices are more favourable, she will sell and keep the margin as income. This business will help his suppliers to focus on production, rather than sales. Chepkurui’s family also stands to benefit greatly from the improved incomes and elevated livelihood as a result of your loan.

loans.use: to buy cereal grains for sale

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a rural farmer in Nandihills, Kenya, which is an area known for producing long-distance runners who have broken major world records. Rose is blessed with six children, and she has been practicing mixed farming for the past nineteen years. On her farm she grows different varieties of crops and keeps a dairy cow and poultry. To meet her expenses and provide the best for her family, she also often engages in small personal business to make extra money. Farming gives her a great sense of satisfaction despite the low earnings. Rose said, "I enjoy it most when I see customers come back for my products because it shows me that I am meeting their needs!" Her biggest challenge, however, is drought. The long dry season can lead to crop failures and poor yields. To a farmer, this means business losses and lack of food for the family. 

Because of this challenge, Rose formed a group and joined Juhudi Kilimo, a microfinance organization that supports small rural farmers. She acquired a dairy cow that she later named Lelmet meaning a cow with a white mark on the head, which produces milk daily that Rose sells to a co-operative. "The money from milk comes regularly and is not really affected by sudden changes in the weather, if you have stored feed," said Rose. 

Her future plan is to construct a zero-grazing unit. That way, she can use the grazing field to plant fodder and prepare silage. The money Rose got from selling her milk was sufficient to repay her last loan. Today she is seeking a new loan to buy another dairy cow and is planning to become a fully-fledged dairy farmer. With this loan, Rose is going to grow into a very successful dairy farmer. All she wants is for her family to enjoy the abundance of life with good health and a good livelihood.

loans.use: to buy a quality breed of dairy cow

loans.name: James

texts.en: Dairy farming has always played a core role in East Africa. The predominant type of dairy farming, traditional subsistence farming, is done mainly on a small scale for survival. James has kept dairy animals for the last three years on his farm in the Chuka area of Kenya. Since James had a child, his personal and financial obligations have skyrocketed. He has different ways to make money including a small personal business (motorbike business), but kept coming up short. He decided the best way to grow economically was to improve his farm's productivity.
