To increase milk production, he could either buy more cows or replace the existing cows with more productive breeds. The latter made more economic sense. Traditional breeds are well-adjusted to the environmental conditions and disease resistance, but their milk production is very low. Cross-breeds and Friesians are more productive, and can survive in the same environment as the traditional breeds, but they come at a price. James is seeking a loan from Kiva lenders to purchase a productive dairy cow that will bring him more income. He will use the additional income to pay for his children's education, and meet family expenses. His future plan is to keep growing his income-generating asset base.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is a forty five year old married man with two children living in Masindi-Uganda. He deals in cattle fattening along side selling milk as his major business. 

He engaged in business with a purpose of getting income to sustain his family and has great hopes of educating his children using the proceeds from his business. He is requesting for a loan to buy cows for fattening to mature quickly for sell.

loans.use: to buy cows for fattening to mature quickly for sell.

loans.name: Kasim

texts.en: Kasim is 49 years old, the father of 15 children, and he lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He deals in the buying and selling of cocoa, and he gets additional income from cocoa growing which he has done for 14 years. He works hard and has plans of educating his children, buying land and expanding his cocoa growing. His main challenges are price changes, expensive labor and inadequate capital to expand the business. He is asking for a loan to buy cocoa to sell to cocoa companies.

loans.use: to buy cocoa to sell.

loans.name: Chhneang's Group

texts.en:
Chhneang, a farmer living in Battambang province, is 45 years old and a mother of six children. She earns income to support her living condition via rice cropping and working for others for a fee. Moreover, she earns more income via cows-raising for 12 years. For her farming, it did not produce her good yield because of drought. 

This is sixth cycles for Chhneang with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid back her past loans as well. Her family’s living is getting before with her past loan. In a group of five members, she is the group leader. 

She will spend her entire loan portion to pay for plowing fee, rice seed and fertilizer for her farm to get more yields. She hopes that she can get more income to improve her living and expand her farmland.

loans.use: to pay for plowing fee, rice seed and fertilizer for her farm to get more yields.

loans.name: Sammy

texts.en:
Sammy is a rural smallholder farmer from Central Kenya. He is married and has four children between 5 and 19 years old. He has a one-acre farm that he lives on and where he keeps farm animals. His main source of income is milk.

Sammy is seeking a loan to construct a cowshed for his cow. The borrowed money will be used to buy construction tools and materials for the project. He hopes that his animals' health and comfort will improve as a result of this intervention. His goals are to increase his animals' milk production and to generate more income from selling milk.

Your loan will create an opportunity for Sammy to elevate his family's livelihood.

loans.use: to construct a cowshed

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel, 47, is an agribusiness entrepreneur from Kitale, in the Rift Valley region of Kenya. He has been actively doing this work for six years. Joel makes a decent income selling milk, eggs, maize, and other crops that he produces at the local market. He is also engaged in other personal businesses to make additional income. Poultry farming has worked out particularly very well for Joel, mainly because of the growing demand for chicken products and by-products. He also attributes his success to the passion and vision he has for the business. He also enjoys harvesting maize and looking after his dairy cow. The biggest risks his business faces are outbreaks of disease and market uncertainties.

Joel is seeking a loan to purchase more poultry. With this money, he will expand his business by buying a brood of hens, which will lay more eggs to resell. David has nurtured a "saving culture" - he will use the money he earns from this investment to build his savings account and provide his family with a balanced diet and better living conditions.

loans.use: To buy poultry to expand his agricultural business

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen is 38 years old and married with 7 children who all go to school. He lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He is a retailer selling clothes in a boutique, a business he started to earn a living. He grows and sells cocoa to supplement his income from the clothing shop. He dreams of expanding his business and completing his commercial house. However, he is limited by inadequate capital. Stephen has asked for a loan to buy clothes to sell for both men and women.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell for both men and women

loans.name: Patman

texts.en:
Patman is a 44-year-old married woman. She lives with her husband and infant daughter in the Zugdidi district of West Georgia. The family is involved in agricultural activities. They have three cows, two pigs, and 1.5 hectares of agricultural land, where they grow 800 nut trees. Patman produces dairy products daily to sell. 

Patman wants to start a trading business and requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative of Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan for purchasing a car and stock of fruits and vegetables. Her husband will drive the car and they will resell fruits and vegetables from village to village. This will increase their income and Patman will provide better living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to purchase a car and stock of fruits and vegetables to begin a trading business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy: wood, nails, sheet metal, cement, sand, gravel and pay for the work to be done to improve the galley with new materials.

loans.name: Gloria Victoria

texts.es: Gloria de 52 años de edad es madre soltera y vive con sus cinco hijos 2 niñas de 10 y 16 años de edad y 3 varones de 12, 20 y 24 años de edad, es una mujer muy luchadora pues sola ha podido sacar adelante a sus hijos. Ella se dedica al a venta de comida típica como: tamales, enchiladas y pasteles de carne, ella misma los cocina y sale a venderlos por las calles de su comunidad. Gloria desea construir un corredor en su vivienda y para ello está solicitando un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, grava, arena y pago de mano de obra para construir un corredor en su vivienda, ya que en el invierno su terreno se lava por causa del agua, ella espera contar con el apoyo de este crédito y comenzar con la mejora de inmediato pues con esto ella evitara probables accidentes con sus hijos a causa de lo resbaladizo del piso.
texts.en:
Gloria is 52 years old, and she is a single mother. She lives with her five children: 2 daughters ages 10 and 16, and 3 sons ages 12, 20, and 24. She is a very hardworking woman, and has managed to take care of her family by herself. Gloria makes a living selling typical food such as tamales, enchiladas, and meat pies. She cooks her products herself, and sells them in the streets of her community.

Gloria would like to build a corridor in her home, and for this reason she is requesting a loan with FUSAI to buy cement, gravel, sand, and pay for the labor costs to build a corridor in her home. She wants to build a corridor because in the winter, her yard washes away as a result of the water. She hopes to be able to count on the support of this loan, and begin the improvement immediately. With this, she and her children will avoid accidents as a result of the slippery floor.

loans.use: to buy cement, gravel, sand and pay for the labor costs to build a corridor in her home.

loans.name: Selevano

texts.en:
Selevano is 32 years old, married, and has four children. He lives in Kasese, Uganda. He deals in crude salt, which he has done for six years. Selevano faces the challenges of weather changes, which reduce the salt levels, and limited capital to sustain his business. He desires to educate his children to higher levels. 

Selevano wants a loan to buy more salt to sell.

loans.use: to buy more salt to sell.

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
Isaac is a first-time borrower who is a cattle keeper. He has had this business for over 17 years. It is profitable through selling milking, keeping heifers and bulls, and then trading them after three months. He feels challenged during the times of drought when there is a scarcity of water and grass to feed his animals, which makes them emaciated and of poor quality. 

With this loan, Isaac will be able to construct a dam to harvest water now for future use during the season of drought. He will also use part of the loan to buy more young bulls, which can persist through the dry season and yield after the season. Isaac is hard-working and thanks Kiva lenders working through UGAFODE for this great service.

loans.use: To buy baby cows and also construct a dam

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is 34 years old. He lives in Kasese, Uganda and is married with six children. Ibrahim has owned a cosmetics shop for 10 years now. He started this business to boost his family's welfare. Ibrahim also has other businesses like a salon and a restaurant from which he earns additional income. He is a hard-working and honest man with a dream of owning a cosmetics wholesale shop. However, he is limited by inadequate capital. 

Ibrahim has requested a loan to buy more cosmetics to sell.

loans.use: to buy more cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Renacer Xenacoj Group

texts.en:
Guatemala is currently ranked as the most violent country against women in Latin America and has one of the highest rates of violence against women in the world. The “Microcredit Plus” Program of Friendship Bridge, which combines education and small loans, has a goal of empowering women so that they can create their own solutions to poverty. The monthly educational component of their meetings is very beneficial and a Friendship Bridge Facilitator shares information on topics like women’s rights, violence against women, and self-esteem. Other subjects discussed are hygiene, health, and nutrition, as well as effective business management techniques such as accounting, budgeting, marketing, and pricing.

Ten women who strive to have more prosperous lives have joined together to form the Trust Bank called “Renacer Xenacoj.” “Renacer” is a Spanish verb meaning to “be reborn.”  They are requesting their very first loan that they hope will be funded by Kiva investors.

Adaligia is a 38-year-old member of the group who began her small business of selling used clothing three years ago. She has seen positive changes in her life. Her earnings have enabled her to send her children to school with one already at the university level studying engineering. Adaligia is requesting a loan to buy more used clothing and, in addition, to buy shoes, as she sees that there is demand for them. With her earnings, she will continue to cover the educational needs of her children because she believes that education is a vital key to a successful future.

Thank you, Kiva investors, for believing in women like Adaligia and her friends in the Trust Bank. They face a brighter tomorrow because of your generosity! We look forward to providing a follow-up report in the very near future!

loans.use: to buy more used clothing and to buy shoes, as she sees that there is demand for them

loans.name: Crecimiento Group

texts.en:
Totonicapán is a large bustling town that has a population largely composed of Maya K’iche.  It serves as an important commercial and manufacturing center for agriculture, as many in the area are farmers and grow beans, corn, potatoes, and wheat. They also raise sheep. In addition, Totonicapán is the major area in Guatemala where the multi-patterned woven tube skirts called “cortes” are made. One also finds leather goods, pottery, and furniture here. 

Seven industrious women have formed a Friendship Bridge Trust Bank called “Crecimiento,” which means “Growth.” These ladies have that goal in mind as they work hard in their small businesses to generate an income, send their children to school, and rise up out of poverty. The women meet each month to receive educational training from a Friendship Bridge Facilitator. They learn about all kinds of useful topics like business management, hygiene, health, and women’s rights. Friendship Bridge calls the combination of education and loans “Microcredit Plus.”

Francisca is a 27-year-old member of the group and, like most indigenous women in Guatemala, she works hard to cover her household costs. She has a textile business and creates ornate woven and embroidered blouses called “huipiles” and aprons called “delantales.” Francisca is well-known in her community and her textiles are in demand. She is requesting a loan from Kiva lenders that she will use to buy needles, pearls, thread, and fabric, as well as traditional skirts. She is looking forward to the annual fair in the town that is coming up soon.

Thank you, Kiva investors, for your generosity in funding Francisca and her friends in the Crecimiento Trust Bank. With your financial assistance, they are growing each day!

loans.use: to buy needles, pearls, thread, and fabric, as well as traditional skirts.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bricks, cement, iron, sand, gravel, and pay for labor costs to build a perimeter wall for her home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cocoa to sell.

loans.name: Peace

texts.en:
Peace is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She lives in Kasese, Uganda. Peace rears and sells goats and grows crops to earn additional income. She has been in business for seven years, having started with the goal of earning income to look after her children. 

Peace is requesting a loan to buy goats to fatten and sell. She hopes to educate her children to higher levels of learning, although she faces the challenge of market competition in her business.

loans.use: to buy goats to fatten and sell.

loans.name: Perizat

texts.ru: Перизат, 28 лет, замужем, есть сын. У нее среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Перизат занимается торговлей продуктами питания на местном рынке. В обороте есть товар на сумму 150,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Перизат обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку продуктов питания для реализации. Доходы от кредита Перизат планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение ее бизнеса и улучшение жилищных условий семьи.
texts.en: Perizat is 28, married, and has a son.  She has a secondary school education and sells food products at a local market as the main source of income for her family.  Her goods in stock are worth 150,000 som.  For the future development of her business, Perizat has turned to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 100,000 som to buy food products for resale.  Perizat plans on using her extra income due to the loan to further expand her business and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: buy food for retail sale in order to attract new customers

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es: Carlos de 59 años de edad habita en vivienda propia a lado de su compañera de vida con quien llevan muchos años  juntos.  Él es un hombre muy trabajador que con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado salir adelante y brindar todas las necesidades a su familia además recibe el apoyo de su compañera de vida  quien le ayuda con algunas cosas del hogar. Carlos cuenta con un negocio de comida con el cual junto a su compañera de vida ha logrado sostener y generar un numeroso grupo de clientes que lo visitan debido a que preparan panes con refresco de lunes a viernes y  los fines de semana preparan sopas de pollo, tamales de gallina entre otros platillos los cuales los brindan a domicilio y a un muy buen precio, es por eso que sus clientes lo recomiendan y di a día son más las personas que demandan sus productos. Carlos con el propósito de  mantener su negocio e invertir en la materia prima para la preparación de sus platillos solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: verduras, especias, pollos,  etc., para incrementar las ventas de su negocio.
texts.en:
Carlos is 59 years old, and he lives in his own home along with his life partner, who he has been with for many years. He is a very hardworking man, who with much effort has managed to take care of all of his family's necessities. He also receives help from his life partner who helps him with some things around the house. 

Carlos has a food business with his life partner, and he has a group of customers who visit them for bread and soft drinks from Monday thru Friday. On the weekends, they prepare chicken soup and chicken tamales among other dishes, and they deliver to people's homes and sell at a very good price. For these reasons, their customers recommend them, and their customer base is growing everyday. 

With the purpose of maintaining his business by buying supplies for the preparation of his dishes, Carlos is requesting a loan with FUSAI to buy vegetables, spices, chickens, etc. in order to increase sales for his business.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, spices, chickens, etc in order to increase sales for his business.

loans.name: Lidice Monserrate

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito San Juan Eudes se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía, que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.
En este lugar vive la señora Lidice, tiene 38 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 7 y 3 años de edad, el mayor estudia en escuela. Su esposo es maestro.
Doña Lidice es una mujer que le gusta salir adelante, ella tiene una pequeña tienda de víveres en su casa, allí vende todo tipo de productos de primera necesidad, también vende productos Avon. Yanbal, Belcorp (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas), estos productos los vende en su tienda y también sale a recorrer por la ciudad donde ella tiene sus clientes, lleva más de 18  años dedicada al comercio y le encanta esta labor.
Este crédito es para comprar víveres, perfumes, cremas y cosméticos. Lleva 9 años en el grupo de crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le permiten ir mejorando su negocio y su vida. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a sus pequeños.
texts.en:
The San Juan Eudes Credit Group meets every fifteen days in the Montecristi Canton, which is known for its rich pre-colonial culture and its artisanal crafts that known on a national and international level. It is the home of the famous Panama hats.

Señora Lidice lives here. She is 38 years old and married. She has two children from this relationship who are ages 7 and 3. The oldest is studying in school. Her husband is a teacher.

Doña Lidice is a woman who likes to get ahead, and she has a small grocery store in her house where she sells all types of basic needs products. She also sells Avon, Yanbal, and Belcorp products (beauty items, cosmetics, perfume, and ladies’ accessories). She sells them in her store and she also travels throughout the city where she has her clients. She has been working in the business for more than 18 years, and she loves this work.

This loan is to purchase grocery supplies, perfumes, creams, and cosmetics. She has been in the credit group for 9 years, and she likes it because the loans allow her to keep improving her business and her life.  Her dream is to give the best to her little ones.

loans.use: to purchase grocery supplies, perfumes, creams, and cosmetics.

loans.name: Lealtad Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LEALTAD” iniciará el tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Villa Exaltación, está compuesta por nueve  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Hercilia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de mantas, tienda de barrio, venta de repuestos para automóviles, venta de comida, venta de cuadros, venta de zapatillas.
	
El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Hercilia es integrante, ella indica que ingreso a Pro Mujer, por la invitación de una amiga de la institución, hace más de cinco años. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tienda de barrio; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió hace varios años por iniciativa propia. 
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de galletas, gaseosas y  dulces por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella vive en unión libre y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que los créditos otorgados y el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The "Lealtad" [Loyalty] communal bank will start its third loan cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the "Centro Focal de Villa Exaltación" [Exaltation Village Focal Center]. It is composed of nine members and is headed by a board where Hercilia is the president. The businesses that the members of the communal bank carry out are varied; among them, there are: blankets sales, neighborhood store, auto parts sales, food sales, pictures sales, and slippers sales.

The loan they will take out will benefit small micro-enterprises where Hercilia is a member of. She indicates that she joined Pro Mujer by an invitation of a friend from the institution, more than five years ago. Today, she has a neighborhood store business. She makes known that she learned this business several years ago on her own initiative.
 
The loan she will now take out is to increase capital by the purchase of wholesale cookies, sodas, and sweets that she will acquire from female wholesalers from the city of El Alto and subsequently sell in her retail space. This way of working allows her to generate resources to support her family financially, since she lives in a common-law marriage and has two children.

When she is asked about what she likes about Pro Mujer, she replies that it's because of the loans granted and the health field offered by the institution.

loans.use: to buy wholesale cookies, sodas, and sweets.

loans.name: Luz Elena

texts.es: Luz es una emprendedora confeccionista de prendas de vestir que trabajo por muchos años en el taller de su hermana en donde aprendió este arte, pero al empoderarse de todo el manejo del negocio decidió iniciar su propio taller en el cual tiene seis años de estar funcionando con excelentes resultados.  Sus principales clientes se encuentran en una población llamada Baranoa ubicada en el Departamento del Atlántico, ellos pueden llegar hasta su taller y solicitar sus costuras de acuerdo a sus gustos y preferencia, sin embargo Luz desea ofrecer el servicio de confección a todo costo, para ello está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con la finalidad de invertir en telas e insumos como botones, correderas, hilos, pellones y accesorios. Su meta a largo plazo es agrandar su taller y contratar empleados.
texts.en:
Luz is an enterprising seamstress. She worked for many years in her sister's shop, developing her skills, but as she became experienced in the business she opted to open her own shop which she's kept for six years now, with excellent results.

Her main clients come from the town of Baranoa, department of Atlántico, and they are currently offered custom sewing services according to their tastes and preferences. 

Luz, nevertheless, wants to offer services at fixed prices that include the cost of all supplies. This is why she is applying for this Kiva loan, her first with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, she will  purchase fabrics and supplies such as buttons, zippers, threads, lining fabrics, and accessories.

Her goal for the future is to expand her shop and hire employees.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and supplies such as buttons, zippers, threads, lining fabrics, and accessories.

loans.name: Rosibel María

texts.es: Rosibel de 38 años, reside en compañía de su cónyuge y sus tres hijos en el municipio de Baranoa, en donde ejerce su actividad comercial de venta de carnes frías a sus vecinos y conocidos.  Su principal motivación para iniciar su propio negocio fue apoyar a su cónyuge con los gastos del hogar, por eso todos los días está disponible para ofrecerle a sus clientes los productos cárnicos con comodidad de pago y a buenos precios.  Su entrega y dedicación han permitido tener éxito en su negocio y actualmente está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para invertir en surtido como salchichas, chorizos y jamones.  Con esta inversión pretende mejorar sus ingresos y ofrecer bienestar a su familia.
texts.en:
Rosibel is 38 years old, and she lives with her husband and their three children in the city of Baranoa, where she makes a living selling fried meat to her neighbors and acquaintances. Her main motivation to start her own business was to support her husband with the expenses of the household. For this reason, she is available to offer her customers meat products with convenient payment methods and at good prices. 

Her effort and dedication has enabled her to be successful in her business, and currently she is applying for a credikiva, her first financing done with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will buy an assortment of sausages, pork sausages, and ham, and with this she hopes to improve her income and improve the well-being of her family.

loans.use: to buy an assortment of sausages, pork sausages, and ham.

loans.name: Hilda Monserrate

texts.es:
EL Grupo De Crédito Esperanza y Progreso se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía, que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla
En este lugar vive la señorita Hilda, tiene 45 años de edad,  es soltera y vive en casa de una hermana. 
Doña Hilda es una mujer que siempre le ha gustado ganarse la vida trabajando en una labor que le encanta como la cocina,  ella es la encargada del bar de la escuela en la ciudad, allí vende alimentos que ella prepara de la manera más saludable para que los niños tengan muy buena alimentación, ella varía el menú todos los días para no cansar a los niños, allí también ella les vende almuerzos a los maestros que laboran en la institución con lo cual le queda más ganancias. Son  10 años con su negocio el cual le permite ganarse la vida y ayudar con los gastos en casa de su hermana.
Este crédito lo va a emplear para comprar víveres, platos, vasos y otras cosa que necesita. Esta desde el inicio  en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque gracias a  los créditos ella empezó su negocio. Sus sueños son seguir adelante mejorando con la ayuda de los créditos.
texts.en:
The Esperanza y Progreso communal loan group meets every two weeks in Montecristi canton, known for its rich precolonial culture and for its crafts, which are known nationally and internationally.  It's also home to the famous palm straw hats. 

Hilda lives in this place. She is 45 years old, single, and lives in her sister's house.

Hilda is a woman who has always liked to earn her living doing work she loves, such as cooking. She is in charge of the school snack bar. There, she sells foods that she makes in the most healthful way so that the children have good nutrition. She varies the menu every day so the children don't get tired of it. There, she also sells lunches to the teachers who work at the school, from which she has more earnings. She has had her business for 10 years, which allows her to earn her living and help with the expenses in her sister's house.

This loan will be used to purchase groceries, dishes, glasses and other things she needs. She has been in the communal loan group since the beginning and she likes it because, thanks to the loans, she began her business. Her dream is to continue improving with the help of the loans.

loans.use: to purchase groceries, plates, glasses, etc.

loans.name: Maria Esmeralda

texts.es: María tiene 24 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su esposo y sus 3 pequeños hijos de 8 años, 4 años y el más pequeño de 1 año de edad. Es una joven muy dedica a su negocio ya que gracias a esto aporta al hogar es así como está sacando adelante a sus hijos, también el esposo aporta al hogar para que no les falte nada a los pequeños porque están de mucho cuido. María siempre buscando lo mejor para su familia decidió desde hace 2 años dedicarse a la crianza de conejos, actividad que le permite obtener ingresos económicos y cuidar de sus hijos, ella ha observado que tiene el espacio suficiente para instalar una pequeña granja de pollos, ya que se ha dado cuenta que sus ingresos no alcanzan a cubrir los gastos, por lo que desea tener una fuente de ingresos más fuerte, para lo cual solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: pollos, vitaminas y concentrado para que así aumenten sus ganancias, y de esta manera apoyar más a la economía de su familia.
texts.en:
Maria is 24 years old and lives in a residence of her own together with her husband and 3 small children ages 8 and 4, along with the youngest one who's 1 year old.  Maria is very young and dedicated to her business, as it's due to her business that she's able to support her household and provide for her children.  Her husband also supports the family so that their children lack for nothing as they need a lot of care.  

Maria is always looking out for her family and wants the best for them.  She decided 2 years ago to start raising rabbits, a line of work which has allowed her to earn income and care for her children.  She's noticed that she has sufficient space to set up a small chicken farm, as she's realized that her income isn't sufficient to cover her costs.  Because she wants to have a stronger source of income, she's requesting a loan from Apoyo Integral to buy chickens, vitamins, and feed pellets to bolster her earnings, and, in doing so, better support her family financially.

loans.use: buy chickens, vitamins, and feed pellets to set up a small chicken farm

loans.name: Jefferson Fabian

texts.es:
EL Grupo de Crédito Esperanza y Progreso se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía, que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla
En este lugar vive el señor Jefferson, tiene 19 años y mantiene una relación de unión libre y de esta relación tiene un bebé de 5 meses de nacido. Su mujer es ama de casa.
Don Jefferson es un joven muy trabajador que desde pequeño aprendió el arte de la ebanistería, actualmente junto a su padre  tienen  un taller de ebanistería en la localidad, allí  elaboran muebles de sala, comedor,  camas, anaqueles, puertas y todo lo que sus clientes le soliciten, los clientes los prefieren por la calidad de sus trabajos y por la seriedad a la hora de entregar sus obras, el lleva 5 años en esta actividad la cual le permite ganarse el sustento diario para él y su familia, el agradece a quienes le ayudan para que el pueda recibir este crédito.
Este crédito es para comprar madera, pinturas y otras materias primas necesarias  para elaborar los muebles. Lleva más de un año en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los  créditos le son de mucha ayuda. Sus sueños son seguir mejorando cada vez más su taller.
texts.en:
The Esperanza y Progreso communal loan group meets every two weeks in Montecristi canton, known for its rich precolonial culture and for its crafts, which are known nationally and internationally.  It's also home to the famous palm straw hats. 

Jefferson lives here. He is 19 years old, in a common-law marriage, and in this relationship has a 5-month-old baby. His wife is a homemaker. 

Jefferson is a very hard-working young man who, when he was little, learned the art of furniture-making. Currently, he and his father have a furniture-making shop in their town. They make living room and dining room furniture, beds, shelves, doors and all sorts of furniture that their customers order. Their customers prefer them for the quality of their work and for their responsibility at the time of completing the work. He has been doing this work for 5 years, which allows him to earn the daily sustenance for his family. He is grateful to those who help him so that he can get this loan.

This loan is to purchase wood, paint, and other raw materials needed to make the furniture. He has been in the communal loan group for more than one year, and he likes it because the loans are very helpful to him. His dream is to continue improving his workshop.

loans.use: to purchase wood, paint and other raw materials.

loans.name: Flor De Cafe Group

texts.es: Don Serapio,  tiene 57 años de edad, esta casado, reside en una comunidad del municipio de Intibucá en compañía de su esposa e hijos.  Lleva aproximadamente 17 años de tener sus propios cultivos de café, el cual vende en grano oro en el mercado local. Esta actividad es  su fuente de ingresos para la familia. Don Serapio esta solicitando un prestamo en forma grupal, este lo invertirá en la compra de abonos, fertilizantes y pago de  limpieza de su finca de café, con el fin de aumentar producción. Su meta es obtener más ganancias para poder mejorar su vivienda. El grupo que ha formado se llama Flor de Café, integrado por 8 personas que viven en la misma zona y se dedican a la agricultura también. El prestamo total que solicitan es por 72,000 lempiras para darle mantenimiento a sus cultivos. En la foto están:  a la izquierda de pie esta Crespinio, Jose, Alexis y Serapio a la derecha y sentados esta Rigoberto, Adrian, María y Marbin a la derecha.
texts.en:
Don Serapio is 57 years old, and he is married. He lives in a neighborhood in the city of Intibucá with his wife and children. He has been farming his own coffee crop for approximately 17 years. He sells his products as golden beans (unroasted) in the local market. This occupation is the source of income for his family. Don Serapio is requesting a loan as part of a group. He will use his loan to buy manure, fertilizer, and to pay to clean his coffee farm, all with the ultimate goal of increasing his production. His goal is to earn more profit to be able to improve his home. 

The group he is part of is called Flor de Café, comprised of 8 people who live in the same area and who all make a living in agriculture as well. The total size of the loan is for 72,000 lempiras to care for and maintain their crops. In the photo standing from left to right are Crespinio, Jose, Alexis, and Serapio, and sitting from left to right are Rigoberto, Adrian, María, and Marbin.

loans.use: to buy manure, fertilizer, and to pay to clean his coffee farm.

loans.name: Gina

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito San Juan Eudes se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía, que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.
En este lugar vive la señora Gina, tiene 37 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 12 y 9 años que estudian en colegio y escuela. Su esposo es chofer.
Doña Gina es una mujer muy luchadora, ella se dedica al comercio  vende ropa de todo tipo y productos de Yanbal (productos de belleza, perfumería, cosméticos y accesorios) trabaja todos los días por las mañanas ya que a esa hora se le hace más fácil salir a visitar a sus clientes,  ella entrega todos sus productos a crédito y  cobra cada quince días, lleva mas de 15 años dedicada a esta actividad con la cual sale adelante.
Este crédito es para comprar ropa, cremas, perfumes, bisutería y otros productos. Lleva más de 17 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por los beneficios y ayuda que les brinda la institución. Sus sueños son que sus hijos tengan una buena educación.
texts.en:
The San Juan Eudes communal loan group meets every two weeks in Montecristi canton, known for its rich precolonial culture and for its crafts, which are known nationally and internationally.  It's also home to the famous palm straw hats. 

Gina lives in this place. She is 37 years old, married, and in this relationship has two children, ages 12 and 9, who go to secondary and primary school. Her husband is a driver.

Gina is a very determined woman. She works in sales, selling all sorts of clothing and Yanbal products (beauty products, perfumes, cosmetics, and accessories). She works every day in the morning since at this time it is easier to go out and visit her customers. She leaves all the products on credit and collects every two weeks. She has been doing this job for more than 15 years, with which she gets ahead.

This loan is to purchase clothing, creams, perfumes, costume jewelry and other products. She has been in the communal loan group for more than 17 years and she likes it for the benefits and help that the institution offers. Her dream is that her children get a good education.

loans.use: to purchase clothing, creams, perfumes, costume jewelry, etc.

loans.name: Quiteria Natividad

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito San Juan Eudes se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía, que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.
En este lugar vive señora Quiteria, tiene 33 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen un hijo de 15 años que estudia en colegio. Su esposo es chofer.
Doña Quiteria es una mujer que le gusta sentirse activa y generar sus propios recursos, ella hace 13 años con el primer crédito que recibió de la fundación surtió en su casa una pequeña tienda de viveras, allí vende todo tipo de víveres, colas, legumbres, aguas y ciertos útiles escolares, con cada crédito ella va comprando más variedad de productos lo cual le sirve mucho ya que así ella cada vez gana más clientes, trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 20h00 y a veces hasta más tarde, su hijo y su marido le ayuda en su negocio cuando ellos pueden, pero por lo general es ella la que siempre pasa en su local. 
Este crédito lo va a emplear para comprar víveres para surtir aun más su negocio. Está en el Grupo De Crédito  desde hace 13 años y le gusta porque con un crédito empezó su negocio. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
TheSan Juan Eudes communal loan group meets every two weeks in Montecristi canton, known for its rich precolonial culture and for its crafts, which are known nationally and internationally.  It's also home to the famous palm straw hats. 

Quiteria lives in this place. She is 33 years old, married, and from this relationship has a 15-year-old son who is a secondary school student. Her husband is a driver.

Quiteria is a woman who likes to be active and generate her own income. Thirteen years ago, with the first loan that she got from the Foundation, she stocked a small grocery store in her house. There, she sells all sorts of groceries, soft drinks, vegetables, water, and some school supplies. With each loan, she has purchased more variety of products which serves her a lot since it is in this way that she continues getting more customers. She works every day from 6:00 am to 8:00 pm and sometimes later. Her son and husband help her with her business when they can, but in general she is the one who is always at the shop. 

This loan will be used to purchase groceries to stock her business even more. She has been in the communal loan group for 13 years and she likes it because she began her business with a loan. Her dream is to give her family the best.

loans.use: to purchase groceries.

loans.name: Monserrate Elizabeth

texts.es:
EL Grupo de Crédito Esperanza y Progreso se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía, que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.
En este lugar vive la señora Monserrate, tiene 53 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene tres hijos mayores de edad, la menor  estudia en Universidad y es la que aun  vive en su casa.  Su esposo es albañil.
Doña Monserrate es una mujer que  le gusta trabajar para ayudarle a su hija en los estudios ya que sus gastos son muchos, ella  se dedica al comercio, vende  ropa de todo tipo y zapatillas de catalogo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta, ella sale tres días por semana, también vende en su casa y su hija le ayuda vendiendo en la universidad a sus compañeras, dejan a crédito y cobran cada ocho  días, lleva 4 años que se dedica a esta actividad la cual la mejora con la ayuda de los créditos razón por lo cual está muy agradecida con la institución y con las personas que le ayudan con los créditos.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar pantalones, blusas, camisetas y zapatillas de catalogo. Esta desde el inicio en el Grupo de Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le permiten salir adelante. Sus sueños son que su hija sea una profesional.
texts.en:
The Esperanza y Progreso communal loan group meets every two weeks in Montecristi canton, known for its rich precolonial culture and for its crafts, which are known nationally and internationally.  It's also home to the famous palm straw hats. 

Monserrate lives in this place. She is 53 years old, married, and from this relationship has three adult children. The youngest one is a student at the university and she is the one who still lives in their home. Her husband is a construction worker.

Monserrate is a woman who likes to work to help her daughter with her studies, since the expenses are high. She works in sales, she sells all sorts of clothing and sandals from catalogs. She sells from door to door, she goes out three days per week and also sells in her house and her daughter helps her by selling to her classmates at the university. They leave the items on credit and collect weekly. She has been doing this work for 4 years, which she improves with the help of the loans, so she is very grateful to the institution and with the people who help her with the loans.

This loan will be used to purchase pants, blouses, shirts and shoes from a catalog. She has been in the communal loan group since the beginning because the loans let her get ahead. Her dream is that her daughter becomes a professional.

loans.use: to purchase pants, blouses, shirts, and sandals.

loans.name: Jose Feliciano

texts.es: José tiene 23 años de edad es un joven que siempre demuestra su espíritu de superación, actualmente habita en vivienda de familiar gracias a ellos el ha logrado salir adelante. José desde hace 16 años se dedica a la elaboración de artesanías como artículos decorativos y otros así como también se dedica a la agricultura al cultivo de maíz y frijol gracias a que su padre le enseño el sobrevive de esto y el sale a comercializar las artesanías y vende frijol y maíz y lo demás lo deja para consumo es así como este joven se gana la vida humildemente, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: alambre, pintura de todo color y tule etc., para seguir en la elaboración de artesanías.
texts.en:
José, age 23, is a young man who always demonstrates his indomitable spirit. Currently, he lives in the home of family members; and thanks to them he has been able to get ahead. 

José has been making artisanal crafts such as decorative articles and others for 16 years.  He also works in agriculture.  He grows corn and beans because his father taught him how, and this is how he survives. 

He goes out to sell the crafts and he sells beans and corn, leaving some for his own consumption. This is how this young man humbly earns a living; and that is why he is requesting a loan with FUSAI to invest in wire, paint of all colors, reeds, etc., in order to continue making artisanal crafts.

loans.use: to invest in wire, paint of all colors, reeds, etc., in order to continue making artisanal crafts.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in juices, cookies, sweet breads, candies, and basic products.

loans.name: Yesenia

texts.es: Doña Yesenia se dedica a la venta de ropa ambulante, solicita un  préstamo de $500 para comprar mayor cantidad de ropa para posteriormente venderla y ampliar su mercado y de esta manera mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en: Yesenia sells clothes in an itinerant manner.  She is requesting a loan for $500 to buy a bigger quantity of clothes to later sell.  She will expand her market, and she will improve her earnings in this way.

loans.use: to buy clothes wholesale.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.es: Josefina se dedica a la confección y venta de artesanías hechas a mano, necesita un préstamo de $250 para la compra del material necesario para la confección de las mismas, esto le permitirá aumentar su participación en el mercado artesanal.
texts.en: Josefina makes and sells handicrafts made by hand.  She needs a loan for $250 to buy the material needed to make the handicrafts.  This will allow her to expand her participation in the handicraft market.

loans.use: to buy material to make handicrafts.

loans.name: Sita

texts.en:
Sita is a rural woman of 31 years old. She lives with her husband and three sons in a small village called Chuakhola of Falakata. She is illiterate but can sign her name only. Her sons are studying in classes 4, 6, and 8.

Sita’s husband has been engaged in agriculture for many years. He cultivates different crops and sells the gathered harvest in the local markets. After managing all household work, Sita assists her husband in his agricultural work. Now they are thinking of cultivating a crop which is profitable and in demand in all seasons. So they have decided to grow paddy on their farmland. For having inadequate capital, they need some financial help. So Sita has applied for a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner).

The requested loan amount will help Sita to purchase fertilizer, seeds and other farm resources for paddy cultivation. They hope it will be a lucrative business as the crop has a tremendous demand in the market. It will greatly help this family to generate more income for the rest of the year.  Sita dreams to purchasing more farmland in future to expand their agricultural business.  

She thanks her lenders.

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizers and other farm resources for paddy cultivation.

loans.name: Najima

texts.en:
Najima is a 26-year-old humble and hardworking woman from Falakata, India. Her family is comprised of her husband and two children (one son and one daughter). Both of them are preschoolers. They live in their small kachha house (made of mud, straw and bamboo).  Her husband is engaged with a centering business.  
 
Najima’s husband's income is inconsistent.  So to provide a better living, Najima has been engaged in cattle breeding for the last few years.  She started her business with the purchase of one cow.  She supplies milk to her neighbors and earns income for her family. Now this business is a strong financial support to the family.  As the prices of essential goods are increasing by leaps and bounds, she has to work hard so that she can be able to generate more income.  She has decided to purchase one more cow and expand her business.

For this reason she is seeking a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase a dairy cow in terms of getting more milk for sale.  This will enable her to provide good education to her children and she will be able to fulfill her future dream of making a concrete house for them. 

She thanks her lenders.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow for her milk-selling business.

loans.name: Khateja

texts.en:
Khateja is an inhabitant of Falakata. She is 40 years old and resides there with her husband and three children (two sons and one daughter). Her two sons are engaged with some income-generating jobs like daily laborer and her daughter got married. 

Khateja's husband is a driver by trade and Khateja has been engaged with a firewood-selling business to help her husband financially. Her potential customers are her neighbors. She purchases logs from her village and neighboring villages and cuts them into small pieces to resell to her neighbors. There is great demand for firewood in her locality because firewood is used as a fuel for cooking in rural areas. But due to lack of capital she cannot expand her business. 

Khateja, who is a sensitive and intelligent lady, understands that the only way out is to access some financial help through which she can expand her business and thereby earn more income. Thus she has applied for a loan from Kiva’s partner BJS to purchase more logs for this business. 

She is very much hopeful that this investment will fetch her more income to fulfill her dream of purchasing farmland in the future for agricultural business, an additional income-generating source. 

She thanks her generous lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more logs to expand her firewood business.

loans.name: Lilibeth Aracelly

texts.es: Lilibeth se dedica a la venta de productos lácteos, embutidos y mercancía seca, necesita un préstamo de $250 para incrementar el inventario y ofrecer más y mejores productos a sus clientes.
texts.en: Lilibeth sells dairy products, cold cuts, and dried merchandise.  She needs a loan for $250 in order to increase her inventory and to offer more and better products to her customers.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Roderick Nodier

texts.es: Roderick es un emprendedor que se dedica a la cría de cerdos, necesita un préstamo de $500 para la compra de alimentos, vacunas y medicamentos para sus animales y de esta manera ofrecer un mejor producto a sus clientes.
texts.en: Roderick is an entrepreneur who raises pigs.  He needs a loan for $500 to buy feed, vaccines, and medication for his animals.  This way he will offer his customers a better product.

loans.use: to buy feed and medication for his herd of pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in a new griddle to make tortillas and pupusas and in this way meet the demand for the products.

loans.name: Bandana

texts.en:
Bandana is a 41-year-old married woman from Falakata.  She is a homemaker and is blessed with two sons. She is illiterate and can sign her name only.  One of her son is studying in grade 12 and the other one works in a small garage.

Bandana's husband is a farmer by trade.  He has been working on his own land for many years.  He mainly grows paddy along with seasonal vegetables. Bandana looks after her household work, and after that she helps her husband in his farm activities.  The couple works tirelessly to provide financial sustenance to their family. They have gained many good customers due to their polite and simple behavior and good quality crops at a cheaper rate.  Like the other farmers they also dreams of extending and improving their productions.

That is why Bandana is requesting a loan for the purchase of good quality paddy seeds, compost, and fertilizer.  This loan will be a great help because it will allow her to maintain a work rhythm and ensure a vigorous crop, so that she can provide a good well-being to her family.

She is very much thankful to her generous lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies for paddy cultivation.

loans.name: Mercedes Agripina

texts.es:
EL Grupo De Crédito Esperanza y Progreso se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía, que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla
En este lugar vive la señora Mercedes, tiene 62 años está casada y de esta relación ha  procreado seis hijos mayores de edad e independientes. Su marido  es comerciante.
Doña Mercedes junto a su marido tienen una tienda de víveres en su casa, allí venden todo tipo de productos como granos, carnes, detergentes, aguas en bidón, sodas, helados, legumbres y productos de bazar y papelería. Trabajan todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 19h00, ahí pasa junto  a su esposo brindando la mejor atención a sus clientes, lleva más de 4  años con su negocio el cual lo comenzó con uno de los créditos que recibió del grupo por lo cual está muy agradecida ya que así se ganan la vida.
Este crédito es para comprar víveres para surtir su tienda y así ganar más clientela. Es socia fundadora del Grupo de Crédito y le agrada por la ayuda que recibe con los créditos. Sus sueños son seguir mejorando su  tienda.
texts.en:
The group "Credit for Hope and Progress"  meets every 15 days in Cantón Montecristi, known for its rich pre colonial culture and for its artisans which are recognized at a national and international level. It is the home of famous straw hats. Mercedes lives in this town. She is 62 years old, is married and from her marriage she has six children who are grown up and independent. Her husband is a merchant. Mercedes, together with her husband, has a grocery store in her home. From there they sell all types of typical products such as grains, meats, soaps, bottled water, sodas, ice cream, vegetables and a variety of products and stationary. 

They work everyday from 6am to 7pm. Mercedes works together with her husband to provide the best service to their customers. They have spent more than 4 years working on their business which they began with one of the loans that they received from the group for which they are very thankful now that this is how they make a living. This loan is to purchase food to supply their store so they can gain more customers. She is a founding member of the lending group and she is thankful for the help that she has received through the loans. Her dream is to continue improving her store.

loans.use: to purchase food.

loans.name: Primavera Group

texts.es: Rosa, tiene 26 años de edad, esta casada, tiene dos hijos, reside en una aldea del municipio de Gracias, Lempira. Rosa siempre se ha dedicado a la agricultura, con el cultivo de café, maíz y frijol  lleva mas de 5 años de tener su propia parcela de café el cual vende ya despulpado y lavado en el mercado local.  El prestamo que solicita es el tercer ciclo con la institución y lo ha solicitado en forma grupal. El cual lo invertirá en la compra de abono para fertilizar la finca de café. Su plan es obtener más ganancias para seguir creciendo. El grupo al que pertenece se llama Primavera, integrado por 4 integrantes que se dedican al cultivo de café y han decidido solicitar un prestamo total por 32,000 lempiras para fertilizar sus fincas. En la foto esta Matilde a la izquierda, Delmi, Rosa y Alba a la derecha.
texts.en: Rosa is 26 years old, married, has two children, and lives in a village in the municipality of Gracias, Lempira. Rosa has always worked in agriculture, growing coffee, corn and beans. She has had her own plot with coffee for more than 5 years, which she sells depulped and washed in the local market. The loan that she is requesting is the third loan cycle with the institution and she has requested it as a group. It will be invested in the purchase of manure to fertilize the coffee plantation. Her plan is to get more earnings to continue growing. The group to which she belongs is called Primavera and is made up of 4 members who work growing coffee and have decided to ask for a loan of a total of 32,000 lempiras to fertilize their farms. In the photo, Matilde is on the left. Delmi, Rosa and Alma are on the right.

loans.use: to purchase manure to fertilize the coffee plantation.

loans.name: Viito

texts.en: Viito is married to one wife. Four of his five children attend school. He is applying for a loan of 1,200,000 UGX. He has been borrowing from UGAFODE Microfinance Ltd (MDI). He is an agriculturalist who rears livestock and farms coffee, beans, and bananas. He works for 10 hours a day and six days a week. He started the business in 1984 in order to generate income for his household. The loan purpose is to buy chemicals and mulches for his plantation. Most of his clients are people in Bushenyi District. He hopes to own a large coffee and banana plantation so he can produce more for sale. He is always faced with challenges of price fluctuations, banana bacterial wilt, and high prices for agricultural inputs. He is a hard-working person.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs of chemicals and mulches

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy chickens as well as vitamins and concentrated feed for them.

loans.name: Liseth Katherine

texts.es:
EL Grupo De Crédito Esperanza y Progreso se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía, que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla
En este lugar vive la señorita Liseth, tiene 23 años de edad,  es soltera y vive en casa de los padres. Ella está por ingresar este año a la universidad y continuar con sus estudios superiores. Este es su primer ciclo en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos son rápidos.
Doña Liseth es una mujer que le gusta valerse por sí misma y así ir ahorrando para continuar con sus estudios que para ella son lo más importante, ella con la ayuda de su mamá se dedican al comercio, venden ropa de todo tipo, ella sale a recorrer por la ciudad unos tres días por semana, mientras que su mamá también lo hace pero más cerca de su hogar y también le ayuda vendiendo en su casa, lleva casi 3 años dedicada a esta actividad con la cual ha ido ahorrando para los gastos que tendrá en la universidad. 
Este crédito es para comprar pantalones, blusas, camisas y otras prendas. Sus sueños son terminar sus estudios y tener un mejor porvenir.
texts.en:
The group "Credit for Hope and Progress" meets every 15 days in Cantón Montecristi, known for its rich pre colonial culture and for its artisans which are recognized at a national and international level. It is the home of famous straw hats. Liseth lives in this town. She is 23 years old, is single and lives in her parent's home. She is preparing to attend university this year and will continue with her advanced studies. This is her second cycle with the credit group and she likes it because the loans are fast. 

Liseth is a woman who likes to take care of herself and she is saving to continue with her studies, which are the most important thing to her. Liseth, with help from her mother, works in commerce selling all types of clothing. She travels to the city to sell three days a week while her mom does the same thing, but closer to their home. She also helps her to sell from their home. She has spent almost 3 years dedicated to this activity through which she has saved for the expenses that she will have at the university. This loan is to purchase pants, blouses, shirts and other clothes. Her dream is to complete her studies and to have a better future.

loans.use: to purchase pants, blouses, shirts and other clothes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in beams, metal sheeting, screws, and windows, in order to achieve his dream of completing the construction of his house.

loans.name: Flor Nataly

texts.es:
Flor es una joven estudiante de la carrera de Administración Industrial, carrera que decidió estudiar porque desde pequeña le ha gustado administrar sus cosas y propinas, ahora ve la gran importancia que tiene esa carrera. Siente que la beneficiará de manera tal que podrá ejercer hacia la vida empresarial, tomando decisiones y oportunidades y no solo eso, sino también el apoyo a su familia en lo económico.

Ella está estudiando Administración Industrial desde hace un año y medio, está a la mitad de su carrera porque aún le falta un año y medio para poder culminarla. 

El principal obstáculo que se le presentó es que su madre se enfermó y su padre no cuenta con un trabajo estable, por lo que no cuenta con el dinero suficiente para poder pagar sus estudios, poniendo en riesgo la continuidad de su carrera. Es por ello que recurre a KIVA para que le puedan brindar el apoyo necesario y así no trunque sus sueños de ser una gran empresaria. 

Cuando culmine su carrera piensa trabajar en distintos rubros de su carrera, como son: el área de almacén, área de finanzas y sobre todo entrar al área de producción.

Ella va a utilizar el préstamo para poder cancelar la deuda pendiente que le impedía continuar estudiando y sus padres no se preocuparán. Hará que su madre pueda recuperarse completamente de su enfermedad, porque no tendrá que realizar trabajos que perjudiquen su salud. 

El préstamo también la ayudará a cumplir uno de sus sueños y objetivos, la satisfacción de poder trabajar y seguir estudiando pero en otras universidades. Ella se siente muy bien porque ve que hay personas buenas que ayudan a la gente que necesitan o pasan por esta situación.

Su mayor sueño es trabajar en una gran empresa siendo Ingeniera Industrial, gracias a la convalidación de sus estudios con la universidad.

Flor quiere expresarles unas palabras a KIVA: "Me siento muy motivada a seguir estudiando, y sigan apoyando porque hay más chicos como yo que necesitan este apoyo. Soy una persona responsable y puntual, que acepto y me comprometo a estudiar y ha no defraudarlos. Mil gracias por su apoyo.
texts.en:
Flor is a young student studying Industrial Administration.  She decided to study this profession because ever since she was little she has liked managing her things and her pocket money.  She now sees that this career is very important.  She feels that she will benefit in such a way that she will be able to engage in the world of business, making decisions, and having opportunities.  It is not just this.  She will also help her family financially.

She has been studying Industrial Administration for a year and a half.  She is half way through her degree studies.  She still needs a year and a half to be able to finish her degree.  

The main obstacle that occurred is that her mother got sick, and her father does not have steady work.  Therefore, she does not have enough money to be able to pay for her studies.  This is putting the continuity of her degree studies at risk.

That is why she turns to Kiva so that they are able to provide the necessary support.  This way her dreams of being a great businesswoman will not be cut short.

When she completes her degree she plans on working in different areas of her field such as storage and finances.  Above all, she plans to enter into the area of production.

She will use the loan to be able to pay the debt that she has, which prevented her from continuing her education and that her parents will not have to worry about.  This will let her mother recuperate completely from her illness because she will not have to do the jobs that impair her health.

The loan will also help her to fulfill one of her dreams and objectives, which is the satisfaction of being able to work and continue studying in other universities.  She feels very good because she sees that there are good people who help people who need it or are going through this situation.

Her biggest dream is to work for a big business as an Industrial Engineer, thanks to the validation of her university studies.

Flor wishes to say some words to Kiva.  “I feel very motivated to continue studying.  Keep helping because there are a lot of young people like me who need this support.  I am a responsible and punctual person.  Approve me, and I promise to study and not disappoint you.  Many thanks for your support.”

loans.use: to pay her current debt, to continue studying Industrial Administration, and to come to work at a great, renown business.

loans.name: Semu

texts.en:
Semu is a 39-year-old married man with six children, all attending school in Kasese, Uganda. 

He owns a retail shop of general merchandise and is also a coffee buyer and seller. He began the business so as to manage his family and educate his children. 

He is seeking for credit to buy coffee for selling. He faces the challenges of high rental fees, licenses, and transport costs. 

He has a dream of expanding his business into nearby centres to serve his customers.

loans.use: to buy coffee for selling

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a 38-year-old married man with five children. Three of his children attend school. He lives in Kasese, Uganda. He sells salted fish to earn a living. He also earns additional income from crop farming. He has been in business since 2005. He began the business to boost the family's welfare and to educate his children. He intends to use the money to buy more salted fish for resale. 

The photo was taken on a market day and includes other people in the background. David is sitting at the front of the photo.

loans.use: to buy more salted fish for resale.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 25 years old and married with one child, living in Kasese, Uganda. 

She operates a retail shop, having ventured into business to generate income for her family's sustainability. She has operated the shop for two years and complains of limited capital. 

Rose desires to build a house for her family. That's why she is asking for a loan: to buy construction materials like cement, sand, and bricks to build a house.

loans.use: to buy construction materials like cement, sand, and bricks to build a house.

loans.name: Kolonba Group

texts.fr: Cet homme de grand taille  sur la photo et qui a aussi ses mains sur les béliers est Lassine ; Agé de 38 ans marié père de 8 enfants âgés de 3 à 18 ans dont une fille scolarisée. il pratique l’embouche ovine (moutons) il y a 10 ans, peut gagner un revenu mensuel de 7500f sur chaque mouton embouché, mais sa capacité de financement ne lui permet pas de satisfaire ses besoins familiale donc il fait recours au prêt du RMCR en s’unissant a un groupe de 7 membre en fin d’augmenter le nombre de mouton à emboucher pour gagner plus d’argent et bien nourrit ses 8 enfant ; Ses embussions est tel que sa fille réussisse dans ses études.
texts.en:
The tall man in the photo who has his hands on the ram is Lassine. He is  38 years old, married, and the father of eight children aged from 3 to 18 years, among whom one daughter is in school. He works at fattening sheep and has been doing that for 10 years. He can earn a monthly income of 7,500 francs on each sheep he fattens, but his capacity to finance his business does not allow him to satisfy the needs of his family. 

So, he has turned to RMCR, together with a group of seven members, in order to increase the number of sheep to be raised and earn enough money to feed his eight children well. His hope is that his daughter will succeed in her studies.

loans.use: to buy sheep  and then fatten and resell them

loans.name: Miroslava

texts.en:
Miroslava is married and has two sons. She has a small business. All family members are involved in the business.

Miroslava grows cucumbers and tomatoes in a greenhouse. Also, she has additional income from selling household chemicals, which she brings from Hungary. 

Miroslava is a very hardworking person. She plans to build a new greenhouse in the future.

Miroslava is asking for a loan of 30,000 UAH to buy seeds, fertilizers, plastic film, and wood for her greenhouse. The loan will help her to have a good harvest and increase the family income.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, plastic film, and wood for the greenhouse

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a toilet, sand, cement and pay for labor.

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en: Shirley is the mother of an 8-year-old daughter. Shirley sells shoes to make money. She needs a loan to buy shoes for her business. She works from Sunday to Saturday. She pays rent and is the only source of support for her family. Shirley hopes you can help her.

loans.use: to buy shoes for her business

loans.name: Olena

texts.en:
Olena is divorced and has two teenage daughters. 

Olena works at the market. She sells groceries and dairy products. Olena has had a car accident that brought some difficulties to her life. Nevertheless, she was able to recuperate and restore her job.

Olena is asking for a loan of 10,000 UAH to change an old wooden floor to new laminate. She also wants to warm up the floor. 

Olena hopes to do more renovations at her house soon.

loans.use: to get rid of an old floor and install modern laminate

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary works as a teacher, and she also rents some rooms. Mary is a divorced woman who lives alone. She needs a loan to fix a room at her house. Mary is healthy and responsible. She hopes you can trust her. She works hard. In the future Mary would like to retire from teaching and dedicate all her time to her business renting rooms because she feels better doing that. Mary is at her house in the picture.

loans.use: to fix a room at her house

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn has a corn field which she has tilled for more than five years now. She is 36 years old, single and lives in Pagadian City. Evelyn finds pleasure in doing her farming activities and earning income for her family. 

As a microfinance member of PMPC, she has sought financial help to purchase 10 bags of fertilizers to start up her farming activities this cropping season. In the future, Evelyn wishes to become one of the suppliers of corn in her province.

loans.use: to purchase 10 bags of fertilizers

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en: Vilma is preparing for the harvest operations of her gardening activity. She wants to have enough supply of fertilizer and other materials needed to boost her production. She is borrowing a loan of 14,900 PHP to purchase three bags of fertilizers, three liters of pesticides and three dozen cellophanes. Vilma hopes to save enough for the education of her children.

loans.use: to purchase three bags of fertilizers, three liters of pesticides and three dozen cellophanes

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Dora

texts.es: Doña Dora tiene casa propia, necesita hacer mejoras en su vivienda, principalmente reforzar las ventanas  y otros detalles  Solicita un crédito de $250 para comprar los materiales y llevar a cabo este trabajo.
texts.en: Dora has her own house. She needs to make improvements on the house, mainly reinforcing the windows and other details. She is requesting a loan of $250 to buy materials and carry out this work.

loans.use: to buy material to make improvements on her house.

loans.name: Innocent

texts.en: Innocent is 31 years old and happily married with one wife. He has four children, ages 12, 9, 7, and 3. Three of his children attend school. He borrowed a loan of 4,000,000 UGX from UGAFODE Microfinance Ltd (MDI). He is primarily a farmer of coffee, and he also trades in shoes. He works for nine hours a day and six days a week.  He started the business in 2004 in order to generate income for his household. The loan purpose is to trade in shoes. Most of his clients are the general public. He hopes to be a leading seller of shoes in public markets. He is always faced with challenges of price fluctuations, high operating licenses, and taxes. He is a hard-working person.

loans.use: To buy more stock of shoes

loans.name: La Familia Del Sector Chicoj Group

texts.es:
Maria (la segunda del lado derecho) es una mujer de 32 años, vive en una comunidad del departamento de Sololá con sus tres hijos de las edades entre 2 y 4 años, para Maria la labor de todos los días es de gran bendición pues a través de ello genera sus ingresos y apoya a su esposo con los gastos de la casa, ella se dedica a la compra y venta de güipiles típicos, tiene quince años de  ejercer esta labor, pues lo aprendió con su querida madre, María por  vivir en una de las zonas más visitadas por turistas, tiene mayores posibilidades de mejorar sus ingresos con la venta de güipiles típicos, es por ello que con el afán de mejorar su trajes ha tomado la decisión de solicitar un préstamo junto a un grupo de señoras que tienen el mismo fin para poder comprar más güipiles de diferentes estilos, colores y precios para satisfacer mejor las necesidades de los socios.
El gran sueño de Maria es comprar un terreno donde puedan construir una casa más grande para sus hijos.
texts.en:
Maria (the second from the right) is a 32 year old woman. She lives in a community in the department of Sololá with her three children aged between 2 and 4 years old. For Maria her daily work is a great blessing as through it she generates her income and helps her husband with the household expenses.

She works buying and selling traditional shirts (güipiles). She has 15 years experience in this work and she learned it from her beloved mother. Because Maria lives in one of the most touristic areas she has greater possibilities of improving her income with the sales of traditional güipiles.

So with the desire to improve her inventory she is getting a loan together with a group of women who have the same goal. Then she can buy more güipiles of different styles, colors and prices to better satisfy the needs of her clients. Maria's big dream is to buy a piece of land where she can build a bigger house for her children.

loans.use: to buy and sell traditional clothing.

loans.name: Rasonara

texts.en:
Rasonara is a rural, married woman of 20 years. She lives with her husband at their own small hut in a small village of Falakata. She received education up to grade 9 while her husband has completed secondary level education.

Rasonara’s husband has been engaged in masonry work, but his income is barely enough to cover the family expenses. Being a housewife, Rasonara runs her animal husbandry after managing all the household work. She rears cows and sells cow milk in her local area to earn for her family. Her dairy milk is in demand in her area throughout the year, so she has decided to enhance her milk selling business for the family’s financial sustenance. She realizes that to make it possible, she has to increase the number of her cattle so that she can sell more milk and cow dung to satisfy her customers. To achieve the same, she needs some financial help as she lacks the adequate capital. So Rasonara has applied for a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner).

The requested loan amount will help Rasonara to purchase another dairy cow. It will greatly help her to generate more income by selling milk and cow dung also, which is used as fuel in rural areas. This will improve her family’s financial condition.  

She thanks her lenders.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow for her milk selling business.

loans.name: Shirly

texts.en:
Shirly signed up for her membership with PMPC and obtained the needed capital to start up a sari-sari store (convenience store) business. She is thankful for the capital that was extended to a small-time borrower like her. Shirly has been able to turn the tide in her favor and is making good sales these days. She wants to take advantage of this good fortune. 

Recently, she took out a loan to purchase one bag of white sugar, one bag of brown sugar, 15 dozen units of coffee, canned goods, milk, noodles, condiments and drinking soda. In the future, she hopes to build a decent home for her family.

loans.use: to purchase one bag of white sugar, one bag of brown sugar, 15 dozen units of coffee, canned goods, milk, noodles, condiments and drinking soda

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Florencia

texts.en:
Some time ago, Florencia learned of Paglaum MPC and the financial assistance it opens to a farmer like her in Bolinsong, Bonifacio-Tangub City, Misamis Occidental. She borrowed a loan to finance her rice production business. After several months, she was able to return her borrowed capital. 

To this day, Florencia feels she owes her good fortune to the Cooperative for having trusted her with the money she used to build her business. Recently, she borrowed a loan to purchase bags of fertilizer for the next cropping season. Florencia wishes to sustain her business and be able to supply rice in neighbouring towns.

loans.use: to purchase bags of fertilizers

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma is 63 years old, a widow, and has four adult children. She has always had enthusiasm for farming. She has cultivated their land in Dipolog City, Zamboanga del Norte and has yielded good earnings doing this type of work. 

Recently, she applied for a loan to purchase additional bags of fertilizers. This will ensure her higher yields this cropping season. Elma knows that she has to get things right to yield more income during this cropping season.

loans.use: to purchase additional bags of fertilizers

loans.name: Angela

texts.en:
Angela is originally from Brazil. She has been living in the United States for the past 10 years and currently resides with her husband and kids in New England. Five years ago, she started working in the cleaning industry and as a result was inspired to open up her own business.

Angela has had great success in obtaining a commercial contract. However, she has faced challenges in getting the finances necessary to grow her business. She is currently seeking a loan to purchase additional cleaning equipment so that she is able to extend her service to more clients.

loans.use: to purchase cleaning equipment required to operate her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to have working capital to expand her tax business and build credit

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en: Leonora has a collection of ornamental garden plants. She finds pleasure in doing her gardening activities and earning as well for her family. As a microfinance member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative, she sought financial help to purchase a variety of ornamental plants that she can grow and sell. In the future, Leonora wishes to become the supplier of flowers for neighboring towns.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of ornamental plants that she can grow and sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to obtain a license to sell property and casualty insurance

loans.name: Anita

texts.en: Anita has wide experience in farming. She has mastered farming activities from growing, caring and harvesting as well as earning income. Anita has supported her husband doing this type of work. Like a farmer, Anita has nurtured her membership with Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative and has maintained a good repayment record. She knows she can always turn to the cooperative for her financial needs. Recently, she applied for a loan to purchase bags of fertilizers and to pay labor costs for hauling of the area. Someday, Anita hopes to purchase more land to cultivate that will potentially add income for the family.

loans.use: to purchase bags of fertilizers and to pay labor costs for hauling of the area

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cream cheese, cream, curd, cheese and cottage cheese to meet the demand for the products.

loans.name: Chona

texts.en: Chona is 29 years old, married and lives in Bagong Silang, Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Norte.
