She is a strong-willed woman who is very committed to her piggery business and never gets too tired to support her family. She is requesting a loan to buy additional piglets and bags of animal feed. Her goal for the future is to open a shop where she can sell her meat in a nearby town.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets and animal feed.

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en: Teresita makes a living by running a retail and wholesale lumberyard in Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Norte. She earns a good income and is able to support her family, and joined PMPC to gain access to capital. She wants to increase her inventory and has requested a loan for PHP 50,000 to buy more lumber to sell. Teresita hopes to sustain her business and dreams of sending all of her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more lumber to sell

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en: Gloria earns a living by running an eatery in Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Norte. She mastered this line of work in the early years of her marriage, and is doing well and able to help support her family. She has local customers and supplements her income by accepting catering assignments. Gloria is requesting a loan to buy pork, fish, beef, chicken, spices, condiments, confectioneries and soda to sell at her eatery. She wants to expand her business and would like to open a small canteen at a nearby school.

loans.use: to buy meat, spices, condiments, confectioneries and drinks.

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en: Margarita is 59 years old, a widow and the mother of two grown children. She decided to give PMPC a try after learning she can use her membership to secure financial assistance for her business. Margarita has maintained her membership in good standing without defaults and has requested a new loan to buy additional piglets and bags of animal feed. Her goal for the future is to manage her business more effectively with help from her family.

loans.use: to buy piglets and animal feed.

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en: Estrella is 62 years old, married and has four grown children. She is a responsible mother and has requested a loan from Paglaum MPC to buy more raw materials, including oil, bananas, and cellophane. This loan will allow Estrella to sell more snacks and food products, which will allow her to earn more money and provide her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy various supplies for her business.

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: María Elena

texts.es: María Elena tiene 28 años, es soltera y vive en la Ciudad de México. Ella es administradora de una revista, es una mujer emprendedora que siempre ha tenido el deseo de ser independiente económicamente y tener libertad financiera, tiene un negocio de publicidad, en el cual ofrece servicio de: lonas, folletos, promocionales, etc. En este negocio ya lleva 3 años y ha sido muy exitoso, tiene una cartera amplia de clientes y cada día sus pedidos son más grandes, por esta razón ella solicita un préstamo de  MXN 35,000, hace algunos días uno de sus clientes le pidió un pedido en gran escala, sin embargo ahora no cuenta con el dinero suficiente para poder pagar la materia prima a sus proveedores. Le gustaría en un futuro poder abrir otras sucursales en distintos puntos de la ciudad. María Elena se siente contenta por lo que ha logrado con su negocio y espera seguir creciendo más.
texts.en:
María Elena is 28 years old. She is single and lives in Mexico City. She is the administrator of a magazine, and is an entrepreneurial woman that has always had the desire to be financially independent and have financial freedom.

She has an advertising business where she offers services for canvases, pamphlets, promotionals, etc. She has been in this business for three years, and has been very successful. She has a large portfolio of customers, and every day her orders get bigger. For this reason she is requesting a loan of 35,000 Mexican pesos. A few days ago, one of her customers made an order on a large scale. However, at this time she does not have sufficient money to pay for the raw materials from her suppliers.

In the future she would like to open other offices in distinct points of the city. María Elena feels happy with what she has achieved with her business, and she hopes to keep growing more.

loans.use: to pay her suppliers in advance for raw materials.

loans.name: Joaquin

texts.es: Joaquín de 58 años, emprendió su propio tras quedar desempleado, él no se dejó vencer por  la situación angustiante por la que atravesaba, por el contrario consideró que esta situación podría ser una oportunidad para ser trabajador independiente y así conseguir los recursos para el sustento de su familia.  Hace ocho años inauguró una tienda de víveres ubicada en el barrio donde reside en una población llamada Baranoa, en donde sus vecinos realizan compras de artículos de la canasta familiar a partir de las 7 a.m. hasta las 7 p.m. Su entrega y dedicación han permitido tener éxito en su negocio y actualmente está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para invertir en surtido de víveres como verduras, gaseosas, golosinas y demás.  Joaquín tiene como meta principal ampliar su local  y surtirlo con más referencias de productos, así mismo desea realizar adecuaciones en su vivienda para mejorar su estilo de vida.
texts.en:
Joaquin, 58 years old, started his own business after losing his job. He did not give up in that distressing situation, but rather he considered it an opportunity to become self-employed so that he could get the income to support his family. 

Eight years ago, he opened a grocery store located in the town where he lives, Baranoa, where the neighbors shop for basic food items from 7am to 7 pm. He has been successful thanks to his commitment and dedication.

Joaquin is requesting this loan, his first through Fundación Domingo Santa Maria, to buy a variety of grocery items including vegetables, soft drinks, snacks and more.

His main goal is to expand the store and increase the variety of products in stock. He would also like to make improvements to his home and thus his lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy a variety of groceries including vegetables, soft drinks, snacks and more.

loans.name: Ligia Esthela

texts.es: Ligia tiene 30 años de edad, vive con su esposo y sus 4 hijos de 13, 11, 5 y 3 años, el de 12 años asiste al colegio y los de 10, 4 se encuentran asistiendo a la escuela, al igual como lo hizo en su primer prestamo, ella opto por incrementar su negocio,el credito nuevo lo va a destinar a la compra y cria de ganado e insumos para el cuidado de los mismos , ella es una persona que ha demostrado mucha responsabilidad y puntualidad en su anterior prestamo, su anehelo mas grande en la vida es a futuro poder tener casa propia y asi poder mejorar la calidad de vida de sus hijos y que terminen sus estudios.
texts.en: Ligia is 30 years old. She lives with her husband and 4 children who are 13, 11, 5 and 3 years old. The one who is 13 years old attends high school, and the two who are 11 and 5 are attending school. Just like she did with her first loan, she is choosing to grow her business. The new loan is destined for the purchase and raising of livestock, as well as supplies to care for the same. Ligia is a person who has demonstrated a lot of responsibility and punctuality with her prior loan. Her greatest goal in life is to be able to have her own home in the future and through this to be able to improve the quality of life of her children, and also that they complete their studies.

loans.use: to purchase a cow.

loans.name: Claudia

texts.es: Claudia tiene 53 años, es casada y madre de 4 hijos, ella vive en el Estado de México, trabaja como empleado administrativo de una empresa, es una mujer muy entusiasta que deja todo en lo que hace, una mujer apasionada y amante de los productos de belleza. Hace dos años ella comenzó a vender productos de belleza por catálogo para ganar dinero extra, su principal dificultad es la capacidad financiera para poder invertir en sus productos, por esta razón solicita un préstamo de  MXN 5,000 para poder invertir en sus productos de belleza. Su mayor sueño es llegar a ser directora nacional de los productos que ofrece, se siente muy orgullosa de lo que ha logrado y también muy motivada para cumplir su sueño.
texts.en: Claudia,53, is married and is the mother of 4 children. She lives in the State of Mexico, and works for a company as an administrative employee.  She is a woman who is very enthusiastic and puts everything into what she does.  She is passionate about beauty products. Two years ago, she started selling beauty products from a catalog to earn some extra money.  Her main difficulty is having the money to invest in her products.  This is why she is requesting a loan of 5,000 Mexican pesos to invest in beauty products.  Claudia's main dream is to become a national director for the products she sells.  She feels very proud of what she has achieved, and is very motivated to accomplish her dream.

loans.use: to invest in beauty products

loans.name: Santos Everilda

texts.es: Santos de 34 años de edad vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos, su vivienda es propia, ella es una madre y una esposa muy responsable y dedicada a su labor en la casa a pesar que es poco el tiempo que pasa en su casa por el trabajo. Santos ya con su primer crédito logro construir el corredor de su vivienda. Ella presta sus servicios a una empresa que ofrece banquetes para fiestas la cual queda cerca de su localidad, ella teme por la seguridad de su familia, ya que no cuenta con un muro que proteja su familia y su vivienda, Santos está solicitando un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, alambre, bloques, arena, hierro, grava y chispa para construir un muro de protección y así sentirse tranquila y ya no temer por la inseguridad por la delincuencia que existe en el lugar donde vive.
texts.en:
34-year old Santos lives with her husband and two children in her own house. She is a very  responsible and dedicated mother and wife who works hard looking after the home despite having very little time for such work. With her first loan Santos had a passage built in her home. She earns her living working for a company that provides catering for events taking place in the vicinity. 

Santos worries about the safety of her family as her home does not have a wall around it. She is seeking a loan from FUSAI to buy cement, wire, blocks, sand, gravel etc. to build a security wall. Then she will feel safer and not worry about protecting her family from neighborhood crime.

loans.use: buy cement, wire, blocks, sand, rebar, gravel etc to build a security wall around her home

loans.name: José Ángel

texts.es: Don José es soldador y ebanista independiente, para desarrollar estas actividades, él se traslada en su vehículo propio, sin embargo, necesita un préstamo de $500 para realizar mejoras necesarias en su vehículo, para poder desempeñar sus actividades de una mejor forma.
texts.en: José is a self-employed welder and carpenter. In order to do this work, he uses his own vehicle. H he needs a loan for $500 to make some necessary repairs on his vehicle in order to be able to carry out his work to the best of his ability.

loans.use: to buy parts to repair his work vehicle.

loans.name: Blanca Noemi

texts.es: Blanca de 19 años de edad es una mujer trabajadora que se dedica desde hace 7 años a la venta de hortalizas y tilapias de manera ambulante recorriendo las principales calles de su municipio para ofrecer sus productos y de esta manera mejorar sus ingresos económicos. Blanca vive en casa familiar desde hace varios años junto a su compañero de vida y su hijo de 1 año de edad que son su mayor alegría. Blanca poco a poco ha logrado agrandar su clientela, pero aún desea mejorar sus ingresos por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: semilla, tilapias y concentrado para obtener mayores ingresos y darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en: Blanca is 19 years old, a hard-working woman who for 7 years has been selling crops and tilapia as a street vendor in the main streets of her town in order to sell her products and thus improve her economic situation. Blanca has lived in her family home for many years with her husband and 1 year old son who is the light of her life. Little by little Blanca has been able to acquire her customers, but she still wishes to increase her income so she is seeking a loan from FUSAI in order to invest in seed, tilapias, and concentrate in order to obtain greater income and provide a better quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to invest in seed, tilapias, and concentrate in order to obtain greater income and provide a better quality of life for her family.

loans.name: Mario Enrique

texts.es:
Mario es joven muy entusiasta con grandes metas y sueños trazados, él tiene 24 años  y el trabajo en el campo es su más grande pasión, pues ya tiene varios años de trabajar en el campo, afortunadamente la zona donde él vive y siembra es muy fértil por lo que el aprovecha todo lo que puede esa maravilla de la naturaleza,  él cuenta que con el apoyo de los créditos su vida ha mejorado y ahora ya cuenta con una pequeña tienda de compra y venta de abarrotes, donde genera otros ingresos, pero Mario para seguir adelante con sus metas solicita un nuevo crédito para la compra de sus insumos agrícolas para la siembra de papa en esta temporada de lluvia.
Mario tiene el anhelo de mejorar sus ingresos para poder construir su casa propia y formar su propia familia.
texts.en:
Mario is an enthusiastic youth who has great goals, dreams and plans.  He is 24 years old, and he works in the fields.  This is his great passion, because he already has a number of years of experience working in agriculture.  Fortunately, the area where he lives and cultivates is very fertile, and so he takes maximum advantage of this marvel of nature.  He states that with the support of loans his life has improved, because now he has a small store where he sells groceries to earn additional income.  However, in order to continue toward his goals, Mario is requesting a new loan to buy agricultural supplies to cultivate potatoes during the current rainy season.  

Mario wants to increase his income so that he can build his own house and form his own family.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies

loans.name: Maria Victoria

texts.es: María de 25 años de edad, es madre soltera y habita en casa de su propiedad al lado de sus dos hijos. María es una mujer muy emprendedora que se dedica a la crianza de y venta de pollos la cual realiza  en su casa de habitación y es de esta manera como ella se gana la vida y lleva a su hogar el pan de cada día. María con el propósito de fortalecer más su negocio e incrementar las ventas que le generen mayores ingresos ha tomado la decisión de solicitar un crédito a FUSAI para la comprar de pollos para aumentar las ventas de su negocio y cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en: María is a 25 year old single mother who lives in her own home with her two children. Maria is very enterprising and raises and sells chickens from her home. In this way she earns a living and supports her home. Maria wants to strengthen her business and increase sales to generate greater income so she made the decision to seek a loan from FUSAI to buy chickens to increase her sales in her business thus meeting the demands of her customers.

loans.use: to buy chickens to increase her sales in her business.

loans.name: Carlos Amilcar

texts.es: Carlos de 22 años de edad es un hombre trabajador que se dedica desde hace 5 años a la crianza de pollos de engorde y de esta manera obtiene sus ingresos para salir adelante. Carlos vive en casa de su propiedad desde hace varios años. El poco a poco ha logrado ir creciendo con su negocio, pero aún desea mejorar y agrandar su productividad y de esa forma incrementar su clientela, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: pollos, concentrado y vitaminas pues lo que más desea es mejorar su nivel y calidad de vida.
texts.en: Carlos is 22 years old, a hard-working man who for 5 years has been raising meat chickens and in this way generating income to support himself. Carlos has lived in his own home for several years. Little by little he has been able to grow his business, but his greatest wish is to expand his production and in this way increase his customers. Therefore he seeks a loan from FUSAI to buy chickens, feed concentrate and vitamins as what he desires most is to improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy chickens, feed concentrate and vitamins as what he desires most is to improve his quality of life.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy galvanized sheets, wood, nails, and basic groceries for his store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy chickens to fatten, feed concentrate, and vitamins in order to increase his production.

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en:
Annabelle is a woman with three children who are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur and is 32 years old.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Annabelle has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca is requesting a loan of $1,000 from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her business. She will use the loan to buy some additional supplies to keep in her kiosk such as hand and body lotion, biscuits, rice, aqua, candy, shampoo, noodles, slippers, cooking oils, and other things to sell. 

Francisca started to open her kiosk in 2014 with her own working capital of $400. She is happy with the loan that is offered from Tuba Rai Metin for her to have more working capital to buy more goods, and she hopes that, with this loan, she can increase her income.

loans.use: To buy hand and body lotion, biscuits, rice, aqua, candy, shampoo, noodles, slippers, cooking oils, and other things to sell.

loans.name: Betzabe Morelia

texts.es:
Betzabe, es una joven estudiante que vive junto a sus padres en Lima. Sus padres trabajan de manera informal, lo que hace que el dinero no les alcance para cubrir la educación de ella y sus dos hermanos menores.

Ella ha escogido estudiar la carrera de Confección Textil, porque desde niña le gustó mucho, siente que la beneficiará mucho tanto a ella como a su familia porque terminando su carrera ella misma puede empezar su propio taller con los conocimientos adquiridos durante su carrera. 

Aún le falta año y medio para poder culminar su carrera, actualmente está estudiando un año. La distancia entre su trabajo y sus estudios es muy larga, por lo que los costos son muy elevados, siendo su principal obstáculo el dinero. Es por tal motivo, que está recurriendo a KIVA para que la puedan apoyar con un crédito educativo y así no deje de cumplir su mayor sueño que es el de tener una gran empresa textil consolidada y poder exportar al mundo.

Cuando termine sus estudios, ella piensa esforzarse mucho para tener su propio taller y más adelante formar una gran empresa textil, es su mayor sueño.

El préstamo obtenido lo utilizaría para pagar sus estudios, dándole tranquilidad a sus padres porque podrán pagar cuotas accesibles a su economía y seguir apoyando a sus hermanos menores. Con el préstamo obtenido, siente que ya no estará muy preocupada con los pagos y se concentrará 100% en sus estudios, será una persona más hábil en lo que se dedique y siente que le abrirá las puertas a nuevas oportunidades.

Betzabé, les quiere decir a las personas de KIVA lo siguiente:"Gracias por el apoyo que nos brindan dándonos esta oportunidad para poder seguir saliendo adelante".
texts.en:
Betzabe is a young student who lives with her parents in Lima.  Her parents work informally, and do not earn enough to cover the educational expenses for her and her 2 younger siblings.

Betzabe has chosen to study for a degree in textile manufacturing, because ever since she was a child she enjoyed this very much.  She feels that this will benefit her and her family greatly, because once she finishes her degree she can start her own workshop with the knowledge she acquired in school.  Although it will be another year and a half before she finishes her degree, she is currently studying in the first year.  The distance between her work and her school is very great, and so the cost of attending is very high.  Therefore, her main obstacle is money.  

This is why she is returning to Kiva for support in the form of an educational loan.  This way, she does not have to put aside her greatest dream, which is to have a large and consolidated textile company that exports to the world.  When she finishes her studies, she plans to exert herself greatly so that she can have her own workshop and, in the future, start up a big textile company, which is her greatest dream.

Betzabe will use this loan to pay for her studies.  This will provide her parents with tranquility because they will pay fees that are affordable to them and will continue to support her younger siblings.  With this loan, she feels that now she will not have to worry about the payments and so will be able to concentrate 100% on her studies.  She will be a more skilled person in her field, and she feels that this will open the doors to new opportunities.

Betzabé, wants to tell the Kiva lenders the following: "Thanks for the support that you are providing us, and for giving us the opportunity to continue forward in life."

loans.use: to pay for her degree in textile manufacturing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy materials to put a new roof on his house

loans.name: Muhammad

texts.en:
Muhammad, who appears in the photo, is a 34-year-old married man from Gaza city, located in the Gaza Strip. He works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. This income barely covers all the family's needs. However, he wants to improve his family's standard of living and help them live more comfortably.

Muhammad took a USD loan from FATEN in order to buy a solar system for heating water for the family house. By taking this loan, Muhammad will be able to heat water more efficiently which enable the family to take warm showers, while also to decreasing the electricity expenses.

loans.use: to buy a solar system

loans.name: Hamza

texts.en:
Hamza, who appears in the photo, is a 37-year-old married man from Gaza city, located in the Gaza Strip. He works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. This income is barely covers all the family needs. However, he wants to improve his family's standard of living and help them live more comfortably.

Hamza took a USD loan from FATEN in order to buy a solar system for heating water for the family house. By taking this loan, Hamza will be able to heat water more efficiently and enable the family to take warm showers, while also decreasing electricity expenses.

loans.use: to buy a solar system

loans.name: Anacorita

texts.en:
Anacorita is 62 years old and widowed with thirteen children. With one child in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like bread, biscuits, canned goods, home care products, and other groceries.

Anacorita has been in this business for two years. 

In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like bread, biscuits, canned goods, home care products, and other groceries

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sporting goods and articles of clothing.

loans.name: Las Hermosas Tejedoras De Chuacalibal Ll Group

texts.es:
Manuela (la primera del lado derecho) trabaja de sol a sol para poder obtener algo de ingresos y apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa, ella tiene 35 años de edad, y vive junto a su familia de cuatro hijos en una comunidad de Chichicastenango,  Manuela se dedica a elaboración de topa típica esta humilde labor lo realiza ella desde hace ocho años,  pero para poder obtener otros ingresos se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, Manuela busca prosperar todos los días es por ello que con el afán de ofrecerle a sus clientes mejores trajes, ha organizado a un grupo de personas para juntas solicitar un crédito que lo invertirá en la compra de hilos de diferentes colores, y marcas.
El gran sueño de Manuela es poder contar con un local donde ella pueda exhibir su propio producto que elabora  y mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en: Manuela (the first woman on the right) works daily in order to be able to obtain income and support her husband with the household expenses. She is 35 years old and lives with her family of 4 children in the Chichicastenango community. Manuela works making traditional clothing, a humble labor that she has been doing for 8 years, but in order to be able to obtain additional income she sells groceries. Manuela seeks to prosper every day therefore she works to provide her customers the best clothing. She has organized a group to band together to seek a loan which will be used to buy different brands and colors of thread.  Manuela's greatest dream is that she is able to have a locale where she can display the products she makes and improve her income.

loans.use: to buy thread.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa is applying for a loan of $1,000 from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her business. She has a shop of second hand clothes and she is also selling in the center of the market, so many people are interested in her clothes. 

She started to do this business in 2013 with her own working capital of $600. Rosa is earning a good income from selling her second clothes, so she is happy to doing her business. It is cheap and unique, compared to new clothes.

loans.use: To buy shirts, turtleneck shirts, long-sleeved shirts, short-sleeved shirts, and other clothes to sell.

loans.name: Nahed

texts.en:
Nahed, who appears in the photo, is a 42-year-old married man from Dier El Balah city, located in the Gaza Strip. He works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. This income barely covers all the family's needs. However, he wants to improve his family's standard of living and help them live more comfortably.

Nahed took a USD murabaha loan from FATEN in order to buy a solar system for heating water for the family house. By taking this loan, Nahed will be able to heat water more efficiently which will enable the family to take warm showers, while also decreasing the electricity expenses.

loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water for the family house.

loans.name: Luz De La Esperanza De S.j.m Group

texts.es: Un grupo conformado por  5 personas responsables a distintas actividades comerciales. Así son las integrantes del grupo comunal. “LUZ DE LA ESPERANZA DE S.J.M” una de ellas es la Sra. Nelly  de 47 años soltera  y con 2 hijos, se dedica ya hace 3 años a la venta de ropa en un pequeño local  todos los días con el mérito de salir adelante y así poder pagar el colegio de sus hijos, Con el fruto de su esfuerzo ha logrado mejorar su vivienda y apoyar en la educación de sus hijos. Seguir mejorando su negocio, su mayor deseo es que sus hijos sean profesionales es por eso  trabaja mucho, Con el préstamo otorgado lo invertirá  en comprar más mercadería (hilos, telas, ETC) y así poder tener más ingresos. A la vez a la Sra. Nelly se encuentra sentada y se le distingue con un polo color morado con chompa color azul marino, se despide con un abraso a Kiva y Edaprospo y  agradece el crédito brindado ya que hace posible su progreso.
texts.en:
A group made of 5 people who are responsible for various commercial activities. These are the members of the communal bank "Luz de la Esperanza de S.J.M". One of these members is Nelly. Forty-seven years old, single, and with 2 children, she has been working for the past 3 years by selling clothing in a small shop every day. The merit of this is to get ahead and therefore pay for secondary school for her children. 

With the fruits of her labor, she has been able to improve her home and help with her children's education. By continuing to improve her business, her greatest wish is that her children become professionals. It is for that that she works hard. With the granting of the loan, she will invest in buying more merchandise (threads, fabrics, etc.), so that she can have more income. 

Nelly can be seen sitting and she is wearing a purple polo shirt with a navy blue sweater. She says goodbye with an embrace to Kiva and Edaprospo, and she is grateful for the offered loan as it makes her progress possible.

loans.use: to buy threads, fabrics, etc.

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella has been considerably preparing for the expansion of her hog-raising business. She presented her proposal to Paglaum MPC and took out a loan of PHP 3,000 to purchase additional bags of animal feed for her hogs.

Estrella hopes to see all of her children finish their degrees and have stable careers.

loans.use: to purchase bags of animal feed for her hog-fattening business

loans.name: Glodiriz

texts.es: Gloridiz de 38 años, reside en compañía de sus dos hijos y su cónyuge en un barrio del municipio de Barranquilla, en donde se concentra la mayor parte de sus clientes a quienes ofrece artículos para el hogar y el cuidado personal.  Con la ayuda de una amiga quien la instruyo sobre el negocio y le otorgó artículos para que entregara  sus primeros encargos, pudo incorporarse al negocio e independizarse,  hoy en día cuenta con un año de experiencia con mucha dedicación y compromiso.  De lunes a sábado mediante catálogos de empresas especializadas hace su gestión de venta en los cuales se pueden encontrar una gran variedad de artículos, sin embargo como su capital es insuficiente para responder a la demanda de productos que le solicitan sus clientes, está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para invertir en promociones de productos y poder tener una mayor rentabilidad.  Su meta a futuro es ampliar la cobertura de clientes que le generen más ingresos y así ofrecer bienestar a sus hijos.
texts.en:
38-year old Glodiriz lives with her two children and husband in a neighbourhood in the Barranquilla municipality. The majority of her customers also live there. She sells household and personal care products. She started out with help from a friend who showed her how to run a business and gave her products so she could make her first sales, register her business, and become independent. Now after much hard work and dedication Glodiriz has a year of business experience.

She works from Monday to Saturday selling from specialized catalogs where her customers can see the wide variety of products available. However, she doesn't have enough capital to fulfill her customers' orders. 

Now Glodiriz is asking the Mario Domingo Foundation for a loan to purchase products on sale and earn more money. Her goal in the future is to increase her customer base, generate more income, and thus improve the wellbeing of her children.

loans.use: buy household and personal care products on sale

loans.name: Norma De Jesus

texts.es: Norma tiene 43 años edad, vive en casa propia junto a su esposo y su hijo mayor de edad. Norma es una mujer que se dedica desde hace un tiempo a atender una pequeña tienda de productos básicos de primera necesidad la cual esta instalada en su casa de habitación y gracias a los ingresos que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos del hogar. Norma con el deseo de cada vez mas mejorar su condición de vida busca la manera de poder incrementar sus ingresos económicos y es por ello que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de cerdos para dedicarse también a la crianza y venta de estos, los cuales piensa distribuir en el rastro municipal con el propósito de generar mejores ingresos y brindar a su familia mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Norma is 43 years old, and lives in her own home with her husband and adult child.  She has worked for some time tending a small store selling basic goods.  The store is located in her home and thanks to the income she makes she is able to cover some of the household expenses.  

Norma, with the desire to improve her living conditions more each day, is looking for a way to increase her income.  For this, she is requesting a loan through FUSAI in order to invest in the purchase of pigs so that she can also work raising and selling them.  She is planning to sell them at the local market, with the intention of generating a greater income to offer her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Berlina

texts.en:
Berlina is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Berlina is 54 years old and has two children who are in school.

Berlina has a buy-and-sell ready to wear business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy items to sell like slippers, etc.

Berlina has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like slippers, etc.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Cecilia has a buy-and-sell coconut wine business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional containers of coconut wine to sell.

Cecilia has been in this business for two years. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional containers of coconut wine to sell

loans.name: Chanda

texts.en:
Chanda is 30 years old, married with three children, and lives in the Kandal province in Cambodia. She has been working as a factory worker for over three years. Her husband is a 36-year-old motorcycle taxi driver and two of her children are in school. Both Chanda and her husband make $10 a day to support their family. 

Due to a difficulty with the family’s traveling, she would like to apply for a loan to buy a motorcycle for her family’s use. By doing this, she will have her own motorcycle and improve the family’s traveling conditions. Her future plans are to save money to build a new house and help support her children in earning high school diplomas.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for her family’s use

loans.name: Jovelyn

texts.en:
Jovelyn is 29 years old, married, and living at Bagong Silang, Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. 

In order to earn a living, she takes in and raises pigs from their neighborhood.  The piglets' owners share in the profits upon sale, to be divided 60/40 or 70/30 depending in their agreement.  

With a desire to earn more, she decided to raise pigs on her own as well. Through Pauglam MPC she obtained the capital to purchase piglets. 

Now, she requests a loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase additional piglets and bags of animal feeds. She really hopes and prays that her business would grow and benefit her family, in addition to the income of her husband. 

Someday, she wants to build a concrete pig cage to easily keep more sanitary conditions.

loans.use: to purchase additional piglets and bags of animal feeds

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is 49 years old, married, and has two children.

Analyn is in the agricultural business, doing pig fattening in the Philippines. Analyn requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig.

Analyn has been in this business for five years now and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is 39 years old and married with four children. With three children in school, Norma works very hard to provide for them.

Norma runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like dried fish, beverages, home care products, and other groceries.

Norma has been in this business for two years now. 

In the future, Norma would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like dried fish, beverages, home care products, and other groceries

loans.name: March's Group

texts.en:
A 33-year-old mother of two children who are both in school, March is a rural villager living in Kampong Cham province. Growing rice has been the main source of her family’s income for 15 years. Her crop being destroyed by insects is the main challenge for her current business. 

This is her first loan cycle with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner. As a group leader, she will use her loan portion to buy seeds and fertilizer to boost the productivity of her crop yields. She hopes to gain more yields then she did in the previous year.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer to boost the productivity of her crop yields

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Elpedia

texts.en:
Elpedia heads for the next cropping season. She wants to prepare well, especially the much needed land and seedbed preparations. 

She wants to have enough supply of corn seeds and fertilizers, for which she applied for a loan from the Cooperative. Elpedia hopes to save enough for the education of her children.

loans.use: to purchase corn seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie is a businesswoman from Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is single and has expertise in selling. She runs a sari-sari store and earns income that sufficiently supports her parents. 

Tessie is a full fledged member of PMPC and has taken several loans already. She maintains her membership in good standing without records of default. 

Now, she applied for a loan to purchase additional inventories for her sari-sari store, like two bags of white sugar, two bags of brown sugar, condiments, milk, canned goods, coffee, and others. 

Tessie continues to look for better business opportunities, proof that she has the passion and the energy to make ends meet for her ailing parents.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventories for her sari-sari store, like two bags of white sugar, two bags of brown sugar, condiments, milk, canned goods, coffee, and others

loans.name: Erma

texts.en:
As the parent of six children, Erma works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell coconut wine business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Erma is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy more containers of coconut wine to sell for her buy-and-sell coconut wine business.

Erma has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more containers of coconut wine to sell

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 49 years old and has two children who are in school.

Imelda has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy items to sell like beverages, condiments, home care products and other groceries.

Imelda has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like beverages, condiments, home care products and other groceries.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional fishing net.

Editha has been in this business for four years now.

In the future, Editha would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing net.

loans.name: Jaira

texts.en:
Jaira works hard to support her daily needs.

She has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. She is borrowing PHP 8,000 through NWTF to buy more vegetables to sell for her vegetable vending business.

Jaira has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie is 34 years old and married with eleven children. With nine children in school, Melanie works very hard to provide for them.

Melanie runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like eggs, canned goods, noodles, home care products, school supplies and other groceries.

Melanie has been in this business for five years.

In the future, Melanie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like eggs, canned goods, noodles, home care products, school supplies and other groceries.

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
Flordeliza is 50 years old and married with three children.

She is in the agricultural business, raising poultry in the Philippines. Flordeliza is borrowing PHP 7,000 through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her chickens.

Flordeliza has been in this business for 28 years and also earns additional income from raising ducks.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her chickens

loans.name: Thol's Group

texts.en:
Thol, 49, is a mother of four children living in Kampong Cham province. To support her family, she grows rice on three hectares' area and works for others for a fee to supplement her income. Her rice crop was destroyed by insects; they caused her rice not to grow well. She has been involved in this business for 29 years, and she can save her daily income, about 27,900 KHR per day. 

This is Thol's third cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid her past loans correctly. With her past loans, she has made a good income to update her family’s living conditions to be better than before. In a group of three members, she is the group leader. She will use her loan portion to buy fertilizer and rice seed to support her rice farming. She hopes that she can get more income to update her lifestyle and her farming and make her yield bigger than before.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and rice seed to support her rice farming.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: An's Group

texts.en:
An is 46 years old and a mother of four children. Two of the children are in school and the other two are too young to attend. Nowadays, she is living with her big family in a rural village of Kampong Cham province. Growing rice and harvesting on another farm for a fee have been the sources of her family’s income for more than five years. This many years, her crop provided her fruitless due to drought and it is the main challenge for her to earn income to support her family. 

Now she has decided to lead a group of five members to apply for a Kiva loan via VisionFund to buy rice seeds to farm and thus increase her crop yields. This is An's fifth loan cycle with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner. The previous loans helped her to have better living conditions. With this loan, she hopes to gain more yields than previous years and have the ability to buy a motorbike so she can drive between her fields and her house.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds to farm and thus increase her crop yields.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Kang Meas District

loans.name: Ghaziya

texts.en:
Ghaziya is a 43-year-old married mother of five children. She opened eight years ago a grocery shop with a bakery section to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their family.

Ghaziya is a hard working, ambitious lady, and a sacrificing mother who is trying desperately to develop her business, thus today she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to increase her business merchandise with new items and products to satisfy her customers' requests.

Ghaziya hopes to expand her business more in the future to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to increase her grocery store merchandise with new items to satisfy her customers' requests

loans.name: Blanca Mirian

texts.es: Blanca tiene 48 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos de 19 años y 9 años de edad a los que están sacando adelante, es una mujer muy trabajadora que su actividad es la elaboración de tamales de elotes que vende a diario para poder tener sus ingresos económicos tiene 15 años en este negocio gracias a esto va saliendo adelante su familia, el esposo aporta para el gasto del hogar. Blanca desea levantar muro de contención debido a que cuando llueve se derrama la tierra por lo que quiere darles una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: ladrillos, arena, cemento para poder levantar el muro que ha deseado dar por terminado.
texts.en: Blanca is 48 years old and lives in her own home with her husband and two children ages 19 and 9. She is a hard-working woman who supports her family by making tamales that she sells daily in order to be able to support her family. She has had this business for 15 years. Her husband also supports the home. Blanca wishes to build a retention wall because when it rains the earth falls in, therefore she would like to provide better living conditions to her children. She seeks a loan from FUSAI to buy bricks, sand, cement in order to be able to finish building the wall.

loans.use: to buy bricks, sand, cement in order to be able to finish building the wall.

loans.name: Leah Fe

texts.en:
Leah Fe is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Leah Fe is 34 years old and her three children are presently in school.

Leah Fe has a buy-and-sell watch business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy stocks of watches to sell to her customers.

Leah Fe has been in this business for five years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy stocks of watches to sell to her customers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cereals for sale

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to increase his working capital and buy a big quantity of bananas to make into banana beer to sell, so as to earn more.

loans.name: Haya

texts.en:
Haya is 34 years old, married and has three children and she lives in Irbid.

She is an ambitious woman who is always looking for the best there is in any field for work, so as to improve the standard of living for her family. She started to help her husband by working in selling clothing from her home and she very happy with this work.  She feels that she can prove her ability in this work and be a productive woman. 

She wants to improve her income by selling more clothes. So she asked for a loan to buy more products and clothes and sell. She hopes to earn good profits in her business.

loans.use: to bring in a new collection of women's clothing to sell

loans.name: Mariela Esperanza

texts.es:
Mariela, es una joven estudiante que vive junto a sus hermanos y sobrino. Sus padres viven fuera de la ciudad por tema de trabajo, aún así el trabajo que realizan sus padres no les permiten solventar los gastos de estudios de ella y sus hermanos. 
Mariela se encuentra estudiando el 2do. Semestre de Tecnología Ambiental, la cual le interesa mucho porque está dirigida al sector industrial, con tareas específicas, prácticas, relacionada con el tema de cuidado y conservación del medio ambiente. 
De no tener el apoyo de KIVA, Mariela tendría que buscar trabajar el mayor tiempo posible para poder reunir el dinero necesario que le permita continuar estudiando su carrera. Es por ello, que ella se siente inmensamente agradecida por contar con una organización como KIVA que le permitirá culminar satisfactoriamente sus estudios y así colaborar con la conservación del medio ambiente, que tanta falta hace.
El mayor obstáculo que encuentra Mariela es la difícil situación por la que está atravesando su familia, lo que pone en riesgo la continuidad de sus carrera.
El máximo sueño que tiene Mariela, es culminar en el tiempo estimado su carrera para trabajar en gran empresa Industrial y apoyar con la conservación del medio ambiente.
Mariela les quiere decir a KIVA:"Muchísimas gracias por permitirme continuar mis estudios, que tanto me gustan, prometo poner todo mi esfuerzo y no los defraudaré".
texts.en:
Mariela is a young student who lives with her siblings and nephew. Her parents live outside of the city because of their jobs, though the work they do does not enable them to cover the cost of their children's education. 

Mariela is in her second semester of Environmental Technology, a subject that is very interesting to her. She is focused on the industrial sector, with specific assignments and work related to environmental safety and conservation. 

Without the support of KIVA, Mariela would have to spend most of her time looking for work in order to get enough money together to continue studying for her degree. She is therefore immensely grateful for an organization like KIVA, which will allow her to successfully complete her studies, as well as help with much-needed environmental conservation.

The biggest obstacle for Mariela is the difficult situation her family is going through, which puts the continuation of her degree at risk.

Mariela's ultimate dream is to finish her degree in the expected timeframe so she can work for a large industrial company and support environmental conservation.

Mariela would like to tell the KIVA lenders: "Thank you for enabling me to continue my studies, which I enjoy so much. I promise to put in all my effort and not let you down."

loans.use: to continue studying Environmental Technology and [eventually] work for a major industrial company.

loans.name: Keang's Group

texts.en:
A mother of two schoolchildren living in Kampong Cham province, Keang is 37 years old. For her family’s living, she grows cassava on a one-hectare area as her single main source of income. She can get only a little income from her cassava farm because her cassava does not grow well. She has been involved in her business for five years and it earns her about 29,700 KHR per day. 

This is Keang's third cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid her past loans completely. With her previous loan, she could get a decent income to improve her living conditions. In a group of two, she is the group leader. She will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer, organic pesticide and pay for labor fees to support her cassava farm. She hopes that her cassava will produce a better yield than last year.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, organic pesticide, and pay for labor fees to support her cassava farm.

loans.name: Tha's Group

texts.en:
Living in Kampong Cham province, Tha is 51 years old and a mother of three dependent children. Nowadays, she earns income to support her family's living conditions by growing rice on a one-hectare area. Moreover, she can get more income via working for others to grow cassava for a fee. Her rice does not grow well and she can sell it at a low price. She has been involved with her rice farm for 38 years. 

This is Tha's third cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid her past loans successfully. With her previous loan, she can make a decent income to improve her family’s living and keep her children in school. She leads a group of three to get a new loan. As the group leader, she will manage her loan portion to buy fertilizer and pay for the plowing fee to improve her farm to increase the yield. She hopes that she can increase her yield so she can improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay for the plowing fee to improve her farm to increase the yield

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Ngezi Group

texts.en:
Tambudzai found it difficult to take care of her four children by herself after her husband passed away. She had to take over her husband’s business of selling building material. She has expanded her business from only selling bricks to supplying sand, quarry, and concrete pavers as well as transporting them. She is currently working with her other two children who have just completed their formal education.

Tambudzai formed a group called Ngezi with her other colleagues who are in business. The group is based in New Marimba suburb of Harare. They have managed to save money as a group and have received financial literacy training from Thrive Microfinance. The group plans to continue helping each other and working for their families.
 
Tambudzai needs a loan for $300 so that she can produce bricks in large quantities and also to buy other building material in order to minimise the waiting period her clients endure before receiving their orders. The group hopes that a loan from Kiva will help in achieving their objectives.

loans.use: To make her own bricks for her building supplies business.

loans.name: Mazina

texts.en:
Mazina is a 50-year-old married mother of four children. She started, twenty five years ago, working in manufacturing soap to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their family.   Mazina is a hard worker and ambitious lady who is trying hard to develop her business.

Today she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to repair her pickup truck that she uses to transport goods and deliver them to her clients. 
Mazina hopes to expand her business more in the future to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to repair her pickup truck that she uses to transport goods and deliver them to her clients

loans.name: Felicisima

texts.en:
Felicisima would like you to know her full appreciation and thanksgiving because her recent loan has indeed helped her in buying additional Barley products for her business. She faithfully repaid her previous loan which she had used in buying additional products for her inventory. 

But still, she would like to improve her sales more. With this, she is humbly requesting for another 
PHP 50,000 which she will utilize to purchase more merchandise Barley products. Preferably, her customers will likely buy more items if she has more products displayed in her store. 

In some time at the future, she wants to further amplify her business. She is praying for security of their family members and good health also to prevail in each one of them. 

She meets every week with her *co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for an additional stock of Barley products

loans.name: Sara

texts.en:
Hello! Meet Sara (pictured above) from the Kitale area of Kenya, an area that is very fertile. Sara is 28 years old and a proud mother of angel-looking children whom she really adores and cherishes. 

Other than doing some small business, Sara is a very hardworking farmer who has been farming for the past five years. She has gained so much experience through those years of farming. Sara practices mixed farming. That is, she grows maize and keeps dairy cows, and through these activities she has been able to earn a decent and honest income. Because of the passion she has for farming, she has even nicknamed one of her cows. She really enjoys taking care of her cows. 

Although Sara has been making profits through farming, not everything has been easy for this humble and industrious mum. Her farm has not been producing as much of a harvest because of the lack of fertilizer and good seeds and the presence of pests and diseases. That is why she is seeking a loan to buy farm implements and buy seeds so as to expand her horticulture farm. 

Through the loan, Sara will be assured of a bumper harvest, and this will translate into more profits and cash. Through the use of good seeds and fertilizer, she will increase her profit margins. Through this loan, Sara will be able to expand her horticulture business. 

She sees a lot of room for improvement and growth. What is lacking is the capital to drive the positive change. With your loan, Sara will make enough income to take care of her family and other farming expenses. 

She wakes up early and goes to sleep very late every day to give her family a decent living and afford her children proper education.

loans.use: to buy farm implements and expand his horticulture business.

loans.name: Rael

texts.en:
Rael is a passionate and hardworking smallholder farmer from the Nandi Hills area of Kenya. She is married and her union with her husband is blessed with 6 children. To look after this big family, Rael relies on their 1.5 acre land. She practices dairy and poultry farming, even though on a small-scale basis. To get better price and value for her produce, she needs to have access to formal markets that are distant from her farm.
 
To solve this big challenge, Rael is seeking a loan to buy a motorcycle. Motorcycle are the preferred mode of transportation among local smallholder farmers because they are economical and very convenient. 
With your loan, Rael will be able to transport her produce over short and long distances as often as she pleases. This will give her the flexibility to explore the different opportunities that she has.

Also, the motorcycle will give her an alternative source of income if she decides to offer transportation services to other members of her community. Income generated from this investment will enable Rael to grow her business and meet the basic needs and wants of her family.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for transporting her farm produce

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William is a rural smallholder crop farmer from the Kapsowar area of Kenya. He enjoys crop farming because it provides food and income for him and his family. The key lessons he has taken away from years of being in crop farming the importance of using quality farm inputs and being able to predict the weather.

William is seeking a loan to buy agricultural inputs. With the borrowed money, he plans to buy improved seeds and fertilizer, and to pay for labour. He hopes this investment will pay off by enhancing his farm’s productivity.
With your loan, having quality agricultural inputs will increase William’s chances for a successful harvest.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs, such as improved seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is an industrious smallholder farmer from Kapsowar area of Kenya. She spends most of her time working in her farmland. To her, nothing is more important than providing her children with a secure foundation for their future. In trying to grow and improve her business, Rose faces one serious challenge- transportation. 

Rose is seeking a loan to buy a motorcycle that will aid with farm transportation. Armed with this asset, she will be in a good position to transport goods to and from the market. The motorcycle will enable her to travel short and long distances in search for better markets and other opportunities. She can also increase her family income by offering transportation services to the public.
 
Through this loan, the life and livelihood of a hardworking mother could be transformed, forever.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for use to transport her farm products to market

loans.name: Jeniffer

texts.en:
Hello, lenders. Meet Jeniffer. She is a 29-year-old smallholder farmer based in Kitale, which is a small rural town in the Rift Valley region of Kenya. 

Jeniffer has been blessed with a lovely family. For four years, Jeniffer has been a mixed farmer. She keeps dairy cattle and poultry on her farm. She also grows vegetables, among other crops. Despite prevailing animal diseases, she finds dairy farming to be the most enjoyable commercial farming activity. 

Besides dairy farming, she has a deep connection with gardening. In African communities, gardening is the most popular, yet the least exclusive hobby for women. You really don't have to be born with a green thumb to give life to a glorious garden; any woman with a homestead and a few square feet of earth is doing her best to make her little corner of the world more gracious and beautiful. 

Jeniffer is taking this a little step further. She is seeking a loan to start horticultural farming. This is a big deal for her. She is very excited to start growing different varieties of crops for commercial purposes. The demand for vegetables and other greens is always high. 

Income from this venture will cover the high farming expenses she has to deal with currently. In the long run, with increased income, she will finally be able to satisfy her family’s basic needs.

loans.use: To start horticulture farming to grow crops for a better income

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan is a smallholder farmer from the Nandi Hills area of Kenya. She is married and has 2 children - one is 3 and the other 6.  In 2006, Joan started farming on a 3 acre land registered under his husbands name. Today, she has 3 cows, 10 heads of poultry, and a garden full of sugarcane crop. She also engages in other side-business to generate extra income from time to time. 

Joan is seeking a loan to purchase land. Through you loan, she plans to make good use of the land by using it to cultivate and produce more food that will give her family decent diets and better income. During the client appraisal process, Juhudi Kilimo's loan officer established that Joan keeps weekly budget and always records expenses. 

She was able to clear her previous loan with no difficulty and her current credit score indicates that she is likely to service this particular loan without much difficulty.

loans.use: to buy land to expand her successful farming activity

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad has been involved in operating a shop for hiring manufacturing equipment that is used in building works. He started his business with a loan he took before. He is 39 years old lives in Wihdat and is married with two children. 

He is requesting a loan because he wants to buy additional materials and electrical transformers and more equipment’s to rent, so that will help him expand his business and increase his income. 

He is happy because, with this loan from Kiva, he can build his business in the future and provide a good life for his family.

loans.use: to buy additional items for hire and electrical transformers

loans.name: Hamza

texts.en:
Hamza is a person with a household of his wife and his two kids and he is the sole breadwinner for his family and also his mother. They are his dependents and they stated that they do not have economic support from their relatives. He works as a blacksmith with his own smith shop. He learned to develop this activity after he works in this field for many years.  Hamza started his business in his home, and then he rented a small shop to increase his incomes and he started to work in repairing of electrical items in homes. Now Hamza has two blacksmith shops which prove that he is a successful and hard working man.

He wants to have everything needed to provide an excellent service to his clients. Working on credit, he hopes to grow his business and that the profitability would be greater so that his family's quality of life would improve.  He applied for a loan to expand and develop his shops and to buy what he needs from materials and equipment to and do good promotion for his second blacksmith shop. His vision is to use the loan the best way and to pay it off on time.

loans.use: to expand his shops and buy what he needs for materials and equipment for his electrical work

loans.name: Geoffrey

texts.en:
Geoffrey is a thirty seven year old married man with six children living in Masindi-Uganda. He deals in livestock production but he also earns a salary from the local government. His hope is to expand his business and get more yields.

He is a hard working man who loves his business and dreams of being a model cattle keeper. Geoffrey requests for a loan to buy more cows.

loans.use: to buy more cows and expand his business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: for the purchase of more raw materials, used in restoration of eastern antiques for sale in his shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to sell beans, tomatoes, cabbages carrots and ground nuts

loans.name: Muka Upenye Group

texts.en:
Many people from Southern Africa have come to appreciate and embrace their culture and this is seen from the way they dress nowadays. The African Attire has become trendy and has presented an opportunity for countries like Malawi who produce the fabric that makes this attire. Primrose is one of the Zimbabweans who have delved into the hunt for this special fabric. She travels to Malawi once a month to procure this fabric for the production of the African Attires that she sells in Zimbabwe.

Primrose is a 26-year-old woman sells African attire clothing and kitchenware. She procures the kitchenware from South Africa. Primrose is married but does not have any children yet. She wants to generate sufficient income to build a nice home for her children in the future. She plans to set up an education fund and start saving for the future. 

She is part of a group called Muka Upenye (meaning “rise and shine”). The group is made up of four hard working entrepreneurs. They hope that a Kiva loan of $1200 will help them buy goods to meet the demand of their customers. With her portion, Primrose wants to buy a sewing machine and attend a dress making course so that she can sew the African Attires on her own and forego the costs of outsourcing.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine to expand her traditional African Attires clothes making business

loans.name: Sorlimor Group

texts.en:
These people are part of group called Sorlimor. They live in the same area and sell sandals, slippers, sachet water and diapers. 

Rebecca is a single and a mother who sells sachet water and diapers. She asks for 2,500 GHS to buy more sachet water and diapers to sell to her customers. She handles her family's daily expenses and supports her children school. 

She has more than 5 years experience in this business and is applying for her seventh loan with ID-Ghana. She works from 7 am until 8 pm.The group has received proper orientation about the loan and saving principals and promise to utilize this loan judiciously. In the future, and with the help of the institution, she would like to expand her business and save money to improve the life of her family. The group will need a total amount of GHS 4,000 to expand their businesses.

loans.use: To buy more sachet water and diapers to sell to customers.

loans.name: Jameela

texts.en:
Jameela is a 60-years-old, married woman. The man shown in the photo is her husband, who is a taxi driver by profession. He drives in the main city and makes enough income to cover all the expenses of his family. He wants to change the taxi's engine, as it is causing a lot of pollution and is consuming too much oil for its work. 

That is why Jameela  has availed herself of a Murabaha loan of 25000 PKR for her husband to buy a new engine for the taxi to provide better facilities to his customers. Jameela  is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy a new engine for the taxi to provide better facilities to his customers

loans.name: Kunthea

texts.en:
Kunthea is from Banteay Chmar, a village in the northwest of Cambodia. She is 30 years old. She lives in a wooden pile house  with her eight-year-old daughter and her husband. Her family owns four hectares of rice fields. In 2003 she was trained by Soieries du Mékong, a social enterprise which fights against rural exodus and for empowerment of women by training them and offering them sustainable work in the village. 

Kunthea makes scarves which are sold in Cambodia and Europe. She uses her weaving income to pay for her family's expenses and to buy diesel and fertilizer for her field. Thanks to the loan, she will buy the silk and pay for the dyeing and preparation of the loom. Please support her so she can keep making beautiful traditional handwoven scarves!

loans.use: To buy silk and pay for fees related to loom preparation

loans.name: Ameeran

texts.en:
Ameeran has successfully built her business of milk sales with the support of Kashf Foundation and Kiva. By the time she has attained good number of customers and makes good amount of income to contribute in the family income. 

Previously with the help of Kiva she was able to expand her business. Now she has applied a loan of 40000 PKR to purchase another cow to increase her sales to more cities and to gain more profits.

loans.use: to purchase another cow to increase her sales to more cities and to gain more profits

loans.name: Beloved Group

texts.en:
The members of this group are part of Beloved group from Chorkor-Accra, Ghana. The group is composed of five members who earn their living by selling shoes, scarves, lining, materials and catering service. They need additional capital to maintain, enhance or expand their businesses and decided to apply for a loan from ID Ghana. 

They are excited and full of hope to begin this new loan with solid goals and dreams. Mercy is a 44-year-old married woman and has two dependent children. In the picture, she is standing far left. Mercy is engaged in the selling of men shoes. She is applying for her fifth loan with ID Ghana. The requested funds will be used to purchase more men shoes to sell to her customers. 

On behalf of her colleagues, Mercy expresses gratitude and appreciation for the support from Kiva investors throughout the world who lend such necessary and vital support.
They will hold each other responsible for repayment of the loan.

loans.use: To purchase more men shoes and scarves to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw.

loans.name: Sokha

texts.en:
Sokha is a 36-year-old married factory worker with four young children in her care. She has worked in the factory since 2012. Her husband is a 35-year-old construction worker. All of them live in the Kampong Chhnang Province of Cambodia. Both Sokha and her husband can earn around USD 12 each day. 

She​​​​​​​​​ is lacking the finances to buy a motorcycle for commuting to work and family use, therefore she requests a loan. With the motorcycle from the loan, her family will be able to have better traveling conditions and reduce traveling expenses. For her future plans, Sokha is going to save money to build a new proper house and support her children to earn high diplomas.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for commuting to work and for family use

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bricks, sand, cement, gravel and iron.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy the ingredients to make cake such as wheat flour, eggs, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Just like any entrepreneur, Rosario wants to develop her business. 

She is now handling a printing business. Though she's already 55 years of age, she remains striving to help and supply the needs of her family. Since 2004, she has been offering customers her print service and starting from just a small one, her business now grew, catering larger services for people. 

Now, to support and continually improve her inventory, she would like to request a loan that she will use in buying more paper products for printing and other materials needed in beautifying her shop. She simply would like to avail an amount of PHP 15,000 for this. She promises to use this amount wisely. 

In the future, if her business expands, she dreams of helping also other aspiring entrepreneurs. It is because she believes that every individual is blessed to bless others also. 

She meets up with her co-fellowship* members weekly to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies. 

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is comprised of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: for buying more paper products for printing and other materials needed in beautifying her shop.

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Thirty-five-year-old Analiza runs a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells basic commodities like powdered soap, coffee, biscuits, edible oil, canned goods and other basic goods. Aside from that, she also operates a tricycle-transportation service to have supplemental income. She is married with three children ages 14, 4 and 1 year old. She has been engaged in this kind of business for three years.

She has requested a loan to buy grocery items like canned goods, soap, seasonings and beverages.  These will keep her store full of stock and attract more buyers to her shop. This will improve her earnings and she will be able to handle her finances. Thus, it could help provide her family with nutritious diets and better shelter in which to live. 

Analiza is trying her best to manage both of her sources of income successfully and also to continue financing her children's schooling so that they will have a brighter future.

loans.use: to buy grocery items

loans.name: Lita

texts.en:
Lita is 54 years old and married with two children, both of whom are currently in school. She is in the agricultural business, farming corn in the Philippines.

She has requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Lita has been in this business for six years now and has borrowed from NWTF one time in the past to sustain it. She would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en:
Born in 1965, Dorcas describes her upbringing as challenging. This taught her not to believe in lack and to work harder than the people in her surrounding. Today, Dorcas is married and a mother of 4 children between 15 and 25 years- 3 of whom are in boarding schools. Her main income sources are is milk, meat, eggs, and tea, which all come from her 4 acre farm.
 
The biggest challenge and growth constraint that Dorcas is facing right now is lack of capital to secure more land for farming. She is appealing to Kiva lender to help her with a loan. The borrowed money will be used to secure land to keep more domestic animals and cultivate to produce more food and cash crops. Her hope is that this loan investment will enable her to provide decent diets and better income to her family. Income from the main income sources will be used to repay the loan.

loans.use: to buy land to expand her dairy farm

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is 54 years old and married with five children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell, like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, breads, etc.

Mary Jane has been in this business for 21 years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell, like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, breads, etc,

loans.name: Tecla

texts.en:
Tecla is a smallholder farmer from the Nandi Hills area of Kenya. She is married and has 5 children between 13 and 23 years old. 

Tecla started farming in the year 2000 and today, she has 2 acres  of land, 1 dairy cow, 10 heads of poultry, several rabbits and 30 trees. She also owns a motorcycle that she uses for farm and public transportation.

She is seeking a loan to secure additional land to cultivate and produce food. With this loan investment, she hopes that she will be able to give her family decent diets and a better income.

loans.use: to lease land for expansion of her farming activity

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a smiling woman; a hardworking person, protective and really down to earth. She is a 28 year-old lady from the Siongiroi area of Kenya and is into dairy farming. Milk is her chief source of income. She uses the income that she makes from dairy farming to help her husband, whom she really adores. As her family grows bigger, Joyce responsibility to provide also grows. 

With 5 years of experience in farming, the only way she can increase her income is through investing large sums of money to acquire more cows. It is for that reason that she is turning to Kiva lenders to inject a loan to invest in her dairy business. With your loan, Joyce will buy an additional better breed of dairy cow which will produce more milk to sell. Income from the investment will enable Joyce to keep up with the growing family expenses.

loans.use: to buy an better breed of dairy cow

loans.name: Mylene

texts.en:
As a woman parent, Mylene works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. She is borrowing PHP 8,000 through NWTF t buy ingredients for her food production business.

Mylene has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Mercelyn

texts.en:
Mercelyn is 43 years old and married with three children, two of whom are in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a farming rice business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Mercelyn has been in this business for seven years.

In the future Mercelyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Evalyne

texts.en:
