Evalyne is a smallholder farmer from the Nandi Hills area of Kenya. She is married and has 4 young children. In the application form for this loan, Evalyne described her upbringing as 'challenging'. This taught her to work harder and study the nature of markets to seize opportunities. 

In 2005, Evalyne started farming. Since then, she operates on her husband's 0.3 acre land. There, she keeps 2 dairy cows, 10 heads of poultry, and plant vegetables. The problem is that the land is too small, and this she finds to be very limiting. She is seeking a loan to secure more land and increase her productivity. 

With your loan, Evalyne hopes to have more land to cultivate and produce more food that will give her family decent diets and better income.

loans.use: to buy land and thus increase her dairy and produce farm

loans.name: Getrude

texts.en:
Getrude is a person who has had to overcome a lot of adversity in her life. However, she has always had the strength to overcome it and move forward with her 12 children. Kiva lenders! Meet Getrude, one of the most hardworking women on planet earth. She is 61 years of age, very hardworking and a go-getter. She hails from Kaplamai, a remote village in the Kitale area of Kenya. This area has harsh weather conditions and to survive, you must have tough skin, but Getrude has defied all the odds and has been engaged in farming for the past forty one years. 

Her primary sources of income are crops and animal farming. She also gets some income through personal business. Getrude is contented with the farming way of life. Getrude is a very enterprising woman, and although she never had formal education or formal employment, she has always worked hard on her farm and she has always assured her children and family of a decent meal. 

The Kitale area has favorable conditions for horticulture farming, and that is why she is seeking a loan to start horticulture farming. Because of good roads, a good climate, and a good transportation network, she is sure that she will reap maximum profits and be able to increase her business. Being an elderly woman and accessing funds in Africa is very challenging, but Getrude feels relieved knowing there are institutions such as Kiva that help enterprising women like her. 

Getrude is well disciplined with finances and she plans that through the accumulated profits, she will be able to improve her living conditions and secure the future of her children who are in college. Please help Getrude so that her horticulture farming can flourish!

loans.use: To start horticulture farming and provide a better income for her 12 children

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to add capital in her bar business by buying more beers,spirits and others to sell.

loans.name: Priscilla

texts.en:
Priscilla is a married mother of nine children living in Bundibugyo-Uganda. She operates a food stall in Bundibugyo town, selling mainly tomatoes, beans and fish. This has helped her so much in providing basic needs for her family. She has hopes of having a bigger business with a permanent address where her customers can easily find her.

Priscilla is requesting for a loan to buy food like fresh beans for selling. She used the first loan to start the business of selling food staffs to locals.

loans.use: to buy food like fresh beans for selling.

loans.name: Muntaha

texts.en:
Muntaha is 48 years old lives in Baqaa; she is conservative woman and asked her daughter Bayan to take her place in the photo. She has a dream which is to see her children successful and special.

Her daughter Bayan is majoring in nursing and she is working hard to complete her education and find a good work with good salary.

Lately Muntaha is facing financial problems so she could not help Bayan to cover her semester fees, therefore she applied for an education loan to help her to pay for her university fees and complete her nursing education to achieve her dreams.

loans.use: To pay the university fees for her daughter, majoring in nursing

loans.name: Na's Group

texts.en:
Na is a farmer 35 years old, living in Kampong Cham province. She has two kids, only one whom is in school. She earns income to support her family’s living condition via potatoes growing and working for others for a fee.  She has been with both businesses for seventeen years. She earns income around 35,000KHR per day, but she can save about 8,000KHR each day from her business. Low potatoes yields are still the main challenge for her business. 

This is eighth loan cycle for Na with VisionFund and the past loans help her to be better support her family’s living and increase her income. In a group of four, she is a group leader and she will take her entire new loan portion to buy fertilizer and pesticide for her potatoes farming in order to generate more crop yields. She hopes that her potatoes provided more yields to get extra income in order to have enough ability to support her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticide for her potato farming in order to generate more crop yields.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Combine Group

texts.en:
After moving to her new house in Dzivarasekwa Extension, Pronela decided to introduce a pre-school in her area. She came up with this idea when she realised the need for children in her community to receive early childhood development, as it was lacking in the community. The community welcomed the idea and they now send their children to her pre-school. 

She has inspired other women in her community through her hard work. After identifying 4 other hard working women in her group, they formed the Combine group and they continually receive business trainings offered at Thrive. This has since helped the group to improve their businesses as they have learnt the importance of marketing which they witnessed it improves sales and customer turnover.

Pronela, aged 40, is a married mother of 4 all of which are still going to school. She uses some of the profits she makes to pay fees and help her husband to meet some of the household expenses. Pronela identifies her business to be at a growth stage, thus she need to continuously improve the premises. A $400 loan will help her to buy more chairs and renovate the toilets for the pre-school.

loans.use: to renovate the premises and buy chairs for her pre-school.

loans.name: Ekome Feemo Group

texts.en:
Hunu is in her forties. She is married and has two school-going children. She supports her family with income from her business. She employed herself in a business where she sells grocery. Hunu has been in her business for 6 years now and is able to realize a good profit each month. She works from 6:00 am to 7:00 pm daily. 

Hunu has been a borrower with ID-Ghana and is on her ninth loan cycle. She has repaid all of her previous loans successfully, which she used to improve her grocery store business by replenishing her supply soft drinks, can food, mineral water cooking oil, rice and beans. She received profits which she used to cover part of her household expenses and school fees. 

Hunu will share this loan with her group members. The group members will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: To buy soft drinks, can food, mineral water cooking oil, rice and beans to sell to customers.

loans.name: Abida

texts.en:
Abida  has successfully built her business of tailoring with the support of Kashf Foundation and Kiva. By the time she attained good number of customers and makes good amount of income to contribute in the family income. 

Previously with the help of Kiva she was able to expand her business. Now she has applied a loan of 45000 PKR  to purchase more sewing materials such as spools of threads, laces and ribbons for completing maximum orders on time. She aspires to save money for her prosperous future.

loans.use: to purchase more sewing materials such as spools of threads, laces and ribbons for completing maximum orders on time

loans.name: Boterekwa Group

texts.en:
Accountability, reliability, vision, discretion and integrity are qualities that are needed in a person in a leadership position. Letwin is one such person who was seen to possess these characteristics. This young and mature chairlady of Boterekwa group is a serious entrepreneur who is taking big strides in uplifting her standard of living. Boterekwa group is a group of four members who reside in the high density suburb of Dzivarasekwa in Harare. The group is in its second loan cycle with Thrive.

Letwin started of business selling dried goods in Mbare market and with her first loan from Thrive she restocked more goods and grew her market stall. With her profits she has managed to help her husband buy a residential stand. She now also has a foodshop business in her neighbourhood selling groceries. With her current loan she is planning on adding on to her businesses. In future she has plans of growing her business and generating more income to enable her to start building their home.

loans.use: To expand the range of goods she sells from her foodshop

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en:
Shamim  has successfully built her business of milk sales with the support of Kashf Foundation and Kiva. By the time she has attained good number of customers and makes good amount of income to contribute in the family income. Previously with the help of Kiva loan she was able to expand her business. 

Now she has applied a loan of 40000 PKR to purchase another cow to increase her sales and profits alongside. She is motivated to provide her family with the better living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase another cow to increase her sales and profits alongside.
